Science - Using scientific rules and methods to solve problems. ABILITIES IN: Oral Comprehension-The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Written Comprehension-The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing. Science — Using scientific rules and methods to solve problems. Information Ordering - The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations). Deductive Reasoning - The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense. Inductive Reasoning - The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events). ADA REQUIREMENTS (For U.S. positions only): Positions in this function typically require typing, sitting, standing, walking.    Concentrated mental and/or visual attention. The work involves performing complex tasks to very close accuracy and quality specifications, or a high degree of hand and eye coordination for sustained periods. The job is typically performed under comfortable working conditions; any disagreeable elements are generally absent during normal performance of job. Compliance with company attendance standards. Sedentary Work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally, and all other sedentary criteria are met.    TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: Position requires travel as needed to support assigned business lines(s) and must have the ability to travel across borders.    NOTE:      The above job description is intended to represent only the primary areas of responsibility; specific position assignments will vary depending on the business needs of the department.     JOB DESCRIPTION HISTORY INFORMATION:      Prepared by C. Traina; reviewed by C. Turner          Date: 2023.11.21

Organisation Position Principal Engineer Vacancy ref 82449 Based in Houston Business area Subsea & Conventional Working hours 40 hours per week Contract type Staff Closing date 30/11/2023Vacancy information OVERVIEW OF ROLE Reporting to Discipline Manage /Structural Team Lead or an Engineering Manager, the principal Engineer will have responsibility for a discipline area and/or planning and coordinating the technical expertise and services required to ensure successful delivery of high-quality engineering to meet commercial and technical needs. Individual is expected to improve the specific discipline work processes and be a technical governance for the Discipline. The scope will include studies and tenders as well as live projects. SPECIFIC KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACTIVITIES Provide specialist skills, integrity and knowledge in key areas of project or discipline engineering, including design codes, legislative requirements and current good engineering practice.Understands clients' needs; identifies and addresses design parameters and problems; develops and implements solutions.Act as technical expert in all aspects of offshore geotechnical engineering design and installation.Manage interfaces within a project structure, including other disciplines, drawing office, document control, project management, client and suppliers.Participlate in the conceptual studies.Undertake geotechnical engineering calculations and design reports for subsea foundation design, pipeline initiation anchorages and pipeline/soil interaction.Understand how trenching equipment works and its uses and limitations.Check and approval of technical documentation, accepting personal responsibility for its adequacy.Understand and manage geotechnical risk.Ensures that specifications and norms related to the project are respected.Participates actively to engineers training and development.Proposes innovative solutions allowing cost & risks reduction.Evaluate, organize and prioritize work for self and others. AUTHORITY/DIMENSIONS Operate within the Business Code of ConductOperate according to Subsea 7’s Management PrinciplesSupport standards and procedures for the Engineering Function KEY RELATIONSHIPS/ STAKEHOLDERS External Client technical representativeProfessional bodies and institutions of learning Internal Project ManagersProject Engineering ManagersTendering ManagersEngineering Department PERSON SPECIFICATION Essential Experience, Skills and Knowledge:Professional qualifications – Degree qualified ideally in Civil/Structural Engineering with geotechnical expertise. (Demonstrable experience in a similar role will also be considered).Relevant engineering experience (10+ years) in all aspects of offshore geotechnical engineering design and installation.Awareness of marine classification and local legislation (Essential).Demonstrable ability to work within time/budget constraints.Presents self in a professional manner appropriate to the role.Produces work of presentable quality.Ability to prioritize and organize work.Use and reference appropriate Codes and Standards associated with geotechnical engineering in the offshore industry, i.e. ISO codes, DNV, API.Sound Knowledge of foundation FEA analysis software, i.e. PLAXIS (Essential) or similar software.Understand and manage geotechnical and geohazards risks.Professional Engineer (PE) or ability to obtain PE in 6 months.

Stress Analysis Engineer: Sr. CAE Analysis Engineer, MultiPhysics, Semi
column7: What to Expect As a Senior Engineer in the CAE team, you will play a critical role in the development of the next generation Tesla products. In this role you will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing the performance of revolutionary products. You will be an innovative and skilled problem solver, using computational analysis tools, complemented with innovative methodologies that you develop, for enabling faster and more accurate solutions. You are a brilliant engineer, technically and as an individual, joining a diverse and cross-functional team, challenging the boundaries of accelerating the world transition to sustainable energy. What You’ll Do Providing CAE support through build of state-of-the-art FEA and CFD models to the finest details Supporting design progression and product evolution with multi-disciplinary engineering teams relying on your analyses Drive manufacturing centric design solutions with CAE, while balancing all applicable requirements with state-of-the-art design and innovative manufacturing processes Perform advanced CAE simulations for evaluating and enhancing the performance of full systems or sub-systems in specific attributes and manufacturing processes Develop and apply analysis methodologies with advanced computational techniques to drive innovation into Tesla products Conducting coupled multidisciplinary analysis domains of CFD, thermal, structural Develop and support subsystem and full vehicle level correlation analyses in line with standard protocols and best practices Perform post-test reviews and corroborate your analyses to test results Develop highly predictive material models and analysis approaches for achieving good correlations with physical tests Conducting optimization studies using optimization tools, including DOE/DFSS techniques on components, assemblies, or full systems with focus on performance requirements and the constraints of mass, cost and manufacturing Provide input in the creation of component specification, component DFMEA, and other technical design documents where analysis plays a pivotal role Produce concise analysis summaries and report-outs that meet the needs of the design teams, management, and decision functions What You’ll Bring BS/MS in Mechanical or General Engineering, or equivalent Robust knowledge of Finite Elements Analysis (FEA) for structures engineering Strong fundamentals in Numerical Methods, Solid Mechanics, and Materials Science Demonstrated experience required in one, or all the following: LS-DYNA, NASTRAN, ABAQUS Experience in CFD (Fluent, Star-CCM) is required Experience in BETA or ALTAIR suites required (ANSA, MetaPost, HyperWorks) Experience in multi-phase CFD and fluid-structure interaction analyses, preferred Experience in coupled FEA-CFD sealers analysis, preferred Minimum 3+ years of similar experience within a product engineering environment in a transportation industry with at least two relevant product lines Knowledge of optimization tools and techniques beneficial Demonstrated proactive attitude and initiative taking mindset Demonstrated ability to work autonomously on pioneering and challenging problems Demonstrated ability to deliver with limited inputs and tight timing constraints Demonstrated ability to deconstruct complex problems and test procedures into analysis cases with a sound engineering mindset Solution-driven and product focused attitude

Your Job Molex is seeking an experienced mechanical Principal Engineer to design our industry leading high-speed connector and cable systems for our big data and hyperscale customers. These creative, high-tech leading-edge components are critical for the data superhighways existence we use every day changing the world. Here at Molex, we are leading the industry, with our smart data solutions to solve our customers toughest challenges. In this highly visible engineering position, you will join a team of professionals who are passionate to deliver the best products in the world to the market. Molex brings together innovation and technology to deliver electronic solutions to customers worldwide. With a presence in more than 40 countries, Molex offers a full suite of solutions and services for many markets, including data communications, consumer electronics, industrial, automotive, commercial vehicle and medical. Our Team As a Principal Engineer you will be responsible to design, model, analyze, characterize high-speed connectors, cables, and systems within our Copper Solutions IO enterprise division team. In this role you will provide technical expertise in connector, cable design for the exponentially growing data storage systems and telecommunications market. This is a dynamic group of highly skilled professionals that will provide an opportunity for constant learning and innovation. This role will be leading projects from idea to high volume production. These new products drive the industry making a big impact on our customers and their products. The successful applicant will have the ability to appropriately plan and see assignments through to completion with minimal direction, provide leadership to other team members; develop timing, meet project schedules, manage risks, accurately quote design, and systematically solve problems of a complex scope. The primary location for this position is the Lisle Design Center (Lisle Illinois) or the Arkansas Design Center (Conway AR)- Molex offers a very flexible work environment to also suit our talent needs. What You Will Do  Be a team member in a global organization designing and developing leading edge new products and components for the high-speed cable and connector industry Working independently to design and develop new interconnect products, including high speed connectors, connector cable assemblies, and miscellaneous related mechanical hardware for datacom and telecom applications such as hubs, servers, switches, routers, HBA servers, and RAIDS You will be expected to interface with professional cross functional team members in our signal integrity team, manufacturing integration team, program management, sales organization, state of the art test laboratories, R&D model shop, manufacturing and senior leadership teams Present concepts, presentations, detailed requirements internally and to customers to obtain support for development of major new products Perform design verification activities, predictive analytics for mechanical and electrical requirements Have travel opportunities to visit our manufacturing sites and meet the global team Create relationships with senior leadership, cross functional team members and peers through team building activities and growth opportunities operating as One Molex Team Provide leadership, support, and guide less experienced team members on multiple NPD projects Work with marketing and external customers to help define new project opportunities and strategize on overall design Provide application and technical support to consolidate inputs from Marketing, customers, and external consultants into product concepts and detailed requirements Drive IP submissions with our legal team  Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)  Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering 12+ years' experience in electro-mechanical product design and development with proven technical leadership within high speed datacom electronics industries Deep experience with design validation testing and end of life testing requirements In depth knowledge of Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and use of Tolerance Analyses GD&T Experience with advanced parametric 3D CAD systems Deep design experience with products manufactured using the some of the following processes: progressive die stamping, injection molding, die casting, reel to reel plating and insert molding along with their respective process capabilities, ability to challenge processes Desire to learn, be challenged and interact in a cross functional team environment ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely Strong working knowledge of signal integrity properties, impedance, insertion loss, return loss and cross talk Familiarity with working on PCBA's and reflow SMT technology. Strong understanding and practical knowledge of Six Sigma quality development tools and principles (DOE, FMEA, etc.) Familiarity with working on tear downs, failure analysis tools (SEM, FIB, FTIR, Cross sectioning) Experience submitting confidential IP and working with Patent Attorneys Ability to set boundaries on development timelines and tasks for deliverables  What Will Put You Ahead  Master's degree or PhD in Mechanical Engineering or other related engineering field Siemens NX experience Deep design experience with high-speed, high-density connectors, cable assemblies, and interconnect products Design experience with products manufactured utilizing electroplating and automated assembly Knowledge of regulatory agency testing requirements (e.g., UL/CSA, NEBS, EMC/EMI requirements) Master Black Belt in product design and development Strong track record of decision-making capabilities for new product development in the high speed industry White papers on industry leading technology and accreditations/industry acknowledgements At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. Hiring Philosophy All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here . Who We Are As a Koch company, Molex is a leading supplier of connectors and interconnect components, driving innovation in electronics and supporting industries from automotive to health care and consumer to data communications. The thousands of innovators who work for Molex have made us a global electronics leader. Our experienced people, groundbreaking products and leading-edge technologies help us deliver a wider array of solutions to more markets than ever before. At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company. Our Benefits Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter. Equal Opportunities Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: http://www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf #LI-AP3

Job Description:    Under the direction of the Automation Engineering Manager, the Senior Controls Engineer will be responsible for the development and implementation of a new generation of leading-edge, high speed, automated manufacturing assembly and test equipment for power tools. Scoping out risks for manufacturing and establishing a plan to mitigate. The individual will take the projects from original concept through final implementation while ensuring long-term sustainment and support.        This position works in a team environment and uses engineering expertise, project management, and leadership abilities to contribute to the development of automated manufacturing assembly and test solutions for existing and future operations for Milwaukee Tool.            You’ll be DISRUPTIVE through these duties and responsibilities:              Mentor and coach team of automation engineers in the designing, prototyping, testing, and commissioning of automated solutions for a variety of projects.                Lead the development of collecting CTQ’s, concepts, schematics, test plans, and processes for new automation systems development.                Execute technical project roadmaps identifying critical electronic and controls components and creating robust design architectures for use globally.                Champion technology investigations including system requirements, architecture definitions, and reusability strategies.                Quickly, effectively, and candidly frame-up and escalate business risks/opportunities to senior leadership.                Mentor and coach the team in engineering best practices including task management, Gantt charts, root cause analysis, control automation design, and software programming.                Effectively communicate and motivate up, down and across the organization to a diverse range of technical and non-technical team members.                Programming of industrial control systems consisting of PC and PLC based applications utilizing SCADA methodology.                Drive urgency in project schedules and accountability for establishing and achieving key project metrics that meet the organization’s needs.                Responsible for building upon established standards for electrical/controls and software engineering aspects of design, testing, and start-up for our manufacturing assembly and test solutions.                Strong analytical skills, knowledge, and experience in process evaluation tools: Design of Experiments (DOE), Finite Element Analysis (FEA), PFMEA, DFMEA, statistical data analysis, risk analysis, flow layout and other related engineering tools.                Work cross functionally with New Product Development design engineers, manufacturing engineers, quality/reliability, and other teams to evaluate and advise product design for optimized testability and manufacturability (DFA/DFT).                Responsible for the research, evaluation, and implementation of new technologies and breakthrough processes to accelerate competitive manufacturing advantage.                Provide multiple design concepts for trade-off discussions in finding the ideal solution for ROI, cost, quality, and delivery.                Maintain and build upon standard electrical design architecture to be used by other engineers in the design of automation assembly and test systems.                Design with lean intent/design for manufacturing (flow, ergonomics and safety of production associates) including standards set by Milwaukee Tool and regulatory bodies such as NFPA, CEN, OSHA and ISA.                Excellent interpersonal skills to work in a team environment and challenge status quo with respect, to drive the best solutions for the business              What TOOLS you’ll bring with you:              Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in Electrical Engineering, or related engineering field.                7+ years of experience in the design, construction, and programming of automated manufacturing assembly and/or test systems at the subassembly and final assembly level.                Development experience with communication protocols, such as IO-Link, Discrete IO, EtherCAT, Ethernet IP, OPCUA, TCP/IP, RS-232, RS-485, CAN, etc.                Experience with advanced control systems used to automate manufacturing processes including pneumatics used in motion control, programmable controllers, sensors, vision systems, and robotics.                LabVIEW programming experience.                Advanced PLC programming experience.                Advanced computer knowledge and skills using MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Outlook, MS Project, and Solid works/AutoCAD/NX.                Must be flexible and willing to adapt to changes and short deadlines.                Experience with electrical and industrial machinery safety.                The ability to work well with people and independently, problem solver, organized, good written and verbal skills, strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize and multi-task                Excellent organizational and facilitation skills.                Ability to be interactive “hands on” with each upcoming engineering project.                Effectively utilize data when analyzing issues and problem solving.

SOFEC, Inc. is a leader in the development and supply of Single-Point Mooring (SPM) systems and is engaged in research involving new and improved tanker mooring systems and associated components. Projects range from preliminary design studies to major engineering, fabrication, and procurement projects that include installation and commission. Projects supplied by SOFEC include marine terminals for product import/export, turrets, tower yoke, and spread moorings for tanker-based floating production, storage and offloading (FPSO / FSO) systems installed in the water a depth ranging from 30 feet to 5,000 ft. SOFEC is currently looking for a Senior Pipe Stress Engineer. Core Responsibilities: Directly report to the Piping Department Manager. Report to and provide support to the Lead Piping Engineer on assigned projects. Conduct pipe stress engineering of piping systems as per ASME Codes need using Caesar II software program. Applies expert knowledge to develop innovative solutions to technically challenging projects. Responsible for the design of all piping support components. Coordinate the design of exclusive pipe supports as needed. Review the Client’s technical requirements for Piping Stress Engineering and establish the stress Design Basis/Philosophy for various load cases, specifications, standards, and guidelines for stress engineering execution Preparation of stress critical line list as per the critical line selection criteria Performs static analysis using CAESAR II for the load cases such as dead weight, sustained loads, Thermal expansion/contraction, Wave acceleration, Hag/sag Deflections, occasional and environmental loads, blast load, fatigue, slug, transportation, module lift, and vibration analysis, FIV and AIV. Perform evaluation of nozzle loads utilizing WRC 107/297 capability of Caesar II program. Perform FEA evaluation of stresses at nozzles, or for determining user-calculated SIFs, using NozzlePro, FE/Pipe, or other FEA software Conduct complex engineering tasks along with key engineering work properly and efficiently. Can organize work, monitor, report, and achieve progress to schedule Provides input to project scheduling for dependencies, durations, and manpower requirements. Develops plans for sharing resources among competing projects, including management of subcontractors. Ensure to extract of engineering data from CAD drawings as well as computer models. Ensure to complete different assignments like drawings, parameters, and varied materials apt for procurement plus construction purposes. Interact frequently with various engineering disciplines and departments. Develop detailed requisitions for pipe stress equipment and materials. Review vendor drawing submittals and conduct technical bid evaluation. Develop and issue parameters, data sheets, and varied construction documents. Guide technically to Pipe designers or drafters and engineers working on the same pipe stress project. Perform as the advisory facility to senior management staff on engineering pertinent matters. Provide magnitude of hydrostatic and operating loads acting on guides and supports. Participate in reviews of PFDs, P&IDs, Piping ISOs, & Structural Drawings. Responsible for engineering quality and timeliness in a highly cross-functional engineering environment. Responsible to produce deliverables, which may include, specifications, design calculations, progress reports, correspondence, procedures, analyses bid evaluations, Engineering Change Notices, study reports, and various 3rd party submissions. Able to develop piping schematics and layouts based on customer requirements and specifications Provides technical follow-up and support on piping matters, from the proposal stage to aftermarket, including vendor comparison and selection, fabrication site support, installation, start-up, and operation. Has a thorough understanding and knowledge of relevant Codes and Standards not limited to, ASME, API, BS, and other guidelines. Good knowledge of spreadsheets and databases is a definite plus. Has a basic understanding of process requirements and operations. Able to do material take-offs and center of gravity calculations. AutoCAD capabilities are a plus. Willing to travel if required to participate in HAZOPs, project reviews, and fabrication site visits. Durations typically are for approximately two weeks. Qualifications & Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering. 15-20 years of experience in Oil & Gas FPSO, Offshore platforms, Petrochemical, or Refinery Industries. A minimum of eight years of experience as Piping Stress Engineer/Lead Stress Engineer for FPSO/offshore Platform based Projects Experience in the use of pipe stress analysis using Caesar II. Experience in the use of Bluebeam. Expert in offshore piping design and codes. Experience and capabilities in E3D are a plus. Experience and capabilities in AVEVA Modules are a plus. Well-versed in Navis works Able to demonstrate in-depth knowledge in Piping and layout engineering, procurement, and cost-effectiveness, with a proven track record on projects in the upstream oil and gas sector. Strong knowledge of spreadsheets, databases, and AutoCAD is a definite plus Possesses a basic knowledge of offshore production process requirements and the capability of developing P&IDs from customer specifications Familiarity with risk assessment concepts and methods. Diverse working experience in project management, conceptual and detailed design, and construction. Familiarity with codes, standards, regulations, and practices applicable to the design and construction of onshore and offshore structures/production facilities Possesses advanced computer skills. Time management skills. Critical Thinking — Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems A self-starter and able to work with minimal supervision, make sound decisions, take independent action, analyze problems, and provide focused solutions to assigned projects. Strong interpersonal and communication skills and be able to work well with people at all levels in the organization. SOFEC, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Overview      The Senior Engineer is responsible for creating a viable design solution in response to customer requirements for products such as Valves, Solenoid Operated Valves, Solenoids and Flame Arrestors. This person will be the technical lead of the design throughout the New Product Development Process. The Senior Engineer may also act as the project manager; which includes generation of the project plan, allocating tasks, setting milestones and communicating status updates with both internal and external customers. This person must be skilled at working in a team environment and mentoring team members as necessary.     Responsibilities Completion of new product design projects from creation of proposals through development, qualification, and production. Determination of design feasibility to achieve performance, quality, cost and schedule. Apply engineering principles to design and develop new products, or modify existing products. Analysis of test data and reports to determine if design meets functional and performance specifications. Prepares or directs preparations of product layout and detailed drawings and schematics. Directs and coordinates the manufacturing/ building of prototype products. Creates and coordinates activities associated with risk mitigation and qualification test plans Successfully work with customer and other functional groups internal to G.W Lisk.Qualifications Bachelors degree in Engineering 10+ years of experience Comprehensive problem solving and decision making capabilities Communication skills - must be able to present complex technical data in a clear and concise manner. Strong leadership qualities Computer Skills: CREO (Preferred), FEA (Structural, Thermal, Magnetic, CFD), MATHCAD, Microsoft Programs (Word, Excel, Project) Lean and six sigma tools; DFM, DFA, DFSS and DMAIC Project management principles; planning, estimating, requirements management, risk analysis Working knowledge of quality, design assurance and product reliability principles Strong business acumen Strong process and detail orientation Detailed knowledge of several fabrication, joining and finishing processes. Compensation: $74,000.00 - $115,000.00 annual salary based on experience

As a Sr. Product Development Engineer I you will design Abiomed’s next generation of innovative heart pumps and accessories. You will work with clinicians to develop user needs, ideate novel concepts, rapidly prototype solutions, design & develop capable and scalable manufacturing processes. You will work in a dynamic fast paced environment that is disrupting the medical device industry by bringing breakthrough technologies to market. The ideal candidate brings deep experience in product design and manufacturing of medical devices. This role focuses on the Impella ECP™ or “Expandable Cardiac Power”. The Impella ECP™ is Abiomed’s smallest heart pump that does not compromise on flow by utilizing unique expanding pump technology. QUALIFICATIONSPrinciple Duties and Responsibilities may include : Lead early-stage design and development projects of novel hemodynamic support devices and accessories. Lead initiatives with engineers in research, product development, new product introduction and contract manufacturers or OEMs. Collaborate to deliver designs with margin to performance requirements and demonstrated process capability in scalable manufacturing processes. Conceptualize, design, prototype, procure, and build components and assemblies for products and testing/manufacturing fixtures. Responsible for tolerance stack-up of critical components and assemblies ensuring the individual component tolerances are carefully considered to meet overall system performance requirements. Responsible for material selection based on performance requirements, manufacturing methods, duration and nature of body contact. Serve as Subject Matter Expert (SME) across platforms and lifecycle phases from research through sustaining teams Conduct voice of the customer and transform clinical observations into new device concepts and requirements Generate intellectual property through invention disclosures in pursuit of patients and trade secrets. Conduct feasibility testing, analyze, and report on test results providing conclusions and recommendations. Bring solutions to market by collaborating with an exceptional cross-functional team. Perform failure investigations in the event of test failures with support from the technical team. Job Qualifications: BS in Mechanical Engineering or directly related scientific discipline. 6-8+ years of related experience in medical device product development Advanced capability using Solidworks 3D modeling, 2D drawing applying GD&T. Able to model complex parts and assemblies and conduct intermediate structural and fluid FEA within solidworks or similar packages. Experience in design for manufacturing of plastic molded components, extrusions, complex catheter shafts, laser-cut and precision machined metal components and ceramics Deep background in plastics, metal, and ceramic material selection Strong problem-solving skills and demonstrated experience identifying root cause of device failures. Demonstrated ability to execute tasks in a timely manner under minimal supervision. Willingness to learn the interventional cardiology space - the devices and the clinical practice. Experience applying statistical techniques and analysis. Willingness & ability to travel internationally ~5% of the time. Strongly Preferred Qualifications : Experience in FDA Class II and III medical devices. Hands on experience in prototyping in pilot manufacturing and rapid prototyping; basic machine shop equipment Hands on experience in testing in a laboratory environment Strong understanding of design control and risk management processes and deliverables Strong understanding of statistical analysis of data, DOE’s, DMAIC, DFSS, Six Sigma Green Belt+ Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com .

The Senior Stress Engineers will support both vehicle design/build and flight test operations directly, via hands on assessment and analytical substantiation of vehicles in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary environment. Persons in this role will be involved in both build and vehicle operations phases of programs. Stress Engineers will interface and collaborate with varied other disciplines, including but not limited to: Structures Design, Maintenance & Operations teams, Manufacturing, Propulsion, Flight Test and more to provide design substantiation, test support, and operations support. Senior Stress Engineers will be able to function both independently and as part of a team in support of their tasking. Responsibilities: Performs structural analysis to provide analytical definition and/or ensure structural integrity of components, assemblies, and systems Reviews, updates, and creates engineering analytical definition of said components and assemblies (analysis documentation) Develops and/or utilizes finite element models (global and discrete) Plays an integral role in the workflow release process for structural design Supports review of manufacturing plans and procedures to ensure compliance with design and load requirements Supports the creation of structural component and system test plans which will be used to verify manufacturing and testing Develops standardized analysis criteria and templates Mentorship of more junior team members May be tasked with leading small teams of engineers through projects / assignments Requirements: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution, with a concentration in a relevant Engineering discipline Minimum 8 years’ prior experience in structural analysis of aerospace structure Solid understanding of material properties & behavior, statics / free body diagrams, and structural load paths. Knowledge creating and questioning FEA models, including pre and post processing of NASTRAN models and associated sizing of structure and system components Strong teamwork and coordination skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite of tools, including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint Preferred Skills and Experience: Previous experience with FEMAP is a strong plus Knowledge of and / or experience with Fatigue & Damage Tolerance analysis is a strong plus Prior experience performing liaison / MRB activities in aerospace stress applications is a plus Experience with manufacturing-based ERP systems, such as Oracle is a plus Experience with the design of flight vehicles or vehicle systems to a set of requirements or standards such as CFR 14, Part 400, Part 23 and 25, military or NASA is highly desired The annual U.S. base salary range for this full-time position is $105,700.00–$161,200.00. The base pay actually offered will vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, location, and experience and take into account internal equity. Other forms of pay (e.g., bonus or long term incentive) may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and other benefits, dependent on the position offered. For more information regarding Virgin Galactic benefits, please visit https://vgcareers.virgingalactic.com/global/en/benefits Who We Are Virgin Galactic is transforming humanity’s relationship with space. By making it more open and accessible, we are connecting the world to the love, wonder and awe inspired by space travel, helping to create new opportunities for the benefit of life on Earth. Whether it’s supporting cutting-edge research missions for scientists and students, or offering life-changing experiences for the adventurers among us, Virgin Galactic is THE spaceline for Earth. Such an audacious vision requires a team as driven as they are curious - one capable of redefining the boundaries of what’s possible. Export Requirements To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. Person (either a U.S. citizen, a lawful permanent resident or a protected individual as defined 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) or be able to obtain the required authorization from either the U.S. Department of State or the U.S. Department of Commerce. The applicant must also not be included in the list of Specifically Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons maintained by the Office of Foreign Assets Control. See list here. EEO Statement Virgin Galactic is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with Virgin Galactic is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status. DRUG FREE WORKPLACE Virgin Galactic is committed to a Drug Free Workplace. All applicants post offer and active teammates are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies. This can include pre-employment, random, reasonable suspicion, and accident related drug and alcohol testing.

Backed by $80M in funding from investors such as Bedrock, Sequioa, BoxGroup, DCVC, and others, Mach Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to create better defense systems for the US and its allies, fueled by hydrogen. With a vertically integrated energy chain, we offer capabilities impossible with conventional methods. Role Summary: The Senior Mechanical Engineer will play a pivotal role in the development and implementation of next-generation products, with a focus on mechanical engineering fundamentals across key areas. The ideal candidate will be a hands-on doer with some managerial experience, capable of taking a product from concept to market. This position demands strong expertise in thermal, structural, manufacturing, and aerospace fluids. Key Responsibilities: Technical Mastery: Apply expertise across the core mechanical engineering disciplines: thermal systems, structural analysis (FEA), manufacturing and assembly (DFM), and aerospace fluids (CFD). Product Development: Lead and contribute to projects that go from concept sketches to functional prototypes and eventually mass production, ensuring a completed product lifecycle. Collaboration: Work in tandem with cross-functional teams, including Hardware, Software, and Product Management, to ensure seamless integration of mechanical components into the broader product range. Quality and Safety Standards: Conduct rigorous design reviews and implement best practices to maintain high-quality and safety standards for products. Industry Experience: Leverage past experience to prove expertise in delivering market-ready products, whether as part of a large project or a smaller product release. Management and Leadership: Provide managerial support to junior staff and project teams while spending a significant amount of time on hands-on, technical work. Communication: Effectively manage up and down the organizational chain, conveying technical challenges, milestones, and needs clearly to both internal and external stakeholders. Cost-Effectiveness: Engage with suppliers and manufacturing partners to ensure feasibility and cost-efficiency in design and production. Adaptability and Learning: Display a coachable attitude and a willingness to adapt to new methods or technologies. Qualifications: Solid experience in mechanical engineering, with a focus on the core disciplines. Industry experience in developing and releasing products or major product components. Ability to manage multiple aspects of engineering projects. Proficiency in numerical tooling software for FEA and CFD analyses. Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field, from an institution with a hands-on focus. Ideal Candidate: A results-oriented engineer with a track record of hands-on technical work and some managerial experience. The candidate should be from an institution that emphasizes practical, hard work over academic theory and should be capable of managing effectively both up and down the organizational chain. Disclosures This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws and regulations, including the Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). Please note that any offer for employment may be conditioned on authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export control laws and regulations without sponsorship for an export license. The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offers may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and training, critical skills, and business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in most offers and are considered part of Mach’s total compensation package. Mach offers benefits such as health insurance, retirement plans, and opportunities for professional development. Mach is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will be treated with respect and receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, uniform service, Veteran status, age, or any other protected characteristic per federal, state, or local law, including those with a criminal history, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws. If you’d like to defend the American way of life, please reach out! Compensation Range: $120K - $180K

Stress Analysis Engineer: Plastics Design and Development Research Engineer
column7: At Greene, Tweed, you'll find the cutting-edge technology, world-class polymer expertise and endless advancement opportunities you'd expect from a multi-national industry leader. You'll find them all in an environment that embraces diversity in people and opinions, moves decision making to the point of impact, and celebrates your success.    If you enjoy continuous learning and are excited about working with and creating technological solutions, explore career opportunities with Greene, Tweed.    Essential Duties/Responsibilities:  Provides technical leadership when interfacing with external customers, sales, manufacturing and quality. Will visit customer sites when required, to ensure that the design and needs of external customers are met on a timely and effective basis. Definition of technical product performance criteria for specific applications in hydrogen service (function and design/dimensions) Generates and approves design proposals. Recommend material based on application criteria as well. Will also recommend new material targets based on application needs Ensures model accuracy, design documentation and/or functional testing requirements are captured, and then used for evaluated for acceptability for the new products/applications. Assures product quality by defining testing/qualification/validation methods aligned with application requirements; Clearly understands and communicates testing methods for finished- product and system capabilities Produces external facing technical reports as needed Must develop a fundamental awareness of customer and industry technical requirements in the hydrogen economy, and basic business acumen regarding the business impact of technical decisions in a developing market space.   Note: This Job Description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by the Supervisor. All requirements are subject to change and updates.    B.S. in Mechanical or Materials Engineering or related discipline required, MS or PhD preferred. BS with significant, demonstrable direct experience will be considered.    Skills and Experience:  10 years of experience in plastics product development. Experience with both design and definition and development of functional application testing to ensure successful product performance Direct experience in design and development of applications related to hydrogen service is a plus Experience in functional product design, modelling/simulation and empirical testing and validation of product performance (mechanical, thermal, chemical, wear, fatigue, creep) Experience using 3D CAD software; direct experience in use of FEA to model systems preferred (successful demonstration of use of simulation tools, not necessarily running the software in and of itself) Experience in tribology is preferred as well Track record of success, as evidenced by successful commercial applications moving from product concept to commercial parts. Pedigree in product development, inventor on patents, published papers or some combination of the above will demonstrate capabilities Strong technical acumen, comfort interfacing with highly technical customers, including technical presentations, establishment of technical product requirements in dialogue with customers, defining, conducting, and interpreting product testing needed for success.   The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting and any applicable collective bargaining agreements. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.    We also provide eligible employees with a competitive benefits package that includes health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings account, 401k savings plan, life and disability insurance, tuition assistance and more, to meet the diverse needs of all employees and their family members.    Equal Opportunity Employer:    Greene, Tweed is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other federally protected class.    Drug Free Workplace:    Greene, Tweed is a Drug Free Workplace. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a pre-employment drug screening and background investigation subject to federal, state, and local laws.    NOTE: Greene, Tweed is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for employment opportunities, unless they have a written agreement for the position they are contacting us about. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at GT without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the sole property of Greene, Tweed, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Greene, Tweed as a result of the referral or through other means.

American Energy Storage Innovations, Inc. has a full-time opening for a Principal Mechanical Engineer in Hudson, Massachusetts. Job Summary: The Principal Mechanical Engineer is responsible for the design, development, and execution of core mechanical systems architecture and components. This individual must have a strong knowledge of energy storage systems for electrical grid and commercial applications, the mechanical engineering discipline, and the processes required to lead a complex design to an on-time product launch. Responsibilities: Generate and present wide-ranging concepts to meet customer and business needs using brainstorming, sketches, mockups, and other techniques. Develop new product designs from prototype to production considering application, cost, weight, performance, thermodynamics, reliability, manufacturing, assembly, and field serviceability. Design new products and components including plastic injection molded parts, die castings, sheet metal, weldments stampings, machined components, HVAC piping, and similar. Verifies control plans and validation plans to ensure proper implementation. Work collaboratively with manufacturing to ensure designs can be manufactured efficiently. Support validation in identifying root cause and corrective action for field and validation test failures. Support prototype builds by ensuring parts are on time and issues are resolved in a timely manner. Proactively monitor the system's cost and schedule, identifying potential triggers for overspending and delays, and implementing corrective strategies. Research new technology options and recommend improvements in terms of safety, performance, efficiency, or costs. Participate in and supports modeling of thermal systems. Furthers the teams’ capabilities specific to HVAC, Cooling, and Fluid systems. Create and manage Solidworks CAD models, drawings, and assemblies. Perform mechanical system analyses such as Failure modes and effects analysis (FMEA) and Worst-case analysis (WCA). Evaluate supplier specifications & validation data to ensure selection of the proper suppliers. Adheres to all company policies, processes, and procedures. Adheres to federal and state regulations. Performs other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Predictable and reliable attendance. Position Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or equivalent degree. Minimum of fifteen (15) years of experience in large-scale power systems or similar mechanical systems; packaging, modeling, thermal, HVAC, and overall large-scale system design. Deep mechanical aptitude is required including a broad knowledge of engineering materials, mechanical properties, and an understanding of the manufacturing processes associated with these materials. Proven knowledge of 3D CAD, SolidWorks, PDM, and similar systems. Strong experience in Finite element analysis (FEA) for stress and structural analysis. Experience in a fast-paced startup preferred. Experience in seismic requirements and electrical safety for Grid utility applications to meet IEEE and obtain seismic certifications. Experience in designing products intended for harsh outdoor environments complying with NEMA / IP ratings & certification. Proficient in data processing and statistical analysis. Effective communicator, capable of concisely presenting highly technical test data to internal and external customers, as well as effectively communicating with suppliers. Familiar with cradle-to-grave product design processes. Self-motivated problem-solver who pays attention to detail. Abides by safety standards and protocols. Experience with high-voltage lithium-ion battery systems including Energy Storage industry test certifications preferred. Ability to travel domestically and internationally approximately 10%. Key Competencies: Decision Making & Analysis: Makes sound decisions based upon a mixture of data-driven analysis, expertise, experience, and judgment; collects relevant information, seeks input from others, and identifies connections and/or root causes of problems. Continual Improvement: Displays a consistent orientation toward producing the highest quality products or services, while keeping a focus on sustainability. Constantly looking for incremental improvements in work processes and results. Takes Initiative: Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure; persists despite obstacles and opposition. Delivers Results: Achievement-oriented, feeling a sense of urgency to reach goals on time, if not before. Assertiveness: Maintaining a position when you know you are right; standing up to others and expressing views without fear, without engaging in unnecessary aggression. Mission, Vision, Values, and Strategic Priorities Focused: Understands and actively supports the organization’s mission, vision, values, and strategic priorities. Physical Requirements / Working Conditions: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment can be moderately loud. Prolonged periods of standing. May be required to recognize small numbers, letters, symbols, colors on prints, and/or operate field instruments/equipment. Ability to lift and carry up to 30 pounds and/or position the body to reach items on the floor/below knee level or reach overhead. Able to continuously stand, bend, squat, and reach. The person in this position needs to occasionally move about in industrial environments, and on uneven terrain. Able to complete physically demanding work. Works in a temperature-controlled office environment, with occasional work in outdoor weather conditions, and in industrial environments. May be required to travel to and navigate a variety of sites to fully understand material needs. May be required to recognize small numbers, letters, symbols, colors on prints, and/or operate field instruments/equipment. Visual acuity to read instructions, operate machines and inspect parts produced. The ability to see and respond to dangerous situations. Why Join Us American Energy Storage Innovations, Inc. (AESI) provides comprehensive benefit plan options at no cost and a competitive salary to all associates. AESI is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. About Us AESI comprises highly experienced core team members who have developed five generations of large-scale BESS systems, heretofore having deployed more than 1.5 GWh worldwide. That same team has come together once again to create their mangum opus — the all-in-one, ultra-high density TeraStor. Third-party analysts contend that the revolutionary design outpaces the market for reliability, availability, utilization and total lifetime value. We’ve designed and manufactured an entirely new line of energy storage products to meet the needs of grid energy storage, deployment, operation, and energy management for the next 20 years. Every detail in our AESI products makes them fundamentally easier to purchase, install, maintain and operate than any other energy storage alternative available today. Benefits Overview Paid time off includes 4 weeks, 15 holidays, and parental leave. 100% company-paid medical, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability life insurance. Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) offerings. Company provided 401K savings plan with matching contributions to help you save for retirement. Voluntary benefits offerings. Tuition assistance. Employee Referral program. Employee development and career growth opportunities. The Location – Hudson, MA American Energy Storage Innovations, Inc. is conveniently located in Hudson Massachusetts directly across from the 290 and 495 freeways. This location is uniquely positioned less than one mile from downtown Hudson, as well as being close to downtown Marlborough offering numerous restaurants, parks, shopping, and many other attractions. AESI is located roughly 45 min drive from downtown Boston, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, and parts of Connecticut. There are a wide range of activities that the area offers to its residents including competitive sports programs, woodlands, as well as safe and entertaining nightlife are all located within minutes of the AESI facility. Hudson mass was awarded the winner of “America’s Main Streets” by a national organization which promotes locally owned businesses. Whether you are looking for hiking, mountain biking, sports lakes, access to Boston, or just a fantastic meal, Hudson, MA has something for everyone. AMERICAN ENERGY STORAGE INNOVATIONS, INC. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

Forward is on a bold mission to make high quality healthcare available to a billion people across the globe. We’re building the world’s most advanced healthcare platform from the ground up, combining hardware, software and doctors under one roof. We are growing our hardware engineering team and looking for world-class design engineers with experience developing scalable hardware solutions from concept to production. As an early member of our engineering team, you’ll play a key role in building the future of healthcare. Your contributions will directly improve the lives of others. For real :)   Forward was founded in January 2016 by former executives and engineering leaders from Google and Uber. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs including Founder's Fund, Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital, Eric Schmidt (Google/Alphabet Chairman), Marc Benioff (Salesforce Founder), Joe Lonsdale (Palantir Founder), Joshua Kushner (Oscar co-Founder) and Garrett Camp (Uber co-Founder).   You can read our story here, take a virtual tour here, and check out news about Forward here.   What you’ll do:   Apply strong technical knowledge to solve the problems:  Work closely with Product and Design to assess feasibility of a new design and define product requirements.Generate robust 3D models and renderings and fully toleranced 2D drawings based on design intent and design collateral.Perform detailed mechanical analyses of structures, enclosures, mechanisms and assemblies.Finalize designs using your broad knowledge of engineering materials and manufacturing processes.Fabricate and debug functional prototypes to test and demonstrate your designs.Lead user experience reviews and technical feasibility reviews.Document and communicate your designs to ensure accurate implementation.Manage expectations on deliverables and schedules, identifying risks and communicating these to the team.Collaborate with external vendors throughout the development cycle as a technical owner of the vendor’s output. Own the results:  Challenge assumptions, identify the critical problems, prioritize those problems, recommend solutions, and implement those solutions. All of these pieces are needed to develop an innovative product.Drive collaborate with diverse expertise (product, design, software, hardware, ops, clinical) to solve full-stack problems with real-world constraints. Work with diverse people:  Work with amazing people from IDEO, Amazon, Nvidia, Google X, Airbnb, Uber, and NASA JPL. Everyone is passionate, smart, and hard working, and we bring our whole selves to work.As needed, travel to remote offices, test facilities, engineering partners, or manufacturing partners. What we’re looking for:   A drive for impact:  You are deeply mission-driven and you believe there’s more to life than software that enables puppy ears to be superimposed on photos, although we concede those are cute. A team-centered, entrepreneurial spirit:  You are a self-starter who loves to own things end-to-end. You don’t ask for permission: you’re too busy making things happen.You thrive in ambiguity and you see the win-win in situations. Challenges energize you.You care for the people, the team, and the business. People want to work with you because you bring out the best in them and you help the team succeed. First-principles thinking:  You make informed decisions by framing and defining the problem, exploring options, and recommending a solution based on trade offs. This is important because the types of problems Forward is solving are often yet-to-be-known challenges that might be buried deep under current societal norms or industry assumptions. Required technical skills and experience:  BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering, Design Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.>10 years of detailed and hands-on experience designing structures, enclosures, mechanisms and assemblies. Practical experience working through DFM.Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) including emails, preparing slide presentations, and presenting technical concepts to multi-disciplinary teams and external vendors.Familiarity with (and appreciation for) the product development process (early concept definition through mass production).Knowledge of diverse materials (metal, plastic, composites, soft goods) and manufacturing techniques (machining, molding, thermoforming, bending, secondary finishes).Strong analytical skills/engineering fundamentals including statics, dynamics, mechanics of materials, FEA and statistical tolerances.Fluency in 3D CAD (any modeling package), including resolving tolerance stack-ups and interference issues in 3D models.Fluency in 2D drawings, including basic GD&T knowledge.Proficiency in a variety of processes and hands-on skills to fabricate prototypes.Strong problem solving skills, with experience in failure analysis, root cause investigation, and DOE creation. Bonus technical skills and experience:  Experience identifying, selecting, and managing vendors for development and/or fabrication activities.    The base salary range for this full-time position is $130,000-$210,000, plus equity and benefits. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, experience, relevant education or training, and location.   Why join Forward? The healthcare industry is broken, and we refuse to just move dollars around the healthcare system. We want to rebuild it and fix it, all of it. You will be a major part of one of the most ambitious startup attempts of the past century. And you’ll work with a smart, experienced, and hard working team that wants to use their talents to make a positive impact on a global scale. We won’t finish until a billion people have access to high quality healthcare. Are you with us?   We are an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and afford equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We conform to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.   Information collected and processed as part of any job application you choose to submit is subject to Forward’s Privacy Notice to California Job Applicants.

AGILE GLOBAL SOLUTION is seeking a Senior Design Engineer to join our team in Blacksburg, VA.APPLY TODAY!!!!!FulltimeOur team in Space and Defense is looking for a Senior Design Engineer to join them. You will report to the Electromagnetic Engineering Manager and will have an onsite work schedule in Blacksburg, Virginia.To be considered for Senior Design Engineer, here’s what you’ll need to bring with you:Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering required.10 years of experience in motor design or related experience.Experience analyzing and improving motor electromagnetic design to determine both electrical and mechanical performance.Knowledge of FEA analytical methods for motor performance modeling and simulation, with a preference for experience with ANSYS or Speed.Experience communicating technical topics to non-technical personnel.Experience managing multiple simultaneous projects.Our Benefits:Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits on day oneFlexible planned vacation401K, profit share, and employee stock purchase optionsTuition reimbursement programInclusive company cultureFlexible Friday Afternoon'sThis position requires access to U.S. export-controlled information.EOE/AA Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran#LI-onsiteSecurity Clearance Required: NoVisa Candidate Considered: NoJob Types: Permanent, Full-timeSalary: $135,000.00 - $140,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayWork Location: In person

POSITION OVERVIEW: Adapt Hussey’s bleacher and chair platform product lines to meet the event configuration needs of spectator seating venues. This individual will have ownership of projects throughout their lifecycle, from time of sale to completed installation. DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop Engineer-to-Order design solutions for Hussey’s bleacher and chair platform product lines. Oversee creation of code compliant submittal drawings for customer approval that reflect the product configurations to be provided. Collaborate with internal project managers and external parties to obtain information required for detailed design development and engineering. Complete field checks and assist with building scans and surveys. Utilize 3D design software and other applications to design and digitally fit seating platforms into the building space. Complete analysis of the platform structure and related designs. Prototype, test and validate new designs. Produce part drawings, instructions and other data required to manufacture and install the components of the seating solution into the final site configurations. Provide guidance during the manufacturing process of custom designs. Provide technical support throughout the installation, including call support and travelling to the site to assist with custom aspects of the installation. Mentor and assist with the technical development of team members. COMPETENCIES: (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities) Proficient with 3D parametric modeling of parts and large assemblies. Can perform stress analysis using hand calculations, spreadsheet tools and/or FEA. Can model and analyze structural systems and connections utilizing structural design software such as RISA. Familiar with structural design specifications and manuals, including ANSI/AISC 360, AISI Cold Form Steel Design, NDS for Wood Construction, and other structural design standards. Design experience with sheet metal fabrication, structural steel, Aluminum, welding, and wood. Mechanical aptitude fasteners, machine design, hydraulics. Experience with quick turn-around prototyping and testing. Demonstrated project management skills. Ability to plan, set priorities, and carry-out detail-oriented work to achieve project deliverables. Support corporate goal for continuous improvement bringing new ideas to reduce waste, improve production capabilities, and enhance performance. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively with others in a team environment Ability to work hands on in the lab and in the field. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: BS in Mechanical Engineering or Civil/Structural Engineering. An advanced degree and/or PE license is a plus. 10+ years’ relevant experience. 3D modeling experience. Experience with Autodesk Inventor a plus. Experience with ERP, PDM, and PLM systems. Proficient with MS Office suite. Open to occasional, short duration travel. Hussey Seating Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law.

About: Auto Motive Power (AMP) is a well-established start-up led by Electric Vehicle (EV) pioneers from Tesla, Zoox, Virgin Hyperloop, and GM, FCA, amongst others with dozens of patented solutions to empower the shift to e-mobility and a cleaner future. The world's largest EV and traditional manufacturers have already awarded us production contracts for our intelligent battery management, charging, and cloud solutions. Come join us to make a greater impact on the transition to a greener future! Job responsibilities: Development of concepts, engineering prototypes, production intent designs, as well as detailed drawings and documentation preparation for components/sub-assemblies/top-level assemblies of electro-mechanical systems used in EVs. Perform packaging studies and provide optimized solutions for size, placement, and interface with vehicles based on customer requirements, market needs, and technical challenges. Close collaboration with hardware engineers, technicians, project management, and component suppliers to ensure quality and timely delivery encompassing DFX principles. Develop engineering prototypes using rapid prototyping processes and coordinate building and testing for functionality and performance. Engage with suppliers from the concept phase to evaluate processes and materials based on manufacturability, quality, cost, reliability, and functional requirements. Provide further support on design improvements to resolve quality issues related to fabrication (die casting, CNC machining, injection molding, sheet metal, etc) Cooperate with contract manufacturers from the early stages of development to mass production on DFM/DFA strategy, process development, and line issues that arise during program scale-up. Participate in the development of assembly and test fixtures for all product phases. Research and introduce automation techniques to maximize the efficiency of production lines. Develop mechanical functions specifications, support with test planning, execution and documentation based on the design requirements and regulations. Mentor and work with junior engineers and technicians Design management and release through company standard NPI, ECR/ECN processes Must-have requirements: Demonstrable experience in electro-mechanical packaging and component design (examples include high-voltage systems, components, bus bars, connectors, and wire harness routing) Excellent understanding of manufacturing processes, fabrication methods, materials, and tool design (die casting, CNC machining, injection molding, sheet metal, etc) Ability to read and interpret customer/engineering specifications and arrive at design/test requirements. Ability to apply advanced mathematical principles and statistics to solve problems. First-hand experience in Solidworks CAD, FEA, and data management tools Experience in the application of GD&T and tolerance stack analyses. Ability to review and act upon simulation and test results to improve the design. First-hand involvement in working in manufacturing lines to resolve assembly and quality issues, especially during NPI to production ramp-up transition. First-hand involvement in prototype building, assembly, and testing. High attention to detail ensuring organization, accuracy, and quality of design work. Excellent interpersonal skills to work well with others in a collaborative environment. Creativity and innovation: the ability to think of new ways to improve products or systems. Nice to have: Exposure/experience in electric vehicle technologies and components such as power electronics, battery packs, mechanical interfacing with power trains, and thermal management systems The market range for this position is $ 120,000/per year up to $ 150,000/per year and includes a generous equity offering in addition to base pay. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. AMP is a total compensation company and in addition to equity and base pay we offer unlimited vacation and a full range of medical, and/or other benefits. grBVpa8ofN

What to Expect     Tesla is currently seeking a Materials Engineer to support our Solar Hardware product line. You will be responsible for identifying, developing, evaluating, processing and qualifying materials needed for current and next generations Solar Hardware products. Other responsibilities include driving engineering tradeoffs, including aesthetics, lifetime, cost, manufacturing process, installation ease, and product features. Materials include structural plastics & composites, adhesives/sealants, and PV specific materials.   What You’ll Do  Evaluate and qualify material candidates, including engineering plastics, composites, adhesives, pottants, and coatings, working closely with the industrial design, mechanical design, electrical design, optical design, manufacturing and supply chain teams Engage with and manage external partners and vendors for materials development and drive implementation into production Perform materials characterization/performance evaluation by conducting analytical studies in collaboration with process/reliability teams Conduct Failure Analysis to understand and correct materials and design shortcomings. Support the design team in analyzing trade-offs via FMEA Understand application-relevant mechanical properties of polymeric components. Develop corresponding structure-property relationships Understand degradation pathways vis stress/reliability testing and on materials and components. Conduct accelerated (chamber) testing to understand degradation modes Determine and optimize process parameters for manufacturing processes of plastics/composites and adhesives.
