Game Composites and RecruitAERO Partnership RecruitAERO provides best-in-class internal, direct recruitment support for Game Composites and we complement their efforts in continuing to bring skilled talent into the company. Are you inspired by working for an innovative company in the aerospace industry? Do you want benefits that protect both you and your family? Do you want to work for a company where people are priority and unique opportunities are present? Let's talk! Why choose Game Composites? Game Composites is a growing aircraft business that designs, manufactures, and sells composite aircraft. Building type-certified, high-performance aircraft under an FAA production certificate that are then delivered and flown all over the world, Game Composites is an agile innovator and top performer in the industry. Game Composites emphasizes the importance of precision, consistency, and reliability with unique opportunities provided to employees. Providing an environment of growth and change, Game Composites affords the opportunity to learn new skillsets and work for a company that invests in their employees. Additional Perks: Medical coverage options with employer contribution (approximately 90% for employee and 50% for dependents). 4 (four) weeks of Paid Time Off that begins accruing on your first day of employment. 401(k) match up to 4% and vested immediately. Company flying club with aircraft available for employee use. Private pilot training available to employees after 1 (one) year of employment. Relocation assistance available. A salary that is based on your experience and expertise because we welcome high-value candidates. Want to be an Structures Engineer for Game Composites? The Structures Engineer plays a crucial role in designing, analyzing, and ensuring the structural integrity of aircraft structures, components, and systems. Your work will contribute to the safety, performance, and efficiency of general aviation aircraft, helping to advance the industry and enhance the flying experience. In this role, you will be responsible for: Designing and developing structural components, including airframes, wings, landing gear, and other critical elements of general aviation aircraft. Performing structural analysis on thermoset composites using computer-aided design (CAD) software, finite element analysis (FEA), and other tools to assess the structural integrity, stress analysis, and performance of aircraft components. Selecting appropriate materials and manufacturing processes to ensure optimal structural performance, weight, and durability, while adhering to industry and safety standards. Staying up-to-date with and ensure adherence to relevant aviation regulations and certification requirements, such as those from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). Participating in the development and testing of prototypes and perform failure analysis to improve designs and address structural issues. Working closely with multidisciplinary teams, including aerodynamics engineers, systems engineers, and manufacturing teams, to ensure integration of structural elements into the aircraft design. Assessing and optimize the cost-effectiveness of structural designs and make recommendations for improvements. Maintaining accurate records, design documentation, and reports to track the progress and ensure the traceability of design changes. Staying current with advancements in materials, technologies, and methodologies to propose innovative solutions and improve existing designs. Minimum requirements: Bachelor's in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field (relevant direct work experience will be considered in lieu of a degree). 7 (seven) or more years of relevant work experience in the aerospace industry. Proven experience in structural design and analysis of thermoset composites in general aviation or similar aerospace components. Experience with and an understanding of carbon fiber behaviors in an epoxy matrix. Proficiency in using CAD software and FEA tools (e.g., SolidWorks, ANSYS, or similar). Strong knowledge of aviation regulations and certification processes. Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills with an attention to detail. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing project requirements. Knowledge of materials and manufacturing processes specific to aircraft design. Want to stand out? Top performers in this role might also have: Experience working toward Type Certification of new aircraft (preferred). A Professional Engineer (PE) license (preferred). A Master's degree in a related field (preferred). High intellectual curiosity, creative thinking and problem-solving, and demonstrated initiative (preferred). Passion for aircraft, flying, and all things aviation (preferred). This is a full-time position with hours Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm, with overtime as needed. If you're ready to take your aviation career to new heights, apply today! Game Composites provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

DESCRIPTION:The Senior Mechanical Engineer will lead the mechanical design of various advanced nuclear power systems ranging from transportable reactor power system (Pylon), Nuclear Thermal Propulsion (NTP) to Radioisotope Thermoelectric Generator (RTG) based Nuclear Electric Propulsion (NEP) in addition to the Micro Modular Reactor (MMR). The Senior Mechanical Engineer will own the mechanical design at a system level, understanding requirements, identifying engineering needs, developing project plans, and leading the team through the process from design to build. This role will be a combination of technical leadership and individual technical contribution. This position will bring expertise leading and performing mechanical, thermal, and structural design with specific experience relevant to the design of nuclear, space payloads, and/or power generating systems. The position will lead the mechanical design and testing, with scope including mechanical design of the reactor vessel, reactor plant structures, systems, and components, including heat exchangers, heat rejection systems, piping networks, valves, and control assemblies. This is complex, multi-disciplinary work that requires outside-the-box thinking and close attention to detail. At USNC, we value a diverse and inclusive workplace culture in order to hire the top talent in our industry from the entire talent pool. Our team is comprised of individuals from all different backgrounds and walks of life which have one thing in common: they have the best hearts and minds to solve the incredible challenges we have ahead of us in the space-nuclear industry. The qualifications listed below are an approximation, not a checklist. Please consider applying if you are excited to be a part of our team even if you do not explicitly meet 100% of the qualifications.RESPONSIBILITIES:Collaboratively leads the integrated mechanical system design of nuclear power system. Develops reactor core components from concept to implementation. An early focus will be the design of the reactor vessel and internals, including core support plates, restraints, insulation, and structural mounts. Analyzes the mechanical and thermal aspects of reactor design elements. For example, use or direct the use of Finite Element Analysis software to determine the impact of vibration, thermal expansion, and structural loading on components. Documents design decisions and write technical reports. Acts as the mechanical engineering point of contact for external partners and customers directly interfacing with the program. Develops test plans, design test infrastructure, and execute tests during development test campaigns. Organizes effective resource loading amongst the team, estimate engineering utilization/needs and support program management in building a program plan to manage product development. Continually fosters an environment of communication and collaboration not only on the team you lead but also with adjacent teams as well. Demonstrates the ability to be self-motivated by proactively identifying, prioritizing, and executing tasks in a fast-moving environment. Demonstrates the ability to communicate technical information to high level stakeholders and customers. Displays strong commitment to employee safety and well-being. Displays commitment to inclusive and collaborative work environmentEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:A Bachelor's degree in nuclear engineering, aerospace engineering, mechanical engineering, or similar. Preferred Master's degree in nuclear engineering, aerospace engineering, mechanical engineering, or similar with 10+ years professional experience. 8+ years of experience in the design, build, and testing of mechanical systems, and/ or nuclear reactors and their sub-components. Experience with detailed mechanical design including machined parts, additively manufactured parts, weldments, fasteners, seals, springs, bearings, and translating/ rotating assemblies. Experience with material selection (preferably including standard nuclear & aerospace metals, exotic metals, high-temperature composites, and ceramics). Experience post processing test data to evaluate component performance and inform design changes. Preferred licensed Professional Engineer credentials Preferred experience designing ASME BPVC compliant components Preferred experience working under an ASME NQA-1 design program Preferred experience in performing FEA/ FEM for static, dynamic, and/or thermal analysis of mechanical systems (preferably Ansys, Simcenter 3D, or Thermal Desktop). Preferred experience designing safety-critical components in nuclear, aerospace, medical, or other highly regulated, high-consequence applications. Preferred experience with the design, analysis, and test of nuclear components. Must have working knowledge or be familiar with SharePoint, Microsoft Office SuiteKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:Have excellent verbal, written communication, and time management skills Have a strong orientation toward internal and external customers Can work with other departments to increase overall strength of the group and company Maintains collaborative, courteous, and respectful relationships Possesses excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively communicate with others Is proficient with GD&T, tolerance stack up analysis, and assembly/ component part drawings. Is proficient with assembly and component design in CAD (NX preferred) Is proficient in structural analysis including experience with impact and vibration analysis. Is proficient in design for manufacturing. Able to foster a collaborative team environmentWORK CONDITIONS:Most of the normal duties will be performed inside, which will involve almost constant interaction with other employees and/or the public with frequent interruptions Travel is required on an as needed basis and out of town and international travel is required Some irregular hours are required; these may include nights, weekends, holidays, and emergencies Must be able to work in generally accepted office and field environments Must have the resources to work successfully from home Exceptional command of engineering fundamentals including structural mechanics, heat transfer, incompressible/ compressible flow, and materials.EXPORT CONTROL REQUIREMENTS:To confirm to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., or a protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3).Are you legally authorized to work in the United States? Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for an immigration-related employment benefit (e.g., H-1B, TN, green card, etc.)?EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT:USNC embraces diversity and equal opportunity and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are striving to build the diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that will make our technology a reality. USNC actively encourages applicants from historically underrepresented backgrounds to apply to this and other roles, acknowledging and committing to address the historical lack of diversity within the nuclear and aerospace industries.USNC does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status.SALARY RANGE: 118.8k-157.7k USDCOMPENSATION: This position is eligible to participate in our performance bonus plan.BENEFITS: In addition to our base compensation package, Ultra Safe Nuclear also offers:36 days of paid time off per year 11 paid holidays A generous PPO or HSA health insurance plan, available at no cost for employee coverage A dental insurance plan, available at no cost for employee coverage A vision insurance plan, available at no cost for employee coverage Access to a commuter benefit Short-term disability insurance Long-term disability insurance Basic term life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance provided at no cost A 401(k) plan which includes a discretionary employer match Voluntary Life Insurance is also availableABOUT ULTRA SAFE NUCLEAR:Based in Seattle, Ultra Safe Nuclear Corporation (USNC) develops nuclear hardware and services for reliable, clean energy anywhere on Earth and in space. USNC offers full-stack capabilities including specialized reactor design services, advanced materials and fuel development, and reactor manufacturing and system deployment.USNC has offices in USA, Canada, France, Korea, Poland, South Africa, the UK and more.

San Diego - Headquarters Engineering Regular Full Time   At Element Biosciences, we are passionate about our mission to develop high performing products to study genomics with unprecedented flexibility and quality that enable researchers to better understand biology for the improvement of global health. We have built a highly efficient product-driven organization where employees can learn, grow, and thrive in a challenging but encouraging environment. We are committed to scientific integrity, collegiality, honesty, objectivity, and openness. We are seeking a Staff Optomechanical Engineer to drive optomechanical design of complex scientific instruments integrating optics, fluidics, motion, thermal, and electrical functions. This is a key role within our instrument mechanical engineering group requiring a technical expert with previous experience collaborating closely with cross-functional teammates from R&D and Operations. Strong engineering fundamentals, rigorous critical thinking skills, and a methodical product development approach are essential attributes to being successful in the role. This position will be on-site at our San Diego headquarters. If you possess the following and want to make a meaningful impact, we invite you to explore this role. Essential Functions and Responsibilities: Drive the design, prototyping, and commercialization of new optomechanical solutions in close collaboration with the optical system design team. Design mechanical structures to interface with and integrate the optical system into advanced desktop scientific instruments. Manage internal and external optomechanical development projects. Contribute to interdisciplinary root cause analysis involving structural tolerance loops, material and thermal sources of variation, and other optical considerations. Translate market requirements into optomechanical architecture, product requirements, module designs, and component selection. Develop test protocols, metrology tools and methods, and calibration/adjustment approaches to achieve optical performance targets. Verify and transfer reliable optomechanical designs from R&D to Operations. Support existing product line and cross-functional troubleshooting as required. Lead design reviews, sourcing and procurement, and integration of proof of concept and prototype optomechanical assemblies. Contribute to the company’s product development roadmap by exploring new technologies and design concepts. Other duties, as assigned. Education and Experience: BS required (MS preferred) in Mechanical Engineering and 8+ years of relevant work experience (or equivalent combination of education and industry experience). Proven track record as a lead optomechanical engineer on development programs spanning from concept to commercialization. Solid understanding of the fundamentals of optomechanical design including kinematic mounts, exact constraint, tolerance analysis, material selection, and thermally stable design. Expertise and proficiency with SolidWorks required. Familiarity with SolidWorks FEA packages a plus. Experience with component and assembly metrology methods required. Familiarity with Structural-Thermal-Optical-Performance (STOP) analysis a plus. Excellent first-principles-focused mechanical engineer with insight into optomechanical design challenges. Proactive self-starter who drives action, investigations, and delivers results without task-level structured guidance. Demonstrated ability to navigate uncertainty in a fast-paced, interdisciplinary environment and quickly adjust to evolving technology and priorities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, capable of clearly explaining technical issues and ideas to peers and management. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Must be able to lift 15 pounds Location: San Diego Travel: N/A Job Type: Full Time, Exempt Base Compensation Pay Range: $125,800 - $165,267 In addition to base compensation noted above, you will be eligible for stock options, discretionary annual bonus, no cost health insurance plans, 401k with company match, and flexible paid time off. Please note: Base compensation will depend on multiple factors, including geographic location, qualifications, and experience. We foster an environment such that all people are afforded the freedom to pursue their passions without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law.

Position Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Hardware Engineer to join our team and take charge of all mechanical and hardware aspects of our groundbreaking product, AIMS. AIMS is an AI-enabled ambient intelligence platform designed to reduce risks in a clinical setting. As the Senior Hardware Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the successful development, design, and implementation of AIMS's hardware components. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver a high-quality, reliable, and innovative product that meets the needs of our customers. Responsibilities: 1. Lead the hardware development and design efforts of the AIMS platform, taking ownership of all mechanical and hardware aspects of the product from concept to production. 2. Collaborate with the product management team to define hardware requirements, specifications, and design goals, ensuring alignment with overall product vision and objectives. 3. Conduct thorough feasibility studies and technical assessments to identify and select appropriate hardware components, materials, and manufacturing processes. 4. Develop and execute comprehensive hardware design plans, including schematic capture, PCB layout, and mechanical design, considering factors such as form factor, reliability, manufacturability, and regulatory compliance. 5. Utilize your deep expertise in product design and management to drive innovation, cost-effectiveness, and scalability in hardware development, while meeting project timelines and budget constraints. 6. Lead prototype development and testing, validating design performance, functionality, and reliability, and coordinating with cross-functional teams for system integration. 7. Collaborate closely with software engineers, AI experts, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration between hardware and software components, optimizing overall system performance. 8. Conduct thorough design reviews and provide technical guidance to junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing within the hardware team. 9. Stay abreast of emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in hardware engineering, applying relevant knowledge to enhance product design and performance. 10. Support manufacturing and production processes, collaborating with external vendors, suppliers, and contract manufacturers to ensure smooth transition from prototype to mass production. Qualifications: 1. A minimum of 10 years of professional experience in product design, with a focus on hardware engineering and product management. 2. Master's degree or higher in mechanical engineering or a related field. An advanced degree in a relevant discipline is preferred. 3. Proven track record of successfully leading hardware design and development projects from concept to production in a fast-paced environment. 4. Extensive experience in selecting and integrating electronic components, PCB design, mechanical design, and design for manufacturing (DFM) principles. 5. Strong knowledge of industry standards, regulations, and best practices related to hardware design and development, including safety and compliance considerations. 6. Proficiency in using relevant hardware design and simulation tools (e.g., CAD, SPICE, FEA) and PCB layout software. 7. Excellent problem-solving skills and a systematic approach to debugging and troubleshooting hardware-related issues. 8. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners. 9. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing project requirements. 10. Passion for innovation, emerging technologies, and a drive to deliver high-quality products that have a positive impact on the healthcare industry. Join our dynamic and passionate team to revolutionize the clinical setting with the groundbreaking AIMS platform. Apply your expertise in hardware engineering and product management to contribute to the development of a cutting-edge, AI-enabled product that enhances patient safety and improves healthcare outcomes.

About Rondo Energy Rondo Energy's mission is to eliminate 15% of global CO2 emissions in 15 years. To accomplish this mission, Rondo is deploying low-cost, zero-carbon Rondo Heat Batteries to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy and to significantly decarbonize industrial processes that are commonly thought of as "difficult-to-decarbonize". Our Heat Batteries charge from intermittent renewables to provide high temperature, continuous heat for customers safely, reliably, at an unprecedented 98% efficiency - and at a cost point that is lower than any other method.  We are looking for an experienced, innovative Structural Engineer to join our team and repower industrial heat at scale. This role will require deep fundamental understanding of structural elements across a variety of material types, experience in design and integration of high-temperature structural elements and complex process equipment, and the capacity to work autonomously with both internal stakeholders and external vendors. Furthermore, this role will require familiarity and comfort in working in a fast-paced environment, comfort in working with uncertainty, assessing risk, and developing multi-disciplinary solutions in a collaborative team setting. Join our team and together we can reduce world CO₂ emissions by 1% in 10 years, and by 15% in 15 years! What You Will Do (key responsibilities for this role include but are not limited to):Convert product requirements into technical specifications, developing conceptual and detailed designs along with the necessary risk assessmentsPerform engineering design, analysis, prototyping and/or testing required to achieve robust and cost-effective solutions for our core technology, as well as on tooling and other equipment to support manufacturingLead assessment of structural requirements and requirements over a variety of potential site types, including high seismic, high wind loading, among others. Use assessments to design individual componentry and act as team expert in fully system structural integrityOperate in an inclusive, collaborative, and iterative design team, contributing to fostering an open engineering culture What You Will Bring:Bachelor's degree in Engineering, or equivalent industry experience5+ years of hands-on experience in Mechanical Design Engineering, with a focus on structural hardware3+ Experience working with process/industrial system infrastructure projects, or comparable construction projectsExperience working with several types of structural materials including steel construction, high temperature alloys, structural ceramics, cement, among othersFamiliarity with structural and thermal modeling techniques including FEA, heat transfer analysis, and stress cycling lifecycle estimationExperience working with one more of the following: high-temperature or elevated pressure structural systems, high-seismic loads, and high wind loadsExperience and leadership in developing and maintaining structural and thermal models for complex process systemsSoftware: SW (Expert), AutoCAD (Intermediate)Excellent communication skills; comfortable gathering, synthesizing, and disseminating program information among internal and external technical and non-technical partiesFlexibility, openness, and creative problem-solvingComfort working with fast-based environments, with uncertainty, and in collaborative team settings What We Offer:Comprehensive Medical BenefitsDental & Vision BenefitsLife Insurance and ADDUp to 13 paid holidays per year, in addition to a company week-long holiday in DecemberFlexible time off policy401(k) plan with company matchRondo HQ is close to Oakland airport - one block from the Bay - and has stunning Bay views! This nature of this role necessitates being majority on-site at our Houston office, with frequent travel to our Alameda, CA headquarters. Please note that some pay bands may have wide ranges of compensation to accommodate candidates' diverse sets of skill levels and experience. Rondo Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create a supportive and inclusive workplace where contributions are valued and celebrated, and our employees thrive by being themselves and are inspired to do their best work. We seek applicants of all backgrounds and identities, across race, color, ethnicity, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or parental status, or disability. Applicants will not be discriminated against based on these or other protected categories or social identities. Rondo is committed to the full inclusion of all applicants. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the interview process, please let our recruiting team know. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. Note to Recruitment Agencies: Rondo does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Furthermore, Rondo Energy does not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its approved partners.

JOB SUMMARY Responsible for the structural certification aircraft interior units, including all supporting stress analysis. Presents analysis in Interface Loads Reports or Stress Analysis Reports. Creates static test plans to certify aircraft interior units via static testing. Able to determine specific certification requirements from FAA and customer documentation. Participates in the development of new products and technical proposals in order to enable the company to capture new and additional business. Participates in the preparation and presentation of Design Reviews. Directs the evaluation and approval of repair procedures. Should possess the motivation to complete projects on time and represent the company's core values. SUMMARY OF JOB DUTIES Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions: Determine structural certification path for installations, units, and components. Carry out preliminary and detailed stress analysis of aircraft interior units and components using FEA (FEMAP/NASTRAN) and hand calculations. Prepare interface loads reports and static test plans/reports, stress analysis reports, comparative analysis reports, etc. Manage static testing efforts, including instructing the technician on the setup and verifying its accuracy prior to start of static testing, interfacing with the DER to coordinate static testing and resolve any deviations from the test plan. Assist technician with fabrication of the setup as needed. Acts as primary interface with customer stress engineers to identify and assist in articulation of customer requirements and priorities; discuss and resolve technical/program issues and problems. and provide contract status and updates. Identifies, evaluates, establishes, and implements alternative courses of action in response to changing customer focus, requirements, or needs relating to structural analysis.May act as a functional lead over other stress engineers on one or more projects (Level II or III only). GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS – Education, Knowledge, and Experience Education: A High School Diploma is required. A four-year college degree (Bachelor’s degree) is required, with a major in    Mechanical Engineering Aerospace Engineering Civil Engineering A related field (coursework in Strength of Materials is highly desired, coursework in FEA, Analysis of Composite Materials, and Stress Analysis desired) Master’s degree is desired. Experience: Level I: 0-5 years of direct experience Level II: 2-10 years of direct experience Level III: 7+ years of direct experience Skills: Strong computer knowledge Advanced finite element modeling skills required (Level II and III). FEMAP/NASTRAN is preferred, but PATRAN, Abaqus, Ansys and others may be considered. Ability to prepare and review detailed stress reports to company, FAA and customer standards. Ability to review drawings with other company disciplines and provide structures input. Ability to define structural test requirements for laboratory and full-scale testing. Ability to review test results and correlate with analytical models. Must possess good understanding of aerospace materials and manufacturing processes. Ability to review overall design and provide structures input at PDR & CDR. Preferred Skills/Experience: Programming (VBA macros) Catia V5 working knowledge. Previous experience fabricating with wood and steel due to the hands-on nature of physical testing, which the stress engineer defines in test plans. Experience with design for aircraft interiors, specifically, aircraft galleys. Other: Extended or irregular hours may be required. Must be authorized to work in the United States. Employer will not sponsor applicant for employment visa status. Boeing EnCore is an “at-will” employer; employment is at the mutual consent of both the employee and the employer, and may be terminated at will for any reason, with or without cause, at any time during employment with the Company. As business conditions warrant a change in the operating necessities of the Company, all employees are expected to react productively, handle other essential tasks assigned now or in the future. Tasks may vary slightly based on products produced at a division. CERTIFICATES AND LICENSES SUPERVISION PROVIDED TO THE POSITIONWork is provided to this position on a goal or project basis. Independently determines methods and procedures of how to accomplish routine work. May receive general instructions on new assignments. LEADERSHIP RESPONSIBILITYMay oversee work teams as related to stress engineering (Levels II and III). PROBLEM SOLVINGDevelop and provide solutions for a variety of problems based on established precedents and policies. LANGUAGE SKILLSAbility to communicate clearly and effectively in English, both verbally and in writing.

Job Description:    Role Summary:    Lead engineering efforts in the new product development, design and implementation of one or multiple new product platforms in a cross functional environment. Duties include but not limited to overseeing the design, schedule, prototyping, testing and the launch of a new product – per an agreed product definition and business plan. Translate input from product marketing and consumers into new product designs and specifications working with the Design Engineers, Test lab, Manufacturing Engineers, Marketing, Industrial Designers and other team members to deliver the project to the business.    Essential Responsibilities:  Responsible for engineering, design, development and implementation of new products in accordance with the NPD process. Coordinate design tasks between internal and external ID and design teams. Compile engineering product development schedule with oversight from the NPD Leader and make sure that key engineering deliverables, quality, performance and cost targets are met. Establish test plans on each product design with the help of the product test engineer. Ensure approval with UL, CSA and other safety agencies with the help of the agency engineer. Assist the laboratory with preparation of test units and the analysis of test results. Work with TTI manufacturing plants and OEMs to ensure that products are constructed properly, that components, assemblies and products are manufacturable and conform to the performance standards. Interpret feedback from product marketing and consumer research to develop a clear design specification that will be used to define the detailed design and intent of the product. Work with in house and overseas engineering, manufacturing in the US and/or overseas Work with NPD management to report project status to great management team on regular basis. Work with Legal Team to establish IP clearance Facilitate regular team meetings to manage and drive cross functional tasks associated with the development of all aspects of the project from product packaging to components. Use Creo PTC software along with prototyping skills to lead the pre-development concept phase of the project. Create breadboard models, refine proof of concept prototypes and complete assembly layouts. Test and troubleshoot in the lab. Team with Industrial Designers and Marketing Team to deliver products that maintain cosmetic intent while meeting all functional requirements. Other Duties as assigned   Qualifications/Requirements:  Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical, Aeronautical or Electrical Engineering required Minimum 7 years experience in new product development team environment and 3D part design and model building. Minimum 7 years experience in plastic part design and electromechanical product design/testing experience Engineering work experience in new product development setting required. Creo experience preferred Technical background and worked as member of cross-functional product teams. Experience with plastic part design and molding constraints. Basic understanding of mold flow simulation, plastic tooling construction, FEA, CFD and DOE a plus. Background in electromechanical product design. Provide design solution/direction that improves product reliability and meets all project requirements including but not limited to cost, performance and schedule. Develop Value Analysis/Cost Analysis and quality improvements opportunities, prioritize and then develop a plan for implementation. Able to work effectively with internal and external resources including Asian team members. Ability to manage time between multiple projects. Able to convey technical concepts effectively through both written and verbal communication. Organized. Attention to detail. PC literate in Microsoft Office Creative yet practical in problem solving. Positive approach. Team player. High integrity. Takes Ownership. Action oriented. Dependable. Ability to mentor and develop internal technical resources Experience in FMEA product analysis. Experience in the hands on assembly of prototypes, products and disassembly of competitive products Overseas travel required (approximately 2-3 times/year, up to 3 weeks at a time) to attend OEM pilot builds, vendor evaluations, etc. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this position. POSITION OVERVIEW: Adapt Hussey’s bleacher and chair platform product lines to meet the event configuration needs of spectator seating venues. This individual will have ownership of projects throughout their lifecycle, from time of sale to completed installation. DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop Engineer-to-Order design solutions for Hussey’s bleacher and chair platform product lines. Oversee creation of code compliant submittal drawings for customer approval that reflect the product configurations to be provided. Collaborate with internal project managers and external parties to obtain information required for detailed design development and engineering. Complete field checks and assist with building scans and surveys. Utilize 3D design software and other applications to design and digitally fit seating platforms into the building space. Complete analysis of the platform structure and related designs. Prototype, test and validate new designs. Produce part drawings, instructions and other data required to manufacture and install the components of the seating solution into the final site configurations. Provide guidance during the manufacturing process of custom designs. Provide technical support throughout the installation, including call support and travelling to the site to assist with custom aspects of the installation. Mentor and assist with the technical development of team members. COMPETENCIES: (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities) Proficient with 3D parametric modeling of parts and large assemblies. Can perform stress analysis using hand calculations, spreadsheet tools and/or FEA. Can model and analyze structural systems and connections utilizing structural design software such as RISA. Familiar with structural design specifications and manuals, including ANSI/AISC 360, AISI Cold Form Steel Design, NDS for Wood Construction, and other structural design standards. Design experience with sheet metal fabrication, structural steel, Aluminum, welding, and wood. Mechanical aptitude fasteners, machine design, hydraulics. Experience with quick turn-around prototyping and testing. Demonstrated project management skills. Ability to plan, set priorities, and carry-out detail-oriented work to achieve project deliverables. Support corporate goal for continuous improvement bringing new ideas to reduce waste, improve production capabilities, and enhance performance. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively with others in a team environment Ability to work hands on in the lab and in the field. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: BS in Mechanical Engineering or Civil/Structural Engineering. An advanced degree and/or PE license is a plus. 10+ years’ relevant experience. 3D modeling experience. Experience with Autodesk Inventor a plus. Experience with ERP, PDM, and PLM systems. Proficient with MS Office suite. Open to occasional, short duration travel. Hussey Seating Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law.

About Rondo Energy Rondo Energy's mission is to eliminate 15% of global CO2 emissions in 15 years. To accomplish this mission, Rondo is deploying low-cost, zero-carbon Rondo Heat Batteries to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy and to significantly decarbonize industrial processes that are commonly thought of as "difficult-to-decarbonize". Our Heat Batteries charge from intermittent renewables to provide high temperature, continuous heat for customers safely, reliably, at an unprecedented 98% efficiency - and at a cost point that is lower than any other method.  We are looking for an experienced, innovative Structural Engineer to join our team and repower industrial heat at scale. This role will require deep fundamental understanding of structural elements across a variety of material types, experience in design and integration of high-temperature structural elements and complex process equipment, and the capacity to work autonomously with both internal stakeholders and external vendors. Furthermore, this role will require familiarity and comfort in working in a fast-paced environment, comfort in working with uncertainty, assessing risk, and developing multi-disciplinary solutions in a collaborative team setting. Join our team and together we can reduce world CO₂ emissions by 1% in 10 years, and by 15% in 15 years! What You Will Do (key responsibilities for this role include but are not limited to):Convert product requirements into technical specifications, developing conceptual and detailed designs along with the necessary risk assessmentsPerform engineering design, analysis, prototyping and/or testing required to achieve robust and cost-effective solutions for our core technology, as well as on tooling and other equipment to support manufacturingLead assessment of structural requirements and requirements over a variety of potential site types, including high seismic, high wind loading, among others. Use assessments to design individual componentry and act as team expert in fully system structural integrityOperate in an inclusive, collaborative, and iterative design team, contributing to fostering an open engineering culture What You Will Bring:Bachelor's degree in Engineering, or equivalent industry experience5+ years of hands-on experience in Mechanical Design Engineering, with a focus on structural hardware3+ Experience working with process/industrial system infrastructure projects, or comparable construction projectsExperience working with several types of structural materials including steel construction, high temperature alloys, structural ceramics, cement, among othersFamiliarity with structural and thermal modeling techniques including FEA, heat transfer analysis, and stress cycling lifecycle estimationExperience working with one more of the following: high-temperature or elevated pressure structural systems, high-seismic loads, and high wind loadsExperience and leadership in developing and maintaining structural and thermal models for complex process systemsSoftware: SW (Expert), AutoCAD (Intermediate)Excellent communication skills; comfortable gathering, synthesizing, and disseminating program information among internal and external technical and non-technical partiesFlexibility, openness, and creative problem-solvingComfort working with fast-based environments, with uncertainty, and in collaborative team settings What We Offer:Comprehensive Medical BenefitsDental & Vision BenefitsLife Insurance and ADDUp to 13 paid holidays per year, in addition to a company week-long holiday in DecemberFlexible time off policy401(k) plan with company matchRondo HQ is close to Oakland airport - one block from the Bay - and has stunning Bay views! This nature of this role necessitates being majority on-site at our Houston office, with frequent travel to our Alameda, CA headquarters. Please note that some pay bands may have wide ranges of compensation to accommodate candidates' diverse sets of skill levels and experience. Rondo Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create a supportive and inclusive workplace where contributions are valued and celebrated, and our employees thrive by being themselves and are inspired to do their best work. We seek applicants of all backgrounds and identities, across race, color, ethnicity, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or parental status, or disability. Applicants will not be discriminated against based on these or other protected categories or social identities. Rondo is committed to the full inclusion of all applicants. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the interview process, please let our recruiting team know. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. Note to Recruitment Agencies: Rondo does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Furthermore, Rondo Energy does not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its approved partners.

Forward is on a bold mission to make high quality healthcare available to a billion people across the globe. We’re building the world’s most advanced healthcare platform from the ground up, combining hardware, software and doctors under one roof. We are growing our hardware engineering team and looking for world-class design engineers with experience developing scalable hardware solutions from concept to production. As an early member of our engineering team, you’ll play a key role in building the future of healthcare. Your contributions will directly improve the lives of others. For real :)   Forward was founded in January 2016 by former executives and engineering leaders from Google and Uber. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs including Founder's Fund, Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital, Eric Schmidt (Google/Alphabet Chairman), Marc Benioff (Salesforce Founder), Joe Lonsdale (Palantir Founder), Joshua Kushner (Oscar co-Founder) and Garrett Camp (Uber co-Founder).   You can read our story here, take a virtual tour here, and check out news about Forward here.   What you’ll do:   Apply strong technical knowledge to solve the problems:  Work closely with Product and Design to assess feasibility of a new design and define product requirements.Generate robust 3D models and renderings and fully toleranced 2D drawings based on design intent and design collateral.Perform detailed mechanical analyses of structures, enclosures, mechanisms and assemblies.Finalize designs using your broad knowledge of engineering materials and manufacturing processes.Fabricate and debug functional prototypes to test and demonstrate your designs.Lead user experience reviews and technical feasibility reviews.Document and communicate your designs to ensure accurate implementation.Manage expectations on deliverables and schedules, identifying risks and communicating these to the team.Collaborate with external vendors throughout the development cycle as a technical owner of the vendor’s output. Own the results:  Challenge assumptions, identify the critical problems, prioritize those problems, recommend solutions, and implement those solutions. All of these pieces are needed to develop an innovative product.Drive collaborate with diverse expertise (product, design, software, hardware, ops, clinical) to solve full-stack problems with real-world constraints. Work with diverse people:  Work with amazing people from IDEO, Amazon, Nvidia, Google X, Airbnb, Uber, and NASA JPL. Everyone is passionate, smart, and hard working, and we bring our whole selves to work.As needed, travel to remote offices, test facilities, engineering partners, or manufacturing partners. What we’re looking for:   A drive for impact:  You are deeply mission-driven and you believe there’s more to life than software that enables puppy ears to be superimposed on photos, although we concede those are cute. A team-centered, entrepreneurial spirit:  You are a self-starter who loves to own things end-to-end. You don’t ask for permission: you’re too busy making things happen.You thrive in ambiguity and you see the win-win in situations. Challenges energize you.You care for the people, the team, and the business. People want to work with you because you bring out the best in them and you help the team succeed. First-principles thinking:  You make informed decisions by framing and defining the problem, exploring options, and recommending a solution based on trade offs. This is important because the types of problems Forward is solving are often yet-to-be-known challenges that might be buried deep under current societal norms or industry assumptions. Required technical skills and experience:  BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering, Design Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.>10 years of detailed and hands-on experience designing structures, enclosures, mechanisms and assemblies. Practical experience working through DFM.Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) including emails, preparing slide presentations, and presenting technical concepts to multi-disciplinary teams and external vendors.Familiarity with (and appreciation for) the product development process (early concept definition through mass production).Knowledge of diverse materials (metal, plastic, composites, soft goods) and manufacturing techniques (machining, molding, thermoforming, bending, secondary finishes).Strong analytical skills/engineering fundamentals including statics, dynamics, mechanics of materials, FEA and statistical tolerances.Fluency in 3D CAD (any modeling package), including resolving tolerance stack-ups and interference issues in 3D models.Fluency in 2D drawings, including basic GD&T knowledge.Proficiency in a variety of processes and hands-on skills to fabricate prototypes.Strong problem solving skills, with experience in failure analysis, root cause investigation, and DOE creation. Bonus technical skills and experience:  Experience identifying, selecting, and managing vendors for development and/or fabrication activities.    The base salary range for this full-time position is $130,000-$210,000, plus equity and benefits. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, experience, relevant education or training, and location.   Why join Forward? The healthcare industry is broken, and we refuse to just move dollars around the healthcare system. We want to rebuild it and fix it, all of it. You will be a major part of one of the most ambitious startup attempts of the past century. And you’ll work with a smart, experienced, and hard working team that wants to use their talents to make a positive impact on a global scale. We won’t finish until a billion people have access to high quality healthcare. Are you with us?   We are an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and afford equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We conform to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.   Information collected and processed as part of any job application you choose to submit is subject to Forward’s Privacy Notice to California Job Applicants.

Shift 1 (United States of America)    Job Description-      Position Summary:        Rotex is looking for a Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer - VAVE to join our team in Cincinnati, OH. As a Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer - Value Analysis/Value Engineering you will be responsible identifying and implementing improvements in our design and manufacturing processes using efficient and sound engineering practices and procedures. You will also manage complex customer orders in an efficient manner with minimal oversight from management.    What you’ll do:          Identify areas of high cost within our current product offerings and make re-designs to improve manufacturability and function without decreasing longevity.            Utilize FEA (Ansys) to prove out design concepts prior to manufacturing.            Perform R&D and cost analyses to prove out design concepts.            Perform product design work at a highly efficient pace with minimal errors in accordance with Rotex engineering processes and procedures.            Provide engineering support to existing customers via work instructions, troubleshooting or field visits.            Design and test prototype parts and assemblies for the purpose of validating new production concepts.            Develop simulation skills and learn to evaluate standard modeling techniques.            Mentor other Engineers and actively participate in their talent development.            Develop and document design standards based on manufacturing and/or customer feedback.            Review and approve other engineer’s design work while referencing the department’s design principles and checklists.            Lead continuous improvement activities that support current business initiatives.            Other duties may be assigned         Basic Requirements:          Bachelor’s degree (B.S./B.A.) or equivalent from a college or university in an engineering discipline            3+ years related design experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience with an emphasis in product design/development            Value Analysis/Value Engineering (VAVE) experience            Experience in reducing costs and improving manufacturability            Must be able to travel up to 15% of the time         Preferred Qualifications:          Understanding of latest technologies pertaining to sheet metal, welding, assembly and manufacturing.            Capable of executing the PDCA process at an intermediate skill level.            Ansys Finite Element Analysis experience (FEA)            Experience with 3D modeling (Solidworks) and ERP software.            Knowledge of DFM with respect to forming, welding and assembly.          #LI-RB1      Who we are:    Rotex pioneered the dry separation industry and grew to become a global manufacturer of industrial separation equipment, becoming a subsidiary of Hillenbrand, Inc. in 2011. Rotex now sets the standards for maximizing yield and minimizing waste for a host of Fortune 500 companies in processing facilities around the world.   The Rotex story of superior separations starts with the people who work here. Our associates are our number-one asset; this fine group of people helped Rotex expand from a regional Cincinnati company to a strong global competitor. And we’re not done yet. We’re always looking for great people to add to our story and to help us write the next chapter in our history. Rotex is a Operating Company of Hillenbrand.  Hillenbrand (NYSE: HI) is a global industrial company that provides highly-engineered, mission-critical processing equipment and solutions to customers in over 100 countries around the world. Our portfolio is composed of leading industrial brands that serve large, attractive end markets, including durable plastics, food, and recycling. Guided by our Purpose — Shape What Matters For Tomorrow™ — we pursue excellence, collaboration, and innovation to consistently shape solutions that best serve our associates, customers, communities, and other stakeholders. To learn more, visit: www.Hillenbrand.com.   EEO: The policy of Hillenbrand Inc. is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, Hillenbrand Inc. and our operating companies are committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at recruitingaccommodations@hillenbrand.com . In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying. At Hillenbrand, everyone is welcome to apply and "Shape What Matters for Tomorrow".

Job Description:    Under the direction of the Automation Engineering Manager, the Senior Controls Engineer will be responsible for the development and implementation of a new generation of leading-edge, high speed, automated manufacturing assembly and test equipment for power tools. Scoping out risks for manufacturing and establishing a plan to mitigate. The individual will take the projects from original concept through final implementation while ensuring long-term sustainment and support.        This position works in a team environment and uses engineering expertise, project management, and leadership abilities to contribute to the development of automated manufacturing assembly and test solutions for existing and future operations for Milwaukee Tool.            You’ll be DISRUPTIVE through these duties and responsibilities:              Mentor and coach team of automation engineers in the designing, prototyping, testing, and commissioning of automated solutions for a variety of projects.                Lead the development of collecting CTQ’s, concepts, schematics, test plans, and processes for new automation systems development.                Execute technical project roadmaps identifying critical electronic and controls components and creating robust design architectures for use globally.                Champion technology investigations including system requirements, architecture definitions, and reusability strategies.                Quickly, effectively, and candidly frame-up and escalate business risks/opportunities to senior leadership.                Mentor and coach the team in engineering best practices including task management, Gantt charts, root cause analysis, control automation design, and software programming.                Effectively communicate and motivate up, down and across the organization to a diverse range of technical and non-technical team members.                Programming of industrial control systems consisting of PC and PLC based applications utilizing SCADA methodology.                Drive urgency in project schedules and accountability for establishing and achieving key project metrics that meet the organization’s needs.                Responsible for building upon established standards for electrical/controls and software engineering aspects of design, testing, and start-up for our manufacturing assembly and test solutions.                Strong analytical skills, knowledge, and experience in process evaluation tools: Design of Experiments (DOE), Finite Element Analysis (FEA), PFMEA, DFMEA, statistical data analysis, risk analysis, flow layout and other related engineering tools.                Work cross functionally with New Product Development design engineers, manufacturing engineers, quality/reliability, and other teams to evaluate and advise product design for optimized testability and manufacturability (DFA/DFT).                Responsible for the research, evaluation, and implementation of new technologies and breakthrough processes to accelerate competitive manufacturing advantage.                Provide multiple design concepts for trade-off discussions in finding the ideal solution for ROI, cost, quality, and delivery.                Maintain and build upon standard electrical design architecture to be used by other engineers in the design of automation assembly and test systems.                Design with lean intent/design for manufacturing (flow, ergonomics and safety of production associates) including standards set by Milwaukee Tool and regulatory bodies such as NFPA, CEN, OSHA and ISA.                Excellent interpersonal skills to work in a team environment and challenge status quo with respect, to drive the best solutions for the business              What TOOLS you’ll bring with you:              Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in Electrical Engineering, or related engineering field.                7+ years of experience in the design, construction, and programming of automated manufacturing assembly and/or test systems at the subassembly and final assembly level.                Development experience with communication protocols, such as IO-Link, Discrete IO, EtherCAT, Ethernet IP, OPCUA, TCP/IP, RS-232, RS-485, CAN, etc.                Experience with advanced control systems used to automate manufacturing processes including pneumatics used in motion control, programmable controllers, sensors, vision systems, and robotics.                LabVIEW programming experience.                Advanced PLC programming experience.                Advanced computer knowledge and skills using MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Outlook, MS Project, and Solid works/AutoCAD/NX.                Must be flexible and willing to adapt to changes and short deadlines.                Experience with electrical and industrial machinery safety.                The ability to work well with people and independently, problem solver, organized, good written and verbal skills, strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize and multi-task                Excellent organizational and facilitation skills.                Ability to be interactive “hands on” with each upcoming engineering project.                Effectively utilize data when analyzing issues and problem solving.

Lead EngineerWho We Are:  Join the team innovating thermal solutions, nominated a "Best Place to Work" in PA this year!   Advanced Cooling Technologies, Inc. (ACT) is a premier thermal management solutions company. We serve diverse markets including Defense, Aerospace, HVAC, Power Electronics and Medical.   ACT is strongly committed to our customers, employees, and community. Innovation, Teamwork and Customer Care are our core values that drive the continuous growth of our company. Our skilled staff is a critical factor in our success.   We provide thermal products and engineering services to the world's leading defense and industrial companies such as Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman, Boeing, General Electric, Intel, and Hewlett Packard. We also conduct advanced research work for government agencies including NASA, DOD, and DOE. Our products and technologies have become integral parts of numerous mission-critical equipment, from life-saving MRI and CT scanners to energy-efficient building HVAC systems to weather and telecommunications satellites.  Position summary: The Product Development Lead Engineer will lead a small group of engineers and technicians in designing and prototyping thermal management solutions to meet specific customer specifications. The Lead Engineer is responsible for all aspects of a project throughout its life cycle, including concept generation, sales support, project management, customer interaction, and budget control. At any given time, the Lead Engineer is responsible for the success of multiple projects. Quite frequently, the Lead Engineer is also responsible for working with the manufacturing department to transition the product design into production.  Performance Metrics IncludeRevenue and Profit on product development projectsOn Time and High-Quality Delivery, and Customer SatisfactionLeadership and Personal DevelopmentMinimum requirements include:US. citizenship or permanent residencyB.S. or M.S. degree in Mechanical or Chemical EngineeringMinimum of 8 years of engineering experience in a technically oriented companyProject management experienceProficiency in using commercial CAD, FEA and CFD softwareHands-on experience with mechanical fabrication, measurement, and computerized data acquisition;Good verbal and written skills.The ideal candidate will possess the following qualities:Initiative: Product Development engineers don't have a daily agenda given to them and are expected to take it upon themselves to work closely with customers, vendors and ACT personnel to fulfill projects goals and objectives.Teamwork skills: Any effective leader must also be an excellent team member. As a member of the product development team, the ideal candidate must have the ability to give and receive encouragement and constructive criticism, communicate effectively, and work cooperatively with team members to achieve common goals. They must effectively balance the personalities and opinions of various team members to maximize each member's effectiveness and direct the team toward meeting the customer's goals and expectationsCritical thinking skills: The product development customer and projects vary widely, and the strategies and design approaches that worked for one program may be completely different for the next opportunity. Because of that, we need a curious individual who loves to dive in, experiment, and develop innovative solutions to new challenges.Desire to grow: The ideal candidate wants to be the best at their job and is never content with "good enough". They set lofty goals and constantly seek to improve themselves and expand their professional knowledge and skillset. They desire to sharpen their engineering and project management skills and grow in leadership ability and responsibility.Technical knowledge: We are looking for a candidate who has a strong academic engineering background, coupled with hands-on skills and fabrication and testing capabilities. Leadership ability: At ACT we believe that leaders are not defined by title or position, but by character and conduct. Our Lead Engineers must possess confidence, humility, and emotional intelligence in addition to their technical knowledge.  ACT is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other trait protected by law.

Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business. Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! Division Information Kenworth Truck Company, founded in 1923, is the manufacturer of The World’s Best® heavy and medium duty trucks. With an excellent heritage of quality, innovation, and technology, Kenworth has played an essential role in the development of trucks that are more fuel efficient, productive, and economical to operate. Today, Kenworth is leading transportation innovation with the introduction of battery-electric vehicles, exploration of fuel cell electric powertrains, and autonomous driving systems. Kenworth is committed to fostering an environment of diversity, equality, and inclusivity in the workplace. Requisition Summary: Kenworth Truck Company is seeking a Lead CAE Durability Engineer to support Product Development and Validation by using CAE to analyze new designs and provide design recommendations to meet functional/performance requirements. This role offers professional development and access to global opportunities in a challenging, high-performance environment with the opportunity to grow your expertise and be recognized among your peers. Job Functions / Responsibilities: Analyze components, sub-assemblies, assemblies, and full vehicle using FEA tools (such as ABAQUS, LS-DYNA, Altair products), Fatigue life calculation tools (such as nCode, Fe-safe) Develop DFMEA driven upfront CAE scope, performance requirement targets, and plan for Design Development and Validation for Durability, Stiffness, NVH and Strength Guide Engineering Design in the development, tuning and optimization to create durable components and assemblies Lead component, sub-systems, and vehicle testing to correlate CAE models Collaborate with suppliers/vendors to improve the material database and accuracy of CAE models Develop and refine CAE analysis procedures and process through method development and capability enhancements Collaborate with Property Owner for Durability/NVH for new vehicles Conduct or coordinate work with internal & external CAE and test resources including other PACCAR divisions Collaborate with Property Owner to conduct or coordinate benchmark tests of PACCAR and competitive vehicles Deliver CAE reports stating clear recommendations and proposals for improvements to Engineering teams Manage delivery of outsourced CAE activities Develop technology roadmaps for Kenworth simulation and analysis toolset Mentor vehicle engineers in the principles of design for Structural Durability, Fatigue, and NVH Qualifications: Technical Skills (required): 7+ years of experience with Implicit (static and dynamic structural analysis) and explicit analysis Expert in linear & non-linear FEA software: Optistruct, Nastran, ABAQUS, and LS-DYNA Working experience of fatigue life calculators (nCode, Fe-safe) Knowledge and previous working experience with structural analysis Knowledge of Fatigue theory Experience with CAD software such as Creo Parametric Demonstrate the ability and desire to learn new tools and stay updated with the latest technological advancements in the industry Work independently while building cooperation among individuals and departments, sharing information and resources, and working to achieve goals and outcomes meeting expectations of internal and external customers Effective analysis and project management skills and excellent engineering judgment Effective communication, administration, and presentation skills Self-driven with concentration on ownership, execution and accountability Ability to manage personal workload, demonstrate flexibility, initiative, and the willingness to respond to shifting timelines and project demands Technical Skills (preferred): Interest or experience with multi-body dynamics and vehicle dynamics Interest or experience with explicit analysis such as crash or drop Scripting experience – Python and MatLab preferred Background in the automotive or heavy truck industry Education: Bachelor’s degree in Structural/Mechanical Engineering or equivalent required; Master’s degree in Structural/Mechanical Engineering or equivalent preferred As a U.S. PACCAR employee, you have a full range of benefit options including: 401k with up to a 5% company match Fully funded pension plan that provides monthly benefits after retirement Comprehensive paid time off – minimum of 10 paid vacation days (additional days are provided with additional seniority/years of service), 12 paid holidays, and sick time Tuition reimbursement for continued education Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA) Paid short-and long-term disability programs Life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance EAP services include wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling, and more Additional Job Board Information At PACCAR, we value talent and promote growth and development. We carefully consider numerous compensation factors including your education, training, or experience. The salary range for Lead Structural CAE Engineer is $93,000-$145,500 annually. This position is also eligible for a holiday gift. Additionally, this role is eligible for the full range of benefit options listed above.
