Requisition ID: 272865 Relocation Authorized: National - Family Grade: 26-27 Position to be Panel Interviewed? No Telework Type: Part-Time Telework Work Location: Richland, WA Salary Range: $105,060 - $182,670 annually(Determined by function, education, experience, and qualifications of the applicant. A 15% salary uplift is provided on top of base salary for positions that are worked in New York City or San Francisco, which is subject to change depending on market conditions.). Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place. Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers’ objectives to create a lasting positive impact. We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations. Core to Bechtel is our values – ethics, safety, quality, people, culture, relationships, innovation and sustainability, and our covenants – integrity, respect, collaboration, trust, and delivery. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver. Project Overview Join us as we make history at the Hanford Vit Plant, known as the Waste Treatment and Immobilization Plant. We are designing and building a one-of-a-kind facility that will turn radioactive and chemical waste left over from World War II and Cold War plutonium production into a form safe for disposal. Your efforts will help protect the nearby Columbia River and the communities, salmon, and wildlife along its shorelines throughout the Northwest. Sitting at the confluence of the Columbia, Snake and Yakima rivers near two mountain ranges, our community provides access to year-round outdoor recreation, 300 days of sun a year, more than 200 wineries within a 50-mile radius, and the amenities of large cities just a three-hour drive (or short flight) to Seattle and Portland. Position Summary Upon initial hire and onboarding, the position will require full time presence in the Richland, Washington project office, then may offer part-time telework flexibility. This position works a 9/80 schedule, offering every other Friday off. You will be working as member of the Equipment Analysis Group designing and analyzing complex mechanical equipment. You will be preparing design documentation, performing calculations using engineering software, and preparing specifications for complex mechanical equipment used in the waste treatment process and support systems. Responsibilities Perform equipment analyses using CFD or FEA software to produce equipment design calculations, as well as perform reviews of analyses and other submittals prepared by equipment vendors. Resolve technical issues related to the equipment design and discuss them with other disciplines, groups, suppliers and the customer. Interface and coordinate with other engineering disciplines in the development of the design. Support the production of the equipment drawings. This may be performed as an individual contributor or leading other engineers. Prepare reports and studies in resolving open technical issues related to the equipment design. Support development of cost estimates and schedules for mechanical equipment. Ensure work is performed to the project’s quality standards for nuclear facilities while executing to the schedule. Qualifications and Skills Basic Qualifications Level One: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Civil Engineering (or equivalent) with minimum of 9 years of experience. Related experience includes, but is not limited to, the design and fabrication of complex equipment, experience with liquid & gas handling equipment preferred (vessels, tanks, air handling equipment, mixers, etc.) Level Two: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Civil Engineering (or equivalent) with minimum of 13 years of experience. Related experience includes, but is not limited to, the design and fabrication of complex equipment, experience with liquid & gas handling equipment preferred (vessels, tanks, air handling equipment, mixers, etc. Additional Qualifications Knowledge of industry and regulatory guides, codes, and standards; particularly fabrication and construction of process equipment, including ASME Section VIII, ASME B31.3, AISC ASD, AISC N690, etc. Significant experience using CFD analysis software (such as STAR-CCM+ and/or ANSYS Fluent). Understanding of fluid dynamics, specifically fluid flow, heat transfer and acoustics. Experience working with procedures employing quality assurance programs such as ASME-NQA-1, MIL-Q-9858A, or ISO-9000. Broad knowledge of the application of Mechanical Engineering design principles. Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), work well with others, and is flexible. Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.). Must be able to complete and pass a pre-employment drug screen, physical (if located at the construction site), and background check which includes verification of employment and education. Must be able to obtain a Department of Energy badge for access to the Hanford Site. (Even if teleworking, must still be able to comply with security requirements to obtain a badge). Must possess the right to work and remain in the United States without sponsorship. Professional Engineering license. MS degree in Engineering (Mechanical or related). Experience in DOE or commercial nuclear facilities, particularly in equipment design analysis. Experience using STAR-CCM+ and/or ANSYS Fluent CFD Software Packages. Experience using ANSYS Finite Element Analysis Software (Mechanical APDL or Workbench). Experience performing equipment analyses using FEA software to produce equipment structural design calculations. Understanding of equipment design; specifically structural, thermal and dynamic (e.g. seismic modal and response spectra) analyses. Knowledge of Bechtel Corporate guides and standards. #LI-TN1 At Bechtel, our employees enjoy a competitive total rewards package that includes comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans, along with optional disability and supplemental insurance options, generous paid time off, paid holidays, paid parental leave, discretionary bonuses, and a well-designed 401K plan with matching and profit-sharing components. Shaping tomorrow together Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Job Description:    Come be DISRUPTIVE with us!    At Milwaukee Tool we firmly believe that our People and our Culture are the secrets to our success - so we give you unlimited access to everything you need to create disruptive new technologies and solutions on our engineering teams.    We continue to invest in engineering resources to design and develop leadership in engineering capabilities; something unique within the industry, and we're pushing the limits.    Behind our doors, you'll be empowered every day to own it, drive it, and do what it takes to design and develop the biggest breakthroughs in the industry. Meanwhile, you'll have the support and resources of the fastest-growing brand in the construction industry to make it happen.    Under the direction of the Automation Engineering Manager, the Lead Automation Controls Engineer will be responsible for the development and implementation of a new generation of leading-edge, high speed, automated manufacturing assembly and test equipment for power tools. Scoping out risks for manufacturing and establishing a plan to mitigate. The individual will take the projects from original concept through final implementation while ensuring long-term sustainment and support.    This position works in a team environment and uses engineering expertise, project management, and leadership abilities to contribute to the development of automated manufacturing assembly and test solutions for existing and future operations for Milwaukee Tool.    You’ll be DISRUPTIVE through these duties and responsibilities:      Mentor and coach team of automation engineers in the designing, prototyping, testing, and commissioning of automated solutions for a variety of projects.        Lead the development of collecting CTQ’s, concepts, schematics, test plans, and processes for new automation systems development.        Execute technical project roadmaps identifying critical electronic and controls components and creating robust design architectures for use globally.        Champion technology investigations including system requirements, architecture definitions, and reusability strategies.        Quickly, effectively, and candidly frame-up and escalate business risks/opportunities to senior leadership.        Mentor and coach the team in engineering best practices including task management, Gantt charts, root cause analysis, control automation design, and software programming.        Effectively communicate and motivate up, down and across the organization to a diverse range of technical and non-technical team members.        Programming of industrial control systems consisting of PC and PLC based applications utilizing SCADA methodology.        Drive urgency in project schedules and accountability for establishing and achieving key project metrics that meet the organization’s needs.        Responsible for building upon established standards for electrical/controls and software engineering aspects of design, testing, and start-up for our manufacturing assembly and test solutions.        Strong analytical skills, knowledge, and experience in process evaluation tools: Design of Experiments (DOE), Finite Element Analysis (FEA), PFMEA, DFMEA, statistical data analysis, risk analysis, flow layout and other related engineering tools.        Work cross functionally with New Product Development design engineers, manufacturing engineers, quality/reliability, and other teams to evaluate and advise product design for optimized testability and manufacturability (DFA/DFT).        Responsible for the research, evaluation, and implementation of new technologies and breakthrough processes to accelerate competitive manufacturing advantage.        Provide multiple design concepts for trade-off discussions in finding the ideal solution for ROI, cost, quality, and delivery.        Maintain and build upon standard electrical design architecture to be used by other engineers in the design of automation assembly and test systems.        Design with lean intent/design for manufacturing (flow, ergonomics and safety of production associates) including standards set by Milwaukee Tool and regulatory bodies such as NFPA, CEN, OSHA and ISA.        Excellent interpersonal skills to work in a team environment and challenge status quo with respect, to drive the best solutions for the business      What TOOLS you’ll bring with you:      Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in Electrical Engineering, or related engineering field.        10+ years of experience in the design, construction, and programming of automated manufacturing assembly and/or test systems at the subassembly and final assembly level.        Development experience with communication protocols, such as IO-Link, Discrete IO, EtherCAT, Ethernet IP, OPCUA, TCP/IP, RS-232, RS-485, CAN, etc.        Experience with advanced control systems used to automate manufacturing processes including pneumatics used in motion control, programmable controllers, sensors, vision systems, and robotics.        LabVIEW programming experience.        Advanced PLC programming experience.        Advanced computer knowledge and skills using MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Outlook, MS Project, and Solid works/AutoCAD/NX.        Must be flexible and willing to adapt to changes and short deadlines.        Experience with electrical and industrial machinery safety.        The ability to work well with people and independently, problem solver, organized, good written and verbal skills, strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize and multi-task        Excellent organizational and facilitation skills.        Ability to be interactive “hands on” with each upcoming engineering project.        Effectively utilize data when analyzing issues and problem solving.      Other TOOLS we prefer you to have:      Master’s or equivalent degree in Electrical Engineering, or related engineering field.        Six Sigma green belt certified.        SolidWorks Electrical proficiency.        Certification in automation & integration safety standards.        Design and deployment experience of robotics.        Experience working with NFPA79 and ANSI.        SQL database development experience.      Competencies and Personal Attributes:  Agility- Embraces change, domestic and international travel.    Passionate and Energetic- Driven to be the best.    Entrepreneurial- Take ownership and appropriate risk, seek breakthroughs.    Drive for Results- Set plans, track progress and deliver commitments.    Team Oriented- embrace teams for overall business success, acting as a leader.    Delivery - put theories into action.    Candid – Gives and receives respectful, objective, and straightforward feedback.      Travel Requirements:      Ability to travel domestically and internationally for machine and/or concept evaluations, and factory acceptance.          Estimated yearly travel: 15%.            Most trips will be 1-2 weeks with possibilities of weekend travel.        We provide these great perks and benefits:      Robust health, dental and vision insurance plans.        Generous 401 (K) savings plan.        Education assistance.        On-site wellness, fitness center, food, and coffee service.        And many more, check out our benefits site          HERE    .

Date Posted: 2023-10-31  Country: United States of America  Location: TX190: 2501 West University, McKinney 2501 West University , McKinney, TX, 75070 USA  Position Role Type: Hybrid  Job Summary: The Radio Frequency and Mechanical Analysis Department is seeking a Senior Principal Mechanical Engineer/Structural Analyst. The qualified candidate will have extensive experience in structural analysis and testing of airborne structures and will be responsible for detailed structural analysis to support all phases of programs including development and production. The position will be based at either our Dallas, TX or McKinney, TX location. Analysis tasks will span the spectrum from classical hand analyses to detailed analyses requiring the use of finite element analysis software. In addition, the structural analyst is expected to have a high degree of technical competence and be a recognized technical leader and/or leader of teams of engineering analysts. The selected candidate will work under only general direction and will be expected to define the scope and level of analysis to meet required objectives and assist in program planning. The structural analyst will be held accountable for completing their work and the work of others on their team within the agreed upon cost and schedule. The candidate will be expected to present their work for peer reviews and to be a peer reviewer for other engineers’ work. The customers of this position will include internal personnel and programs as well as external Government(s) personnel and programs. The selected candidate will work with the customer and engineering leadership to define testing required to validate structural analyses and to verify that hardware is compliant with requirements. In addition, the selected candidate will be expected to plan and support tests, perform data reduction, and engage in structural model correlation. The candidate will also be expected to assist with proposal preparation including estimating the scope of new engineering projects. Responsibilities to Anticipate: Analysis tasks spanning the spectrum from classical hand analysis to detailed analysis requiring the use of finite element analysis software. Leading small teams of other structural analysts, peer reviewing your own work and the work of others. Interpreting structural analysis results and proposing changes for design improvement. Presenting results to internal and external customers. Planning and supporting testing, data reduction and structural model correlation. Estimating scope of structural engineering products for proposal support. Qualifications You Must Have: BS degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering and minimum of 10 years of prior relevant experience performing structural analysis or Advanced Degree in a related field and a minimum of 7 years performing structural analysis. Ability to travel to government or other facilities in support of program activities, typically less than 15%. Ability to work on-site at a Raytheon facility. Ability to obtain a U.S. Government issued Secret security clearance and ability to obtain and maintain special access program (SAP) security clearance. U.S. Citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance. Performing sizing calculations to determine scope of higher detail analysis models. Performing peer reviews of analyses to validate process and results. Delivering results to customers (internal and external). Structural analysis using FEA software. Proficiency with engineering workstations running Windows and Office suite. Qualifications We Value: Working knowledge of Abaqus FEA software. 10 or more years of experience of structural analysis of complex systems that require collaboration with multiple engineering disciplines. Demonstrated experience in structural testing: planning, organization, execution, data reduction, and correlation. Advanced degree in aforementioned disciplines. ABET is the preferred accreditation standard. Experience as a technical leader and/or leader of engineering teams. Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Arlington, VA. To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors and communities to succeed. This requisition is eligible for an employee referral award. ALL eligibility requirements must be met to receive the referral award. RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Job Description Summary Sr. Mechanical Engineer responsible for the thermal and structural design and analysis of gradient coils for Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI). This role will work with cross-functional teams to design, develop, manufacture and service complex state-of-the-art MRI systems and components throughout all phases of the product development life cycle. Activities include detailed mechanical, structural, and thermodynamic design of sub-systems and components related to MRI gradient coils, including analysis, Thermal, Mechanical, and failure FEA simulation, documentation, prototyping, testing, verification, and integration of hardware.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description Responsibilities: Thermal and Structural design, simulation and analysis of gradient coils and components used in MRI systems. Develop innovated designs to meet all thermal-mechanical requirements for performance, reliability, cost, and manufacturability. Lead the strategy and roadmap of Mechanical, Thermal and Acoustic Testing of Gradient Coils. Provide solutions to alternative Mechanical simulations, tests and methodology to minimize and mitigate mechanical failure modes. Detailed FEA thermal modeling with all fundamental forms of heat transfer and structural analysis of complex geometries. Thermal-mechanical stress analysis using temperature dependent properties. Design and analysis of composite components (eg. Fiber reinforced plastic, epoxies, carbon and glass fibers). Non-linear thermal and structural analysis. Modal and Fatigue analysis and testing. Design and implementation of verification activities using accelerometers, strain gages, spectrum analyzers, thermocouples, temperature sensors, thermal cameras, pressure sensors, and data acquisition systems. Preparation and presentation of design analysis reports and part/assembly drawing reviews. Participate and lead prototype build activities to ensure compliance with design intent. Develop product and component test and purchase specifications. Design leadership of productivity projects (both product cost and life cycle quality or reliability improvements). Provide creative solutions to unstructured product and system design issues from both factory and field. Required Qualifications: PhD in Mechanical Engineering. Engineering experience: 5-10 years - MRI Gradient experience preferred. Strong software skills with proficiency in ANSYS FEA and/or other analysis packages such as COMSOL. Modeling skills with experience in solid modeling packages such as PRO/E. Direct design & analysis experience of mechanical components. Effective understanding and working knowledge of metals, plastics, and composite materials. Experienced in test setup, data collection, and design of experiments for thermal-mechanical testing. Structural failure analysis and fatigue design. Desired Characteristics: Experience with numerical analysis tools and optimization methods. Hands on hardware experience on mechanical systems and components. Paper to product experience with ability to read and apply GD&T. Ability to work with cross-functional, multidisciplinary teams. Leadership, teamwork, and interpersonal skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Overview:  This position exists to support the growth of the Bal Seal Engineering (BSE) through the creation, refinement, and maintenance of BSE custom products (seals, springs, and contacts). This position has general knowledge of our customers' technical needs and how our products can meet their basic requirements.  This position is responsible for problem solving, process development, evaluating customer requirements and recommending changes to improve product and process performance.  This position is responsible for having intimate understanding of customers applications and provide regular communication between Sales, New Product Development Engineering, and Operations to ensure the design, development and testing of all aspects of our components, including new and existing products, meet the customer application requirements.  This position is responsible for applying standard application and design requirements to new opportunities.  Candidates should have excellent communication skills, good problem-solving capabilities, and the ability to work well with the Organization as a whole.  Operating as an independent division of the Bloomfield, CT-based Kaman Corporation, Bal Seal Engineering is “a Kaman company.” This structure allows us to remain agile and entrepreneurial as we leverage our parent company’s scale, resources, and complementary capabilities. We’re proud to be part of Kaman, a company with a past so similar to our own, and a commitment to positively shaping the future.  For information regarding benefit offerings, please visit our site here: https://kaman.com/contact/careers/employee-benefits/  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Establish a close working relationship with Sales team to improve technical support for External and Internal customers either in-person or virtually. Communicate with customers to identify new business opportunities and clarify customers’ technical requirements. Review designs for applicability, form, fit and function to a customer’s application. Execute design activity in accordance with established design policies and procedures. Model and create drawings using 3D CAD (SolidWorks) for product components. Supply full details necessary in handoff of proposed designs to Manufacturing. Evaluate industry trends for new and existing product technical requirements. Provide a “bridge” between Sales and New Product/Opportunity initiatives, Engineering Segments and Operations. Understand of the end use application and related BSE value proposition. Work with cross functional teams to identify custom designs, materials and test requirements that allow consistent performance for meeting customer and industry expectations with high quality solutions. Update Design Rules per identified proven industry standards solutions sets. Perform Failure Analysis to determine needs for BSE product improvements or customer end improvements for the application. Support development and maintenance of Applications Engineering Process documentation, Work Instructions and Tools. Support Continuous Improvement, 6-Sigma and Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DFMA) activities. Support Configuration Management with Change Orders (ECO, EO). Provide hands-on support of Prototype to ensure product meets application needs and documentation is ready movement towards Production. Perform miscellaneous and non-standard duties as required. Such duties are diversified in nature and may be changed from time to time to suit the needs of the company. Up to 20% travel required to BSE facilities and External Customers. Qualifications:   Education: BSME or equivalent technical degree. Other technical qualifications and/or a demonstrated minimum of 7 years' experience in a similar technical environment may be considered. Experience: Experience working in a supplier-based manufacturing environment preferred. Experience with a variety of manufacturing techniques and materials. Experience working with Applications that utilize Seals and/or Conductive Connector. Experience working with Continuous Improvement, Lean initiatives, developing and implementing Processes. Experience utilizing Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software and Enterprise Resource Planning tools (ERP). Strong computer skills and analytical skills. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment. Ability to work with external customers and handle difficult situations. Proficient with utilization of Microsoft Office tools and CAD Software (SolidWorks). Proficient with Engineering and Manufacturing 3-D model and drawing best practices. Working knowledge with Finite Element Analysis (FEA) tools and result interpretation. Well versed in Design for Manufacturability and Assembly (DFMA) best practices. Must be hands on and interface with manufacturing personnel as required. Initiative to identify and solve problems with little direction or assistance. Working knowledge and understanding of GD&T best practices, ASME Y14.5. Physical Requirements: This position is mainly sedentary; therefore, required to sit. Must be able to enter data into a computer by use of a keyboard and mouse and be able to sit for long periods at his/her desk as well as occasionally visit employees throughout the building to gather data and clarify information. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to walk. Work Environment: The work environment conditions are typical of a manufacturing environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the basic functions. The noise level in the work environment ranges from quiet to moderate, however, hearing protection may be required if employee enters high noise areas as a part of their normal job duties.   Salary Range for this position is $90k-115k per year

Stress Analysis Engineer: Senior Manufacturing Engineer - Tooling and Fixture Design
column7: ABOUT FIREFLY AEROSPACEFirefly Aerospace Inc. is an American end-to-end space transportation company committed to providing economical and convenient access to space for small payloads through the design, manufacture, and operation of reliable launch and spacecraft vehicles. Firefly’s launch vehicles utilize common technologies, manufacturing infrastructure, and launch capabilities, providing LEO launch solutions for up to ten metric tons of payload. Combined with Firefly’s in-space vehicles, such as the Space Utility Vehicle (SUV) and Blue Ghost Lunar Lander, Firefly provides the space industry with a single source for missions from LEO to the surface of the Moon or beyond.SUMMARYAs part of a small, fast-paced, and passionate team you will be instrumental developing the world’s largest liquid fueled all composite rocket and implementing full rate production on our current vehicle and programs. We are seeking a Senior Manufacturing Engineer with a strong background in tooling and fixture design to join our innovative structures manufacturing team. The ideal candidate for this role will have experience with the manufacture of composite materials.  You will be responsible for developing tooling and fixtures for development programs as well as production programs, driving continuous improvement initiatives, optimizing processes, developing new processes, and providing technical expertise to enhance our production capabilities. This role will give you a wide variety of opportunities. This position requires a strong background in aerospace tooling and fixturing, strong background in composites manufacturing and the ability to lead cross-functional teams to achieve program goals.RESPONSIBILITIES Lead the design and development of tooling, fixtures, and production equipment necessary for the manufacturing of aerospace composite components. This includes selecting appropriate materials and manufacturing processes to meet specific aerospace industry standards.Continuously evaluate and enhance manufacturing processes, tooling, and fixtures to optimize efficiency, quality, and cost-effectiveness. Implement improvements to increase production capacity and reduce cycle times.Manage projects related to tooling and fixture design, including creating project plans, timelines, and budgets. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.Keep up-to-date with the latest advancements in tooling and fixture design for aerospace composites. Apply this knowledge to the development and improvement of manufacturing processes.Create and maintain detailed documentation, including engineering drawings, specifications, and work instructions for tooling and fixtures. Provide guidance and training to junior engineers and technicians in tooling and fixture design. Foster a culture of learning and continuous improvement within the team.Work closely with cross-functional teams, including design, manufacturing, and quality, to ensure the seamless integration of tooling and fixtures into the production process.Manage and oversee manufacturing programs, ensuring they meet quality, cost, and schedule requirements.Identify and address production challenges, implementing effective solutions to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality aerospace components.Work closely with cross-functional teams, including design engineering, quality assurance, and production, to drive collaboration and achieve program objectives.Implement and maintain rigorous quality control measures to meet industry standards and customer expectations.Identify cost-saving opportunities and participate in cost reduction initiatives while maintaining product integrity.Champion a culture of continuous improvement, driving Lean and Six Sigma principles throughout the manufacturing process.QUALIFICATIONS RequiredBachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related Engineering field. 7+ years of experience in tooling and fixture design, preferably in aerospace composites manufacturing.Strong knowledge of aerospace industry standards, materials, and processes.Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., NX, SolidWorks, CATIA) and FEA analysis tools.Exposure to composite materials and processes (carbon fiber, resins, curing methods, etc.).Project management skills with a proven track record of successfully completing projects on time and within budget.Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.Strong communication and teamwork skills.Excellent communication and leadership skillsExperience establishing new procedures and streamlining old proceduresA passion for creating, building, and making things happenDesired10+ years working in a manufacturing environment with a bachelor’s degree in mechanical, aerospace, or similar area.Master's degree is a plus.Automated Fiber Placement experience is a strong plusQuick-turn custom composite tooling design and fabricationSix Sigma or Lean manufacturing Black Belt certification Firefly offers outstanding benefits for our employees, including generous health, dental and vision plans with low plan deductibles, parental leave, educational reimbursement, short term disability, and flexible PTO options.  To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.  Firefly Aerospace, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with Firefly is governed based on merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status

SENIOR MECHANICAL ENGINEER, Laboratory for Nuclear Science (LNS)-Bates Research and Engineering Center, to conceptualize, conduct, coordinate, or make significant contributions to large or multiple small projects. Bates designs and builds equipment for use in physics research worldwide. Will work with project scientists, professors, and engineering management to translate scientific needs into engineering concepts and specifications; oversee schedule and budget creation and reporting; prepare and present proposals and communicate directly with collaborators; provide technical direction for development and integration of project components; design and analyze complex vacuum, cryogenic equipment, and support and motion systems for physics experiments; oversee the design, construction, and installation of accelerator, detector, cryogenic, and other engineering systems for national user facilities; identify and work with vendors to secure quotes and manage procurement cycle; and perform other duties as needed.Job Requirements  REQUIRED: B.S. in engineering; ten years' relevant experience working with air and fluid cooling systems, detector technologies for physics research, magnets, ultra-high vacuum equipment, and similar mechanical systems; excellent interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills; experience managing multiple stakeholder projects independently, from start to finish; initiative; flexibility; expert-level experience with 3D modeling tools and FEA/CFD for electromechanical, thermal, and cryogenic systems; knowledge of machine shop operations, thermal sciences, and mechanical design; hands-on experience with fabrication, assembly, and testing of complex electro-mechanical systems; and ability to design equipment and oversee the fabrication of complex components and assemblies. Must be able to listen carefully and communicate tactfully; master and quickly contribute to complex projects with aggressive schedules; relate effectively to faculty, students, staff, collaborators, and stakeholders; work as a team member; and write clear procedures, document test results, and present findings. Job #22263   The salary range for this position is $130-150K, based on experience.  There may be travel (~10%) to meetings, visit vendors and install equipment.  Bates is located in Middleton, MA.

Position Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Hardware Engineer to join our team and take charge of all mechanical and hardware aspects of our groundbreaking product, AIMS. AIMS is an AI-enabled ambient intelligence platform designed to reduce risks in a clinical setting. As the Senior Hardware Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the successful development, design, and implementation of AIMS's hardware components. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver a high-quality, reliable, and innovative product that meets the needs of our customers. Responsibilities: 1. Lead the hardware development and design efforts of the AIMS platform, taking ownership of all mechanical and hardware aspects of the product from concept to production. 2. Collaborate with the product management team to define hardware requirements, specifications, and design goals, ensuring alignment with overall product vision and objectives. 3. Conduct thorough feasibility studies and technical assessments to identify and select appropriate hardware components, materials, and manufacturing processes. 4. Develop and execute comprehensive hardware design plans, including schematic capture, PCB layout, and mechanical design, considering factors such as form factor, reliability, manufacturability, and regulatory compliance. 5. Utilize your deep expertise in product design and management to drive innovation, cost-effectiveness, and scalability in hardware development, while meeting project timelines and budget constraints. 6. Lead prototype development and testing, validating design performance, functionality, and reliability, and coordinating with cross-functional teams for system integration. 7. Collaborate closely with software engineers, AI experts, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration between hardware and software components, optimizing overall system performance. 8. Conduct thorough design reviews and provide technical guidance to junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing within the hardware team. 9. Stay abreast of emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in hardware engineering, applying relevant knowledge to enhance product design and performance. 10. Support manufacturing and production processes, collaborating with external vendors, suppliers, and contract manufacturers to ensure smooth transition from prototype to mass production. Qualifications: 1. A minimum of 10 years of professional experience in product design, with a focus on hardware engineering and product management. 2. Master's degree or higher in mechanical engineering or a related field. An advanced degree in a relevant discipline is preferred. 3. Proven track record of successfully leading hardware design and development projects from concept to production in a fast-paced environment. 4. Extensive experience in selecting and integrating electronic components, PCB design, mechanical design, and design for manufacturing (DFM) principles. 5. Strong knowledge of industry standards, regulations, and best practices related to hardware design and development, including safety and compliance considerations. 6. Proficiency in using relevant hardware design and simulation tools (e.g., CAD, SPICE, FEA) and PCB layout software. 7. Excellent problem-solving skills and a systematic approach to debugging and troubleshooting hardware-related issues. 8. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners. 9. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing project requirements. 10. Passion for innovation, emerging technologies, and a drive to deliver high-quality products that have a positive impact on the healthcare industry. Join our dynamic and passionate team to revolutionize the clinical setting with the groundbreaking AIMS platform. Apply your expertise in hardware engineering and product management to contribute to the development of a cutting-edge, AI-enabled product that enhances patient safety and improves healthcare outcomes.

Company Profile   Oceaneering Technologies (OTECH) develops, manufactures, and operates customized marine systems, shipboard equipment, subsea vehicles, and engineered solutions for commercial and U.S. military vessels. Oceaneering Aerospace and Defense Technologies (AdTech) delivers solutions that enable humans to work safely and effectively in harsh environments – from underwater to the outer reaches of space. Our innovative solutions support the development and application of practical, cost-effective systems that meet our customers’ challenges – from routine to extreme. Our experience and expertise across multiple industries uniquely positions us as a leader in the government, space, and maritime services markets. Our products and services meet the rigorous demands of the complex environments in which they operate, delivering results without compromising safety or reliability.Oceaneering is a global provider of engineered services and products, primarily to the offshore energy industry. We develop products and services for use throughout the lifecycle of an offshore oilfield, from drilling to decommissioning. We operate the world's premier fleet of work class ROVs. Additionally, we are a leader in offshore oilfield maintenance services, umbilicals, subsea hardware, and tooling. We also use applied technology expertise to serve the defense, entertainment, material handling, aerospace, science, and renewable energy industries.    Position Summary   In the Project Structural Engineer and Stress Analyst position you will work in a fast-paced environment and perform structural analysis using hand calculations and finite element analysis (FEA) on a wide variety of highly loaded subsea structure such as ROV frames, mechanisms, pressure vessels, ship over-boarding equipment, and advanced development projects. You will work with designers from a program’s initial stages through structural testing and completion, influence load path, and ensure structural integrity. The work spans static and dynamic studies, performing linear and non-linear structural analysis including transient shock, fatigue and fracture, bolt and weld analysis, defining load tests, and documentation. Applicant must be a US citizen and have the capability to obtain a security clearance. Applicants with Top Secret/SCI with CI poly are preferred.    Duties & Responsibilities   Develop load cases and quantify loads for primary and secondary structures.Perform initial sizing of conceptual structure.Perform static analysis using industry standard methods (Bruhn, Roark, Shigley).Perform stress analysis by developing, solving, and post processing large FEA models using ANSYS.Possess an understanding of converting complex systems into simplified FEA.Participate in design reviews.Properly document analysis.Additional duties as assigned.    Qualifications   EDUCATIONBachelor’s degree in mechanical, ocean, or aerospace engineering from an ABET accredited program. EXPERIENCE15+ years of experience in stress analysis.Proficient in standard industry analytical methods (hand analysis).Proficiency in ANSYS, NASTRAN, or PATRAN.Skilled in finite element modeling and analysis.Familiar with a variety of analyses including static, dynamic, loads, nonlinear contact, stability, vibration, frequency response, transient shock, DDAM, bolt analysis, weld analysis, pressure vessel analysis using FEA and design guides.Organizational skills and ability to prioritize daily activities to meet department objectives.Very good written communication skills, including the ability to read, write, and understand technical requirements and reports.Must be able to obtain a security clearance.DESIRED QUALIFICATIONSProficiency in ANSYS analysis software: Workbench and Spaceclaim.Advanced skill in modeling and analysis.Experience in fatigue and fracture analysis.Basic proficiency in 3D CAD platform, preferably SolidWorks.Proficiency in Mathcad and MS Excel.Experience in structural optimization.    Equal Opportunity Employer   All qualified candidates will receive consideration for all positions without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other non-merit factors.

Partnering closely with product design team, and optics, electrical and software engineering to deliver outstanding products and ground breaking technologies! Join us as a Mechanical Engineer owning the design, development and deployment of test systems for touch, sensing and display modules for mass production. The role involves working closely with the product design teams to support the entire gamut of Apple products and new technologies. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Stress Analysis Engineer: Sr. Test Engineer, Industrial and Residential Energy Systems
column7: What to Expect  As a Senior Test Engineer, you will play a key role in designing reliability into Tesla Energy’s products. This role follows the reliability lifecycle of the product from concept to design, development testing/analysis, manufacturing, and field operation to design-in, confirm, and grow exceptional reliability at every stage. You will investigate failures through physical testing of residential and industrial energy/solar products to accurately predict the system’s robustness and optimize product reliability while accelerating Tesla’s next gen products’ time to market. What You’ll Do  Spearhead execution of design verification and reliability testing of Tesla Solar products as well as system level testing in residential & industrial ecosystems Determine test solutions that optimize for product reliability and durability, DFMEA-based risk mitigations, test team resources, and program schedules Design and develop custom built mechanical/electrical test setups to replicate real-life field stress conditions and develop hardware and software to automate test equipment Execute product, subsystem, and component level reliability/durability testing Conduct test data analysis, clearly communicate test results, and collaborate with design and reliability engineers to resolve issues detected in testing Design and implement next generation hardware test systems and setups to facilitate reliable design characterization and accelerated life testing Procure and develop required test equipment, instrumentation, and data acquisition systems to enhance creative component and product level reliability testing Facilitate failure analysis to understand root cause and drive resolution for failures originating in testing Continuously drive design risk burndown to ensure product design is reliable and durable Collaborate cross-functionally with design, reliability, and manufacturing engineers to suggest design and/or process improvements and to address reliability & durability issues based on understanding of failure root causes Train technicians and interns to operate and troubleshoot test systems Comply with safety policies and regulations. What You’ll Bring  Minimum BS degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related engineering discipline 3-10 years of experience in hardware design, design validation, hardware testing, mechanical system reliability and durability testing. Knowledge of programming in scripting languages for test automation and data analysis / post-processing Experience in CAD and finite element analysis (FEA) (e.g. SolidWorks, Catia, Ansys) Experience with hand and power tools Experience specifying sensors for test instrumentation and utilizing data acquisition systems Hands-on experience with data acquisition and signal analysis using Python, Matlab, and/or Labview Excellent teamwork/interpersonal skills Familiarity with semiconductor electronics preferred Experience pro-actively owning and delivering test engineering projects within accelerated validation timelines Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent organization and documentation skills Experience working safely with high voltage equipment Proven ability to develop reliability and durability test setups including environmental, mechanical, and electrical stress testing highly preferred

Job Summary: As a Senior Staff Mechanical Engineer - Power Electronics Specialist , you will be a key technical expert responsible for developing robust and efficient mechanical solutions for our power electronics products. You will play a critical role in ensuring the reliability, thermal performance, and environmental protection of our advanced electronic systems, empowering our customers to leverage cutting-edge technology for their applications. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Mechanical Design: Lead the mechanical design and development of power electronics systems, ensuring they meet performance, size, and cost requirements. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate mechanical components seamlessly into the overall product. Thermal Management: Design and optimize thermal solutions for power electronic modules and systems, including heat sinks, thermal interface materials, and cooling mechanisms, to ensure efficient heat dissipation and temperature regulation. Enclosure and Potting Design: Develop NEMA6-rated enclosures and potting solutions to protect power electronics systems from harsh environmental conditions, including dust, moisture, and extreme temperatures. Material Selection: Identify and specify appropriate materials for mechanical components, taking into account thermal conductivity, environmental factors, and manufacturing considerations. Simulation and Analysis: Utilize CAD and simulation tools to perform thermal and mechanical analysis, such as Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), to validate designs and optimize performance. Testing and Validation: Plan and conduct tests to validate mechanical designs, ensuring they meet industry standards, safety regulations, and product performance requirements. Manufacturing Support: Collaborate with the manufacturing team to ensure seamless transition from design to production, providing input to optimize manufacturing processes and assembly techniques. Product Improvement: Continuously monitor and evaluate the performance of existing products, identifying opportunities for improvement and implementing design changes to enhance reliability and performance. Compliance and Documentation: Ensure all mechanical designs and processes comply with relevant industry standards and regulations. Maintain comprehensive documentation throughout the design and development process. Leadership and Mentorship: Provide technical leadership to the mechanical engineering team and mentor junior engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, excellence, and continuous learning. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field; Master's or Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering is a plus. Proven track record of 8+ years of experience in mechanical engineering, with a specific focus on power electronics, thermal management, potting, and NEMA6 enclosure design. Preferred Qualifications: Strong expertise in thermal analysis and design for power electronics systems, including proficiency in using simulation tools like ANSYS, COMSOL, or equivalent. Experience with enclosure design and potting techniques for protection against environmental factors. Solid understanding of power electronics principles, including power modules, inverters, converters, and related components. Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD) for 3D modeling and mechanical design. Knowledge of industry standards and regulations related to power electronics and thermal management (e.g., IPC, JEDEC, UL). Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a team environment. Leadership experience and a strong sense of accountability for project deliverables. Physical demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting; close vision and ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel.  “We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”

Stress Analysis Engineer: Senior Engineer, Air Exhaust Gas Recirculation Design

And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. Your Responsibilities As a Senior Engineer, Air Exhaust Gas Recirculation Design for John Deere Power Systems located in Waterloo, IA, you will: Lead design & development of new air systems to deliver traditional JD high performance but with non-traditional fuels like Ethanol and Bio-Methane. Title: Senior Mechanical Engineer@ Franklin Lakes, NJ  Terms of Hire: Full Time.  Contract on W2 under option to Hire: Job description: The Sr. Mechanical Engineer is a key contributor in the Concept & Technology (C&T) team. The C&T team is a multi-disciplinary front-end innovation team comprised of mechanical, electrical, biomedical and software engineers that work closely with our MDS Strategic Innovation Group to identify and develop new opportunities for our MDS business.  Key to this role is having significant depth and experience as a mechanical engineer and an entrepreneurial can-do mindset. The applicant should be very hands-on and be passionate about developing innovative solutions that are aimed at improving clinical outcomes, patient experience and workflow for healthcare professionals. Applicant should have a positive attitude and ability to work in a team environment.  This is a contracting position till end of Sept 2020, with potential transition to a full-time position after Sept 2020.  Responsibilities, skills, and behaviors that an engineer should expect to experience or express in this role include:Gain understanding of customer needs through literature review, observing customer Stress Analysis Engineer: Sr. Mech Product Engineer, Data Center Eng, Mech Solutions
column7: Bachelor’s degree or higher in mechanical engineering. Will also accept equivalent domain specific technical experience in lieu of a degree.7+ years of experience in data center design and product development/HVAC design/related product development.Thorough understanding and use of principals, theories and concepts in mechanical engineering. Are you interested in developing solutions that have big impact? Are you someone who likes to challenge the status quo and work on developing innovative product solutions? If you are a mechanical engineer and looking for an exciting career in cloud infrastructure, come join a team that constantly seeks ways to build things better & faster for our customers.  AWS is looking for a Sr. Mechanical Engineer to become part of a global data center engineering team, responsible for the design and continuous innovation within our rapidly expanding data center footprint. This position can be based out of Seattle, Washington or Herndon, Virginia.  Our Senior Mechanical Engineers take full ownership to design resilient, cost effective mechanical systems. As engineers at Amazon, we are responsible for achieving a world class uptime for our customers. We drive continuous advancements and improvements with our designs, and communicate technical direction to Sr. Management. We seek new ways to enhance the reliability, scalability, and cost effectiveness of our engineering designs. As an engineer at Amazon, you have the ability to drive change and make a substantial impact in the systems our customers rely on. Key Functional Dimensions:Work in a cross-disciplinary setting with ability to influence and drive others.Work has deep and far reaching impact on overall product design/solutionsAdvises peer engineers and management team.Deep-dive and perform root cause analysis.Make technical trade-offs between short-term project goals and long-term business needs.Develop integrated systems extending the life of data center infrastructure products.Simplify, optimize and lower costs of data center mechanical and associated sub components. At Amazon, team work is absolutely necessary for us to accomplish our goals. We work within a team and depend on others to accomplish the required work. As a mechanical engineer at Amazon you will be working with other internal groups as well as external groups including manufacturers, vendors, and contractors. Responsibilities:Collaborate with internal and external ecosystem partners to design and develop new data center product solutions.Support field engineering and data center operation teams for performing root cause analysis and implementation of corrective actions.Leverage economy of scale through standardization and modularization of data center products.Provide technical subject matter expertise to peers, senior management and partner teams.Develop business justification and narratives to promote new concepts and ideas.Lead key initiatives for the organization while demonstrating extreme ownership.Work with global suppliers and manufacturers to specify appropriate mechanical and associated sub components.Provide product design support to other team members.Writing functional specifications, design verification plans, and functional test procedures.What we offer: A fast paced, fun, and exciting work environment. We continue to grow at exponential rates and are looking for individuals that can support our speed to market, enjoy a challenge, and have a desire for professional growth and continuous learning experiences. Amazon’s work environment is unique in every aspect and offers an exceptional opportunity for the right candidate.  If you are a creative, smart and driven individual that enjoys working with complex problems we want you! At Amazon, you will be responsible for working on multi-million-dollar designs and supporting our wide variety of customers. Great ideas are encouraged and supported. Ingenuity is the main mechanism which supports our focus on quality, speed, and cost.  We LOVE Data so be sure to apply with a detailed resume/CV.  We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:  Columbus, OH, USA | Herndon, VA, USA | Seattle, WA, USA Masters or PhD in Mechanical Engineering.Deep understanding of data center mechanical systems and cooling control schemes.Prior experience working with an interdisciplinary team to execute product designs from concept to production including specification, design, prototyping, validation and testing.Experience with full lifecycle and proficiency at completing tasks to meet associated milestones.Familiarity of product verification using testing and experience for product certification testing by third party lab.Experience evaluating design, performance and logistical tradeoffs for rack and room level products.Proficiency with FEA and CFD-based analysis tools.Demonstrated understanding of engineering documentation, electrical and mechanical diagrams, and standard operating procedures.Experience designing air- or water-cooled systems for high-heat density applications.Knowledge of industry standards such as ASHRAE, NFPA, ANSI etc. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.  Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $114,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $212,800/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
