Valley Tech Systems, a Voyager Space company, is an innovative engineering company that is leading the way in controllable solid propulsion and open architecture airborne intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) technologies. VTS’ innovative solutions address technology needs across the U.S. Government and commercial space industry. reentry systems, missile defense, commercial and DoD space launch systems, small launch vehicles, and payloads. At VTS our mission is to supply the most advanced and innovative solutions to complex problems found in Department of Defense weapon systems. We approach these problems using a “mission-focused”, “customer first” engineering approach. Working at VTS means you will be engaging with industry pioneers at a small company who all work collaboratively to make big things happen. General Requirements: 1. Valley Tech Systems believes in consistent, positive, cooperative, self-motivated professional behavior—we expect all employees to contribute as necessary to get the job done. 2. Unless otherwise stated in the requirements section of an individual job description, our positions require U.S. Citizenship, U.S. Permanent Residency, or other status as a U.S. Person as defined by 8 USC 1324b(a)(3). Basic Function: Under supervision, perform engineering and testing assignments with clear and specified objectives and involves conventional types of plans and specifications. Apply sound engineering judgment. Perform as a technical contributor on projects. Interface with engineering peers, senior engineers, and program managers to receive tasks. Work within a team to promptly complete tasks. Communicate effectively to accomplish assignments and support others in accomplishing their assignments. Responsibilities: 1. Perform mechanical component design for rocket propulsion systems using CAD models 2. Participate in design reviews 3. Conduct structural and thermal FEA on rocket motor components 4. Prepare engineering drawings 5. Participate in hardware assembly and testing activities 6. Participate in customer meetings and reviews 7. Other related job duties, as assigned. Experience: Required: Ten (10) years to 15+ years of mechanical engineering experience Preferred: Rocket motor design and testing Education: Required: Bachelor of Science required in mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, or other relevant engineering discipline from an accredited university. Skills:Experience with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and ExcelWorking knowledge of CAD softwareUnderstanding of finite element analysisPossess good communication skillsWorks well in a team atmosphereWillingness to seek-out and assume increasing responsibilities as workload changesAptitude for working with mechanical and electrical systems Other:Must be able to travel approximately 20% of the time.Must be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Security Clearance at the appropriate level (requires U.S. Citizenship) Job Type: Full-time Salary: $132,000.00 - $257,600.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Referral program Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: In person

Description Here at Leidos, our Directed Energy team in Albuquerque is looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to contribute to the research and development of game changing, next-generation technologies. This is an exciting opportunity to design and develop a broad range of novel mechanical, electro-mechanical, and electromagnetic components and systems. Working alongside our scientists, engineers, and technicians, our successful candidate will be afforded the satisfaction of seeing ideas and designs implemented into next generation directed energy systems. Primary Responsibilities: Create 3D solid models of innovative hardware and systems and provide mechanical analysis of the models. Develop mechanical designs in accordance with established company standards and customer specifications. Work with government, Leidos and vendor machine shops to procure parts and components. Contribute to the overall success of projects and programs by actively interfacing with the Leidos team and customers to develop creative and robust mechanical designs. Resolve manufacturing and testing issues, including providing innovative mechanical design and fabrication ideas. Effectively manage time to ensure designs are completed according to project schedules. Basic Qualifications: BSME and 12+ years of prior relevant experience or MSME with 10+ years of prior US Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD security clearance. Ability and willingness to adhere to government safety requirements. Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision and communicate with machinists, technicians, engineers and scientists. Ability to organize and effectively work on multiple projects at the same time. Possess excellent written and oral communication skills. Experience with Microsoft Office suite Proficiency with SolidWorks Preferred Qualifications: Experience with PDMWorks and Simulation FEA Experience designing vacuum and pressure vessels Knowledge of electromagnetic and pulsed power component design Active DoD security clearance About Our Team Our Directed Energy team in Albuquerque consists of approximately 100 scientists, engineers, technicians, drafters, fabricators and support staff with backgrounds in advanced physics, electrical and mechanical engineering, electromagnetics, lasers, and high-power microwaves. For over three decades our team has worked with government laboratories to push the limits of the state-of-the-art in several high-tech fields and continue to do so on several programs. Pay Range: Pay Range $118,300.00 - $213,850.00  The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Job Summary and Primary ResponsibilitiesResponsible for leading the Research and Business Continuity efforts within our Mechanical Systems Integration team (instrument and array design). As a Development Manager, you will be accountable for the research and commercialization of instruments with enhanced features that allow the integration of our implant and instrument systems with our navigation and robotics enabling technology platform to treat spinal pathologies. You will be responsible for the development of innovative mechanical solutions to meet patient and surgeon needs from concept to commercialization in accordance with US and international regulations. This requires leading cross-functional teams, including marketing, purchasing, regulatory, quality, research and testing, manufacturing, etc, to manage the product development process, project timeline, and deliverables to ensure designs are safe and effective for clinical use as well as directly managing and developing mechanical engineers on the team. Primary Responsibilities: Mentors a team of mechanical engineers to elevate overall performance and guide professional development. Manages a team of mechanical engineers to ensure on-time and on-budget research projects and commercialized medical device projects. Participates in and guides project planning, design and phase reviews, mechanical design, technical assessments, root cause analyses, and design control documentation. Works collaboratively with surgeon design and marketing teams to identify unmet clinical needs and distill them into product requirements and design inputs. Creates and interprets advanced mechanical designs using CAD software suitable for subtractive, additive, sheet metal, and injection molding manufacturing methods while applying DFX principles Guides, reviews, and approves documentation relevant to design control and other applicable internal and regulatory requirements. Reviews and approves test plans to effectively characterize product performance, retire technical risks, and establish sufficient design verification and validation test requirements. Reviews and approves engineering specifications with dimensions and tolerances appropriate for performance and functional requirements as well as technical assessments of mechanical design (e.g. FEA, tolerance analysis, testing, etc.) Coordinates with suppliers and procurement teams to manage the production and commercialization process. Ensures compliance with NuVasive’s Quality Management System and applicable US and OUS regulations and standards. Leads or supports cadaver labs during surgeon design evaluations and surgeon education events, including cadaver setup, running a fluoroscopy machine, clean-up, etc. Performs other duties as assigned Required Skills / CapabilitiesProven ability to drive the research and product development process with cross-functional teams (Supply Chain, Marketing, Quality, Regulatory, Operations, etc) Proven experience interpreting an extensive variety of technical specifications in mathematical or diagram form and managing several abstract and/or concrete variables Demonstrated ability of applying concepts of algebra, geometry, trigonometry, calculus, geometric tolerances, and tolerance analysis in addition to ability to solve and interpret problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions Ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment, set direction, manage diverse and conflicting priorities in an effective manner, and meet deadlines with minimal guidance from leadership. Strong communication skills (verbal & written) including ability to positively influence all levels of internal cross-functional teams, suppliers, surgeons, and sales teams Demonstrated expertise with CAD software (Pro/E, Creo, or SolidWorks), and Microsoft Office suite Expertise in use of project planning tools such as Microsoft Project Ability to read and interpret documents such as drawings, safety rules, company policy and procedure manuals Education and ExperienceTypically requires a minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 6 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 3 years’ experience; or equivalent experience Previous experience leading and coaching a high performing team Demonstrated understanding of ISO 13485 and Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 21 Part 820.30 Design Controls, or equivalent understanding working in a regulated industry Experience in medical device industry, with complex mechanism design (spine or orthopedics) and/or emerging technologies preferred Travel and/or Physical RequirementsSalary Range: $129,500 - $240,500For roles that require access to hospital facilities, must be eligible for and maintain credentials at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including the COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable). NuVasive is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. The “EEO is the Law” poster options are available here. NuVasive's EEO policy is available here.  About NuVasive    NuVasive, Inc. (NASDAQ: NUVA) is the leader in spine technology innovation, with a mission to transform surgery, advance care, and change lives. The Company's less-invasive, procedurally integrated surgical solutions are designed to deliver reproducible and clinically proven outcomes. The Company's comprehensive procedural portfolio includes surgical access instruments, spinal implants, fixation systems, biologics, software for surgical planning, navigation and imaging solutions, magnetically adjustable implant systems for spine and orthopedics, and intraoperative neuromonitoring technology and service offerings. With more than $1 billion in net sales, NuVasive has approximately 2,700 employees and operates in more than 50 countries serving surgeons, hospitals, and patients. For more information, please visit www.nuvasive.com.

Are you an experienced mechanical engineer who wants to be part of our electrification journey? If the answer is yes, keep reading, as this may be just the right position for you. This is your opportunity to join Sandvik’s smart minds, all working together to build a more sustainable future.    Sandvik's Camarillo site is part of the Sandvik Mining and Rock Solutions business area and the company's innovation center for Battery Technology. Our mission is to advance the world through engineering. Do you share our mission? We are currently looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our Batteries & Chargers R&D department.    Your primary areas of responsibility:        You are responsible for designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting current and new mechanical and electro-mechanical designs for battery systems and battery accessories (e.g. chargers and coolers). Your main responsibilities are:          Developing complex mechanical and/or electro-mechanical systems for HV batteries including designs, drawings, performance predictions, and verification requirements            Performing related structural analysis (simple FEA) and classical hand calculations to determine if design meets functional / performance specifications and optimization of design before fabrication            Collecting and analyzing data in support of failure analysis, root cause, and corrective action            Implementing and validating changes to (electro-) mechanical designs resulting from troubleshooting efforts, production concerns or issue reports from the field            Supporting build and testing of prototypes for batteries, battery chargers, and coolers            Designing automatic test or alignment fixtures for misc. (electro-) mechanical components            Ensuring that designs and documentation of components and systems meet specified technical customer demands, product safety, legislative requirements, and internal demands            Review & approve designs of other engineers, mentor & teach more junior engineers      Your background and what we find important:          You have Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar discipline            A minimum of 7 years’ experience in mechanical engineering and design            Experience preparing manufacturing drawings to ANSI Y14.5M drawing standards using GD&T for manufacturing and repeatability            Experienced in 3D CAD systems (NX or Solidworks) and Teamcenter is preferred            Hands-on experience with mechanical development and design of high voltage batteries            Good understanding of HV battery systems is beneficial            Experience in analysis, testing, troubleshooting, diagnosing, and root-causing electro-mechanical systems            Basic knowledge of electrical design principles            Proficient in the use of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and related software            You have good analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail            You are a team player and have the ability and self-motivation to learn quickly and independently            You demonstrate strong technical leadership skills and a commitment to delivering high quality products while adhering to strict deadlines            You foster an environment that welcomes and encourages new and innovative design concepts, inventions, patents, and product opportunities for improvement            You possess excellent written and verbal communications skills            Ability and willingness to travel domestically and internationally as required (max. 10%)      Benefits        Sandvik provides a competitive compensation and benefit package, 401(k) Guarantee 5% of Salary Paid by Company, Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance plans, Paid Life Insurance, Paid Parental Leave, Salary Continuation, Paid Time Away, Paid Learning and Development Opportunities, Global Leadership Programs, Annual Performance Reviews, Merit and Bonus Opportunity, Employee Assistance Program, 11 paid holidays and Employee Appreciation Events. This position is eligible for hybrid work. This position is eligible for hybrid work.    You will be part of a fast-growing community of highly motivated people who have a strong will to succeed. With us, you have substantial opportunities for personal development and will be working with highly skilled colleagues. Sandvik offers a career opportunity with an international company that develops and creates cutting edge electric and hybrid technology.    Are you intrigued? Visit our          website    ,          LinkedIn     or          Facebook page     to get to know us further.       EEO Statement      Sandvik is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Any applicant who, because of a disability, needs accommodation or assistance in completing an application or at any time during the application process should contact Human Resources at hrsolutions.us@sandvik.com. Sandvik also provides reasonable accommodations to employees with disabilities consistent with its obligations under the law.      Salary Range: $110,000-$152,000   Our company      Sandvik Mining and Rock Solutions is a business area within the Sandvik Group and a global leading supplier of equipment and tools, parts, service, digital solutions, and sustainability-driving technologies for the mining and construction industries. Application areas include rock drilling, rock cutting, loading and hauling, tunneling, and quarrying. In 2022, sales were approximately 5.4 billion USD with about 16,200 employees.

Gradient's mission is to cool the world by transforming every home to be more comfortable and healthy for the people who inhabit it — without compromising the environment. Today, heating and cooling equipment emit more greenhouse gas emissions than the entire transportation sector, and expansion in the use of cooling is projected to double these emissions in the next 30 years. However, comfortable buildings are critical for health and productivity, especially among communities that are vulnerable to the effects of climate change. Gradient's vision is a future where everyone has access to comfortable buildings that are fully decarbonized. The Senior Mechanical Engineer will join our mechanical engineering team and design the mechanical systems in our current and future products. A reasonable estimated salary for this role is between $130,000 and $180,000. The Company Barko Hydraulics located in Superior, WI, manufactures innovative heavy equipment solutions for the forestry, site prep, and material handling markets. Tough, dependable and powerful since 1963, BARKO’s forestry innovations have become the standard for equipment designs and are the machines of choice among customers. BARKO’s line of forestry equipment includes harvesters, processors, utility loaders, strong-arm grapples, industrial wheeled tractors, and more. For more information, visit BARKO.com. Barko is located in Superior, WI, Superior is known for its location on Lake Superior, beautiful waterways, big ol’ forests, good people, great food and lots of fun. Just over the Bridge you will find Duluth, MN an all-seasons city on the tip of Lake Superior, it was voted “Best Town” by Outside Magazine as well as being named one of the Country’s best Coastal Towns. The lifestyle in the area is known for its year-round outdoor activities, including snowmobile trails, ice fishing, skiing, curling, golfing, rock climbing, hiking, fishing, sailing, and even surfing!! Barko Hydraulics is an affiliate of The Heico Companies, a family-owned business and parent holding company for a diverse portfolio of manufacturing, construction and industrial services businesses. Since its founding over 30 years ago The Heico Companies has grown from a single business to over 80 separate companies and 10,000 team members. The Position The Senior Design Engineer is responsible for one of BARKOs product lines including development and maintenance. This position provides technical direction and oversight for product development with long-term business and organizational impact. The position is responsible for technical scope, cost and schedule management of assigned projects/tasks. S/he plans, schedules, and coordinates efforts of cross-functional staff and is accountable to meet project team performance objectives. Key Performance Areas Develop and support heavy equipment attachment design for total life cycle.Utilize a passion for heavy equipment to drive innovative new product development and maintenance for various types of heavy equipment attachments.Operate in a team environment working closely with other business functions to lead development projects.Develop a thorough understanding of relevant markets.Identify market opportunities and unmet needs through voice of customer work. Lead design responsibility for new heavy equipment attachment products.Lead cross-functional development team through project scoping, innovation, vehicle concept, component selection, design reviews, release, build, validation, and industry.Work with all key stakeholders to develop product specifications, project timing, product cost and project budget targets that ensure successful product launch to meet the organization’s strategic plans.Ensure project adherence to BARKO’s phase-gate product development process.Responsible for product design, finite element analysis, and release of machine structural fabrications: sheet metal, heavy weldments, and related assemblies.Perform engineering calculations to determine the size and strength of components. Solve design problems and check computations contributing to analytical designs.Lead design reviews for areas of responsibility.Prepare change orders, requisitions, and parts lists.Lead assembly of prototype designs.Lead testing of prototype machines/components in actual or simulated field conditions including data acquisition and analysis of test data.Ensure compliance with industry regulations and standards.Utilize engineering tools such as: risk assessments, FMEAs, and 8D problem resolution process to validate the design content. Lead design responsibility for current products.Redesign existing products to enhance functionality or reduce costs.Lead data driven investigation, resolution, and timely corrective action implementation related to customer field issues.Provide technical support to Sales, Marketing, Manufacturing, Quality, Supply Chain and Customer Service departments.Lead timely resolution of manufacturing related issues to support production goals. Support new heavy equipment product design efforts, as necessary.Perform engineering calculations to determine the size and strength of components. Solve design problems and check computations contributing to analytical designs.Primary responsibility will be new product design, finite element analysis, and release of machine structural fabrications: sheet metal, heavy weldments, and related assemblies.Utilize engineering tools such as: FMEAs, FEA, 8D problem resolution process, and risk assessments to validate the design content.Lead design reviews for areas of responsibility.Review and release drawings created in SolidWorks.Prepare change orders, requisitions, and parts lists.Participate in or lead assembly of prototype designs.Participate in or lead testing of prototype machines/components in actual or simulated field conditions including data acquisition and analysis of test data. Support current heavy equipment product design efforts, as necessary.Lead data driven investigation, resolution, and corrective action implementation related to customer field issues.Provide technical support to sales, marketing, manufacturing, quality, supply management and customer service organizations.Support cost reduction initiatives on current products.Lead timely resolution of manufacturing related issues. Support maintenance and enhancement of engineering technical documentation and tools.Lead the structuring, release, and maintenance of the assigned product lines: bills of materials, published technical specifications, and other related documentation.Create of bill of materials for customer orders.Follow the standards established in the BARKO Engineering Standards Manual, while also developing new engineering standards and revising existing engineering standards.Ensure compliance with relevant industry standards and regulations.Drive continuous improvement of products and processes. Qualifications Experience and Education:Experience: 5-7 years of demonstrated design engineering experience as well as experience with project management.Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Agricultural, Electrical or Hydraulic Engineering required.Leadership: Ability to engage diverse teams of people, provide clear instructions, and effectively manage the team’s performance.Passion: Demonstrate genuine passion about leading people and building relationships.Communication: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal communication.Technology: Strong working knowledge of SolidWorks, Parker IQAN, MS Office and appropriate analytical tools.Supervisory Responsibility - This position will oversee new product development and current product support for existing product lines and may supervise the activity of Engineers, Designers, Technicians and Drafters. Position Type and Expected Hours of Work - This is a full-time position. Typical work hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. Travel - This position requires occasional travel, including travel outside the local area and overnight. Work Environment - The position operates in a professional office environment using standard office equipment such as computers, iPads, phones, copiers and filing cabinets. The employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles and moving mechanical parts. Physical Requirements - The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by the Project Engineer position to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand and walk. The employee is occasionally required to use hands to finger, handle or feel and reach with hands and arms, lift and/or carry up to 25 pounds, balance, bend, stoop or kneel, climb, push/pull and squat, or crouch.

Stress Analysis Engineer: Senior Engineer* – Quality Assurance and Testing
column7: Diese Stellenanzeige ist nicht in deutscher Sprache verfügbar.The main purpose of PERI’s Senior Engineer – Quality Assurance & Testing (SEQAT) position, is to introduce new products for the North America market. The SEQAT does this by being accountable for new product development activities relating to the design for manufacture, quality of manufacture and application approvals. Leveraging PERI’s resources, the SEQAT ensures product requirements and quality standards are satisfied to PERI and industry standards. In addition, it is the responsibility of the SEQAT position to provide continuing support for manufacturing, application engineering, testing, CAPA, and product documentation.Your responsibilitiesResponsible for product project management from prototype to full production based upon accurate project schedules and budgetsPerform research and testing on product concepts, new, and existing productsLead material, design, and process changes to existing products by following design control processes and analyses of defectsProve product design by developing test plans, developing suppliers for both testing and manufacturing, maintaining quality standards, and approving prototypesIdentify areas to streamline or improve manufacturing costs and qualityCollect and analyze data and present test results to PERI teamCoordinate with manufacturing or suppliers at suitable stages, such as at initial design, to evaluate the design’s suitability for manufacturing in an efficient and economical manner, on targetEnsure alignment to the requirements of ISO 9001 standards and OSHA regulationsUse industry best practices to solve engineering problems using analytical methods such as 8D UnternehmensinfoMit einem Umsatz von 1.864 Mio. € im Jahr 2022 ist PERI international einer der größten Hersteller und Anbieter von Schalungs- und Gerüstsystemen. Das Familienunternehmen mit Stammsitz in Weißenhorn (Deutschland) bedient mit rund 9.100 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern, über 60 Tochtergesellschaften und deutlich mehr als 160 Lagerstandorten seine Kunden mit innovativen Systemgeräten und umfangreichen Serviceleistungen rund um die Schalungs- und Gerüsttechnik.

General Summary:Experienced senior/lead aerospace stress engineer with significant experience in the analysis, certification and testing of metallic and composite primary structure.*This is a Contingent position with our company (1-year or longer)*Duties and Responsibilities:· Serve as subject matter expert stress engineer responsible for metallic primary structure.· Provide leadership and guidance to a group of contract and associate stress engineers working on certification, analysis and testing.· Experience writing certification stress reports, working with FAA DER's and structural testing needed.· Applicant must be competent in both classic hand analysis (Bruhn, Peery, Roark, ESDU) methods as well as FEA.· Must also have the the ability to explain and present analysis and assumptions in a rational manner.· Must be able to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be expected to take ownership of assigned projects and see them through to completion.· Provide recommendations and status updates to management.Education, Work Experience, Certification and/or Licensure:· BS required, MS preferred Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering· FAA DER is a major plus but not required. (14 CFR 23/25)Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:· Experience with 3D solid modeling (CATIA v5, Unigraphics)· Experience with programming languages (Python, VB, Matlab)· Expert in Finite Element Analysis (NASTRAN, ABAQUS)· Proficient computer skills with MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS ProjectPhysical Requirements:1. Incumbents may be routinely exposed to equipment operational noise heat-cold-dust, and/or aircraft equipment, parts, or fuel odors.2. Incumbents may be required to stand, sit, squat, walk, bend, climb ladders, move, reach, or stretch for prolonged time periods with no restrictions, as required by job duties.3. Work in a safe and professional manner while adhering to all regulatory requirements (FAA, OSHA, DOT, EPA, State, and Federal regulations, etc.).4. Read, hear, speak, and see with no restrictions, as required by job duties.5. Comprehend and adhere to management directions and/or safety instructions with no restrictions.6. Effectively communicate in Business English language.7. Pull, push, carry, lift, or move items up to 10 lbs. throughout the work shift without assistance, as required by job duties.8. Pull, push, carry, lift or move materials/people/items/equipment weighing up to 50lbs or more during the work shift, with the use of Company provided “reach assistance technology”Job Types: Full-time, ContractSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayApplication Question(s):Will you now or in the future require sponosrship?Work Location: In person

POSITION TITLE Naval Architect Senior LOCATION New Orleans, LA MANAGER Systems Design Manager POSITION TYPE Full-time/Exempt COMPENSATION $121,232 - $147,270 MAIN DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible of the interviewing, onboarding, training, assigning work, and performance improvement recommendations of the assigned SWBS section team. Meets daily with assigned SWBS section group members to identify roadblocks and remove barriers. Escalates unresolved issues to the Systems Design Manager and fellow SWBS section leads. Monitors and controls design contractual commitments to ensure that all work is performed in accordance with the specifications, drawings, and terms of the contract. Partners with Weight Manager to monitor and control the weight of the systems to meet design targets. Approver of Engineering Change Notifications to formally release design data. Ensures Engineering Change Requests are implemented into the design while maintaining compliance to the contractual requirements. System life-cycle activities – including System Requirements Review (SRR), System Design Review (SDR), Preliminary Design Review (PDR) and Detailed/Critical Design Review (DDR/CDR). Development of engineering deliverables in accordance with engineering processes, ensuring safe, fit for purpose engineering deliverables, and presenting material associated with the above gate reviews. Ensure the design is approved in accordance with relevant standards working closely with ABS lead as part of the Integrated Project Team. Coordinates with sub-contractors and vendors to ensure timely receipt of deliverables as well as compliance to the requirements. New vessel concept design as well as structural, hydrostatic, hydrodynamic, vibration, weight and stability analysis. Development of resistance and powering estimates. Sea testing and trials report writing and support. Perform hand calculations and FEA on structural components/assemblies to verify working stresses are below ultimate, yield, and endurance allowables. Develop NX 3D models and associated 2D drawings for existing and new products in accordance with company, industry, and project standards. Release drawings into Teamcenter system following company workflow. Create engineering reports to show compliance with project requirements based on design, test, analysis, and similarity. Partner with quality to troubleshoot installation issues, determine root cause, and recommend solutions. Create product illustrated parts diagrams and write product manuals. Contribute to the continuous improvement of the department by creating work instructions for best practices as well as mentoring/training junior engineers/designers. QUALIFICATIONS & ATTRIBUTES ESSENTIAL Management - The ability to work within tight deadlines and multi-task various activities in an organized manner. Oral & Written Comprehension & Expression - Candidate must have excellent communication, teamwork, leadership, conflict management, and critical thinking skills. Experience leading small teams of engineers. Bachelor’s degree in Naval Architecture, 10+ years of experience in propulsion, hydraulic, fuel, water, and mechanical systems. Experience with government procurement and contracting. Skills: Automation - MS Office, Project. CAD – NX, Teamcenter, AutoCAD. Process - Understanding of the project management process as defined by the PMI PMBOK. Time Management - Managing one's own time and the time of others. Ensuring that all aspects of the program are met on and according to schedule. Judgment and Decision Making - Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one. Mathematics - Using mathematics to solve problems and possess analytical skills. Writing & Speaking - Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience. Talking to others to convey information effectively. Compliance – Steel and aluminum boatbuilding, mechanical and electrical systems to ABS and ABYC standards. Design - Experience complying to ASME, and ANSI drafting standards a plus. Attributes: Management - Ability to work within tight deadlines and multi-task various activities in an organized manner. Oral Expression - Ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand. Written Expression - Ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand. Written Comprehension - Ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing. Oral Comprehension - Ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Deductive Reasoning - Ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense. Problem Sensitivity - Ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem. Physical Requirements: Position requires use of computer, telephones, and other office equipment, reading, writing, standing, sitting, walking, repetitive motions, bending, climbing, listening, and hearing ability and visual acuity. Position occasionally requires ability to work in a manufacturing environment and boats from the beginning of production through the sea trails. This includes mobility to work in and around incomplete aluminium hull structures. Ability to lift packages, equipment, etcetera, up to 50 lbs. KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS WCC Contractual Performance. Annual performance review. RELATIONSHIPS This position is based in New Orleans, LA and will report to the Systems Design Manager. Birdon’s senior management team, including Divisional and Functional Managers, may provide additional direction and duties from time to time. Clear communication and people skills are necessary as direct contact with Birdon clients, prospective clients, and production team is an important aspect of this position. It is your responsibility to ensure that Birdon’s values and interests are maintained in support of the customer during all internal and external communications.

R&D Principal Electrical Engineer Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences. In this role, you will be supporting strategic corporate technology direction and future electric motor products within Motion NEMA Motors in Fort Smith, Arkansas by initiating and driving solution development substantially impacting the NEMA industrial motor business. This position reports to Director of R&D - Electrical Your responsibilities Demonstrate technical leadership and drive R&D efforts using in-depth technical expertise in the field of electric motor design and development Coach, mentor, and support colleagues in developing their skills to ensure high quality solutions. Lead, supervise, and coordinate strategic development projects within NEMA Motors Division Lead activities to assist customers and colleagues in problem solving related to future technologies. Demonstrate proficiency and lead development of engineering processes and tools based on state of the art design methodologies, modeling tools (FEA), design optimization, and machine learning Maintain a special emphasis on broadening R&D (Research and Development) competence in induction motor design methodology, modeling techniques, engineering tools, and test standards Perform design optimization of industrial motors and a cost benefit analysis per internal practices and industry standards from fractional through integral horsepower range. Analyze motor test data for performance verification and document work results solidly, allowing others to maintain them Anticipate and propose actions to mitigate possible quality problems early in R&D projects. Leverage in depth expertise and experience to contribute innovative and creative ideas to a variety of complex R&D assignments. Ensure appropriate protection of newly created intellectual property Collaborate with Product Management and Operations on product specifications, application assistance, regulatory/certification requirements and processes Your background Master’s degree in engineering with minimum 10 years of experience or Bachelor’s degree in engineering with minimum 12 years of experience or PhD degree in engineering with minimum 8 years of experience Preferred experience includes design of electric motors with a minimum of 5 years in induction motors, SAP, AutoCAD, and SolidWorks Strong communication and team skills to work with Sales, Marketing, and customers Candidates must already have a work authorization that would permit them to work for ABB in the US Benefits Retirement plan Life insurance Disability insurance Healthcare plan Wellbeing program More about us ABB’s NEMA Motors Division markets, designs and manufactures the market-leading Baldor-Reliance® brand of industrial motors. As the #1 global manufacturer of NEMA motors, our quality products are designed to reliably and efficiently meet the challenges our customers face. Our business is investing in technology, tools, people and processes to ensure our general purpose and application-specific solutions perform as expected, every time. We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans status. For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/OFCCP/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf As an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, applicants may request to review the Affirmative Action Plan of a particular ABB facility between the hours of 9:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. EST Monday through Friday by contacting an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762. Protected veterans and qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ABB's career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762 or by sending an email to US-AskHR@abb.com. Resumes and applications will not be accepted in this manner. #LI-Onsite

PERI is the largest provider and manufacturer of formwork, shoring, and scaffolding systems in the world. Originally founded in Germany in 1969, PERI currently operates in 60 countries worldwide. Our success is the result of a philosophy to provide the best possible solutions together with the best possible service with a workforce that is focused on and understands the importance of customer satisfaction. PERI is currently looking for a Senior Engineer – Research and Development to join the PERI family! The main purpose of PERI’s Senior Engineer – Research and Development position, is to design new products for the North America market. The Senior Engineer – Research and Development is accountable for the creation of concepts and design solutions from initiation to production. We are looking for someone who has a positive attitude, an entrepreneurial spirit, is open-minded, passionate about their work, in addition to being a team player. Are you are looking for an exciting opportunity with a growing company that cares about their employees? If so, we invite you to apply! What you'll do on a typical day:Design and create detailed engineering specifications ensuring proper tolerancing and design for manufacturabilityReview relevant competitive products to provide benchmarking and analysis of technical specificationsIdentify and resolve problems in a timely manner, gather and analyzes information skillfullyCoordinate with manufacturing at suitable stages such as at initial design to evaluate the design’s ability to optimize for manufacturing in an efficient and economical mannerEnsure compliance to the requirements of OSHA standards, referencing ACI, ASME, ANSI and SSFI StandardsDevelop technical solutions to engineering problems using analytical methods such as DOE, correlation studies, and apply statistical analysis for product improvements and apply FMEA process to implement sound engineering solutionsDevelop product literature by recording, interpreting, and explaining technical data and product performanceWhat you'll need to be successful in the role:Strong aptitude for hands-on engineering problem solving skillsExpert user of 2D and 3D CAD tools, including basic analysis tools (FEA, Stress, Bending, etc.)Ability to communicate clearly and professionally with internal and external customers and provide training and coaching to Engineering and Sales team membersOpen to other’s ideas and exhibits a willingness to try new thingsSelf-motivated with a strong competitive drive, a resilient nature and a goal and results oriented mindsetAbility to accurately analyze situations and reach productive decisions based on informed judgmentAbility to effectively collaborate with peers to reach a common goal Adapt to changes in the work environment, manage competing demands, and can deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected eventsExcellent attention to detail, strong organizational and multitasking skills with the ability to problem-solveAbility to effectively prioritize and manage time, tasks, and resources while working in a fast-paced environmentDemonstrates proficiency in 3D CAD modeling part and assembly modelsExperienced in the phases and requirements of the NPD processAdditional Requirements:Post-secondary education degree in Mechanical, Production Engineering or other related Engineering disciplineConstruction and/or formwork industry experience is an assetProficient in Microsoft Office application and computer skills with the ability to quickly learn and adapt to utilizing new technology/softwareExceptional verbal and written communication in the English languagePERI Offers a competitive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, supplemental options, 401k retirement with company match, paid holidays, sick leave, and paid time off. PERI participates in E-Verify. For additional information regarding E-Verify please go to www.e-verify.gov. Peri USA is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment based upon membership in a protected class. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, or other classifications protected by state, local or federal law. Following receipt of a conditional offer of employment, candidates may be required to have a Motor Vehicle Report (MVR) ran for candidates who drive company vehicles or receive vehicle allowances as permitted or required by applicable law. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or if you have questions or difficulty using our online system or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to Recruiter@peri-usa.com; or call +1 (410) 796-5861. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only individuals selected for an interview will be contacted and considered a candidate. Education Preferred  Bachelors or better in Civil Engineering or related field Skills Required  Microsoft Office AutoCAD Behaviors Required  Thought Provoking: Capable of making others think deeply on a subject Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking Motivations Required  Entrepreneurial Spirit: Inspired to perform well by an ability to drive new ventures within the business

Prefix Corporation is an engineering services company, developing innovative design and engineering solutions for various industries. Continuously owned and operated by the same founding family for over 40 years, today the company operates multiple facilities in Michigan with over 300 employees, and has become a single-source American manufacturing, prototype, concept vehicle and production solutions provider to the automotive, aviation, motion picture, themed entertainment, and a variety of other industries. At Prefix, we are wanting motivated, ambitious people who put the needs of our customers first, bring creativity to their work and will do whatever it takes to achieve success. If you share our passion for providing innovative solutions to complex challenges, we want you on our team. We have an opportunity for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our team. This position will be involved in the creation of mechanical designs on multiple systems from concept to commissioning for the Themed Entertainment industry. This includes mechanism design, 3D Computer-Aided Design (CAD) models, drafting, and assembly of complex mechanical systems as well as involvement in structural analysis of said systems. This position will work in a team environment on defined tasks while also collaborating with other team members to meet the customer’s needs and requirements for Show and Ride systems. The position is located at our Rochester Hills, MI facility. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Convert customer ideas and requirements from concept design through possible production release using applicable engineering analysis to design components, subsystems and assemblies. Direct the design of mechanical, electromechanical and structural systems through the product design cycle while providing leadership, guidance, coaching, mentorship and technical support to team members. Participate and assist in the development and maintenance of Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA), Design Validation Plan & Report (DVP&R) and associated engineering documents. Prepare, review and approval of customer deliverable design packages and reports and present mechanical design elements at formal reviews to team and customers. Review and approval of Bill of Materials (BOM’s) and all other required design documentation. Assure design are in compliance to customer and industry standards, and manage engineering change through completion including tracking and reporting of design hours budget to actual. Defines and develops hardware development tasks, manpower needs and required testing, in support of mock-ups, prototype / pre-production, and production builds. Coordinate with CAE/FEA resources for simulation analysis and part mitigation resolution and review and report status of analysis progression to defined schedule. Review and approve design of components, subsystems and assemblies to meet or exceed the required stress load conditions, duty cycle, acceleration, velocity and other related engineering performance requirements. Collaborate, manage and oversee allocated CAD resources for the refined development of 3D models and 2D drawings as required. Provide design recommendations, alternative solutions and risk assessment for resolution to mechanical, performance and operational design issues. Collaborate with other project stakeholders (quality, purchasing, manufacturing, etc.) on issues including but not limited to design for manufacturing feasibility, cost, ease of assembly and error-proofing. SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Required): Bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or related technical degree Minimum 6 years of engineering experience in automotive, machine design, aerospace or other related industry. Proficient using SolidWorks 2D/3D CAD (Computer-Aided Design) or similar operating system. Experience in the development and understanding of CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) and/or Rigid Body Dynamics (RBD). Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel (intermediate), Outlook, and PowerPoint). SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Preferred): Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent. Knowledge on manufacturing processes in machining, composites and metal fabrication. Ability to multi-task and ability to support multiple programs at one time. Superior written and verbal communication skills and able to convey technical data to various audiences and thrive in a team environment, strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Work experience in themed entertainment industry. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: Direct Reports: 2-4 P.E. License preferred (not required) Travel Requirements: Up to 20% may be required. (Current valid passport preferred / not required) U.S. Citizen or legally authorized to work in the United States.

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced mechanical engineer - who must have expertise in engineering design involving mechanics, materials, heat transfer, and fluids - to develop an energy harvester (i.e. a heat-to-electricity thermoelectric generator called 'TEG') for vehicle engine exhaust, among other applications. The novel technology also enables cost-effective manufacture with muffler components, offering a 2-in-1 'muffler-TEG'. Furthermore, the TEG scales compactly in capacity from 100 to 10,000 Watts or more.A detailed job description is presented below.Job Summary:An experienced mechanical engineer will participate in the technical design, development, and launch of a category of products based upon a heat recovery technology, positioned for lasting impact in clean-tech. This position requires technical and interpersonal maturity to work well within a multi-disciplinary environment as well as a pragmatic drive to deliver results towards product realization.Major Job Duties and Responsibilities:Design, analyze, fabricate, and test prototypes and products - involving mechanics, materials, heat transfer, and fluids - ultimately positioning detailed mechanical designs for volume manufacture and commercialization.Model and simulate mechanical structures involving heat transfer (conduction, convection) from heat exchangers and mechanical and thermal stresses from thermal expansion and effects due to high temperature, materials, and their interfaces.Develop computer models as design tools to assist product development.Define specifications for parts and system. Lead vendors and suppliers to deliver to spec.Participate as key technical contributor within multi-disciplinary team, involving company staff and external company partners.Contribute to developing company’s core technologies and intellectual property.Document designs and results in the form of detailed drawings, reports, and presentations.Manage technical tasks and projects in order to meet overall program goals.Required Skills and Experience:Solid technical capabilities involving detailed mechanical designs (SolidWorks) and analysis and modeling of material mechanics and heat transfer (i.e. FEA, CFD). Such experience with heat exchange and materials at high temperatures (i.e. 400 – 900 degC) is preferred as is durability / fatigue analysis from dynamic shock and vibration in automotive vehicles.Product development experience in applying rigorous technical skills to deliver prototypes / products. Design for Manufacturability and Assembly (DFMA) strongly preferred.Experience with heat exchangers, thermoelectric devices, and vacuum-sealed devices is preferred.Technical project management is preferred.Good communication skills, verbal and written.Good interpersonal skills, ability to work well in a team environment.Agility, adaptability, and resourcefulness within a dynamic work environment.Strong desire to work in a start-up company is a must. Experience in a start-up is preferred.Required Level of Education and Experience:B.S. in relevant field - plus 5 to 10 years of industry experience, orMS. in relevant field - plus 3 to 8 years of industry experience, orPh.D. with product realization industry experience in relevant fieldAbout VECARIUS:VECARIUS, Inc. is an emerging leader in exhaust waste heat recovery systems, significantly improving the energy efficiency of engine platforms. Conceived by MIT engineers, our proprietary technology is positioned to make a lasting impact in clean-tech and has high potential to penetrate mass vehicle markets. We are looking for top talent to join our team of world-class business and technology leaders and to share this vision of success.Contact for job opportunity:Please send a resume and cover letter to the following:Steve CaseyPresident & CEOscasey@vecarius.com617-308-4324

Do you want to... Fulfill why you got into engineering in the first place? Work on products that really make a difference? Find a high-energy, dynamic work environment where development cycles are short and you are exposed to a wide variety of technologies?Critical innovation. Leading-edge technology. Continuous learning.Product Creation Studio is an award-winning, fast-paced, full-service product development firm located in Seattle’s booming South Lake Union tech center. We fuse our passion and expertise in strategic design and precision engineering to create, innovate, and solve complex challenges for our clients across the consumer, medical, and industrial fields. From burgeoning start-ups to top-tiered companies, we make products happen. Designing Products for Positive Impact for nearly two decades, Product Creation Studio has fostered innovation and transformed ideas into meaningful products and experiences.Stimulating environment. Collaborative culture. Inspiring people.At Product Creation Studio, we are dedicated to attracting and retaining the best talent in the business. Our projects include a broad range of products in the consumer electronic, medical device, fitness, automation, marine and avionic industries and our growing client base ranges from small startups to Fortune 500 companies. Product Creation Studio is a highly collaborative environment where good ideas can come from anyone. We work in an open studio where you will work with electrical, firmware, and people from other practice areas where you will provide technical leadership on assigned projects. If Product Creation Studio sounds like what you're looking for, then we'd like to hear from you.We are seeking a self-motivated, talented, and exceptional Senior Mechanical Design Engineer to fill a vital role in our expanding development team.Job Description:The Senior Mechanical Design Engineer will own the mechanical engineering design of select new products. As an engineering owner you’ll brainstorm concepts, guide industrial designers in DFM, engineer design concepts to completion, partner with electrical and firmware engineers, and own nearly all aspects of product functionality, client deadlines, verification, validation, and manufacturing efficiency. You must be able to integrate with the team, working in tandem with us or as an engineering leader when needed.Requirements:Expert in Solidworks (or ProE) in C2 surfacing and complex assemblies7+ years in mechanical engineering in product developmentStrong product portfolioLead Design Engineer on 2 mass manufactured (1M or more) electro-mechanical productsProven examples of designing to meet budgets and rigid timelinesDemonstrated ability to create production data sets that fully define manufacturing requirementsAbility/flexibility to work on numerous projects at a time and navigate shifting requirementsAbility to self-manage, work directly with clients, vendors, and design teamsStrength in computational engineering including FEASkilled ability to assemble and make prototypesGeneral machine shop knowledgeAbility to listen to client/company needs and add value through billing efficiencyBSME or engineering equivalentAbility to travel and support clients/factories <20%Ability to own BOMs and write manufacturing contractsDesirable:Formal Project Management skillsetMedical Device experienceConsulting experienceExisting client base a plusThorough knowledge of injection molding tooling, metal design, handheld electronics, and computer designElectronics experience a benefit; including circuit design, PCB layout, component specification and sourcingExperience in automation, mechatronics, and kinematic assembliesProduct Test design and implementation510K, FMEA, and compliance experienceAbility to quote work, develop product specifications, and document design historyMasters in an engineering related fieldExperience in overseas manufacturingCore Competencies:Puts the Customer First: Has a relentless focus on the customer. Understands what the customer wants and knows how to deliver those needs best.Works Well with Others: Listens and communicates well with clients and teammates. Fosters a team environment that is positive and constructiveLeads Courageously: Takes personal responsibility to do the right thing and persists in times of challenge or uncertainty. Adapts quickly to change and makes timely, thoughtful decisionsAchieves Results: Understands what drives overall business success and is accountable for prioritizing and delivering quality results. Anticipates obstacles and takes action to prevent or minimize their impactTo apply, please send your resume, cover letter, and portfolio to Don Baumgarten at careers@productcreationstudio.com* and include Mechanical Engineer in the subject line.*Product Creation Studio is an EEOC company.Job Type: Full-time

Stress Analysis Engineer: Sr. Mechanical Engineer – Chassis and Suspension
column7: WET Design Burbank, California ***Local Candidates are preferred*** Sr. Mechanical Engineer – Chassis and Suspension WET is looking for a highly motivated Mechanical Engineer to join the WET Product Design Team! Objective: Work in an existing engineering team to help design unique suspension and isolation solutions and other chassis related components for specialty vehicles. While contributing to the mechanical design of WET’s products, you will work closely with many cross-functional teams, including visual design, industrial design, electrical hardware engineering, manufacturing engineering, tooling, and operations. This role offers a great opportunity to develop through rapid iteration, concurrent engineering, on-site production, testing, and assembly. Key Responsibilities: Design of custom shock absorption and isolation systems Design of chassis related structural systems DFM of Components / Production Drawings Development, Testing and Evaluation of Designs Experiment with Active stabilization using hydraulics and electro-mechanics Key Qualifications: Master’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical or related discipline 7+ years of experience with theory and design of Automotive chassis, suspension, dampening and/or stabilization systems SolidWorks mastery SolidWorks FEA, Buckling and Fatigue Simulations Modal Structural Analysis WET is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with WET is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status. k9ZvJOuDbT

Overview:   Purpose:   Analyzes project requirements and performs the necessary design of material handling systems and equipment, selecting the most appropriate configuration to meet specified cost, function and schedule goals.  Responsibilities:   Responsibilities: Designs autonomous vehicles to meet all customer requirements and all global, federal, state and local safety and environmental regulations within time and budget. Estimate material cost, time and labor for material handling equipment and/or product line equipment with consideration for correct application and manufacturability. Troubleshoot escalated technical issues. Build vendor relationships to ensure selection of materials and systems while meeting quality and cost guidelines. Interface with customer with regard to technical inquiries, including on-site technical support during initial design preparation, commissioning, and/or post-production, as required to provide the highest level of customer satisfaction. Individually or as part of a team, has major responsibilities for internal and external projects and the latitude to select the most economically feasible solution to each assigned project. Exercises their creative abilities to question current practices and propose novel methodologies to solve design challenges. Performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications:   Requirements: Knowledge and Skills:   To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Minimum BS Mechanical Engineer MS in Mechanical Engineering a plus 5-10 years experience in product development mechanical design in an industrial field such as automotive, aviation, construction equipment; agricultural equipment; electrical vehicles or similar. Must have experience specifying, designing, and troubleshooting hydraulic systems. Lift truck experience highly desirable. Knowledge of European autonomous vehicles and manufacturing practices preferred Knowledge of 3691-4 and B56.5 standards preferred Ability to create detail, assembly and layout drawings. Proficient in AutoCAD, 3D modeling, Pro/Engineer/Creo preferred FEA analysis, a plus DFEMA experience a plus Ability to manage multiple priorities and workload demands Knowledge of Kaizen and Lean Manufacturing techniques, a plus Ability to travel, domestic and international, up to 25% Experience: Special Position Requirements: Ability to travel up to 25% (domestic and international). Bonuses will be offered to this senior design engineer that can work at a fast pace to produce rapid prototypes and move quickly to meet these product development goals. About Ideal Vacuum Ideal Vacuum is the largest supplier of scientific and industrial vacuum equipment in the southwest. We are a manufacturer of sophisticated environmental simulation instruments, for vacuum applications such as:High Altitude SimulationAerospace Component Environmental TestingSpace Flight Conditions SimulationRocket Launch Thermal Vacuum SimulationOur other vacuum products such as vacuum pumps, valves, and pressure measurement devices are used within an increasingly diverse range of industrial and R&D processes, including solar cell manufacturing, thin-film optical coating applications, quality control processes, analytical chemistry methods, like Raman spectroscopy and mass spectrometry, pharmaceutical manufacturing, chemical engineering, and are integrated into various scientific instruments.About This Position Ideal Vacuum is seeking a senior engineer to work on the product development of mechanical scroll and multi-stage blower type vacuum pumps. They are called "dry pumps" because they do not use vacuum pump oil to seal the pumping stages. Being dry, they operate on a non-contact design, where high-speed rotors are mounted very close to stationary stators, this is in some ways like a turbo or supercharger in a performance sports car. The fast-rotating speed and close tolerance keeps airflow moving forward while limiting backwards migration of gases. A key technical challenge is to correctly address thermal expansion, to maintain the close tolerances between fix and moving components. Elegant and innovative designs are needed, which will correctly manage thermal expansion caused by the heat generated as the gases are compressed in the vacuum generating process; while simultaneously preventing component contact which would cause the pump to seize.  This Senior Mechanical Engineer will lead the Product Development team to design, analyze, test, and validate these new vacuum pumps through the full Product Life Cycle, from concept, the initial sale, to product service. This will involve developing and implementing innovative solutions, leading the product development process, and delivering these projects on time. Primary Job ResponsibilitiesDeliver innovative ideas by examining alternate techniques/approaches and provide intellectual property.Design parts and assemblies, create 3D solid models using SolidWorks, and 2D drawing prints for manufacturing.Develop pump components, such as rotors, stators, scrolls, shafts, valves, electric motor mounting components, to deliver performance, reliability, and the margin of safety.Leverage various statistical techniques, and predictive modeling to identify and drive design improvements.Collaborate with our CNC machining department to manufacture prototype parts.Operate in-house tools for design validation, including CMM.Design and make custom assembly fixtures and tooling.Conduct laboratory testing, prepare a written report of the results, and use those results to refine the design.Collect and analyze data to identify trends and relationships.Interpret design specifications and support concept, design, documentation, fatigue analysis, fabrication and testing of pumps.Lead evaluation of pump designs for structural integrity, such as vibration and thermal heat management analysis.Collaborate with documentation team to create assembly instructions along with the user's operating manual.Give PowerPoint presentations on the research results to other engineers and managers.Assist production team.Conduct failure mode analysis and troubleshooting of product life cycle.Support various types of cost management and improvement activities.Lead the design team to create attractive product packaging, using a variety of cast metal and injection molded plastic cover components, which would be popular with our customers, and support the look of our Ideal Vacuum brand.Qualifications We DesireProfessional experience designing and developing production mechanical products.Experience working with suppliers and machine shops to fabricate parts and components.Experience performing mechanical testing (e.g., vibrational and thermal analysis, etc.)Working knowledge of manufacturing processes associated with precision metal parts (e.g., CNC machining, gaging, CMM based inspection).Proficiency with SolidWorks CAD Software.Proficiency with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) as well as tolerance analysis methods.Proficiency with mechanical modeling analysis tools (e.g., FEA software).Familiarity with material characterization techniques.Proven ability to interact well with diverse teams.Excellent communication skills including the ability to prepare clearly written reports and deliver well-articulated briefings.Genuine technical curiosity, and an interest and aptitude for learning more.Strong commitment to quality, safety, collaboration, and teamwork.Education/Experience Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s in Engineering, Engineering Technology, Chemistry, Physics, or Computer ScienceAt least 12 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experienceAt least 2 years of experience leading new technologies or specialized technologies OR  Master’s in Engineering, Engineering Technology, Chemistry, Physics, or Computer ScienceAt least 8 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies and/or computer science experienceAt least 2 years of experience leading new technologies or specialized technologies OR  PhD in Engineering, Engineering Technology, Chemistry, Physics, or Computer ScienceAt least 5 years of experience in product design/development or new technologies or specialized technologies and/or computer science experienceAt least 2 years of experience leading new technologies or specialized technologiesBeneficial Experience: We are looking for candidates that have professional experience working as a development design engineer for any of these production products:Dry scroll pumpsMultistage roots vacuum pumpsTurbomolecular vacuum pumpsAutomotive motorsScrew, scroll, or Root’s blower type air compressorsHVAC refrigeration compressorsAutomotive transmissions, superchargers, or turbochargersGas turbine enginesSmall combustion enginesHigh speed electric motorsRotary water pumpsAerospace vehiclesBeneficial Experience: Please email resume to workwithus@idealvac.com By Regular Mail To: Ideal Vacuum Products Human Resources 5910 Midway Park Blvd NE Albuquerque, NM 87109 Phone: (505) 872-0037 Fax: (505) 872-9001 Email: workwithus@idealvac.com

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility   At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.    We plan to lead in this new era of luxury electric by returning to the fundamentals of great design – where every decision we make is in service of the individual and environment. Because when you are no longer bound by convention, you are free to define your own experience.    Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.  As a Sr. Technical Team Leader on the Motor Gearbox Engineering design team, you will have design ownership of next generation EV mechanical propulsion systems and components for Lucid vehicles, motorsports programs and other applications. You will work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with talented and passionate colleagues to design, prototype, test and launch these exciting products into production. Show your passion for innovation with our transmission and EV powertrain systems.  The Role: Design and develop EV mechanical propulsion systems, subsystems, and components, including motors, geartrains, castings, lubrication systems and other structural, thermal, and rotational components. Partner with colleagues in test, manufacturing, quality, software, supply chain, vehicle attributes, and other teams to solve challenges and achieve breakthroughs that will take Lucid’s powertrain technologies to the next level. Work with suppliers and prototype shops to design, specify and qualify drivetrain components. Work with manufacturing team to define best practices for assembling powertrains, and solve assembly related issues at the plant Write performance and test specifications for powertrain components. Develop unique test methods to evaluate functionality and quantify performance benefits of design proposals Write business cases to justify expenditures related to performance improvements or engineering test equipment Manage parts through the various stages of their lifecycle, from conception to obsolescence As part of a growing global team, you may travel domestically and internationally as required. Qualifications: At least 3 years of technical industry experience focused on component design or manufacturing. Automotive powertrain experience, or other similar experience. Transmission and EV powertrain systems preferred. Proficiency with 3D modeling software (CAD). Catia v5/v6 highly preferred. Ability to work effectively with cross functional teams Excellent organization and project management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proactive, ownership mindset and strong work ethic Ability to thrive in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment Collaborative, team player personality Willing to get your hands dirty Preferred: Hands on mechanical fabrication, prototyping and/or test experience Casting design / gear design / Injection Mold part design Previous direct involvement in product launch or manufacturing support for mass production Experience with DMFEA, 8D, DOE, Six Sigma, or other structured problem-solving Experience with Ansys or other similar FEA based modeling software Education: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related field. Masters preferred. Salary Range: The compensation range for this position is specific to the locations listed below and is the range Lucid reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position taking into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions ,including job-related knowledge; skillset; experience, education and training; certifications; and other relevant business and organizational factors.  California (Bay Area) - $115,000-$165,000/yr Additional Compensation and Benefits: Lucid offers a wide range of competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, vacation, and 401k.The successful candidate may also be eligible to participate in Lucid’s equity program and/or a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing such programs. (Cash or equity incentive awards, if any, will depend on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and company performance.)  Lucid maintains your privacy according to its Candidate Privacy Notice. If you are a California resident, please refer to our California Candidate Privacy Notice.    At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.  To all recruitment agencies:   Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
