Job Description:    INNOVATE without boundaries! At Milwaukee Tool we firmly believe that our People and our Culture are the secrets to our success - so we give you unlimited access to everything you need to create disruptive new technologies and solutions on our engineering teams.    Our fast-paced, agile environment continuously delivers disruptive technologies by providing every team with the resources needed to excel and deliver heavy duty products with high performance. We create Best in Class products by leveraging advanced analysis tools, extensive testing regimes, state-of-the-art manufacturing machinery and cross-functional agility.    This role will be responsible for evaluating, developing, and implementing new or improved manufacturing processes to execute innovative, sustainable, and cost out goals. You will be required to plan, direct, manage and coordinate engineering personnel involved in the development of new products or the enhancement/value engineering of existing products. Our ideal candidate possesses strong technical engineering knowledge, strong leadership skills, and experience in managing complex projects internally and with development partners. The candidate would love to create new products, learn about new technologies, understand user needs and are often thinking about better ways to optimize them.    Your Role on Our Team:      Lead mid to high level advanced manufacturing projects, providing direction, guidance, and engineering expertise to team members.        Help facilitate project flow involving regular contact with engineering, manufacturing, and other cross functional teams.        Work with and steer development with equipment suppliers to deliver custom processing solutions to achieve goals and targets.        Perform a variety of calculation and software-aided analyses to prove process reliability, capability, and sustainability.        As a subject matter expert, you will provide technical leadership for the team, and drive manufacturing excellence through new processes and methods that will improve safety, reduce product cost and improve product quality        Understanding of cost drivers and how to mitigate them through advanced manufacturing techniques        Create, maintain, and package robust documentation packages for responsible development activities and work with manufacturing team to verify alignment regarding collected information and support the pre-production activities for processes.      The TOOLS you’ll bring with you:      A Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical, Industrial or Electrical Engineering, or equivalent combination of training, education, and experience.        A minimum of 8 years of engineering related experience.        Strong proficiency in 3D CAD - NX, Solidworks, or similar        Proficiency in FEA (Static, Dynamic, Thermal and Fluidic modeling)        Deep mechanical aptitude, including a broad knowledge of manufacturing process related activities such as fixture design, metal working, stamping, forging, injection molding, machining, automated assembly, polishing, and grinding.    Other TOOLS we prefer you to have:      Strong analytical skills, knowledge, and experience in process evaluation tools: Design of Experiments (DOE), statistical data analysis, risk analysis, flow layout and other related engineering tools.        Knowledge to draw preliminary sketches and prepares layout and detail drawings, using standard computer-assisted design software (NX or SolidWorks).        Advanced computer knowledge and skills using MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Outlook, MS Project, and Solidworks/AutoCAD/NXAbility        Able to set up, repair, adjust and troubleshoot production automation, industrial robotics equipment and interface devices.        Have an understanding of PLC driven control systems and be capable of interpreting ladder logic programs.      Travel Requirements:      30% (includes domestic and international travel for machine and/or concept evaluations)      We provide these great perks and benefits:      Robust health, dental and vision insurance plans        Generous 401 (K) savings plan        Education assistance        On-site wellness, fitness center, food, and coffee service · And many more, check out our benefits site HERE

Summary New product design, analysis, testing, and performance improvement. Resolves issues relating to existing designs. Shares knowledge up, down, and across the department.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.Analyzes research data and proposed product specifications to determine feasibility of product proposal.· Prepares or directs preparation of product or system layout and detailed drawings.· Directs and coordinates manufacturing or building of prototype product or system.· Plans and develops experimental test programs.· Analyzes test data and reports to determine if design meets functional and performance specifications.· Confers with research and other engineering personnel and prepares design modifications as required.· Evaluates engineering test results for possible application to development of systems or other uses.· Uses computer assisted engineering and design software and equipment to perform engineering and design tasks.· Employee’s primary duties require him/her to use discretion and independent judgment.· Determines priorities with minimal oversight from the engineering manager.· Identifies design risk early in the program and develops mitigation plan.· Possess a deep familiarity with materials, heat treatments, and finishes.· Communicate deeply technical test or analysis results, in written or verbal form, to a less technically-orientated stakeholder.· Evaluate technical specifications and flow down the appropriate requirements to test procedures and compliance matrices.· Review and critique designs, drawings, procedures, and reports produced by entry-level members in the department.· Shares recent developments and lessons learned with the department.· Supports Root Cause and Corrective Action (RCCA) activities associated with development or qualification problems.· Supports proposal efforts by providing accurate input to the document writer as to the time, effort, and cost required to complete certain engineering tasks.Provides and/or recommends training to entry level engineers in the department.Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Education and/or Experience B.S. in Engineering, or Associates Degree in a related field with at least five (5) years of experience.Language Skills Must be fluent in written and spoken English.Computer Skills Must have 3D CAD experience, Solidworks preferred. Must have FEA experience.Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.The employee is expected to adhere to all company policies.NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other duties assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.Equal Employment OpportunityCEF Industries is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Holtec International, a turnkey supplier of technologies for the nuclear and fossil power industries, is seeking to add an experienced mechanical/civil/structural analyst to its Applied Mechanics Group with opportunities to contribute to Holtec’s first of a kind small modular reactor (SMR-160) design. The senior analyst would be called upon to analyze metallic, reinforced concrete and soil-subgrade supported structures. Typical analyses include: Static and dynamic finite element modeling and analyses (FEA) using ANSYS Drop and impact (e.g., missile and aircraft) analyses and target response using LS-DYNA Simulation of the seismic response of freestanding structures in air or submerged in water Static and dynamic analyses of large reinforced concrete structures Soil-structure interaction (SSI) analyses with freestanding and/or anchored structures Beam and plate stress calculations using established principles of strength of materials MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Applicant must possess a BS in mechanical/civil/structural engineering with a minimum of 7 years of experience. MS will count for 2 years of experience and Ph.D. will count for 4 years of experience (experience from MS and Ph.D. cannot be combined) Familiarity with standard industry and design codes/manuals such as ASME, ASCE, ACI and AISC Must possess excellent credentials in principles of solid mechanics Must possess excellent technical writing and communication skills DESIRED SKILLS Academic or industrial experience in the latest stress analysis codes such as ANSYS, LS-DYNA, STAAD.Pro and GT STRUDL Prior nuclear industry experience including interactions with NRC or other regulatory authorities  VQug228fLF

column7: Company Overview: Second Order Effects (SOE) is an engineering consultancy that transforms uncertainty into fully functional hardware and software. We work on projects at various stages of development and scope; we perform analysis, build prototypes, and take products to market. Our cross-disciplinary team solves critical problems across numerous industries, including automotive, aerospace, consumer electronics, industrial automation, biomedical, green energy, and marine. Our designs control rocket engines, manage satellite communications, generate safety-overrides for self-driving cars, and are enjoyed by consumers around the world. Founded in 2016, Second Order Effects has 90+ employees (and counting!) in offices in El Segundo, California and Redmond, Washington. We've worked with 90+ clients on 250+ projects as a partner, on a retainer, or on demand, all of which have no involvement with weapons. How do we do this? We prioritize others, build the right thing, welcome difficulty, and play the long game. Learn more at soeffects.com! Team Overview: As the mechanical team rapidly expands, each addition to the team has an immediate and meaningful impact on the team and company. Our work often entails learning and inventing over the course of a project, and you will be awarded support, trust, and autonomy to do so. The mechanical team is a collaborative group with a passion for wading into uncharted territories. Job Overview: As a Mechanical Engineer, Senior, you will be part of a core SOE team and support all of the projects by designing enclosures, mechanisms, and custom parts for customers. Ideally, you are forward thinking and have solid experience carrying projects from whiteboard design through fabrication and test. Additionally, you must effectively communicate technical concepts to all audiences and balance creativity and technical foundations, as innovation requires both. What You Will Do:Oversee mechanical projects as the responsible authority, working closely with other engineering disciplines and customers to plan, coordinate, and execute on deliverablesIdeate within a multi-disciplinary team to generate producible solutions that meet project requirementsProvide hands-on leadership to the engineering team, including technical guidance, development strategy, resourcing, and business supportDesign and model complex integrated 3D assemblies and produce robust engineering drawingsSelect materials, processes, and finishes best suited for the application of the project and the industryDevelop test setups and environments to evaluate the integrity of hardware and accuracy of analysesDrive technical efforts and teams through the lifecycle of a product developmentCommunicate designs, analyses, solutions, ideas, challenges, and progress effectively and accurately to the team and customersDeliver articulate and comprehensive documentation, reports, and presentations as part of technical design reviews and customer proposalsMentor and motivate other engineers and team members, fostering a constructive and rewarding cultureWhat You Will Need:Bachelor's Degree (Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Math, related field)5+ years of experience in mechanical engineering design and system developmentDemonstrated passion for engineering and technology developmentExperience in modeling, simulation, and testing of electro-mechanical components or assembliesExperience with a myriad of manufacturing processes such as machining, injection molding, water jetting, electro-discharge machining, and 3D printingSolid understanding and application of GD&TWhat Would Be Useful:Master's degree (Mechanical / Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, related field)Leadership experience in team-based design and project managementSteady state and dynamic thermal analysis of electronic devices with CFD modeling softwareSolidworks design tool for modelling and analyzing complex systemsProficiency in mathematical back of the envelope hand calculation analysis, finite element analyses (FEA), and computer-aided designs (CAD)Ability to analyze and estimate structural loading from environmental sourcesExperience with fatigue and thermal testing of electro-mechanical assembliesUnderstanding of Electrical Engineering fundamentals and design experience with simple circuits using op amps, ICs, and discrete componentsAdditional Requirements:Applicant must be willing to work 40 hours a week on-site in El Segundo, California, USAApplicant must be eligible to work on ITAR projectsJob Type: Full-time (Salary)ITAR Requirements:To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Unfortunately, we are unable to provide sponsorship at this time.Benefits:Compensation range of $135,000-$175,000 + equity incentive plan100% employer-paid health insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision) for employees + 50% dependent coverageFlexible paid time off policy + 11 paid holidays + 12 paid sick days401(k) retirement account and employer matching (Safe Harbor 4%)Hybrid working arrangementsPaid parental leaveRelocation assistance available if 50+ miles away from the officeElectric Vehicle (EV) charging portsCasual dress codeDaily catered lunches, snacks, and accessible kitchen& more!If you don't meet 100% of the preferred skills and experience, we encourage you to still apply! Second Order Effects is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SOE is governed on the basis of excellence and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status.

Company: RSA Engineered Products, LLC Primary Location: 110 West Cochran Street, Unit A, Simi Valley, CA 93065 USA Employment Type: Salaried | Full-Time Function: Engineering Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled Main Duties & Responsibilities Job Summary:  As a direct report to the Engineering Director, the Project Engineer II shall be responsible to plan, organize, implement and control a variety of activities related to engineering, research and development and design related to customer specifications to ensure company business goals and customer requirements are met within cost and on schedule. The Project Engineer II may have Junior Engineers supporting them.  Projects will include, but are not limited to: New Product Development RSA IP designs, Build-to-Print, Design to Spec, and other relevant design activities. The Design Engineering Manager shall be responsible to ensure the completion of projects from the Request for Proposal (RFP) phase thru Contract Award, Detailed Design, Design Validation/Certification, initial Production, and sustaining engineering efforts.  Required Education & Experience:  Bachelor’s degree in ME, Physics, EE, Aeronautical Engineering or IE with preference toward Mechanical Engineering. Advanced degree preferred.Understanding of a broad range of engineering skills.Preferably in aircraft/aerospace design and structural analysis.Product development background necessary.  3 – 7+ years of experience in metallic or composite ducting and motion compensator design per ARP 699 guidelines as Project / Systems Engineer, or equivalent experience in ECS (Environmental Control System), bleed air, or AMS (air management system) system or component design in the following industries: Valves (pneumatic or electro mechanical) Heat Exchangers Turbo Machinery Fuel Tank Inert Systems (FTIS, OBIGGS, OBOGGS, NGS, etc.) Wing-Anti Ice Systems Ram Air Systems High Pressure or Low Pressure pneumatic systems Structural design Preferred to have experience with analysis tools such as FEA / FEM tools MSC NASTRAN / PATRAN, ANSYS, ATA NASTRAN / FEMAP Experience with aircraft certification to EASA, Transport Canada, and/or FAA 14 CFR FAR 25 requirements. Experience from program award (kick-off) to Milestones such as:PDR (Preliminary Design Review), CDR (Critical Design Review), PRR (Production Readiness Review), SOF (Safety of Flight), EIS (Entry-into-Service). Understanding of the value of Project Management Skills with experience working with internal or external customers and resources. Experience writing certification documentation, such as: ATP, QTP, QTR, etc. Test experience per RTCA-DO/190 or MIL-STD-810 (vibration and environmental tests). Ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced environment. Ability to read / support the creation of 3D models and 2D drawings with dimensioning and tolerance per ANSI/ASME Y14.5 standards. Support manufacturing team during the Product Development Phase (i.e. initial design for manufacturability and redesigns, as required during the development phase). Thorough understanding of industry specifications, such as MIL, AN, MS, NAS, ASTM, AMS, etc.  Preferred experience with sheet metal and/or composite manufacturing / forming processes. Preferred experience with CAD software (CATIA V5 or Solidworks). Preferred test experience with LabVIEW data acquisition / control VIs. 25% or less travel.  Principal Duties & Responsibilities:  Organize and schedule engineering activities to ensure they are completed on schedule and within cost. Peer review of detailed design activities including: manufacturing drawing review, stress analysis, project schedules, etc. May require support of junior engineers. Assure design compliance to customer requirements. Schedule design reviews, meetings, and interdepartmental presentations to ensure design points are understood and are concurrent with other organization activities. Ability to take “hands on” approach. Perform other duties as assigned Conform to company safety policies and procedures. Work in a team environment. The pay scale for this position ranges from $64,480 to $131,300 annually. Qualifications

Job Title: Senior Mechanical EngineerDepartment: Innovative TechnologiesReports to: EVP Innovative TechnologiesLocations: Amarillo, TX or McKinney, TXFull/Part Time: Full timeRemote work authorized: NoFLSA Classification: ExemptCBA: N/AEffective Date: 1 November 2023Security Clearance Req: Eligibility Required_____________________________________________________________________________The Albers Aerospace Innovative Technologies team is pressing the state-of-the-art forward in cutting edge innovations such as ultra-short pulse laser ablation, heavy fuels hybrid electric propulsion, and novel eVTOL air vehicle design.Growing rapidly, we have established ourselves as the company to solve problems, be a partner with, and make things happen. We are passionate and aggressive about getting things done!Job Summary:The Senior Mechanical Engineer performs and oversees engineering tasks related to requirements development, mechanical design to satisfy functional and performance requirements, verification and validation testing, mechanical systems integration, and bench testing of a heavy fuels aviation engines coupled with electrical power generation and storage systems. The Senior Mechanical Engineer will also support ground and flight testing of unmanned aerial vehicles, including structural design, modification, repair, and data gathering to inform CAD, CFD, and CAD modeling and program status reporting. Works with eVTOL design SMEs, Chief Technology Officer, test engineers, other engineers from different disciplines (electrical, aerospace, systems, industrial, etc), and Program Management on defining and completing tasks.Duties/Responsibilities:May lead and direct the work of other engineers and stakeholders while acting as the Subject Matter Expert (SME).Perform a range of design development, analysis, or review tasks under minimal supervision.Act as a lead on less complex tasks and responsible for a portion of a design or section of an analysis or design review.Generate complete design specifications of more complex projects.Coordinate and work closely with other engineering, logistics, financial, and program management disciplines to define system specifications and requirements.Establish and maintain a filing system or databases as needed for tracking project status.Develop, maintain, and produce technical documentation and system/subsystem specifications.Provide a direct interface and liaison with customers at all levels from quotation to final design and test activities, design reviews, and technical working group meetings to comply with requirements and specifications.Conduct site visits and investigate engineering problems, propose solutions and alternatives, and provide recommendations.Integrate designed components into function subsystems and engineering prototypes.Oversee, support, and participate in production of designed elements.Verify and comply with engineering documentation standards and test procedures.Support development of technical proposal and provide comments on the technical content and level of effort of the proposed scope of work.Supervisory Responsibilities:NoneNote: The duties and responsibilities described on this document are not necessarily a comprehensive list and additional tasks may be assigned to the employee from time to time; and the scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands.Required Skills/Abilities:Excellent communication, organization, scheduling, and analytical skills requiredExperience with leading and training small teamsExperience with modeling and simulation tool sets and softwareExperience in project management and familiarity with Agile methodologyExperience in producing analysis reports that detail requirements analysis, analysis of alternative, system mechanical design, and system integration and testExperience in risk analysis, risk management programs, and Risk Analysis ReportsExperience in providing engineering design analysis to identify problems that may affect a component, physical integration, or systems performance in the fieldExperience with CAD, FEA, and CFD software, MATLAB, SIMULINK, and/or Solid WorksDesired Skills/Abilities:Experience with aviation engine repair, especially heavy fuels enginesExperience with aviation cooling, airflow, and related disciplines.Experience with hybrid electric powerplantsExperience with composite layup processes and composite repairEducation, Experience and Certifications Required:Minimum:Bachelor’s Degree in engineering or related STEM discipline or A&P License5-10 years of relevant work experienceMust be a U.S citizen. Must possess or be able to obtain a Secret security clearancePreferred:Aviation Propulsion Test and Evaluation experience8+ years of experience in the field or related areaBachelor’s degree in mechanical engineeringPhysical Requirements:Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computerWhile primarily an office job, may require time at a manufacturing facility or other locationMust be able to lift up to 15 pounds at timesCONUS travel may be required from time to timeWhat We Offer:Teammates at Albers Aerospace receive a robust benefits package which includes medical, dental, and vision plans, matching 401k, 10 days of PTO the first year and 15 after that, 11 holidays, employer paid term life, AD&D, long and short-term disability, and education and certification reimbursement.Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with DisabilitiesAlbers Aerospace will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)Job Type: Full-timePay: $90,000.00 - $135,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Location: In person

Location: Atlanta, GA Office: Atlanta Department: Mechanical Engineering THRIVE is an award-winning, ISO 9001 certified end-to-end product development and innovation strategy firm. Our company is built on Informed Design — an empathy-driven, human-centered approach that helps us and our clients design, develop, and engineer products that have real meaning and experiences that people love. You can find our innovations positively impacting lives in homes, hospitals, and businesses around the world. This is why THRIVE continues to be a trusted advisor to some of the world’s most iconic brands, including AT&T, Amazon, Amgen, Becton Dickinson, Coca-Cola, Keurig, Hillrom, Intuitive Surgical, Johnson & Johnson, McDonald’s, Samsung, Wolf, and SC Johnson. Now, we’re looking to add even more talent to our awesome team! Hello, we’re THRIVE We’re a group of creative professionals raising the bar on Informed Design. We design human-centered brands, products, services, and experiences for leading companies around the world. Why should you work with us? 1) Your skills will be nurtured Every organization talks about development and evolving your career, but at THRIVE, it’s a part of the job description. We welcome your talent and your skills and want to give you the support and framework to nurture your abilities. We also want you to be able to do everything you’ve wanted to do, whether that’s something focused in design, branding, strategy, or something entirely separate. 2) Your skills will be used in a variety of ways Our clients come to us because they have a problem and they want THRIVE’s help solving it. The exciting and challenging part is that no problem is just alike, which means our team members — and hopefully you, if you decide to bring your talents to THRIVE — work on a variety of projects for a variety of clients. This keeps the work fresh and stimulates innovation. 3) You’ll be surrounded by talented, passionate people like you We’re growing fast, which also means that there’s lots of growth opportunities at THRIVE. But the other factor that helps our team members grow is the amount of sheer talent everyone is surrounded by on a day-to-day basis. In addition to top-tier talent, the other thing our team possesses is a serious passion for their work, which ultimately stems from a passion for designing a world that helps people thrive everywhere. If this is something you’re interested in doing, THRIVE might be the perfect place for you. Working at THRIVE is an engineer’s dream. You will learn more, grow faster, work with an excellent team and be appreciated for your contributions. If our requirements fit your background, we want to talk with you! RESPONSIBILITIESYou have technical and programmatic ownership of consulting engagements to deliver robust designs for innovative new products.You will be responsible for the product design from concept through pilot manufacture.You will be a key contributor in an interdisciplinary team, rapidly evaluating design feasibility to help clients select product architectures.SKILLS & ABILITIESExcellent communication skills.Some background working in smaller companies.Solid experience working with clients and suppliers.Experience with technical leadership of projects with 2-3 other contributors.Experience managing project deliverables (schedule/budget), including technical status updates and status reporting.Working knowledge of design using Injection Molded Plastics.Production plastics & tooling support experience.Solidworks CAD experience.Hands-on experience in shop/lab work.M.E, Analysis experience in one or more of the following areas:     Strength of materialsHeat transferTolerance analysisFEAShock and vibrationDesign for manufacturability (high/low volume) REQUIREMENTSBSME. MSME is a plus.2+ years consulting experience in a design, engineering, or product development consultancy.8+ years of technical design and project management, doing product and system design, not components.Broad based M.E. Design experience in 1 or more of the following markets: Consumer products, industrial products, Medical Devices.Mechanism Design experience. Cross-disciplinary electromechanical experience is a plus.Hands-on Project Management of at least 1 full product development cycle of high-volume tooled products, from concept through pilot production.Experience managing a team of other engineers is a plus. OTHER DETAILS This role must sit onsite in Atlanta, GA at THRIVE’s studio. Covid-19 vaccination required. THRIVE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER At THRIVE, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it! We believe difference and inclusion are critical to creating an innovative environment capable of delivering groundbreaking products, services, and experiences. All aspects of employment at THRIVE, including hiring, promoting, and disciplinary issues, are based on competence and the needs of the business. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

column7: PURPOSE OF THE JOB The Modeling Center of Excellence guides decisions within Owens Corning’s (OC) businesses by using virtual prototyping and simulation tools to influence new designs, increase safety, and reduce product and process development time and expense. Assistance is needed to support fluid, thermal and structural modeling activities in support of more sustainable glass melting and glass delivery processes. The Modeling & Simulation Engineer will lead projects that are using Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) and finite element analysis (FEA) software packages. Results will be reviewed and applied to design and operations efforts. Reports to: Leader Modeling Technology/ Manufacturing Innovations – Granville, OH Span of Control: Individual Contributor Granville, OH is home to the Owens Corning Science & Technology Center. The 524-acre campus with 22 buildings hosts world-class Science and Technology professionals dedicated to delivering sustainable solutions across our three integrated businesses, impacting the environment and the way people live around the world. With its small-town charm, streets lined with locally owned shops, historic district, and commitment to education and development, Granville will meet all your needs when you bring your career to Owens Corning. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Demonstrates a commitment to safety Implements a personal safety action plan. Ensures rigorous compliance to standard safety procedures and OC corporate policies. Lead modeling & simulation projects related to sustainable design and/or performance of melting, conditioning, and process equipment/assets (85%) Understand fundamental sciences of the processes. Construct geometries and generate high quality meshes for simulation purposes. Determine and collect relevant technical information required for modeling tasks. Leverage resources to efficiently prepare and process modeling data. Work with other modeling engineers and those responsible for capital projects, as well as those supporting manufacturing operations, to review and interpret simulation results, and make appropriate model adjustments accordingly. Develop fast and precise models using reduction techniques, link to data analytics, machine learning and controls of the processes of interest. Develop an understanding of manufacturing operations in order to develop improved simulation methods and/or identify new concepts for improving processes. Partner with cross functional resources and uses science fundamentals to translate process needs into actionable modeling insights for accelerated development Leverage external resources to accelerate learnings and advance our capabilities for fundamentals and solution development. Develop soft (or virtual) sensors, use reduced order models and plant data to enable model based predictive process control and real time optimization. Coordinate physical trials related to model validation. Effectively communicate results through reports and presentations. Effectively manage simulation data (15%) Utilize simulation data management methods to store, organize and share simulation data. Effectively compare, both qualitatively and quantitatively, simulation data to field and/or laboratory measurements/observations. Maintain appropriate property data. Follow the confidentiality policy on all modeling input and output data. JOB REQUIREMENTS MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: M.S. degree in Mechanical, Chemical, Materials Science Engineering, or closely related discipline. Strong background in fluid mechanics, thermal sciences and structural mechanics. Demonstrated capability in computational modeling such as CFD and/or FEA. Experience with simulation reduction techniques and their connection to controls and analytics is a plus. Ability to travel 10%. PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: Ph.D. degree in Mechanical, Chemical, Material Science Engineering, or closely related discipline. Five or more years’ experience in CFD modeling and the development of advanced modeling capabilities that drives process innovations Strong working knowledge of engineering design, industry safety standards, and integrated system design with the ability to apply to our manufacturing processes. Demonstrated experience in applying techniques that lead to foundational & data driven insights for solving problems KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: Has passion for sustainability and making a positive impact on our environment. Uses collaboration, teamwork, influence, and diplomacy to achieve the best results. Facilitates and motivates others who are not direct reports to accomplish tasks and improve processes and operations. LI-NM1LI-ONSITE About Owens Corning Owens Corning is a global building and construction materials leader committed to building a sustainable future through material innovation. Our three integrated businesses – Composites, Insulation, and Roofing – provide durable, sustainable, energy-efficient solutions that leverage our unique material science, manufacturing, and market knowledge to help our customers win and grow. We are global in scope, human in scale with approximately 19,000 employees in 31 countries dedicated to generating value for our customers and shareholders, and making a difference in the communities where we work and live. Founded in 1938 and based in Toledo, Ohio, USA, Owens Corning posted 2022 sales of $9.8 billion. For more information, visit www.owenscorning.com. Owens Corning is an equal opportunity employer.

You will learn more, grow faster, work with an excellent team and be appreciated for your contributions. If our requirements fit your background, we want to talk with you! RESPONSIBILITIESYou have technical and programmatic ownership of consulting engagements to deliver robust designs for innovative new products.You will be responsible for the product design from concept through pilot manufacture.You will be a key contributor in an interdisciplinary team, rapidly evaluating design feasibility to help clients select product architectures.SKILLS & ABILITIESExcellent communication skills.Some background working in smaller companies.Solid experience working with clients and suppliers.Experience with technical leadership of projects with 2-3 other contributors.Experience managing project deliverables (schedule/budget), including technical status updates and status reporting.Working knowledge of design using Injection Molded Plastics.Production plastics & tooling support experience.Solidworks CAD experience.Hands-on experience in shop/lab work.M.E, Analysis experience in one or more of the following areas:     Strength of materialsHeat transferTolerance analysisFEAShock and vibrationDesign for manufacturability (high/low volume) REQUIREMENTSBSME. MSME is a plus.2+ years consulting experience in a design, engineering, or product development consultancy.8+ years of technical design and project management, doing product and system design, not components.Broad based M.E. Design experience in 1 or more of the following markets: Consumer products, industrial products, Medical Devices.Mechanism Design experience. Cross-disciplinary electromechanical experience is a plus.Hands-on Project Management of at least 1 full product development cycle of high-volume tooled products, from concept through pilot production.Experience managing a team of other engineers is a plus. OTHER DETAILS This role must sit onsite in Atlanta, GA at THRIVE’s studio. Covid-19 vaccination required. THRIVE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER At THRIVE, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it! We believe difference and inclusion are critical to creating an innovative environment capable of delivering groundbreaking products, services, and experiences. All aspects of employment at THRIVE, including hiring, promoting, and disciplinary issues, are based on competence and the needs of the business. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

Holtec International, a turnkey supplier of technologies for the nuclear and fossil power industries, is seeking to add an experienced mechanical/civil/structural analyst to its Applied Mechanics Group with opportunities to contribute to Holtec’s first of a kind small modular reactor (SMR-160) design. The senior analyst would be called upon to analyze metallic, reinforced concrete and soil-subgrade supported structures. Typical analyses include: Static and dynamic finite element modeling and analyses (FEA) using ANSYS Drop and impact (e.g., missile and aircraft) analyses and target response using LS-DYNA Simulation of the seismic response of freestanding structures in air or submerged in water Static and dynamic analyses of large reinforced concrete structures Soil-structure interaction (SSI) analyses with freestanding and/or anchored structures Beam and plate stress calculations using established principles of strength of materials MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Applicant must possess a BS in mechanical/civil/structural engineering with a minimum of 7 years of experience. MS will count for 2 years of experience and Ph.D. will count for 4 years of experience (experience from MS and Ph.D. cannot be combined) Familiarity with standard industry and design codes/manuals such as ASME, ASCE, ACI and AISC Must possess excellent credentials in principles of solid mechanics Must possess excellent technical writing and communication skills DESIRED SKILLS Academic or industrial experience in the latest stress analysis codes such as ANSYS, LS-DYNA, STAAD.Pro and GT STRUDL Prior nuclear industry experience including interactions with NRC or other regulatory authorities  VQug228fLF

Job description Corvid Technologies is seeking experienced software developers with experience in structural dynamics and computational physics to join our development group in Mooresville, NC. This position will provide an opportunity for talented candidates to advance state-of-art technology that supports Corvid's endeavor to deliver timely and accurate engineering solutions to our customers. Representative Duties and Tasks: Lead and participate in the research, design, and development of Corvid's high-fidelity multi-physics modeling tools, which include but not limit to CFD, FEA, heat transfer, and fluid/structure interaction, etc. Collaborate with application engineers/customers, analyze real-world problems, and provide robust and fast turn-around solutions. Design, prototype, and implement advanced algorithms that can improve simulation speed and accuracy. Required Qualifications: M.S. or Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Applied Mathematics with dissertation requiring significant programming/algorithm development effort. Strong background in both Numerical Mathematics and Computer Science (algorithms, data structures, etc.). Related course works or previous experience are highly desired. 5 years of C++11 or later experience. Proficient in shell scripting languages. Direct experience in creating and implementing parallel/concurrent algorithms for high performance computing systems. Direct experience in implementing software systems for parallel explicit or implicit three-dimensional PDE solvers. Familiar with MPI and multithreading packages, such as CUDA, TBB, and OpenMP. Ability to write clear, elegant, and maintainable codes. Familiar with version control, continuous integration, and software testing tools. An open-minded team player with excellent oral and written communication skills. Desired Qualifications: Direct experience in optimizing algorithms for speed. Direct experience in building simulation system based upon MPI+X hybrid programming model for modern HPC systems. 10 years of C++11 or later experience. C++14/17 experience. Fortran 77/90/95/etc. experience. 5+ years of industry experience. US citizen or permanent resident. Why Corvid: Founded in 2004, we are a group of over 300 engineers and scientists, about 3/4 with master’ degrees or Ph.D.'s, that provide end-to-end solutions including concept development, design and optimization, prototype build, test and manufacture. We leverage the predictive capability of our high-fidelity computational physics solvers, indigenous massively parallel supercomputer system, prototyping plant, and ballistics and mechanics lab to investigate a variety of high-rate physics phenomena. The results are complex engineering solutions for a variety of applications; aircraft, ballistic missile defense, cybersecurity, motorsports, armor development, biological systems, and missile and warhead design and development. These results are achieved with optimal design and cost efficiency due to the predictive capability of Corvid’s tools and our in-house, end-to-end integrated approach, which differentiates Corvid from the market. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Benefits for full-time employees include: Paid gym membership       Flexible schedules            Blue Cross Blue Shield insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision            401k match up to 6.0%,            Three weeks starting PTO; increasing with tenure            Continued education and training opportunities      Uncapped incentive opportunities All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Stress Analysis Engineer: Sr Mechanical Analysis Engineer- Secret Clearance
column7: Quest Defense is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world's fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are part of a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility. We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers. As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we're eager to hear from you. The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek have the following characteristics and skills: Looking for your chance to join a growing and engaged engineering team in the aerospace field? Have you been waiting for a chance to apply your engineering know-how to come up with innovative solutions to complex problems? Quest Defense is looking for an experienced candidate to join our engineering team in order to continue our growth and to enhance our service offerings. If you like seeking out complex challenges to solve, and using the latest techniques to design new game-changing products, come and be a part of our team. What you will be doing: The successful candidate will draw upon their experience to aid in the design and analysis of gas turbine components using a mix of commercial tools and/or customer proprietary tools. Collaboration and a forward thinking approach are important to ensure we remain the supplier of choice for our customers. You will also be the face of QuEST to your customers. Through listening to customer challenges, and building on your previous experiences, you will find creative approaches that will solve their most difficult engineering problems.  Potential Job FunctionsUse computational tools to perform FEA analysis for gas turbine components and turbomachineryMentoring less experienced engineersGeometry and mesh preparationModel setup and analysisPost-process and prepare high-quality presentations of resultsDocument all work according to customer requirementsPrepare and present reports on findings Qualifications We're excited to talk to you if your qualifications meet the following criteria:  3-8 years of turbine gas-path design or FEA analysis experience in the gas turbine industryBS in Mechanical or Aerospace engineeringDemonstrated ability to meet deadlines, work under time constraints, maintain composure and handle multiple tasks simultaneouslyExperience with ANSYS Classic and Workbench strongly preferredExperience with part ownership and design cycle preferredExperience with stress, life estimation, creep, and vibration FEA analysis techniques requiredProficiency with MS Office, particularly MS Excel requiredStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environmentLike to work in a fast paced, creative environmentEnjoy people and dynamic teams with diverse experiences. We have fun together!US Citizen   Location: Cincinnati, Ohio   Travel: Less than 10%   Compensation type: Competitive wages. Position also qualifies for benefits including medical insurance, dental insurance, disability, life insurance, 401(K), tuition reimbursement, and paid time off.   Reports to: Team Leader  Quest Defense provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Join our growth team at Bray International, leader in flow control worldwide. Bring your engineering and industry experience to a reward career. Apply today. R10017403 Sr Systems Engineering Manager (Open)    Location:  Cheshire, CT (ASG) - Management    How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?  The Sr Systems Engineering Manager, Advanced Technologies & Services, hereafter referred to as “SEM AT&S”' is responsible for Driving the development, prototype fabrication and lifecycle management of our automated systems which differentiate Airgas as the US leader in Bulk, Package, and Specialty Gases. SEM AT&S will recruit, develop and manage day to day activities of a diverse group of 20+ multidisciplinary engineers and technicians with world-class talent. SEM AT&S will lead this high performance research and development team, focused on innovating and delivering solutions to Airgas and its customers with relentless execution. SEM AT&S will have a proven track record of developing complex automated industry leading systems, and services. SEM AT&S will Sustain a culture of: Safety, passion, hard-work, innovation and accountability that will continue to make Airgas the place to be for top talent interested in developing and delivering Advanced Automated Systems & Services      Safety: Unwavering commitment to ensuring our systems are developed with safety as 1st priority. Ensure robust engineering process is in place and adhered to: ie: applicable internal / external Codes, Standards, regulations, Hazops, DOE’s, SOP’s etc.        Accountability: Personally owns / administers critical documents ie: Project Plans, Hazops, DOE’s etc        Talent: Attract, develop, motivate, retain and lead top talent for the following technical disciplines:        Software, Electrical, Chemical, Mechanical Engineering, Analytical Chemistry, Robotics, Vision Systems, Controls, etc        Develop and oversee associate career progression and mentorship programs        Develop & Execute detailed project plans with sufficient functional decomposition to facilitate accurate estimates and execution.        Ensure projects are completed on time and within budget, proposing any adjustments etc in a timely manner.        Develop and maintain an extensive network and solid working relationship with functional leaders in the following departments / roles across Airgas & AL        Ability to evaluate potential projects at a high level based on deep understanding of the team's capabilities. Capture requirements and make appropriate recommendations / proposals to VP / Customer        Evaluate and protect Intellectual Property (IP) , working with legal department, and engineering teams, as required, to write/submit patentable inventions.        Manage internal / external research collaborations        Strategic Negotiations: Critical parts for systems, devices and operations, OEMs, Telecom, etc        Purchasing: Oversee large cycles with spend of $10MM +        Inventory: Responsible for tight control of ~ $5MM of critical parts.        Work with Quality and Regulatory Teams to ensure products are developed and validated in a manner that complies with applicable local and global regulatory requirements        Develops and maintains critical relationships with consultants and vendors.        Support Marketing developing and maintaining a strong product pipeline of systems, devices or services that differentiate Airgas and provide competitive advantage for the company.      ________________________    Are you a MATCH?    The Sr. Systems Engineering Manager will possess strong technical & practical knowledge of the extensive array of systems fielded and supported by his group. The SEM AT&S will have a demonstrable history of successfully managing multidisciplinary engineering teams in the development of complex automated systems and associated services and support.    It is critical the SEM can contribute technically in the projects in addition to managerial responsibilities.      Advanced Technical Degree, SE,ME, CE, Physics etc. In lieu of degree requirement, may accept an equivalent level of education and / or experience.        Minimum of 15 years of experience in progressive research and product development leadership roles within US or global companies that develop, manufacture and support complex automated systems handling volatile processes ie: high pressure, high voltage, flammable, toxic and corrosive gasses or liquids etc.        Experience managing and knowledge of the following areas highly desirable:   Mechanical / Chemical Engineering / PhysicsElectronicsAdvanced analytical instrumentation: ie: Mass Spectroscopy, FTIR etcIO/ PLC control systems & methodologiesRobotics and vision systemsFEA, CFD, HazopsAdvanced fabrication: CNC, Orbital Welding   _________________________    Your differences enhance our performance    At Airgas, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.    We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, disability or any other protected characteristic. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.    _________________________    Equal Employment Opportunity Information  We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.    Please click      here   to view the EEO Know Your Rights poster and      here   to view the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination poster. Job Description  Sr. Engineer: New Product Development will support concept to commercialization of a new enteral feeding electromechanical device(s) in the Digestive Health Business Unit. You will work with Marketing and cross functional team(s) to convert user needs into feasible solutions leading to commercialization of medical device(s). Along with participating in large projects as a SME on a sub-system, it is expected that this role will be able to also lead small NPD projects and technology development projects. Primary duties include assessing engineering requirements from user needs, component(s) selection, planning product design, developing test system(s), prototyping, verification and reliability test planning and execution. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Provide tactical platform level technical leadership for developing electro-mechanical medical devices. Drive product development and design control activities from concept to commercialization via Avanos’ stage-gate process. Leverage electro-mechanical expertise to develop specifications for selection of DC motors, gear housing, and sensors to meet system performance and reliability. Create testing platforms and methods to evaluate system performance, screen components, and develop control algorithm paradigms. Present and discuss technical concepts, tradeoffs, analyses, cost, and performance estimates and steer the product development team with data driven decisions. Apply a working knowledge of materials used in medical device applications. Conduct and timely document technical design reviews. Assist in designing for manufacturability, serviceability and developing assembly and tooling strategies for components. Guide integration of electrical, mechanical, and software subsystems for new products and features, and lead verification activities through proper test planning, execution, and reporting. Assist in compiling customer requirements and product specifications. Assist in creating a Hazard and Safety/DFMEA analysis. Qualifications  Required: BS in Mechanical, Electrical, or Biomedical Engineering, or equivalent. Expert in Solidworks 3D modeling design for moving/rotating parts. Proficient in sensor/actuator GPIOs, integrating them into open bed systems and configuring them for system performance. Working knowledge of LabVIEW / automated test systems. Preferred: Solidworks CSWE and/or CSWP certification. Expertise in LabView and Arduino open-source electronics prototyping platforms and statistical software like Minitab and SAS-JMP. Knowledge EMC/EMI compliance to meet IEC60601 standard(s). 3D surfacing, and sheet metal expertise. Six Sigma Green Belt certification. Certification in engineering analysis including tolerance analysis, GD&T, FEA. 7+ years of product development experience as mechanical design engineer with 3 years in a lead role for electro-mechanical capital equipment. Class I and class II medical device experience is desired. Ability to work with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

as specifications that meet the requirements of the product performance and program charter.Create and verify the accuracy and consistency of engineering drawings and CAD/CAE models in accordance with facilities to develop product designs jointly, promote consistent design practices, and check global design project elements to ensure the project’s design intent.Perform as team leader and peer mentor to facilitate the development and advancement of the engineering group.Required Education, Experience & Skills:Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent combination of education and Sponsorship will not be provided for this rolePreferred Education, Experience & Skills:Seven plus years relevant experienceFEA, CFD or other analysis.Proven track record of innovative and patentable ideasKnowledge of common manufacturing processes and techniques used to produce high volume production componentsKnowledge of common processes used in producing prototype components and fixturesKnowledge and experience within HVAC Industry.Experience using Teamcenter database softwareFlexible Work Schedule – Remote Work Option and Core HoursThis role has the flexibility of a remote work option up to two days a week and a core hour schedule. You can choose to flex your start and stop times given you are working during the core hours of 9:00am - 3:00pm. Our teams work together to ensure our chosen work schedules enable our creativity and productivity as we serve the needs of our customers.”Job Type: Full-timePay: $75,000.00 - $105,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programEmployee discountFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveProfessional development assistanceReferral programRelocation assistanceRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceExperience level:5 yearsSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: In person

Pivotal is the leader in the emerging market of electric Vertical Takeoff and Landing (eVTOL) aircraft. We design, develop, and manufacture light eVTOL aircraft and are renowned for the BlackFly, the first light eVTOL to fly manned missions and enter the consumer market.  Efficient, compact, and simple, Pivotal vehicles are designed for a wide range of consumer, public service, and defense applications. Our distinctive tilt-aircraft architecture and scalable platform have been in development, preparing to enter the market for over 10 years. We recently announced our next-generation aircraft, the Helix, planned for general release and scalable production in January 2024.  Mobility is one of the most highly-valued areas of technology investment today. This is the right company, in the right space, the right strategy, at the right time. We invite you to join our amazing team and grow with us.  The Aeromechanical team at Pivotal is seeking a highly experienced and motivated senior composite design engineer to join our team. In this position you will serve as the subject matter expert for all composite design, development and optimization of our aircrafts. Responsibilities Serve as the go-to expert in composite part design within the Aeromechanical Team, providing technical guidance, expertise, and mentorship to ensure the successful integration of composite components into our eVTOL aircraft Lead the design and development of composite structures, from concept to detailed design, utilizing advanced composite materials and manufacturing processes to achieve lightweight, high-strength, and aerodynamically optimized components Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to develop innovative composite solutions that meet performance requirements while adhering to weight, cost, and manufacturing constraints Conduct feasibility studies and perform design analyses to evaluate composite solutions, including stress analysis, laminate optimization, and failure mode analysis, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements Utilize CAD and simulation tools to create detailed composite part designs, generate manufacturing drawings, and validate structural integrity Collaborate with suppliers and external partners to source composite materials, define material specifications, and oversee the manufacturing processes, ensuring quality, consistency, and timely delivery Support the testing and validation of composite structures, analyzing test data and implementing design modifications as necessary to enhance performance, durability, and safety Stay up-to-date with advancements in composite materials, manufacturing techniques, and industry trends, and apply this knowledge to drive continuous improvement and innovation within the composite engineering field Participate in the development and refinement of design standards, best practices, and documentation related to composite engineering, ensuring consistent and efficient processes across the organization Qualifications Bachelor's or advanced degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field Extensive experience (5+ years) in composite part design, preferably within the aerospace industry Strong knowledge of composite materials, including carbon fiber, fiberglass, and associated manufacturing techniques, such as autoclave curing, resin infusion, and filament winding Proficiency in CAD software, such as CATIA, with expertise in composite design tools and plugins Experience with composite structural analysis and simulation tools, such as FEA and laminate optimization software Familiarity with aviation regulations and certification processes, such as FAA or EASA, relating to composite structures is preferred Demonstrated expertise in composite engineering principles, including laminate theory, failure analysis, and damage tolerance Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically, analyze complex issues, and develop innovative solutions Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively collaborate and present technical information to diverse stakeholders Bonus Qualifications Experience with eVTOL or other electric aircraft Master's degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent field Personal Attributes Passion for aviation and technology Strong sense of ownership and accountability Willingness to take on challenging projects and push boundaries Strong work ethic and ability to work in a fast-paced environment Salary Range The salary range for this role is reflected in Pivotal's Pay Structure - Pay Bands (PB) 13-15.   Applicants must be eligible for employment in the United States and willing to work onsite at our HQ office in Palo Alto, CA.  Pivotal offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and 401k plans.  Pivotal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Pivotal does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

modeling, equipment layout, design and analysis on new technology concepts relative to generator sets, well stimulation/drilling machinery and specialty off-road vehicles, including systems,
