About Mertz ManufacturingMertz Manufacturing, Inc., founded in 1927 in Ponca City, OK, designs and builds a wide range of custom steel fabricated products. The majority of our products are custom designed trailers to serve as the mobile platform for our customers’ specialized equipment, typically used in the Oil & Gas industry. We also build stationary structures to house or transport equipment. Very often, our products involve complicated electronics and hydraulics to achieve the results our customers require.All of our products are custom designed and built to our customers’ exacting specifications for the quantities and delivery times the customer requires. Frequently, customers approach Mertz with an idea for a product to fill a unique business need with little more than a sketch to work from. Mertz has consistently been able to work with our customers to find unique and affordable solutions to their complex problems. Mertz’ ability to take a customer idea from inception through design, prototyping, and final production with the highest commitment to quality and safety have earned our customers’ trust.Just under half of our workforce consists of welders followed by almost equal numbers of painters, machinists, assembly mechanics, and steel cutting and forming workers. We also have a design team and other support functions that provide essential services such as purchasing, quality control, inventory, and IT.The Senior Mechanical Engineer reports to the Engineering Manager.Duties and ResponsibilitiesPerform Static FEA for trailers, skids, lifting devices and seismic equipmentPerform Dynamic FEA for trailers and skidsPerform engineering calculations for a variety of applicationsDesign hydraulic, brake, lighting, steering, and pneumatic systemsOversee and review designs of other engineers and designersManage engineering and design projects from conception through productionResearch DOT regulations and verify designs conformCreate models and shop drawings to customer specificationsBe able to design models and shop drawings for tooling and fixturesBe able to create hydraulic, electrical, and pneumatic schematicsCreate product specifications through testingCreate ETRs (Engineering Test Reports) for various products, materials, and component testingPosition QualificationsHave a solid understanding and working knowledge of:Various axles, suspensions, landing gear and kingpins availableDOT requirements for all statesFMVSS rules and regulationsMathcad3D Modeling:Creo/ProECreo Simulate (Mechanica) for FEA workSolidworks is a plusMaterial Properties: Carbon Steel, Aluminum, StainlessWeld strength and qualityBills of Material (BOM)Engineering Calculations using conventional methodsProblem SolvingMS PowerPoint and ExcelProject ManagementCWI (Certified Welding Inspector) Certification is a plusOther RequirementsHave at least ten (10) years design and fabrication experience in large, industrial steel trailer manufacturing, including but not limited to: coiled tubing, frac, nitrogen doubler pumpers, and hydration units for oil and gas industryA pre-employment drug screen and background check are required after receipt of a conditional employment offer. Candidates must be at least 18 years of age to apply.Benefits OfferedComprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Life, and Vision insurance with competitive rates.Employer 401K plan with company matchAnnual vacation and sick time per company scheduleJob Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceExperience level:10 yearsAbility to commute/relocate:Ponca City, OK 74601: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)Application Question(s):Engineering discipline: MechanicalEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Design & Fab in industrial steel trailer manufacturing: 10 years (Required)Work Location: In person

Date Posted: 2022-08-31-07:00  Country: United States of America  Location: RC1: United Tech Research Center 411 Silver Lane, East Hartford, CT, 06108 USA  Position Role Type: Hybrid  The following position is to join our Corporate Research Center Team: Raytheon Technologies Corporation Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Arlington, VA. To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued, and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors, and communities to succeed. Senior Engineer – Thermodynamic Systems Raytheon Technologies Research Center (RTRC) develops new technologies that enable the most innovative products in the world. Our researchers serve as expert technical consultants to Raytheon Technologies (RTX) businesses, lead government-sponsored research programs, and pursue their own creative ideas. From advanced mission systems for our warfighters to next-generation green propulsion, we combine innovation with product application to shape the future of technology. The next generation of products demand that we cross traditional boundaries. If you enjoy leveraging your technical expertise in thermodynamic system and heat transfer analysis to work across disciplines, our Thermodynamic Systems Team needs your skills. Our Senior Engineer position demands strong engineering fundamentals, expertise in analytical and numerical physics-based modeling, and the ability to select appropriate modeling fidelity for a given problem. On our team, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to the following areas: Modeling and analysis of novel thermodynamic systems for power generation, waste heat recovery, and cooling Development of exploration methods for combinatorial architectural design spaces across aerospace and defense system domains Application of machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to enable system design Implementation of novel optimization and uncertainty quantification methods Control co-design approaches Power and cooling system build and test Operations analysis and commercial product utilization simulations RTRC was founded by some of the world’s greatest inventors. We helped build the Second Industrial Revolution and brought about a century of urbanization and globalization. Come help us build the next one. Basic Qualifications: Demonstrated experience in heat transfer and thermodynamic systems design Analytic modeling and programming skills in common languages General understanding of FEA and CFD modeling Demonstrated experience in publishing and presenting research Excitement about working across domains and disciplines Permanent Resident or U.S. Citizen required Preferred Qualifications: Adaptability and the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment Excellent communication skills, informal and formal presentation skills, and ability to foster positive relationships with internal and external partners Ability to manage uncertain requirements, formulate a problem from ill-defined needs, develop approaches to solve problems, and recognize when additional subject matter expertise is needed Experience developing externally funded programs with relevance to a particular research agenda Familiarity with operations analysis Education Requirements: Master's Degree or Ph.D. in Mechanical, Aerospace, Chemical, or Nuclear Engineering required Ph.D. candidates with no formal experience will be considered M.S. candidates must have 1+ year of experience in a relevant work environment Location: This position is located in East Hartford, CT and is a hybrid role (expected to be on-site 2-5 days/week) Relocation is offered for this position Work Authorization: US Citizen or Permanent Resident Required Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Stress Analysis Engineer: Structures, Interior and Passenger System IPT Lead
column7: Mountain View, CADepartments – Aircraft Development /Full Time/ Hybrid  At Wisk, we're transforming the future of urban mobility through safe, all-electric, autonomous flight. We are a passionate team working together toward a sustainable future, solving high-impact problems that have never been solved before. By delivering everyday flight for everyone, we're making it possible to spend less time getting there and more time being there. If you want to be part of shaping the future of mobility, then read on! The Structures, Interior and Passenger System IPT Lead will be in charge of a team of engineers responsible for the aircraft structural configuration, detailed design, structural FEA including stress and stiffness modeling, requirement development, trade studies, simulation and modeling, integration, manufacturing, test, and certification of the aircraft structure as well as the design and integration of the aircraft interior, lights and passenger systems. The aircraft structure consists of fuselage, wings, booms, control surfaces, landing gear, windows, fairings, and other structural components. The Structures, Interior and Passenger System IPT Lead will coordinate closely with the IPT Leads who will be developing the systems that comprise the aircraft, along with the Aircraft IPTL, the Aircraft Chief Engineer, and the other IPT leaders.        The IPT Lead will utilize their business and technical acumen to drive program/technical decisions and objectives. They are responsible for planning and coordinating the resources required to execute the project and assigning responsibility to activities. The IPT Lead will also be responsible for the generation and review of the schedule, comparing actual results to a baseline plan and assessing project performance, conducting risk management, supporting gate reviews, facilitating peer reviews of all work products produced by the team and identifying root cause and corrective actions to improve project execution.    Responsibilities: Has authority and accountability for technical scope, schedule, and cost Primary point of contact for the technical, cost, risk/opportunity, and schedule performance of the specific development effort Engage with other IPT Leads, Chief Engineers, and leadership to promote successful program planning and execution Frequent collaboration with multiple functions (e.g., certification, systems and safety engineering, manufacturing, flight test, etc) and the program office Leads technical development efforts related to the concept, architecture, design, development, integration, validation, performance assessment, risk management, and flight test Monitor engineering performance and ensuring that issues are addressed immediately and corrective actions and recovery plans are implemented expeditiously Develop and mentor direct reports and other members of the organization Plan and coordinate activities to support verification and validation, including oversight of designing test fixtures, authoring test plans and associated reports Coordinate the engineering review, approval and release processes Support multidisciplinary program reviews and presentations throughout the different phases of development, certification, and production readiness with internal and external stakeholders Required: Bachelor’s degree in engineering or STEM field 20+ years of experience in engineering development and leadership with responsibility for project scheduling and management 10+ years of experience in leading a multi-functional, technically oriented, Integrated Product Team 10+ years experience with airplane or helicopter certification Experience with all phases of the development life-cycle including planning, conceptual design, requirements definition, preliminary design, prototyping, test and evaluation, detailed design, integration, formal verification, entry to production, etc. Knowledge of 14 CFR 23 subpart C. Experience in the design and FAA certification of composite airframe structures with knowledge of associated FAA regulations and guidance material and industry standards Familiar with CAD software such as NX, Solidworks, CATIA, etc. Strong engineering analytical and technical writing skills with demonstrated experience authoring formal analysis reports and supporting design reviews Effective communication & interpersonal skills with ability to present data and explain results to leadership, subordinates & peers Experience performing cost and schedule management Experience with risk, issues, and/or opportunity management Expertise in project management tools such as Microsoft Project, Confluence, and/or JIRA Strong decision making abilities Desired: Proficient with commercial FEA software (e.g. NASTRAN) and methods (modeling techniques, failure criteria, etc.), specifically for analyzing composite structures Successfully helped organizations transition from the R&D stage to a product delivery and execution mode Experience with the design of safety-critical high and low voltage voltage power distribution topologies Experience developing complex operational systems using System Engineering processes and methods, including architecture development, systems integration, requirements development, validation, verification, etc. Able to effectively manage multiple tasks and priorities Experience mentoring junior engineers and promoting two-way communication Strong understanding of engineering fundamentals Knowledge of systems engineering and systems safety analyses and processes PMI Program Management Professional (PMP) certification     $222,311 - $255,530 a year    Compensation and Benefits:     In addition to offering a great work environment and the opportunity to be part of the team making electric autonomous flight a reality, at Wisk, we offer excellent total rewards which include a competitive base salary, annual bonus, long term incentive, 401K, health benefits and much more.    Job Type: Full-time        Pay Range the Company expects to pay:     $222,311 - $255,530     per year - The starting base salary within this range for this role varies based on factors such as your geographical location, and your relevant job-related experience that is consistent with a business necessity.        We are located in Mountain View just a couple of hundred feet from Shoreline Lake and its surrounding walking/jogging trails. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision and life insurance, alternative work schedule (9/80), flexible time off, 11 company holidays, a 401(k) plan with 50% company matching vested immediately, commuter assistance, and education assistance. And on top of all that, we also offer a variety of perks such as free catered lunches, flight lessons, wellness allowances, snacks, drinks, fruit, employee referral bonus, charitable giving match, patent bonus program, happy hours and much more.    Wisk Aero provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Wisk Aero abides by applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.    Wisk Aero is an E-Verify employer.

Country: United States of America  Location: CAI23: Carrier-Indianapolis, IN 7310 W Morris St, Indianapolis, IN, 46231 USA  Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe and sustainable building and cold chain solutions with a world-class, diverse workforce with business segments covering HVAC, refrigeration, and fire and security. We make modern life possible by delivering safer, smarter and more sustainable services that make a difference to people and our planet while revolutionizing industry trends. This is why we come to work every day. Join us and we can make a difference together. ABOUT THE ROLE: The sound & vibration (S&V) engineer will be responsible for implementing sound & vibration control treatment in product design and testing, lead S&V system/component testing in a Sound chamber and in Quiet rooms, develop high quality standard work documents, be engaged in agreed terms of requirements, quality review boards, technical review boards, design input to RES engineers for prototype engineering check sample/manufacturing check sample/Pilot stages and assist Quality group in resolving field issues related to sound and vibration. The S&V engineer will work closely with product development teams and component suppliers to develop robust S&V design and lab test procedures to achieve reliable and better sound quality products. The S&V engineer will work closely with S&V team to develop advanced sound and vibration technology (S&V control, testing and analysis) and oversee its implementation in the S&V lab. Candidate should have strong analytical and experimental skills in acoustic and vibration measurement, modeling, and analysis. Position involves work ranging from early concept studies to implementation of production sound and vibration treatment. Candidate should be creative and flexible, with the ability to work on problems ranging from analytical modeling to experimental testing and S&V facility design. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Complete discrete S&V tasks to meet platform design and project objectives. Apply expert knowledge of Mechanical and Sound & Vibration engineering. May manage moderately sized projects or processes. Support subject-matter experts within S&V and MBD (FEA & Vibro-Acoustic modeling) discipline. Making moderate to significant improvements of processes, systems, or products to enhance performance of S&V and related FEA modeling workflows. Active participation in S&V system modeling innovation and integration projects Develop sound and vibration (S&V) control solutions using analytical and experimental methods including: Plan, design and coordinate test facilities /setups for sound and vibration measurement. Plan and/or conduct experimental testing and carry out data analysis and reporting. Generate written technical proposals and summary reports. Identify solutions to S&V problems by working with product engineers. Implement sound and vibration control in Residential HVAC products. Conduct sound & vibration testing, analysis, and sound rating of residential heating air conditioning products in three broad areas: AHRI and internal standards using conventional reverberation room measurement and open area survey techniques, S&V qualification of HVAC products, R&D investigations, and some analytical modeling and vibro-acoustic simulation Sound Quality assessment of RES HVAC products in Indy SV Labs & at field sites (including physical and /or digital sound jury’s). Support & conduct correlation testing to validate Vibro-Acoustic & Structural MBD (Model-based Development) FEA Structural Dynamics and Vibro-Acoustic Models Develop high quality standard work procedures for new, novel, and improved sound and vibration techniques. Provide product engineers with sound and vibration test support and S&V control solutions and design recommendations to improve product sound and vibration performance while meeting both internal and external AHRI standards for sound, vibration, and robustness. Train and mentor, the sound & vibration lab technicians in learning and implementing new S&V lab test and measurement techniques BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Master’s degree with 7+ years in Vibration and Acoustic testing & Vibro-Acoustic Modeling experience. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: PhD in Mechanical/Aerospace Engineering Strong fundamentals or course work in acoustics, vibration, vibro-acoustic modeling, structural dynamics, and digital signal processing Proficient in S&V experimental methods, instrumentation, and measurement systems Experience in Experimental Modal Analysis (EMA) and Operational Deflection Shape (ODS) analysis Experience in application of both TPA (Transfer path analysis) and Blocked Force determination Understanding of HVAC residential compressor mounting techniques and ability to experimentally determine and numerically predict compressor resonance considering rubber grommets. Understanding of HVAC residential air management system working principles as well as testing and simulation to determine its vibration characteristics. Experience in noise and vibration control and noise reduction techniques Demonstrated application of SPR (source-path-receiver) mapping techniques to solve noise and vibration problems (e.g., noise source identification, noise & vibration path analysis) using both test diagnostics and FEM simulation methods. Experience in Linear and nonlinear FEA of hyper-elastic materials (e.g., rubber grommets) sub-systems Ability to program data acquisition systems for S&V testing. e.g., Siemens TestLab and HBK Pulse/BK Connect. Experience in post-processing methodologies and techniques used in S&V test data analysis. Experience with organizing test sequences and keeping customers informed of schedule and progress to schedule. Proficient utilization of HEAD Acoustics binaural headsets, along with the adept application of sound quality metrics and methodologies Experience in Sound Quality analysis (e.g., using Artemis software) A working knowledge digital signal processing (DSP) and FFT analysis needed for sound & vibration test measurements and data analysis. Demonstrated expertise in FEA concepts encompassing structural static, harmonic and transient vibrations, linear and non-linear explicit analyses. Demonstrates expertise in model validation, mesh convergence, and reconciling modeling with physical testing. Demonstrated mastery in FEA & Vibro-Acoustic software applications (e.g., Simcenter 3D, ACTRAN and/or ANSYS) Experience with application of FEM and BEM simulation techniques applied to residential HVAC systems & sub-systems for simulation of noise radiation. Proficient in coding using MATLAB and Python programming platforms. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing with diverse audiences including cross functional team members, senior leaders, global suppliers, and external customers including service managers and technicians. Experience working in a team environment. Excellent communication skills (written and oral) Self-starter with ability to learn quickly. Organized with strong attention to detail. Familiarity with HVAC equipment and systems used in Residential Applications #LI-onsite RSRCAR Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Overview:     Mid-Level Plant Services Practice Mechanical Engineer (Petro-Chemical)  Stress Engineering Services, Inc. is the premier provider of engineered solutions and professional    consulting services across a wide range of engineering disciplines. Since 1972, our clients have    benefited from our special in-depth technical knowledge and proven performance in failure    analysis, solid mechanics and structural design, reliability and predictive engineering,    instrumentation and testing, heat transfer, fluid mechanics, floating systems, forensics, and    material science. We maintain an excellent reputation within the industries we serve, with more    than 80% of our current business from repeat clients or direct referrals.   We are seeking a mid-level engineer for our Plant Services Practice (PSP) in our Houston or    Cincinnati office. PSP primarily serves the petrochemical and energy industries; but our engineers    may also work in other related fields such as aerospace, defense, manufacturing, and material    processing. The successful applicant will work in multidisciplinary teams solving challenging    problems including component design/analysis, integrity assessments, failure analysis, repair    solutions and remediation. A strong balance of technical, interpersonal, and communication skills   (both written and verbal) are required.  Responsibilities:     The successful candidate must have the desire to build a successful engineering practice in a    dynamic, work-orientated environment. They must be a self-starter. They will work primarily on    an individual basis, but also need to function well on project teams. Mentoring and developing    engineers with less experience should be a priority. Additional responsibilities are:  Application and review of API 579 Level 1, 2 and 3 assessmentsStress Analysis and mechanical design of various components, including pressure vessels, piping systems and mechanical parts  Carrying out stress analysis using computational and classical methods as well as relating these analyses with instrumentation and strain gauge data  Strong proficiency in FEA software Abaqus/ANSYS (required)Field visits to client facilities to examine client-identified problems and to support business development  Preparation and review of technical reports and proposalsContributing to the growth of the company by further establishing credibility through participation in technical associations and code committees, and    preparation of papers/presentations  Key focus on refining, chemical, oil sands, pipeline, plant equipment and other larger engineering consulting opportunities  Qualifications:  Masters or Ph.D. Degree in Mechanical Engineering from an accredited university (the advanced degree requirement can be waived if the applicant has 10+ years of relevant   plant experience) A minimum of 7 years’ experience as a practicing engineer is requiredExperience at a major oil company or consulting firm working in refineries or chemical plants is preferred Registered Professional Engineer (P.E.) or possess the ability to become registeredKnowledge and experience with API 510, 570, 579, 580 and 653, NACE, ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Codes; NDE methods is preferred Must be willing and able to travel on occasion and work in a variety of environmentsTravel could be worldwide and the applicant must have or be able to obtain a passport without restrictions

Third Pole is on a mission to expand the lifesaving benefits of Nitric Oxide inhalation therapy, making it accessible to millions of respiratory challenged newborns and adults around the world. This is a rare opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing team, making a huge social impact, touching the lives of those we love and care about most. We are a fast-paced startup developing a game-changing technology that generates Nitric Oxide on demand, at the patient location, from the air we breathe. Company Generac Power Systems  Name Senior Staff Engineer-High Voltage Battery  Req # 63413  Employment Type Full Time  Shift 1st  Generac Power Systems – We are seeking an experienced battery engineer to join the Generac Core battery technology team and contribute to our continued growth and transformation as a leading energy technologies provider! You will apply your engineering expertise to create and deliver better energy solutions to our customers. This position is based in Headquarters in Waukesha, WI co-located with a world-class R&D lab infrastructure.  The Sr. Staff Engineer – High Voltage Battery Packs will lead development projects and core technology projects with an emphasis on stationary storage applications having medium-to-high production volumes. The successful candidate will conceptualize and develop battery architectures, design battery module, battery pack, and bms hardware, and drive validation testing of designs.  As a technical leader, you will work with product line partners to ensure delivery of class-leading energy storage products. Highly qualified candidates possessing extensive battery design experience may be considered for a principal engineer role. This position reports to the Director of Core Energy Storage Technology. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Lead battery pack and battery subsystem development projects; perform as a technical team leader as well as an individual contributor depending on the project need Drive the development of design tools and lab activities to support requirements development and architecture decisions; ensure decisions are supported by rigorous first-principles analyses. Design and specify battery pack components including battery cells, power collectors, thermal management components & materials, high voltage insulation systems & materials, bms solutions, protection and safety hardware, etc. Drive excellence in the design review, approval, and release process; work with team members as an effective technical leader to consistently plan and close-out open issues. Identify & manage key project risks attentively; effectively communicate mitigation plans to technical & non-technical stakeholders at multiple levels of the organization. Help foster an environment of innovation and an open exchange of ideas, including improved processes; collaborate with others to vet and implement them. Develop and support validation testing; support manufacturing partners in the development of routine testing methods/systems. Work with business partners, product engineering peers, and battery team members to assess new product concepts, develop intellectual property, and enhance Core technology roadmaps. Serve the organization as a technical expert, mentor and coach less experienced engineers and share know-how with internal business partners in the field of energy storage. Support technical documentation; invest necessary time to guide & support release documentation cycles. Minimal Qualifications: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, or equivalent degree. Minimum 10 years of relevant work experience or advanced degree equivalency.  Preferred Qualifications Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or an equivalent relevant degree. 5 years of industry experience directly responsible for the engineering of advanced energy storage systems, battery packs, and/or key subsystems. Proficient grasp of technology including battery cells and high power, high voltage battery packs at ~400V+, and associated control and protection methods. Strong understanding of battery system component reliability & reliability test/validation principles. Strong decision-making skills and the ability to navigate high-complexity engineering problems. Demonstrated ability to follow-through on work assignments, while collaborating effectively in a team environment. Strong creative engineering acumen with the ability to clearly explain ideas. Proficiency with modeling simulation platforms including Matlab/Simulink; ability to perform FEA analyses in Ansys, thermal, mechanical, etc is considered a plus. Solid technical business acumen, ability to identify key issues and communicate effectively in a business environment. Good familiarity with power electronics and charging hardware and controls. Experience with battery safety standards (UL or similar), and test standards to meet agency compliance such as UL, CSA, NEC, CE, FCC, NFPA and EPA Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion, the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job include are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel.  “We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”

THRIVE is an award-winning, ISO 9001 certified end-to-end product development and innovation strategy firm. Our company is built on Informed Design — an empathy-driven, human-centered approach that helps us and our clients design, develop, and engineer products that have real meaning and experiences that people love. You can find our innovations positively impacting lives in homes, hospitals, and businesses around the world. This is why THRIVE continues to be a trusted advisor to some of the world's most iconic brands, including AT&T, Amazon, Amgen, Becton Dickinson, Coca-Cola, Keurig, Hillrom, Intuitive Surgical, Johnson & Johnson, McDonald's, Samsung, Wolf, and SC Johnson. Now, we're looking to add even more talent to our awesome team! Hello, we're THRIVE We're a group of creative professionals raising the bar on Informed Design. We design human-centered brands, products, services, and experiences for leading companies around the world. Why should you work with us? 1) Your skills will be nurtured Every organization talks about development and evolving your career, but at THRIVE, it's a part of the job description. We welcome your talent and your skills and want to give you the support and framework to nurture your abilities. We also want you to be able to do everything you've wanted to do, whether that's something focused in design, branding, strategy, or something entirely separate. 2) Your skills will be used in a variety of ways Our clients come to us because they have a problem and they want THRIVE's help solving it. The exciting and challenging part is that no problem is just alike, which means our team members — and hopefully you, if you decide to bring your talents to THRIVE — work on a variety of projects for a variety of clients. This keeps the work fresh and stimulates innovation. 3) You'll be surrounded by talented, passionate people like you We're growing fast, which also means that there's lots of growth opportunities at THRIVE. But the other factor that helps our team members grow is the amount of sheer talent everyone is surrounded by on a day-to-day basis. In addition to top-tier talent, the other thing our team possesses is a serious passion for their work, which ultimately stems from a passion for designing a world that helps people thrive everywhere. If this is something you're interested in doing, THRIVE might be the perfect place for you. Working at THRIVE is an engineer's dream. You will learn more, grow faster, work with an excellent team and be appreciated for your contributions. If our requirements fit your background, we want to talk with you! RESPONSIBILITIESYou have technical and programmatic ownership of consulting engagements to deliver robust designs for innovative new products.You will be responsible for the product design from concept through pilot manufacture.You will be a key contributor in an interdisciplinary team, rapidly evaluating design feasibility to help clients select product architectures.SKILLS & ABILITIESExcellent communication skills.Some background working in smaller companies.Solid experience working with clients and suppliers.Experience with technical leadership of projects with 2-3 other contributors.Experience managing project deliverables (schedule/budget), including technical status updates and status reporting.Working knowledge of design using Injection Molded Plastics.Production plastics & tooling support experience.Solidworks CAD experience.Hands-on experience in shop/lab work.M.E, Analysis experience in one or more of the following areas:    Strength of materialsHeat transferTolerance analysisFEAShock and vibrationDesign for manufacturability (high/low volume) REQUIREMENTSBSME. Cross-disciplinary electromechanical experience is a plus.Hands-on Project Management of at least 1 full product development cycle of high-volume tooled products, from concept through pilot production.Experience managing a team of other engineers is a plus. Description The Electronic Warfare Division has an opening for an experienced Hypersonic Systems Engineer. Leidos is looking for experienced engineers with a Hypersonics Aerospace background to lead Systems development and Modeling and Simulation (M&S) efforts based in the King of Prussia, PA office. This is a senior engineering position integrating multiple design concepts and defining analysis and test roadmaps to validate performance of hypersonic systems against system level requirements. This position will lead and develop system level critical thinking skill sets for less experienced engineers. Candidates should have prior experience with hypersonic boost glide or air breathing systems and be able to articulate the technical challenges associated with high speed flight system design. Candidates should have experience in multiple domains crucial to hypersonic design including but not limited to aerodynamics, aerothermal, materials, thermal, structural, Loads & dynamics, or other relevant areas. Preferred candidates will have prior experience defining and integrated multiple domain analyses and tests results through the systems engineering processes starting with requirements generation and compilation through Verification and Validation activities and be able to provide guidance on both methodologies and resources to achieve the desired system level requirements. The Aerophysics group operates in a team environment where individual creativity is rewarded and continuous learning is the norm. Our engineers typically work directly with DOD personnel and regularly interact with leaders in the development of hypersonic weapons. Be a part of generating the designs for the next generation of hypersonic weapon systems in this high growth field. Successful candidates will interact with internal and external stakeholders to define system level requirements. The candidates will then define plans including design requirements, allocations, and M&S plans for execution by Leidos and external team members. Finally, the candidate will integrate results of analysis and tests performed into a comprehensive customer deliverable demonstrating design capabilities and the ability to meet the customer needs. Required Skills: Experience Level: Candidates should have 8+ years’ experience in addition to a bachelors in Aerospace Engineering (or similar) degree. Candidates are expected to generate solutions for technical issues in hypersonic weapons system development. Candidates will also be expected to support development of junior team members (1 to 2) through a mentorship role. Communication Skills: Successful candidates will effectively communicate issues and results to internal team members and internal and / or external customers. The candidate will develop a clear understanding of customer objectives and create execution plans / tasks required to satisfy them. The candidate will provide both written and verbal execution status on a regular basis. Engineering Skills: Experience with the following disciplines is required: System Requirements Generation and Decomposition Trade study execution System Integration and Interface Coordination Verification and Validation Experience in multiple of the domains listed below: Aerodynamics / CFD Aerothermal Trajectory simulation Material response Mechanical design Structural analysis (FEA) Thermal analysis Ground Test planning and execution Flight Test planning and execution Range safety analysis Payload integration Clearance: Must be a U.S. Citizen. Active Secret clearance required, Top Secret preferred. Desired Skills: System Architecture Aerodynamics/CFD (Cart 3D, FNS Tools suites) Trajectory simulation (OTIS, POST, or similar) Aerothermal & Material response Finite Element Analysis (ANSYS, NASTRAN, Sierra) CAD Matlab Tecplot, ParaView Planning, Execution, and Analysis of ground and/or flight test data TRAVEL: Attend technical reviews, customer meetings, and professional conferences. 25%. Stress Analysis Engineer: Computational Chemist - Sr Advanced R&D Engineer / Scientist
column7: Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Sr. Advanced R&D Engineer/Scientist Discovery & Innovation, Fluorinated Products, Honeywell  When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. Advanced Materials is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, additives, metals, films, and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors, and military protection. Advanced Materials is making the world safer, cleaner, and enabling the modernization of a growing middle class by enhancing our customer offerings through a differentiated portfolio of chemistries, materials, value-added solutions, and superior customer service. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. Join Honeywell as a Sr. Advanced R&D Engineer/Scientist who will direct computational modeling & simulation efforts necessary for development of novel sustainable materials and applications for Honeywell Advanced Materials Division. You will play a central role in the Advanced Materials Discovery team by employing state-of-the-art modeling & simulation tools to provide fundamental insights into material properties and their behavior in applications ranging from automotive and stationary refrigeration, data storage and communication, electronic materials, advanced energy storage, personal care, building and construction, pharmaceutical packaging. Key Responsibilities: Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as, a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status or have the ability to obtain an export authorization Understand scientific aspects important for different applications of HON products and identify and solve problems where fundamental insights from computational modeling & simulation can accelerate design and development of new materials Act as first screen in design of new materials by rapidly down-selecting from a list of thousands or millions of candidate materials to identify few most promising ones Develop, implement, and maintain efficient simulation methodologies required for design of new products/processes, validation of new applications, and plant/customer/regulatory support Keep up to date with latest developments in modeling & simulation methodologies and implement most promising ones based on current needs Work simultaneously on multiple projects across diverse areas while ensuring timely deliverables are met Maintain software versions and licenses up-to-date and work closely with Honeywell HPC team to resolve problems encountered during installations and upgrade/refresh of HPC servers Identify, coordinate, and work with external research, academic and new venture partners to prioritize and accelerate learning of application and material performance requirements Translate voice of the customer and customer unmet needs to material performance requirements Work with customers and Honeywell marketing to meet needs in a fast-paced environment Follow all related safety and environmental rules and regulations MUST HAVE Advanced Degree in Chemical Engineering, Physical Chemistry, or Material Science 3+ years of experience in advanced materials or specialty chemicals industrial research and/or new product development WE VALUE PhD in Chemical Engineering/Chemistry/Material Science with emphasis on modeling & simulation applied to new material development Strong fundamentals in one or more modeling & simulation technique – quantum mechanics, molecular mechanics, process modeling, CFD, FEA, AI/ML Expertise in modeling wide variety of materials and processes Proficient in at least one programming language – Python, R, MATLAB Experience with one or more simulation packages – Gaussian, DMOL3, CASTEP, VASP, QuantumESPRESSO, COSMOTherm, LAMMPS, GROMACS, Towhee/Cassandra, UniSim/Aspen, Ansys Experience in employing data science and AI/ML techniques for development of new materials Familiarity with Integrated Computational Materials Engineering (ICME) principles Experience in a fast-paced environment Technical curiosity and passion for R&D Desire and abilities to identify, develop, and improve new technical concepts and products External orientation and desire to accurately understand technology trends, customer unmet needs, and working with external partners Proficient in leading technical projects involving scientists, engineers, application development and marketing Excellent interpersonal and communication skills - written and verbal Reliable and trustworthy with the highest ethical standards and integrity Inclusion and Diversity (I&D) is a foundational principle at Honeywell, both because it’s the right thing to do and because it is a fundamental enabler for our business. We actively recruit, develop and retain talent from diverse backgrounds and cultures who bring different experience, perspectives, abilities and ideas. We foster an inclusive environment in which all employees feel valued, respected and accepted.  Inclusion and Diversity is more than a commitment to us, it is the way we work. Description Looking for an opportunity to make an impact? The Leidos Innovations Center has an immediate opening for a Sr. Mechanical Engineer to work in our La Jolla office in San Diego, CA. This is an exciting opportunity to leverage your experience to develop and produce advanced nuclear detection instruments, radiography equipment, satellite payloads, and chemical & biological sensing instruments as the lead mechanical engineer on a variety of projects and systems. Emphasis is on research and development programs with activities ranging from support of early scientific research to transitioning products to production. If this sounds like the kind of environment where you can thrive, keep reading! The Challenge: Design, develop, integrate, and test all aspects of mechanical designs for Chemical, Biological, Radiation, Nuclear, and Space sensor systems for federal government customers. Collaborate in scientific research, engineering product development, and test activities. Contribute to design reviews and present designs for review. Work independently and use judgement to perform engineering tasks with uncertain and evolving requirements. Evaluate physical systems for thermal, vibration, and structural performance before they are built. Collect performance data from various sensors, and effectively present results. Provide mentorship and supervision to junior staff. 0-15% travel to customer sites as required. What Sets You Apart: B.S. degree or higher in Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or related field from an accredited college/university and 8+ years of relevant experience as a mechanical engineer in an R&D environment. Masters’ degree or Ph.D. preferred. Must be a U.S Citizen and be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret Security Clearance. Demonstrated design experience in at least three of the following areas: Optics and optical packaging, fabrication with composites materials, mechanisms for use in space environment, materials for space environment, microfluidics systems (µL scale), shock and vibration analysis, precision motion systems, MIL-STD-810 testing, systems engineering, technical project planning, heat transfer and thermodynamics. Experience with definition, setup, characterization and testing of complex systems, for requirements validation. Good interpersonal skills and ability to coordinate work with others. Good oral and written communication skills. Experience working with cross-functional R&D development teams. Motivated self-starter able to work under minimal supervision with an entrepreneurial approach to roles and responsibilities. Well-organized, reliable, attention to detail, demonstrated personal initiative. Ability to multi-task and prioritize workload. Able to build BOM’s and assembly work instructions. Familiarity with Solidworks as a primary design tool. You’ll really WOW us having one or more of the following: Masters’ degree or Ph.D. Experience leading small teams on projects or tasks. Experience with GD&T per ASME Y14.5 Hold an active Secret Clearance or higher. Familiarity with Python, Matlab, or Mathcad Experience programming and basic coding for motor-actuated mechanical systems Experience with Solidworks Simulation, ANSYS, or similar FEA software LInC Pay Range: Pay Range $97,500.00 - $176,250.00  The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Who Are We? Have you ever gone into a grocery store or convenience store for things like milk, bagged salads, or frozen pizza? The coolers and freezers you find those and other food products in are what we do!! Zero Zone is a manufacturer of reach-in and open refrigerated and frozen food display cases as well as the refrigeration systems that work behind the scenes to cool the cases, keeping the food fresh! We also make powerful industrial refrigeration systems for food warehousing, pharmaceuticals, and even ice rinks! Our company is structured across 2 divisions – the Display Case Division, located in North Prairie, WI, Waukesha, WI, and Mukwonago, WI and the Refrigeration Systems Division, located in Ramsey, MN and Dyersville, IA. What Are We Like? At Zero Zone, you will be a valued member of the Zero Zone team, able to take ownership of your own career path. We believe in hard work, teamwork, collaboration, and respect, and we have grown through dedication to our Purpose: “Preserving customer valuables through refrigeration.” For over 60 years, we have been a leader in refrigeration, and our people are well known for exceptional customer service. We also believe we are the COOLEST coworkers (pun intended)! This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in the refrigeration industry with one of the top leading manufacturers in the country! Come grow with us!! What Can We Offer You? Vacation and Personal Hours (after only 30 days!)Competitive WagesComprehensive Benefits Package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, STD, LTD, AD&D, HSA/FSA, EAP)401k and Profit Sharing10 Paid HolidaysFlexible SchedulesCasual Dress CodeWellness Programs and IncentivesSteel Toe ReimbursementEmployee Engagement ProgramsOne-time Home Computer ReimbursementAnd more!What Will You Do? Reporting to the Research and Advanced Development Manager, the Principle/Project Engineer will be the leader of the design for assigned projects. They will be a core team member and work as a liaison between the core team and engineering design team to develop a unified solution. They will help to translate the voice of the customer from Marketing/Product Management into quantifiable design requirements to ensure project and product success. They will also develop documentation (i.e. PRD’s, DFMEA’s, DVP&R’s, etc.), non-standard tests and other forms of effective communication to highlight risks and overall status of projects. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Be a champion in all areas of Zero Zone’s strategic vision, purpose and priorities with particular focus on Commitment to Organizational Excellence and Product Platforms. Own the Theory of Operation of design and direct design engineering efforts to fulfill project requirements which fulfill the Voice of Customer (VOC). This will include associated documentation.Work as a core team member of projects and act as liaison between the core team and engineering.Conduct design reviews with an emphasis on DFx to ensure the best product possible.Utilize best practice tools to engage in Continuous Improvement (CI) activities for both the product and the business.Other duties as assigned.What Are We Looking For? The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required of you in this position:Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Refrigeration Engineering or 10+ years of experience in project engineering role.Experience in CAD, CFD and FEA packages.Experience with ASHRAE, Intertek or other Agency is preferred.Ability to work effectively in a team environment with a keen ability to continually identify continuous improvement opportunities throughout the organization.Ability to write comprehensive reports, business correspondence, and test procedures as needed.Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general publicProficiency in any of the following computer packages; MS Word, MS Excel, CAD Packages (SolidWorks, Pro-E, or AutoCAD)Working knowledge of any of the following disciplines; refrigeration, thermodynamics, economic/cost analysis, sheet metal, plastics, and fabrication, preferred.Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization existsAbility to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule formUnderstanding of GD&T and statistical capability analysis.Experience in translating customer requirements to technical requirements.Other duties as assigned.Zero Zone, Inc. Please explore our website to learn more about our company and to view our highly engineered products. www.zero-zone.com

Company Description  Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!  Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.  We are committed to a diverse and equitable workforce with an inclusive culture that values and celebrates the diversity of our people, talents, ideas, experiences, and perspectives. This is important for continued success of the Laboratory’s mission.  Pay Range  $153,210 - $236,112 Annually  $153,210 - $196,788 Annually for the SES.3 level  $183,840 - $236,112 Annually for the SES.4 level  Please note that the pay range information is a general guideline only. Many factors are taken into consideration when setting starting pay including education, experience, the external labor market, and internal equity.  Job Description  We have multiple openings for Senior Mechanical Engineering Analysts. As a Senior Mechanical Engineering Analyst, you will help the analysis team support the engineering design, testing, and certification of our nation’s nuclear weapon systems by using Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and some of the world’s largest computers. Our Engineering Analysts develop computational models using custom, in-house codes, conduct engineering analysis of full weapon systems and components in thermal, quasi-static, dynamic, and hydrodynamic environments, and help guide design and test engineers to develop successful products and tests. Engineering Analysts at LLNL also perform research and development in advanced simulation capabilities and workflows including advanced constitutive modeling, pre- and post-processing, Simulation Process and Data Management (SPDM), Verification, Validation and Uncertainty Quantification (VVUQ), and workflow automation. These positions are in the Computational Engineering Division (CED).  These positions will be filled at either a SES.3 or SES.4 level based on knowledge and related experience as assessed by the hiring team. Additional job responsibilities (outlined below) will be assigned if hired at the higher level. In this role you will: Lead and/or contribute to the development of finite element models of mechanical systems and components. Perform engineering in-depth analysis using finite element models and other techniques in support of stakeholders in design, modification, optimization, testing, and certification of the nuclear weapon systems under minimal direction and provide technical insight which influences solutions to stakeholder challenges. Document and present (as appropriate) simulation and analysis results and technical approaches. Work independently, in consultation, and/or on teams of analysts, code developers, engineers, and subject matter experts following established procedures, standards, and verification and validation best practices to solve complex technical problems under minimal direction. Contribute to and implement improvements to analysis workflows, processes, and procedures. Support deliverables with occasional travel as needed. Participate in formal and informal design reviews as required. Identify capability gaps and develop solutions or proposals to mitigate them. Lead and direct small to moderate technical projects or teams. Set and/or participate in vision and strategy development for analysis group and/or influence vision and strategy of larger project teams. Serve as a technical mentor for more junior engineering analysts and/or serve as a subject matter expert to internal and external stakeholders. Perform other duties as assigned.  Additional job responsibilities, at the SES.4 level  Perform engineering in-depth analysis using finite element models and other techniques in support of stakeholders in design, modification, optimization, testing, and certification of the nuclear weapon systems under self-direction and provide alternative solutions to stakeholder challenges . Work independently, in consultation, and/or on teams of analysts, code developers, engineers, and subject matter experts following established procedures, standards, and verification and validation best practices to solve highly complex, not well-defined technical problems. Lead development and mentor others in the development of new analysis workflows, process standards, and procedures. Lead and direct large technical projects or teams or influence technical direction and decisions made by stakeholders as a subject matter expert in the field. Qualifications Ability to secure and maintain a U.S. DOE Q-level security clearance which requires U.S. citizenship. Master’s degree in Mechanical or Civil Engineering, or related field, or the equivalent combination of education and related experience. Advanced communication and organization skills necessary to perform duties. Significant experience with Finite Element Analysis (FEA), the Finite Element Method (FEM), static structural, thermal, thermal-mechanical, dynamic, or hydrodynamic analysis through FEA. Experience using a meshing software to develop hexahedral based meshes. Advanced knowledge of elasticity, plasticity, failure, and heat transfer in engineering materials/structures, and materials science, engineering material performance, and properties of materials, and of associated analytical models used in mechanical engineering problem solving. Advanced knowledge and experience in one or more of the following areas: mechanical behavior of materials structural mechanics failure mechanics dynamics modal response heat transfer hydrodynamics thermo-mechanical response of engineering systems Experience developing solutions to complex challenges requiring innovative methods or in-depth analysis with limited factors and ability to exercise independent judgment in determining optimal techniques, methods, and evaluation criteria for answering engineering questions. Ability to work independently with minimal direction and as part of a team comprised of external partners or mid-level management and ability or experience to lead teams and/or direct technical projects. Ability or experience in formal and informal design reviews. Ability to travel.  Additional qualifications at the SES.4 level  Expert communication and organization skills necessary to perform duties. Expert knowledge of elasticity, plasticity, failure, and heat transfer in engineering materials/structures and expert understanding of associated analytical models used in mechanical engineering problem solving. Expert knowledge and experience in one or more of the following areas: mechanical behavior of materials structural mechanics failure mechanics dynamics modal response heat transfer hydrodynamics thermo-mechanical response of engineering systems Significant experience developing solutions to complex challenges requiring innovative methods or in-depth analysis of multiple tangible and intangible factors. Significant experience developing solutions to complex challenges requiring innovative methods or in-depth analysis of multiple tangible and intangible factors.  Qualifications We Desire  PhD in Mechanical Engineering or related field. Experience with commercial FEA codes such as Abaqus, Ansys, LS-Dyna, Nastran, CTH, or similar. Average or strong programming experience in Python, Java, C, Fortran, Perl, and/or MATLAB. Experience with national lab codes such as ParaDyn, Nike3D, Dyna3D, Diablo, Sierra, ALE3D, or similar. Experience in testing or experimental set up. Experience using a scripting language to build parametrically driven meshes. Significant experience in one or more of the following areas: Advanced constitutive models Continuum mechanics and material model development Energetic materials Magneto-hydrodynamics Transportation safety analysis Uncertainty quantification or statistics Nuclear weapon system mechanical design and materials Experience using a CAD software such as Solidworks or PTC Creo to build or defeature geometry. Understanding and ability to calibrate material models to test data. Advanced to Expert knowledge in the development of relevant principles, theories, or techniques in the solution of complex engineering problems. Ability to facilitate others through leadership. Experience with application of Verification and Validation practices. Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Position Information  This is a Career Indefinite position, open to Lab employees and external candidates.  Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?  Flexible Benefits Package 401(k) Relocation Assistance Education Reimbursement Program Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs) Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Accountability (IDEA) - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity Our core beliefs - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity/our-values Employee engagement - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity/employee-engagement  Security Clearance  This position requires a Department of Energy (DOE) Q-level clearance. If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. Also, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. Q-level clearance requires U.S. citizenship.  Pre-Employment Drug Test  External applicant(s) selected for this position must pass a post-offer, pre-employment drug test. This includes testing for use of marijuana as Federal Law applies to us as a Federal Contractor.  How to identify fake job advertisements  Please be aware of recruitment scams where people or entities are misusing the name of Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) to post fake job advertisements. LLNL never extends an offer without a personal interview and will never charge a fee for joining our company. All current job openings are displayed on the Career Page under “Find Your Job” of our website. If you have encountered a job posting or have been approached with a job offer that you suspect may be fraudulent, we strongly recommend you do not respond. To learn more about recruitment scams: https://www.llnl.gov/sites/www/files/2023-05/LLNL-Job-Fraud-Statement-Updated-4.26.23.pdf  Equal Employment Opportunity  We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.  We invite you to review the Equal Employment Opportunity posters which include EEO is the Law and Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.  Reasonable Accommodation  Our goal is to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates applying and interviewing at the Laboratory. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please use our online form to submit a request.  California Privacy Notice  The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

About the Company Phase Four is developing the next generation of in-space propulsion for the rapidly expanding space economy. From large constellations in low earth orbit to new missions and cutting-edge capabilities, our team is the key to mission success. We are focused, innovative and passionate about space. And above all else, we work together to get the job done. Join us at Phase Four as we design, build and deliver the next generation of in-space propulsion and change the way humanity moves in space. Job Summary As Senior Propulsion Systems Engineer you will be at the forefront developing new propulsion capabilities to provide breakthrough mobility and maneuverability to national security and civil science missions. You will be responsible for the technical efforts of one or more development programs, from concept development & requirements definition to delivery to the customer & demonstration on-orbit. You will lead trade studies, concepts evaluation, and system sizing for future propulsion technologies and mission applications, many of which will be the first of their kind. customerLead trade studies, concepts evaluation, and system sizing for future propulsion technologies and mission applicationsLead requirements definition for propulsion systems and advanced development programsPerform design, analysis, development engineering, and flight operations tasks for propulsion systemsInteract and manage engineers and technicians from all disciplines, including IC, and/or NASADemonstrated track record of success in a rapidly growing, changing and highly technical environmentActive Secret clearancePreferred QualificationsMaster's degree in Engineering, Physics, or a related fieldOver 7 years of direct design and development experience with mechanical or fluid systems in the space propulsion industry (liquid and/or electricExperience with hardware preferred)Knowledge of plasma physics conceptsExperience with hypersonicsExperience with scientific simulation software (i.e., particle-in-cell or custom-written code)Experience working in a Date Posted: 2022-08-31-07:00  Country: United States of America  Location: RC1: United Tech Research Center 411 Silver Lane, East Hartford, CT, 06108 USA  Position Role Type: Hybrid  The following position is to join our Corporate Research Center Team: Raytheon Technologies Corporation Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Arlington, VA. To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued, and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors, and communities to succeed. Senior Engineer – Thermodynamic Systems Raytheon Technologies Research Center (RTRC) develops new technologies that enable the most innovative products in the world. Our researchers serve as expert technical consultants to Raytheon Technologies (RTX) businesses, lead government-sponsored research programs, and pursue their own creative ideas. From advanced mission systems for our warfighters to next-generation green propulsion, we combine innovation with product application to shape the future of technology. The next generation of products demand that we cross traditional boundaries. If you enjoy leveraging your technical expertise in thermodynamic system and heat transfer analysis to work across disciplines, our Thermodynamic Systems Team needs your skills. Our Senior Engineer position demands strong engineering fundamentals, expertise in analytical and numerical physics-based modeling, and the ability to select appropriate modeling fidelity for a given problem. On our team, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to the following areas: Modeling and analysis of novel thermodynamic systems for power generation, waste heat recovery, and cooling Development of exploration methods for combinatorial architectural design spaces across aerospace and defense system domains Application of machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to enable system design Implementation of novel optimization and uncertainty quantification methods Control co-design approaches Power and cooling system build and test Operations analysis and commercial product utilization simulations RTRC was founded by some of the world’s greatest inventors. We helped build the Second Industrial Revolution and brought about a century of urbanization and globalization. Come help us build the next one. Basic Qualifications: Demonstrated experience in heat transfer and thermodynamic systems design Analytic modeling and programming skills in common languages General understanding of FEA and CFD modeling Demonstrated experience in publishing and presenting research Excitement about working across domains and disciplines Permanent Resident or U.S. Citizen required Preferred Qualifications: Adaptability and the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment Excellent communication skills, informal and formal presentation skills, and ability to foster positive relationships with internal and external partners Ability to manage uncertain requirements, formulate a problem from ill-defined needs, develop approaches to solve problems, and recognize when additional subject matter expertise is needed Experience developing externally funded programs with relevance to a particular research agenda Familiarity with operations analysis Education Requirements: Master's Degree or Ph.D. in Mechanical, Aerospace, Chemical, or Nuclear Engineering required Ph.D. candidates with no formal experience will be considered M.S. candidates must have 1+ year of experience in a relevant work environment Location: This position is located in East Hartford, CT and is a hybrid role (expected to be on-site 2-5 days/week) Relocation is offered for this position Work Authorization: US Citizen or Permanent Resident Required Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.
