POSITION: Senior Engineer, Airfoil Structures       LOCATION: Houston, TX.            STATUS: Salary Exempt      JOB SUMMARY ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES       The essential functions of the job include, but are not limited to, the following:      Analyze Industrial Gas Turbine Engine component designs to ensure parts maintain appropriate stress levels, meets life requirements and design criteria. Utilize appropriate analysis/design tools, such as ANSYS/Abaqus, Microsoft Excel, ProEngineer or similar. Support the continued development and oversee the adherence to PSM technical reviews, engineering changes and field validation plans and verification. Assess needs and identify critical path schedules for design, manufacturing and procurement activities. Create, lead and/or deliver presentations to internal and external clients. Other duties as assigned. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Education & Training Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field is required. Must complete EHS assigned regulatory training for work area as described by PSM’s EHS Training Matrix Skills/Experience 5+ years of experience designing, analyzing, and manufacturing gas turbine engine components and/or large rotating components. Combination of education, experience and research work will be considered. Strong analytical decision-making and organizational skills are required. Experience with FEA software desired (ANSYS or Abaqus). Knowledge of various manufacturing processes, general machining and fabrication techniques is preferred. Familiar with vibration and dynamics analysis of rotating structures. Familiar with advanced FEM modeling techniques such as nonlinearity, contact, and creep. Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills are required. Ability to perform hands-on fieldwork is strongly desired. Travel is required on an as needed basis. Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans/Disabled

The Senior Product Development Engineer is responsible for designing, testing, validating, and releasing to production all new products as well as product enhancements and design related cost reduction efforts. This position reports to the Senior Product Development Engineering Manager and works closely with the entire cross functional team from the concept phase through production. Overview of Responsibilities Manage all technical aspects of multiple internal or external projects through the engineering lifecycle including project plans, project budgets, resources, and delivery of outcomes. Develop and maintain detailed project schedules. Track and report performance of these schedules. Work closely with the cross functional team to define product specifications. Hold regular cross-functional project meetings to review and update project status, logistics, resources, schedule and objectives. Assure early problem identification and implementation of corrective action. Develop detailed product specification, utilizing a cross functional collaborative approach to meld technical capability, market opportunities, and the voice of the customer. Create new and modify existing designs using 2D and 3D CAD drafting tools (Solid Works). Create technical data packages including drawings, BOMS, and test plans for new products and new configurations of existing products. Establishes and maintains a manual and electronic library for all technical drawings. Assembles prototypes to ensure original and new parts have the proper form, fit and function. Test fires prototypes for functionality and endurance and document non-conformances Responsible for evaluating and recommending and implementing new technologies to support new and existing product lines. Other duties will be assigned as required. Qualifications & Knowledge Required To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. These requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or the equivalent is necessary. An advanced degree is a plus. Minimum of ten (10) years’ experience in new product development in a manufacturing environment. Extensive knowledge of CAD (Solidworks preferred) with FEA and functional expertise in the application of GD&T. Knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerances (ANSI Y14.5) is necessary. Ability to manage projects and teams that deliver products on schedule and within budget constraints. Extensive experience in various manufacturing processes including but not limited to: castings, metal injection molding, plastic injection molding, machining, forgings, and additive manufacturing. The ability to multi-task and to manage several projects simultaneously is a must. Experience working on highly-concurrent, collaborative, multi-disciplinary programs across multiple broad business disciplines (Sales to Engineering) Ability to engage and manage cross functional teams Self-motivated with good written and verbal communications skills; ability to effectively prepare and deliver technical reports and presentations. Experience in Firearm Manufacturing and Product Development is a plus.

Stress Analysis Engineer: Senior Analog Electrical Design Engineer - Optical Solutions
column7: Molex possesses a rich heritage in the optical industry. We provide the highest performing and field-proven wavelength management solutions from components, modules to integrated line-cards. Continuous innovation in passive component function integration, miniaturization, and manufacturing automation, cutting edge WSS and amplification technology and comprehensive optical, mechanical, electrical and software design capabilities enable us to serve the needs of high-density, high-bandwidth, and flexible optical networks of telecom, datacom, hyperscale datacenter and supercomputing.  In Fremont, CA, we serve global clients in telecom and datacom industries in providing innovative optical modules and subsystems to support our customer's next generation networks. We are looking for an Analog Electrical Design Engineer. This person will be responsible for the designing, developing, testing, optimizing, and debugging analog circuits and systems with a focus on innovative MEMS devices and systems. You will be responsible for leading the electrical aspects of MEMS systems from concept to production, collaborating with other engineers, scientists, and customers, and ensuring the highest quality and performance of our products. What You Will Do  Design, develop, debug, optimize, and test analog circuits and systems, such as MEMS drivers, ADC, DAC PD TIA, op-amp based amplifiers and active filters Create and maintain test plans, technical documents, reports, and presentations, generate engineering changes, release designs for fabrication and assembly, evaluate vendors, analyze issues and determine root cause Participate in design reviews and provide feedback on the design of analog circuits and systems Work with other team members to optimize and finalize design for full production and to meet all specifications Provide technical support to customers and suppliers Perform and/or support design verification, reliability, and failure analysis to ensure that design meets all specifications and customer requirements Perform other related duties as assigned by management Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, or related technical field or discipline At least 5 years of experience in analog electrical circuit design and development Experience in analog electrical circuit design and debug of various circuits Experience using CAD tools, such as OrCAD, and familiarity with Allegro Experience with DFMEA, PFMEA Experience with design for manufacturing and yield Demonstrated ability to analyze information and solve problems Experience leading projects and mentoring more junior engineers What Will Put You AheadMS or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, or related field related technical discipline 8+ years of mechanical system design and process development of optical products Experience with optical MEMS devices, especially micromirror arrays for optical switching, and electrical circuits associated with EDFA amplifiers, VOA, Photo Detectors, ADC, DAC, op-amps, etc. Experience with simulation tools such as SPICE Ability to speak and communicate in Chinese Familiarity or ability to perform FEA simulation using Ansys Mechanical or other tools For this role, we anticipate paying $120,000 - $180,000 per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form. At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. Hiring Philosophy All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here . Who We Are As a Koch company, Molex is a leading supplier of connectors and interconnect components, driving innovation in electronics and supporting industries from automotive to health care and consumer to data communications. The thousands of innovators who work for Molex have made us a global electronics leader. Our experienced people, groundbreaking products and leading-edge technologies help us deliver a wider array of solutions to more markets than ever before. At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company. Our Benefits Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter. Equal Opportunities Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: http://www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

Develop and lead initiatives to improve internal and external quality for supported product lines and achieve related targets of <2500 PPM and >92% first pass yield. Lead and promote kaizen activities to help achieve quality, delivery, cost and productivity goals. Develop assembly documentation, workmanship specifications and in cell production controls to prevent and reduce defects. Support training initiatives within the quality team and assigned product areas. Promote Lean manufacturing principles via the use of Standard Work, Poke-Yoke, FMEA, Visual Management and Variation Reduction.    Essential Duties and Responsibilities    To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  Develop, lead and implement quality improvement action plans, procedures and processes necessary to achieve and maintain targeted quality performance goals Maintain a high level of technical knowledge in the areas of quality and lean manufacturing to maximize productivity, quality, and cost efficiency Initiate and monitor corrective and preventative actions Enforce quality standards Support direct labor training and certification. Verify accuracy of training plans Provide project leadership for major quality initiatives Lead and drive efforts to transition temporary corrective actions to permanent corrective and preventative actions Use analytical techniques and tools to study production data, identify trends and define innovative solutions to challenging problems Support part and process qualification initiatives for supported product lines    Requirements         Education and Experience Requirements            The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required.      Engineering Degree or a minimum of 10 years commensurate experience in an engineering related discipline required Experience with ISO9001 quality system is required, AS9100 is preferred Previous motors experience is preferred Previous quality experience is preferred Proven experience with leading teams in a lean production environment Experience directing and interacting with production personnel Thorough understanding of manufacturing and assembly processes and methods including flow, layout, assembly, and production equipment Knowledge of material procurement functions such as purchasing, inventory, shipping & receiving Must have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of customers, employees, and suppliers ranging from assembly technicians to Management Experience with Microsoft Office tools is required Experience with CAD, FEA, and Database systems is preferred Experience with Oracle is preferred       Physical Demands:            The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.            While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, and sit. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and ability to adjust focus.            To conform to U.S. export control regulations, applicant should be eligible for any required authorizations from the U.S. Government.        Benefits      Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Coverage        Spending accounts (HSA, Health Care FSA and Dependent Care FSA)        Paid Time Off and Holidays        401k Retirement Plan with Matching Employer Contributions        Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance        Paid Leaves        Tuition Assistance      About Regal Rexnord  Regal Rexnord Corporation (“Regal Rexnord”) is a leading manufacturer of electric motors, electrical motion controls, power generation and mechanical power transmission products and sub-systems, serving customers around the world in the general industrial, consumer, commercial construction, food & beverage, and alternative energy end markets, among others. Regal Rexnord sells its products and solutions to OEMs, through distributors, and directly to end-users. Regal Rexnord is a $7.2B company with 36,000 associates globally.    You may not know it, but Regal Rexnord impacts your life every day. The company’s products enable the fans in HVAC systems that keep us comfortable; the power source that keeps smart buildings running; the agricultural and food service equipment that keeps us fed; and the conveyer systems that keep e-commerce flowing, to name a few of the applications where our products are used.    Regal Rexnord’s business purpose is to create a better tomorrow by energy-efficiently converting power into motion. This means creating innovative solutions while focusing on both customer needs and the company’s commitment to sustainability. The company’s industrial powertrain and automation solutions offerings are an important part of the company's growth strategy. The company’s strategy includes leveraging 80/20 to prioritize all activities, including product excellence, operational excellence and commercial excellence (i) driving organic sales growth through the introduction of innovative new products, with a particular focus on improving energy efficiency, (ii) establishing and maintaining new customers, as well as developing new opportunities with existing customers, (iii) participating in higher growth end markets and geographies, and (iv) identifying and consummating strategic, value creating acquisitions.  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement    Regal Rexnord is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, ancestry, national origin, marital status, citizenship status (unless required by the applicable law or government contract), disability or protected veteran status or any other status or characteristic protected by law. Regal Rexnord is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are committed to building a team that represents diverse and inclusive backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.    Notification to Agencies: Please note that Regal Rexnord Corporation and its affiliates and subsidiaries ("Regal Rexnord") do not accept unsolicited resumes or calls from third-party recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement or similar contract and approval from HR to submit resumes for a specific requisition, Regal Rexnord will not consider or approve payment to any third-parties for hires made.

Stress Analysis Engineer: Sr Mechanical Design Engineer | Fixed Equipment
column7: ECI Group, the world’s leading specialist engineering contractor for low-density polyethylene (LDPE) and ethylene vinyl acetate (EVA) projects has an immediate a need in our Baton Rouge office for a Senior Mechanical Design Engineer – Fixed Equipment who will be responsible for design and specification and fixed equipment [pressure vessels and heat exchangers]. Your Role With The Company: This position reports directly to the Mechanical Engineering Section Leader Develop equipment specifications and become knowledgeable on the equipment necessary for each project. Prepare and check technical inquiry documents (requisitions, datasheets/specifications, etc) Review supplier technical quotes and prepare technical bid analysis Update inquiry documents to order Attend/run post order kick off meetings Review supplier design documents and coordinate with equipment supplier Travel to witness inspections Attend kick-off meetings or attend client sites. The role will interface with other internal engineering disciplines as well as external project team members such as the client or license provider. Background Profile: Bachelor’s Degree Mechanical Engineering is required. PE License Required in Texas and Louisiana 10+ years of related experience in engineering design of oil& gas, petrochemical or plastics plants ASME Section VIII, Division 2 High Pressure Experience Preferred Knowledge of ASME VIII Division 3 and other codes / regulations preferred not essential (AD Mekblatt, EN13445, EU PED etc) Knowledge of FEA analysis and fitness for service assessments such as API 579 would be of interest but not essential General understanding of the entire cradle to grave workflow for an EPC Project, interdepartmental dependencies, recognition of the importance of TIC rather than individual constituents that make up the whole. Must be capable of working a part of a close-knit small core team as well as being self-reliant with the confidence to make decisions acting on their own initiative. Organized with the ability to support multiple concurrent projects. Accountable, confident, bright, articulate, innovative, highly motivated, and self-starter with a high energy level that performs with the highest integrity. Knowledge and understanding of industry codes, product safety standards, regulations, etc. Experience with other Machinery/packages such as Thermal oxidizers, Pneumatic conveying systems, Extruder/pelletizers, and other types of packaged equipment would also be of interest (but is not mandatory). Experience in the high -pressure LDPE (Low Density Polyethylene process) would also be of interest (but is not mandatory). Material selection knowledge and familiarity with international codes for steel types used in the petrochemical sector required, familiarity with high strength steels preferred. Knowledge of thermal rating for heat exchangers would be of interest but not essential. Comfortable with occasional opportunities for international travel. Benefits and Features Full Benefits Package – health, dental, vision insurance. Company paid short & long-term disability and life insurance Flexible Spending Plans, Education Reimbursement, Dependent Care Spending Plan 401K Retirement Plan Company Information: [Website https://ecigrouponline.com/engineering-services/ ] Founded in 1977 ECI Group Inc. [ECIG] provides world-class engineering solutions to clients around the world, with have a long history of designing and developing industrial facilities and process plants for the production of fuels, chemicals and polymers. With core technical skills focused around the development and design of a range of processes, we continually embrace new technologies and innovative project methodologies which have contributed to our success in this field. Our full-service offering covers all Engineering discipline including Process, Mechanical (Machinery/Vessels), Piping and Pipe Stressing, Plant Layout, Electrical, Control & Instrumentation, and Civil & Structural. Our engineering services expertise includes: Concept Development – feasibility, cost estimates, front end design, basic engineering Detailed Design – multidisciplinary integrated design of petrochemical plants to IFC; Use of HVEC and specialist design partners, site operational troubleshooting and consultancy. Owner’s Engineer – Project Management, contractor evaluation, due diligence, technical reviews Safety Critical Engineering – SIL/LOPA, relief systems, HAZOP chair, thermal and vibrational stress analysis, design for high pressure / toxic / corrosive service rLs2NKTNdw

Overview      GW Lisk engineers create actuator, valve and sensor products designs for demanding applications in space, aerospace, medical, industrial and heavy duty vehicle and equipment markets. Our team of exceptionally talented people engages our customers to tailor and optimize a product to meet their specific needs. We do this work in a dynamic, collaborative and fun environment. We provide a supportive atmosphere for maintaining a healthy balanced lifestyle and are committed to assisting our employees in their career development.     As part of the Commercial Valve Engineering Team, this Senior Engineering position reporting to the Valve Engineering Manager will support the design, development and project management of hydraulic and electrically actuated valves for use on heavy duty diesel and natural gas engine applications. Specific experience with high temperature exhaust systems, hydraulic, oil and coolant control valves is preferred. Any electro mechanical background is also preferred.    Responsibilities Review customer inquiries and assess specification requirements. Determine the feasibility of compliance and develop design concepts that meet cost goals. Design custom products such as EGR valves, coolant valves, fuel injectors, and proportional solenoid valves for air, water, oils, and other media. Follow the Lisk NPD (New Product Development) Stage Gate process. Utilize FEA, CFD, FMEA and Six Sigma principles and other appropriate engineering tools to evaluate, understand/reduce risks and develop solutions. Identify critical parameters. Lead teams to implement cost reductions on existing products and programs. Travel occasionally to meet with customers for VOC (Voice of the Customer), design reviews, FMEA reviews, and general technical and project support. Attend industry trade shows and technical training as required. Reduced travel due to Covid. Respond to customers’ project information needs and provide timely responses. Participate with cross functional team members to complete design reviews. Complete product designs, improvements and changes based on all aspects of the customer specification, agency compliance, assembly and life cycle requirements. Provide guidance and support to Lisk Test Engineers and Technicians to develop test requests and execute them. Support vibration, shock, thermal, humidity, salt spray and other environmental testing. Hands on work in the test lab is expected at times.Qualifications Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering. 10+ years related experience in product development. Trained in problem solving/decision making methods. Communication skills – Able to present complex technical data, both orally and in writing, in concise terms. Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Project. Proficiency in 3D modeling complex parts in Creo Parametric preferred or other 3D modeling software. Trained in the use of Geometric tolerancing (GD&T) preferred. General understanding in the design of machined metal parts, forgings, castings, stampings, and injection molded components. Background in electro mechanical and hydraulic design preferred      Compensation: $74,000.00 - $115,000.00 annual salary based on experience

Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company’s new website at:      http://www.WabtecCorp.com  .   It’s not just about your career… or your job title…it’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters…do things that haven’t been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.    Role Summary    The Senior Engineer will be responsible for developing our next generation of Energy Storage products for locomotive and mining applications. The ideal candidate will have experience in electromechanical systems and/or battery packaging. This engineer will work with other subsystems and systems, develop requirements, provide system level packaging solutions and safety strategies. This Engineer will also collaborate with customer facing and sourcing teams to develop a roadmap for future battery technologies, services, and reliability support strategies.    Essential Responsibilities:      Lead design and development efforts for current products, including battery packs and thermal management systems        As the Subject Matter Expert provide technical leadership to the team, mentor junior members        Drive project initiatives across a matrixed organization, communicate progress cross functionally and to all levels of the organization including C-suite        Develop long term strategic relationships with suppliers and industry groups        Collaborate with service and reliability teams to develop customer support strategy and develop cost optimal reliability solutions.        Identify cost saving opportunities        Perform detailed design analysis (FEA, Thermal Models, Bolted Joints, Tolerance stack ups, Design reviews)      Minimum Qualifications      Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent engineering degree.        Minimum of 10 years of hands-on design experience        Experience interpreting and using standards and regulations      Preferred Qualifications      Battery packaging experience        Electromechanical systems experience        Experience with Energy Storage safety standards and regulations        Experience with manufacturing process and automation        Understanding of electrical and control systems        Strong understanding of material properties, sheet metal applications and welding methodologies        Project Management        Sig Sigma Green Belt/ Black Belt      Wabtec Corporation is committed to taking on the world’s toughest challenges. In order to fulfill that commitment we rely on a culture of leadership, diversity and inclusiveness. We aim to employ the world’s brightest minds to help us create a limitless source of ideas and opportunities. We believe in hiring talented people of varied backgrounds, experiences and styles…people like you! Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Summary      Posted: Nov 8, 2023            Role Number:       200519316      Do something different! We are seeking a hardworking engineer to support the design and integration of Apple’s products by owning the investigation of sophisticated optical and electro-optical components inside camera, display and sensing modules. You will work with both suppliers and cross-functional teams at Apple to craft the technologies that go into Apple products.     Key QualificationsExperience with nano-optics manufacturing process including deposition, lithography, nano-imprint, etching etc.Knowledge and experience of thin film or nanostructure optical design and modeling, process and characterizationThin film understanding and nanostructure related metrologies (XPS, SEM, TEM, AFM, XRD, SIMS, FT-IR, etc.) and optical devices related characterization methods (interferometer, spectrometer, ellipsometry, etc.)Excellent cross-functional coordination and team managementDescription       We are needing an outstanding engineer to own sophisticated optical technologies from concept exploration to high-fidelity prototypes and high-volume consumer products delivery Identify areas where optical components can improve display, camera, sensor performance and customer experience Identify and define equipment for high-volume manufacturing and process (including deposition, patterning and etch) solutions for technically complex nano-fabricated optical components to enable new designs and functional requirements Lead the multi-functional interaction with Product Design, Engineering/Operations, and drive international suppliers to deliver optics components/modules Lead root cause analysis and trouble-shooting for failures and component performance improvement Define Engineering Requirement Specification (ERS) for the optical components IQC, OQC, and IPQC Provide meticulous presentations and reports to a broad range of collaborators, including management, peers, and suppliers Hands-on experience and proven track record in areas relating to optics, optical coating or advanced semiconductor process technology development is ideal Knowledge and experiences of diffraction optics, metasurface optics or nanophotonics is ideal Knowledge of experiences of optical, FEA or Multiphysics simulation software, such as COMSOL is ideal      Education & Experience       - BS and a minimum of 10 years relevant industry experience in Engineering Physics, Material Science, Physics, Chemistry or equivalent.      Additional RequirementsPay & BenefitsAt Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $170,700 and $300,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.  Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.  Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Job Summary    The Mechanical Design Engineer will be based in Fremont, CA. Nextracker seeks a creative and experienced Mechanical Engineer for a position on the design engineering team. This engineer will be responsible for designing components in order for Nextracker Gemini to support a wider range of modules, more difficult site conditions, and cost reduction.    Watch      this video   to learn why Nextracker is more than just a place to work.    Here is a glimpse of what you’ll do:  Contribute to the design and development of the next generations of Nextracker horizontal tracking products Perform and manage engineering work using CAD/CAE software to solve problems in mechanical/structural design, finite element analysis, design optimization, prototype generation (such as stereo lithography on NC machining), fatigue analysis, structural dynamics and kinematics, vibrations, thermal analysis, production of manufacturing drawings, and plastic part design Develop testing fixtures that accurately simulate real world scenarios Perform and document engineering tests under general supervision Write proposals, technical reports and papers Participate in brainstorming sessions with the mechanical engineering team to identify concepts and designs for future products Develop and maintain best practices to foster the creative process Design mechanical components, execute prototyping, and manage design iterations Implement continuous improvement in order to maximize efficiency in the design process Partner with the Manufacturing Engineer on design for manufacturability to address questions and issues.   Here is some of what you’ll need (required):  B.S. or M.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering, Structural Engineering or a related field (advanced degree preferred) 8 years of experience Toolsets required: SolidWorks, ePDM, FEA, Ansys Extensive knowledge/experience with drawings, model and GD&T standards and application. Hands on experience with shop tools such as chop saw, band saw, grinders, wrenches, etc. Strong understanding of DFM for castings and sheet metal stampings Strong aptitude and intuition in mechanical failure analysis Practical knowledge of prototyping manufacturing process Must possess solid written and verbal communication skills Ability to prioritize and juggle multiple projects Self-motivated team player Ability to work within a cross-functional team while maintaining self-sufficiency Proficient in most common PC based applications (Word, Excel, Visio, PPT, MSProject, and the like) Willingness to travel and work at client sites both domestically and internationally   Here are a few of our preferred experiences:  Experience with Solar or renewable energy Management experience Labview, MATLAB Netsuite, Arena, Miro (Real Time board), Jira, Confluence Python or other coding Automation experience   Nextracker is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on: age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, pregnancy status, or any other status protected by law. We're happy to provide reasonable accommodations to those with a disability for assistance in the recruitment process. Please advise us of any accommodations you may need by e-mailing:      accessibility@flex.com  .  Pay Range (Applicable to California)  $87,700.00 USD - $120,600.00 USD Annual    Job Category  Design, Process & Technology Engineering  Relocation: Not eligible    Is Sponsorship Available?  No

Denton, TX 76205: San Jose, CA 95112 (North San Jose area)
column7: San Jose, CA        Full-time         The Position     We're looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to join the Speck Design team in San Jose. The Senior Mechanical Engineer will: Design mechanisms, enclosures, and highly-cosmetic parts using 3D CAD software Work closely with our team of industrial designers, electrical engineers, and others to develop world-class products and user experiences Manage multiple concurrent projects, and meet with clients as a technical expert Use shop tools to create rapid prototypes and debug systems Perform engineering analyses on parts and systems, including DFM, FEA, fatigue, FMEA, root cause analysis, DOE creation Create and maintain engineering documentation (2D drawings, design notes, assembly methods, test specifications, regulatory documentation) ‍      Background     BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience 7+ years’ experience designing and launching successful hardware products Experience with a wide variety of materials and manufacturing processes, from the commonplace to the extremely niche Expert in 3D modeling tools, including simulation and surface modeling (we use Solidworks) Proven ability to integrate electronic sensors, actuators, and motion control components to perform mechatronic tasks Experience with GD&T You feel right at home in a machine/wood/model shop Strong analytical skills and engineering fundamentals Collaboration skills, including experience working with UX and ID teams Ability to manage multiple projects, and work effectively towards fixed deadlines ‍      What We Are Looking For     Medical device development experience Prior consulting experience Mechatronics/electronics experience

Company Overview:If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you’re searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. As an individual contributor, or as a leader of people, your enterprise mindset will ensure Flowserve’s position as the global standard in comprehensive flow control solutions. Here, your opportunity for professional development and industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!At Flowserve, working on global infrastructure projects is just another day at the office but it takes the brains and imagination of our more than 19,000 employees to get the job done right. If the solution exists, we’ll find it. If it doesn’t, we’ll create it. Experience, leadership, and creativity are the tools we use to turn an idea into a solution. Together, we enable the world.Flowserve offers competitive pay, annual bonuses, medical benefits on day 1, generous paid vacation time, paid holidays, pension plan, 401(k) and many other excellent benefits.ROLE SUMMARYIn this role, the candidate will be responsible for product line engineering for assigned quarter turn valves. The Senior Product Engineer will deal with issues of product design and manufacturing, sales / quoting support, production costs, feasibility, quality, performance, reliability, serviceability and customized user features. Addressing these product characteristic requires product and component design, development, transitioning of the product to manufacturing, and supporting the sales and service teams in quoting and repairing the product.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESLead product development and improvement activities addressing manufacturability, material cost, reliability and performance enhancements, coordinating across global engineering product resources as needed.Take ownership of engineering design support for assigned valve line, coordinating and enforcing global product design consistency across all operations and sales organizations.Ensure engineering design and standards documentation is complete, accurate, and sufficient in support of global manufacturing and quality assurance activities. This includes generating or checking bills of material, manufacturing drawings and sales order drawings.Provide technical and customer service support for new customer inquiries, including the design of special products, technical evaluations of project sales quotations, application and troubleshooting assistance, and evaluations of returned goods.Implement engineering best practices and Flowserve standards.Maintain up-to-date awareness of relevant national, international and industry standards and initiate any product improvements of modifications to ensure the product line meets these requirements.REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIESBachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent degree.7+ years’ experience in product engineering, particularly on industrial type products in a manufacturing environment.Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously utilizing advanced project management tools, methods, and applications.Familiarity with and understanding of various International Standards relating to valves.Computer-Assisted Design/3-Dimensional design, Solidworks and/or Inventor.Engineering analysis using appropriate methods, such as calculation, testing or FEA.Capable of reading, interpreting, and creating engineering drawings, especially relating to manufacturability and tolerancing.Effective oral and written communications.Must have a collaborative style that encourages the flow of communication, removes obstacles, and promotes problem solving and teamwork. Interpersonal communications skills are critical for working with cross-functional departments, customers and vendors.Must have high sense of urgency to plan and execute project deliverables to meet schedule milestones. Able to work independently, with organizational skills to establish priorities and drive tasks to completion.PREFERRED EXPERIENCE/SKILLS:Experience in industrial process valve design. Specifically, experience with quarter turn valves, such as butterfly, plug or ball valves.Experience with castings, forgings and machined components.Knowledge of various materials utilized in industrial products, such as steel alloys and non-metallic sealing elements.Design for Six Sigma (DFSS).Continuous Improvement Process (CIP) certification, Green Belt minimum preferred.Experience in driving down product cost through tools such as Design to Value, VaVe, etc.Mastery level application of advanced engineering processes including CFD, FEA; use of ANSYS preferred.Recognition as a qualified engineer by external certifying bodies, as indicated by Professional Engineering license, IMechE, or other Engineering accreditation is a plus.Req ID : R-7539Job Family Group : EngineeringJob Family : EN EngineeringEOE including Disability/Protected Veterans. Stress Analysis Engineer: Mechanical Engineering Manager for Airborne Products
column7: Your Impact: We are seeking to hire an Engineering Manager to lead our Mechanical team in the Airborne portfolio. Our division focuses on rapid deployment of radar payloads for space and airborne applications. The small company atmosphere with big company resources provides the perfect opportunity to demonstrate your engineering skills on the most challenging problems while also expanding your skills and advancing your career. If you are a highly motivated engineering leader who enjoys a challenging and dynamic environment where your contributions are both critical and valued, Jacobs will provide you the tools and opportunity to flourish and have some fun while you are at it.Candidate would have a lead technical role to research, design, develop, and test a variety of airborne payloads. Candidate coordinates activities involving electronics packaging, thermal design, manufacturing engineering, airborne sensors, and aircraft pods. Candidate would focus on mechanical/thermal design and manufacturing, with consultation from other engineering disciplines. Candidate would also manage the established AgilePod® team and design approaches to package airborne radars. Candidate would also have the responsibility to manage a group of mechanical engineers with responsibility of managing resources, developing and improving engineering processes, organizing training, hiring of new mechanical engineers, and supervising members of the group. It is expected that this role is approximately 70% technical and 30% managerial.Manages and directs mechanical engineering group resources and activities for airborne products. Joby Overview: Located in Northern California, the team at Joby Aviation is driven by our goal of creating an affordable, all-electric air transportation system. Imagine a piloted air taxi that takes off vertically, then quietly carries you and your fellow passengers over the congested city streets below, enabling you to spend more time with the people and places that matter most. Since 2009, our team has worked steadily to make this dream a reality. We’ve designed and tested many generations of prototype aircraft capable of serving in a network of electric air taxis. We’re looking for talented, committed individuals to join our team as we push onwards toward certifying the Joby aircraft with the Federal Aviation Administration, scaling our manufacturing, and preparing to launch commercial service in 2025. Overview:     Joby Aviation is searching for a senior tool design engineer with experience designing tools and equipment for large carbon fiber parts and assemblies for aircraft production. Individual must have a strong technical background in certified aircraft manufacturing. This person should be well versed in all aspects of the tool design process from concept sketches to implementing tools on the production floor.  Responsibilities:  Design, develop, and implement manufacturing aids and equipment such as jigs, fixtures, molds, etc. Develop Joby’s tool design standards. Produce easy to follow prints and shop floor drawings with strong GD&T understanding. Coordinate and support tooling activities across a wide range of departments including; airframe design, structural analysis, planning, vendors & suppliers, manufacturing, production, quality assurance, testing and tool fabrication. Provide knowledge to those that are less experienced Required:  B.S. in engineering OR substantial tooling design experience. Experience working with CATIA, NX, Creo, or Solidworks and PLM systems. Proficiency in GD&T and common drafting practices in compliance with ASME Y14.5 & Y14.100. Experience in composite manufacturing processes: manual layup, AFP, autoclave operation, hot press, assembly processes, etc. Experience in prototype manufacturing in a professional environment. Experience with FEA, hand calculations, and documenting results. Excellent verbal communication with internal departments and external vendors. Desired:  8+ years of related experience as a tool design engineer in relevant industry. Compensation at Joby is a combination of base pay and Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). The target base pay for this position is $89,800-$150,400/year. The compensation package will be determined by job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.   Joby also offers a comprehensive benefits package, including paid time off, healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan with a company match, an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP), short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, and more.  EEO:     Joby is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Overview:  Position Summary: Nusano has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Mechanical Engineer at our Salt Lake City Utah facility. The Senior Mechanical Engineer will work with the Mechanical Engineering team to provide support for radioisotope production efforts as a primary member of an agile multi-discipline project team responsible for the research & development of next generation radiochemical processing systems and radioisotope drug manufacturing equipment. To execute this project, we are looking to add talented people to the team who are mission-driven, who provide diverse perspectives, and who have demonstrated exceptional results through a range of different pursuits. This role will be primarily responsible for taking ownership of projects from concept to operational deployment, driving CAD designs, fabrication drawings, and BOMs of the project. This role will also be the primary technical interface with selected fabricators and manufacturers, including on-site visits, progress inspections and technical reviews. software, preferably ANSYS mechanical, to conduct structural/thermal analyses (2+ years Substantial technical experience with advanced knowledge and judgment in most of the following areas: Precision kinematics, linear motion stages, linkages, pneumatics, and mechanism design Design, installation, commissioning, and operation of precision scientific instrumentation Welding, machining, and mechanical assembly processes and techniques 3D CAD Design and drafting in SolidWorks and SolidWorks PDM Project management abilities defined as the ability to control scope, cost, and schedule Metrology, inspection, quality control, and test methods related to manufacturing Ability to supervise and safely direct activities of small teams of technical personnel Ability to interact and communicate efficiently with researchers, scientists, engineers, designers, machinists, and engineering technicians to provide a high level of customer service Fully proficient with digital Frequent use of computer with repetitive use of keyboard, mouse, and manual dexterity. 2-8 weeks of travel per year for site visits, visiting vendors, and attending conferences About Nusano: No patient should be denied the cancer care they need simply because some options are in short supply or unavailable. Yet, all too often, this is what happens.  Nusano is a medical technology company that creates radioisotopes used to target and eliminate cancer cells with precision. Health care has used radioisotopes to diagnose and treat cancer and other diseases for decades. But, if supply does not keep up with demand, patients will lose out on the benefits of these lifesaving, proven tools.  Nusano’s patented technologies and methods are poised to transform radioisotope production and usher in an exciting new era in cancer care. Our state-of-the-art facility in West Valley City, Utah will produce radioisotopes quickly, efficiently, and affordably. This will make desperately needed resources available to hospitals and cancer clinics around the world and offer those with life-threatening diseases hope for a healthier tomorrow. We are hiring a Senior Project Engineer. The Senior Project Engineer ASME Development will lead design, simulation, and development of products within AMSE – Engineered Products (EP) portfolio and will be act as ASME Person in Responsible Charge (PRC) per ASME code, as well as mentor and further mature our ASME engineering team. We are seeking an experienced, top-tier engineer that thrives in fast paced, diverse, and entrepreneurial environments and excited to take technical ownership. Responsible for all ASME Calculations and drafting changes to ASME product per ASME Section VIII Div I. Lead product part design of components and accessories; work with external consultants and suppliers to refine design further, prototype and manufacture at scale. Work closely with Corporate and Plant Engineering for optimized manufacturability. Lead and perform Finite Element Analysis (FEA) for rapid design iterations. Outsource and manage simulation (FEA, Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD)) when beyond team skillset or available resources. Facilitate and participate in Design Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (D/FMEA) as well as cross functional design reviews. Build engineering drawings for design reviews. Manage REVIT and vessel submittal data. Introduce best design practices and frameworks. Provide engineering mentorship and input to vision as the team matures and expands. Participate in Voice-of-Customer research, translating needs to product requirements and building customer loyalty and empathy. Be a bridge and champion of cross collaboration among technical and sales partners. Desired Experience Strong mechanical and manufacturing technical foundation. Experienced in all stages of new product design and realization. Proficient in static loading, small deflection Finite Element Analysis and other simulation techniques to improve product performance, cost, and decrease overall risk. Practical understanding of common part manufacturing methods and design constraints. Business Acumen - Identifies cost and risks at the component and sub-assembly level to meet defined cost targets. Strong communication skills; comfortable and effective in presenting and distilling complex technical topics to the business. Respectfully challenges and confident in voicing opinion. Software proficiencies: CompressCalcs, ANSYS, SolidWorks CAD and FEA. Highly collaborative and able to quickly build trust across multiple disciplines including design, voice of customer, quality, procurement, supply chain and project management. Q Bio is building technology for the Physical of the Future that measures more, faster and cheaper about the human body, to enable proactive primary care for all. We're revolutionizing primary care with the first clinical digital twin platform, powered by breakthrough whole-body scanning technology, that highlights the most important changes in a person’s physiology for sharing with physicians and specialists anywhere in the world.   Join us! Q Bio’s clinical digital twin platform, Gemini, is the first to capture and monitor comprehensive baseline patient health in a scalable virtual model. The Gemini Dashboard highlights the most important chemical and anatomical changes in an individual weighted by an individual’s lifestyle, genetic and medical history, that can be securely shared with physicians and specialists all over the world.   Gemini is powered by the fastest, most accessible, whole body scanner developed: the Mark I. Self-driving and optimized for primary care, the Mark I can complete a whole-body scan in 15 minutes or less in an open space, without radiation, breath holds, or claustrophobia. Patient comfort is maximized with the option to sit, stand, or lie down, and real-time telemetry is displayed throughout.   Why should you consider a career with Q Bio? We dream big. Our team is aligned and excited about the opportunity to save lives and understand the human body like never before. We know how critical empowering and supportive leadership is, both to our excellence as a company, and for our team experience as a whole, and our leadership team will empower and support career growth. We’re a team of engineers, scientists, and operators who come from a diverse background of disciplines and experiences. We value teamwork, growth, determination and persistence, commitment to collaboration, and a reliance on staying nimble while keeping the big picture in mind.   Join our team and lead the development of cutting-edge quantitative MRI techniques, creating a comprehensive whole-body Digital Twin. From concept to deployment, you will play a critical role in shaping the future of MRI technology and bringing it to the forefront of medical innovation.   As a Senior Mechanical Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, prototyping, and productization of the mechanical system for the crucial component of Q Bio Mark I: the superconducting magnet. You will play a critical role in the development of the most accessible MRI scanner ever developed and be part of a paradigm shift in health care and precision medicine!  Responsibilities: Define requirements and specifications for the mechanical system of the superconducting magnet for the Mark-I whole-body MRI scanner. Perform structural analysis using hand calculations and finite element methods. Lead the design, fabrication, assembly, and testing of mechanical components (coil support structure, radiation shield, vacuum vessel, suspensions, etc.) Create, review, and maintain CAD models and technical drawings for the magnet and interface with manufacturing companies to drive the production. Develop and implement comprehensive verification/validation test plans for mechanical systems, leading testing efforts and evaluating results to ensure compliance with requirements and performance standards. Lead the verification and validation of the mechanical system. Develop and execute the superconducting magnet reliability plan. Develop service tools to support the maintenance & safety of magnetsQualifications: Master's degree in mechanical engineering, physics, or a related discipline. A minimum of 2 years of experience in superconducting magnet design within a manufacturing or research environment. Demonstrated hands-on experience in designing, fabricating, commissioning, and operating superconducting magnets. Hands-on experience with CAD. Proficiency in using commercial FEA tools for mechanical analysis. Familiar with vacuum systems and suspensions. Excellent communication and prioritization skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.Additional nice to have: Ph.D. degree in mechanical engineering, physics, or a related discipline. At least five years of experience in superconducting magnet design within a manufacturing or research environment. Experience in welding, GM cryogenic refrigeration systems, high vacuum systems, and helium leak testing. Knowledge in thermal, electro-magnetic and multi-physics simulations. Experience in cryogenic testing, strain gauge, temperature sensors, and hardware and software for data acquisition systems. Proven track record of gathering system requirements, creating design documentation, developing test plans, and preparing other supporting documentation. Experience in leading cross-functional teams to deliver new product designs. Flexibility and adaptability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with ambitious goals.   In the San Francisco Bay Area, the standard pay range for this role is $160,000-$180,000 annualized. This pay range is for the San Francisco Bay Area and is not applicable to locations outside of this location or for remote roles. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance, and work location. In addition to a competitive base salary, we offer significant equity and an employee-friendly stock option plan. Employees will also be eligible to participate in benefits plans available to other similarly situated employees subject to any eligibility requirements imposed by such plans.   Q Bio was founded in 2015 by serial entrepreneur Jeffrey Kaditz, Dr. Michael Snyder, Chair of Genetics and Director of Personalized Medicine at Stanford University, and Dr. Garry Choy, physician, radiologist, and former Chief Medical Information Officer at Mass General Hospital. Q Bio has raised over $80M from world class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Kaiser Foundation Hospitals, Khosla Ventures, Founders Fund, SciFi VC, and many more.   Q Bio is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Stress Analysis Engineer: Sr. Director of Engineering, Commercialization Engineering
column7: Description:  The Senior Director of Engineering, Commercialization Engineering holds a key position leading commercial design, systems integration and commissioning initiatives at our customers’ production sites, and product sustainment engineering. This vacancy is to be filled with a highly creative, seasoned, hands-on engineering leader, who will lead design and integration of core modular automated bio-electro-mechanical systems into new adaptable customized configurations to address customers’ workflow and enable state-of-the-art automatic operations. This position leads commercialization initiatives internally through a matrix organization in addition to managing external engineering consulting, design, and field integration firms. The selected candidate will also play an integral role in R&D efforts of TARGAN’s New Product Development from conceptualization to development and commercialization, including idea generation, research, evaluation, product design, feasibility analysis, value assessment, product introduction, field application and commercialization. The position reports directly to the VP, Engineering. Knowledge and Responsibilities: Directs the Commercialization Engineering team from conception of customer engagement, through system integration at the customer site, to sustaining engineering for our product lines. Leading his key design engineers, develops and Manages schedules, develops timelines and resource allocation for engineering design of projects; and tracks deliverables for projects to achieve projected completion dates. Supports technical direction and oversight for all aspects related to mechanical, electrical, optical and vision engineering design for bio-devices and systems, by applying a broad multi-disciplinary knowledge across multiple fields of engineering and applied sciences (heat transfer, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, pneumatic and drive systems, electrical and controls systems, vision systems, HMI, material science and mechanics across system and process design). Initiates and coordinates necessary proposed equipment/system changes with design reviews, multi-disciplinary teams and product management. Manages and leads improvements of full documentation for all systems engineering commercialization efforts to support business needs in coordination with our ERP system. Ensures standardization of documentation systems and compliance of standards by all design engineers. Responsible party for safety compliance. Actively participates in conceptualization, invention, design, and development of automated mechanisms for bio-devices and medium to large size automated bio-systems by creating robust, reliable designs with complex electromechanical, electro-pneumatic, user interface, and fault tolerance requirements. Assures full compliance with ISO Quality System requirements for all developments and documentations. Integrates new technology, techniques, and concepts to enhance functionality, simplify designs, improve reliability, and reduce production costs. Works with Manufacturing Engineering and contract manufacturers to plan and execute design for manufacturability and design for testability activities. Works with bio-process development team members to identify and mitigate development risks and produce development plans. Leads product risk analysis activities Requirements:  Desired Skills and Qualifications: MSME or equiv. preferred with a minimum of 15 years of hands-on design engineering experience, 10 years of leadership role and project management experience and 5 years of experience in a lead design role. Previous experience with automated capital equipment design is a must, experience with bio-medical equipment/instrumentation is preferred. Demonstrated experience in conceptualizing, architecting, designing, testing and implementing complex multi-functional electro-mechanical, pneumatic and fluid measurement/ dispensing systems /subsystems. Demonstrated design and implementation experience utilizing a wide range of mechanical fabrication techniques and process, including metal/plastic molding, laser cutting, welding, 3D printing, material forming, machining and casting for variety of materials. Strong hands-on knowledge of 3D CAD software and engineering analysis software. Working knowledge of robotics/automated systems, motion control/stepper servo systems, machine vision systems, laboratory/medical/bio-medical equipment/instrumentation and applicable standards is highly desirable. Experience in factory automation and workflow analysis and management Broad multi-disciplinary engineering knowledge in capital equipment development and commissioning, cost reduction, product life cycle management, testing, and quality improvements with emphasis on mechanical, pneumatic and fluid control systems and problem-solving techniques related to automated equipment. Extensive mechanical engineering design experience with working knowledge of Finite Element Analysis (FEA), Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA), design for Six Sigma, DFM, DFT, and DFR. Knowledgeable in safety regulation, such as CE, NEC, NFPA and OSHA requirements and application to machine safety. Broad engineering knowledge in manufacturing operations, including new product introduction, cost reduction, and quality improvements. Demonstrated problem solving experience is required. Experience with Engineering Change Management processes desired. Experience retrieving, interpreting and communicating field data is a plus. Ability to concurrently handle multiple project assignments. Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills required. Able to influence senior leaders in the organization; ability to present ideas with impact and make compelling presentations. Forward thinking individual able to focus on tasks at hand. Team player, who can challenge the team to think out of the box. Creative problem solver with ability to execute ideas and stay focused on the end goal. Flexible and adaptive; able to explore many ideas simultaneously. Strong organizational skills and ability to manage time effectively. Proficient in Microsoft Office suite including Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

Dynisco is a global leader in the design and manufacture of pressure sensors for demanding plastic and oil and gas applications, as well as automated rheological capital equipment sold to polymer laboratories around the world. The successful candidate will be a primary contributor to the next wave of sensing and capital equipment solution development, and to the acceleration of our product development funnel activities. Create and revise product BOMs, routings, and operations as requiredWork with Marketing and Application Engineers to develop functional and technical specifications for new products.Identify required product configuration/design changes as related to new sales ordersProvide technical support for outsourcing activities and manufacturing issue resolutionManage regulatory documentation in compliance with Dynisco’s quality system and industry standards. Support quality improvement initiatives as required.Project ManagementFamiliarity working within a stage gate development process. Adhere to disciplined design process using design controls, FMEA, rapid prototyping and design reviews.Understand project requirements, anticipate development challenges, and deliver robust solutions on schedule and budget.Assist management in the development of accurate project plans; coordinate project activities with other stakeholders to ensure on time delivery to project commitments.Work effectively with multi-disciplinary design teams to ensure integration of all stakeholder inputs in the development of comprehensive new product design specifications.EducationBachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering with 10+ years of design experience. MSME preferred.Competencies You Need to be SuccessfulExperience designing and operationalizing automated capital equipment a must.Experience designing automated fluidic systems a plus.Knowledge of GD&T, DOE, DFM, DFA, FEA, DFEA, PFMEA.Experience in CAD and Solidworks a must. SolidEdge a plus.Experience managing projects a plusExperience managing direct reports a plusKnowledge of design and manufacture of precision metal components using various fabrication techniques (welding, brazing, heat treating, plating, turning, milling, grinding, etc,) a plusExcellent problem-solving skills – experience with root cause and corrective action a plusStrong communication skills required (listening and speaking) – ability to distill complex technical topics into clear and concise messages and calls to action.Desire to lead people and teams required.Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, reports, and documentsAbility to respond professionally to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business communityAbility to effectively present information to customers, management, and co-workersAbility to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusionsAbility to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variablesTravel RequirementsAbility to travel up to 5 percent of the timePhysical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. What You Can Expect from Us Our goal is to provide employees and their families with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package. Our benefits include Health Insurance, Health Savings/Flexible Spending Accounts, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Life Insurance/Accidental Death & Dismemberment, Short-Term/Long-Term Disability, 401(k) company match on first 5%, Paid-Time Off, 11 Company-paid Holidays, Bereavement Leave, Jury Duty, Military Leave, Employee Assistance Program and Educational Assistance Reimbursement. Who We Are Dynisco is a global leader in innovative applications of high precision, sensor-based technology and critical insight solutions that improve process safety and performance for the plastics, oil & gas markets. The company serves a diverse group of customers throughout the world and with more than 6 decades of commitment to helping customers, Dynisco provides the tools and services for the polymer industry allowing customers a “window into the process”. The information Dynisco provides allows our customers to keep their process consistent regardless of their global locations. Dynisco’s diverse portfolio of sensing and polymer test equipment delivers some of the most accurate information available in the market for the measurement of polymer rheology, pressure, and temperature. Over the next 5 years, Dynisco will be aggressively expanding its business and is seeking top-level talent to join our growing team. (www.dynisco.com) Come help us and some of the biggest names in plastic production shape the future of sustainability in the plastics industry. Learn more about us here! Dynisco is headquartered in Franklin, Massachusetts, with facilities in Tonawanda New York, Heilbronn, Germany and Malaysia. Dynisco will not pay to relocate. We are an EOE M/F/D/V employer. Our Team. Globally, we are a team of diverse and talented individuals. Qualified candidates come to “Dynisco with a passion to grow while making a difference with innovation, employee engagement, customer partnerships and continuous improvement. Our Culture. Every employee has a voice. At Dynisco, new hires are selected to affect change, participate in solutions, challenge the norm, collaborate and contribute. DYNISCO VALUESRespect: We believe in the dignity of every person and the power that can be harnessed through diversity in talents, perspectives, and experiences.Credibility: We strive to earn long-lasting trust and credibility with others through uncompromising ethics, integrity, quality performance, and honoring our commitments.Customer Commitment: We meet or exceed customer needs and expectations by demonstrating deep understanding, meaningful collaboration, and a positive productive experience.Pursuit of Excellence: We promote a growth mindset that fosters creativity, innovation, and learning, to drive continuous improvement.Community Responsibility: We actively participate in our communities to support social priorities, help those in need, and drive a more sustainable future. At Dynisco, we value the unique backgrounds, skills and abilities each team member brings to our workplace. We believe everyone deserves a fair opportunity to succeed and appreciate the experiences and perspectives each person brings beyond the traditional job requirements. Please don’t hesitate to apply even if you do not meet full requirements — we’d love to hear from you! The Senior Mechanical Engineer position is responsible for the design, development, validation, and maintenance of the company’s technology, processes, and workflows within the mechanical and electromechanical domains. You will work across a broad technological scope, from mechanical design and build of products, fixtures, and test rigs, to data collection and analysis. Focus area for data analysis include stress, fluids, and heat transfer. You will support lifecycle workflows from concept design through validation and transition to manufacturing by contract manufacturers. This involves cross-functional collaboration with internal and external stakeholders across other disciplines, including electrical, software, firmware, manufacturing, quality, and business development. This position is on-site from day one, convenient to I-26 and I-526, in a well-appointed office flex space with lab. Responsibilities Designing, developing, prototyping, testing, and integrating mechanical/electromechanical designs from component level to system level. Maintaining mechanical designs and drawings Designing experiments and tests to validate concepts. Designing and building test rigs, including LABVIEW test programs and scripts. Selection of manufacturing process for fabricated parts, including metal, plastics, composites. Designing and developing manufacturing processes for fabricating, building, assembling, and installing components. Communicating engineering project status Evaluating the final product’s overall performance, reliability, and safety Maintaining compliance with applicable government regulations BS degree in Mechanical or Materials Engineering and 10+ years’ experience.Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)Proficiency with SolidWorks solid modeling and drawings.Proficiency with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing, drawings, and various international standards including ANSI, JIS, ISO.Experience with analysis, including:heat transfer,thermodynamics,fluid mechanics, andstress analysis.Experience with analytic tools, including FEA and CFD.Experience with a variety of fabrication processes for both prototyping and series production, including:additive manufacturing,injection molding,machining (mill/lathe/grind),laser/waterjet,welding, andcomposites.Excellent organizational skills, drive, determination, grit, a positive attitude with an open mind to continuously learn and thrive with a highly varied workload, and the focus to meet objectives.Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.

Job Summary    The Sr Manager, Engineering will be based in Fremont, CA.    Watch      this video   to learn why Nextracker is more than just a place to work.
