While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.  Watch Our Story:' https://www.hdrinc.com/our-story'   We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. Primary Responsibilities Consistently ranked among the top firms, including #6 in Top Engineering News-Record 500 Design Firm, by leading industry publications, HDR has 200+ locations around the globe with over 10,000 employees and specializes in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. The position opening for a Senior Structural Engineer offers exciting opportunities in the field of Power Generation and Renewables. As an HDR Senior Structural Engineer your responsibilities may include:Performing detailed structural design, analysis, engineering calculations, and developing construction documents for a variety of reinforced concrete, reinforced masonry, and steel structures as well as a variety of foundation systems like piles, spread footings, and mat foundations.Projects will include new and retrofit power and energy projects (i.e. wind, solar, battery storage, and non-renewable power generation), in addition to industrial, institutional facilities, and a variety of other project types.Acting as an Owner’s Engineer for new or retrofit projects.Writing/Editing structural specifications.Verifying code compliance, quality checks, meeting project schedules and budget.Working independently on projects and overseeing the work of junior engineers.Using stiffness matrix-based analysis software (i.e. RISA, STAAD, and LPile), hand calculations, as well as current codes and standards to perform both static and dynamic analysis.Participating in project site visits in conjunction with the Project Manager and other disciplines.All other duties as assigned. Qualifications Required QualificationsDegree in Civil or Structural Engineering with Structural emphasis, from ABET accredited university, and interest in continuing education.Minimum of 10 years structural engineering experience, preferably in power and energy projects or heavy industrial facilities.Professional Engineering License in home state.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and structural analysis software such as RISA, STAAD, and LPile.Familiarity with CADD software such as AutoCAD or Microstation a plus.Understanding of the finite element method and how to perform FEA.Must be capable of working in a team-oriented environment and possess analytical and organizational skills to work on multiple projects at one time.Having both strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to coordinate your work with other disciplines and CAD designers either in person or remotely from another HDR office.Additional skills such as attention to accuracy, detail orientated, self-directed learning, meeting deadlines, and multi-tasking are required.The willingness to try new things and be a forward thinking, innovative engineer.An attitude and commitment to be an active participant in our employee-owned culture is a must.Preferred QualificationsMaster of Science (MS) Degree in Structural Engineering or Structural emphasisRegistered as a Professional Engineer in multiple statesDemonstrated knowledge of how software packages related to structural engineering workWorking understanding of deep foundations and geotechnical applications for foundation designWhy HDR At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way. Date Posted: 2023-08-15  Country: United States of America  Location: VA141: 8350 Alban Road, Springfield 8350 Alban Road Suite 700, Springfield, VA, 22150 USA  Position Role Type: Onsite  Job Description: Raytheon is seeking a Senior Principal Mechanical Engineer to lead technology development and mission support projects. The Senior Principal Engineer possesses extensive knowledge of mechanical engineering theory and practices, often tackling unique and complex problems. Many of these problems may be undefined or difficult and require extensive investigation, research, experience, and testing to understand root causes and determine engineering solutions to address the underlying issue(s). During this process, you will collaborate and lead cross-functional teams to develop innovative solutions from concept to completion, often including customer deployment and associated readiness activities. You will recommend, develop, and/or implement new products, processes, operating plans, and standards that impact program results, improve upon existing practices, and align with internal and external objectives. In this role, you’ll contribute to functional strategies and operational goals, directing and contributing to activities that affect program execution and results. As a Senior Principal Engineer, you will communicate with internal and external stakeholders, including customers and vendors. You will also work to influence others to adopt your views, practices, and new concepts, and conduct briefings with internal senior leaders. The role requires expert-level knowledge in mechanical engineering principles and practice, acquired through a combination of education and experience. You may also possess knowledge of project management and related disciplines within your work area, identifying links and potential impacts on projects, programs, or systems. Additionally, you will support the Program Manager in meeting technical, cost, and schedule requirements while contributing to future strategies and customer needs. This role offers a unique and rewarding opportunity to drive technology development, lead mission support, and make meaningful impacts to the program, organization, and company. Security Clearance & Other Requirements: U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position requires a U.S. Top Secret Clearance. U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position will require the ability to access US only data systems Ability to travel to temporary assignments outside of the greater Washington DC Metropolitan area. Travel <10%. Required Skills: Candidate must possess an active TS/SCI security clearance A University Degree in Mechanical Engineering and minimum 10 years prior relevant experience, or an Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 7 years’ experience. Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment, handling diverse project tasks. Proficiency in test planning, reports, and procedure documentation. Strong understanding of material mechanics and engineering dynamics. Proficiency in MS Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Project). Experience with Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD, Creo). Experience in leading small technical teams. Ability to lift 50 pounds. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Desired Skills: Familiarity with Finite Element Analysis (FEA) tools. Passed the NCEES Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam or hold an active Professional Engineer’s (PE) license. Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Arlington, VA. To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors and communities to succeed. The following position is to join our Corporate or Research Center Team: Requires expert or mastery level knowledge of work area, typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience. May have deep knowledge of project management. Advanced knowledge of related disciplines within work area and ability to identify links and potential impact on projects, programs or systems. Typically requires: A University Degree or equivalent experience and minimum 10 years prior relevant experience, or An Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 7 years experience Engineering/Other Technical Positions: Typically requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and a minimum of 10 years of prior relevant experience unless prohibited by local laws/regulations. RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Privacy Policy and Terms: Click on this link to read the Policy and Terms

Mechanical Engineer engaged in changes to the design of complex electro-mechanical systems.General Function: Mechanical Engineer engaged in changes to the design of complex electro-mechanical systems. Essential Functions: Perform a variety of engineering work, including designing new parts or changing existing parts to improve and cost reduce products. Conceive and develop 3D part designs, manage 3D assemblies, and create detailed 2D drawings using SolidWorks. Participate in updating and maintaining mechanical development processes and procedures. Construct prototypes of new products and ensure that their designed usage meet the product specifications. Investigates and resolves operational problems in conjunction with other engineering and technical personnel. Compile technical data and information for use for project submittals. Knowledge of various materials (plastics, metal, sheet metal) and ways to process them (injection molding, casting, powdered metal, stamping). Experience in reviewing tool designs for injection molding, castings, and stampings. Defines, documents, analyzes, performs, and interprets test for new and/or modified products or product components. Experience with PPAP and other quality review processes. Must be capable of interacting in a team environment and working with others to achieve the best possible product from all functional viewpoints. Answer questions concerning products performance and capabilities. Manage, support and correct product related production issues when problems arise on the production floor. Works with other engineering disciplines to increase production quality, efficiency, or through-put of manufacturing. Provides technical support and advice to various technical and non-technical personnel. Works with outside suppliers in establishing or modifying specifications for purchased items. Devises and applies testing procedures for parts or sub-assemblies received from outside vendors. Perform life cycle testing on proposed cost reducing material to ensure that they meet the product specifications. Supports product certification by outside agency (e.g., UL) to applicable safety and performance codes or standards to obtain product approvals and certifications. Demonstrated analytical skills which should include FEA, statistical analysis, DOE, DFMEA, DFM, and tolerance stack up analysis. Other duties as assigned by supervisor.Education: BS/MS in Mechanical Engineering Experience/Skills Required: 7+ years mechanical design and integration experience for electro-mechanical products, preferably in a high-volume manufacturing industry. Strong knowledge of mechanical engineering methodology. Strong decision-making requiring detail analysis and investigation with solutions requiring original thinking. Excellent problem solving and analytical skills. Experience with Engineering Change Notice Processes (ECN/ECR’s). Ability to self-manage multi-projects, multi-task, and work alone or in a team setting. Operate as a member of cross-functional teams involved at every stage of design and development in collaboration with colleagues in other engineering functions as well as production, research, marketing, and after-sales service. Solid modeling required; SolidWorks is preferred. Ability to use power tools, hand tools, drill presses, band saw, calipers, and torque wrench. Must have strong interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and in written. Ability to use personal computer, calculator, copy machine, fax, telephone, presentation systems and printers. MS Office experience required. Knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing. Ability to work long hours, if needed. Travel, as required. (Less than 10%)

column7: At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams! With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation. Ford Model E is responsible for developing the key technologies and capabilities – such as EV platforms, batteries, e-motors, inverters, charging and recycling – to create ground-up, breakthrough electric vehicles. By joining the best software, engineering, design and UX talent, you will be a part of creating new technologies and concepts that can be applied across the Ford enterprise. Being on the Ford Model E team means building the future as Ford’s center of innovation and growth through electric and connected vehicles and services.   Current Seating commodities include structures, mechanisms, actuators, cushions, wire harnesses, controllers, sensors, software, trims and so on. However, future seating solutions are not limited to these. Progression is targeted. A seat can be defined as a product which enables comfortable support for vehicular occupants. In some sense, a seat can be viewed as a moving robotic structural art piece.   Team members typically play dual roles as experts and polymaths. Each team member typically uses their particular expertise as a superpower to complement the team. You shall be part of the Seating Engineering Team which resides within Ford Model E -Vehicle Engineering Group.   What You’ll Do  As a Seating System Structure Engineer, your role will focus on the design, development, and optimization of the structural components and systems of automotive seating. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the creation of safe, durable, and efficient seating structures that meet industry standards and customer requirements.The minimum requirements we seek: B.S. in Mechanical Engineering or a related field 3+ years of experience designing, developing, and releasing one or more Seat structure components. 2+ years of experience using 3D CAD software collaboratively (Catia V5/V6, 3DX, etc.) 1+ year of experience in the production release process 1+ year of experience in a factory setting launching a new product Preferred Requirements: Master's Degree in Engineering Excellent understanding of GD&T standards High level of expertise and proficiency with Catia, Enovia, or similar tools including drawing and modelling practices and methodologies Hands-on experience building and launching automotive products Experience with Microsoft Office applications and other information management tools Strong written and verbal communication skills A degree in Mechanical Engineering, Certificate of Accomplishment from a recognized Design educational institution, or equivalent skills and expertise Experience using Confluence, Jira, Asana, or other project management tools An eagerness to work cross-functionally in a dynamic environment where you are part of a high performing team A system approach to design and development with the desire and curiosity to strive for exceptional delivery execution and continuous improvement  What you’ll receive in return: As part of the Ford family, you’ll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You’ll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition. If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we’d love to have you join us. Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is available for this position. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.Key Responsibilities : Structural Design and Development: Design and develop the structural components and systems of automotive seating, including seat frames, backrest structures, headrests, and mounting brackets. Utilize CAD software to create 3D models and generate detailed engineering drawings of seating structures. Ensure compliance with safety standards, regulatory requirements, and customer specifications. Collaborate with industrial designers, mechanical engineers, and material experts to optimize the structural design for performance, weight reduction, and cost-effectiveness. Material Selection and Analysis: Select appropriate materials for seating structures based on performance requirements, weight considerations, and manufacturing constraints. Conduct material testing and analysis to ensure compliance with industry standards and safety regulations. Collaborate with suppliers and material experts to evaluate and validate material properties and suitability for the seating structures. Perform structural analysis using simulation software and finite element analysis (FEA) to evaluate and optimize the structural integrity and durability of seating components. Validation and Testing: Develop test plans and perform validation testing to evaluate the performance, durability, and safety of seating structures. Analyze test data, identify issues or areas for improvement, and propose design modifications. Collaborate with testing laboratories and internal teams to conduct physical and virtual tests, such as static and dynamic load testing, vibration testing, and crash simulations. Ensure compliance with relevant industry standards, including FMVSS (Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards) and ECE (Economic Commission for Europe) regulations. Documentation and Reporting: Create detailed engineering documentation 3d modelling and 2D drawings, including specifications, design guidelines, technical reports, and test procedures. Prepare and deliver technical presentations to internal teams, clients, and stakeholders. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of design changes, test results, and project progress. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop manufacturing and assembly guidelines for seating structures. Collaboration and Project Management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including industrial designers, mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, and suppliers, to ensure seamless integration of structural components with other subsystems. Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources to ensure timely delivery of projects. Communicate effectively with internal teams, suppliers, and customers to address technical queries and ensure project success.

POSITION OVERVIEWThe Senior Mechanical Design Engineer is responsible for the documentation and specification of equipment for mechanical solutions for both new and existing electric motors/coil/actuator assemblies in a cross-functional engineering team environment. This position has direct contact with the customers to understand their specification/needs and determine the best solution. The ideal candidate will approach the solutions from a systems standpoint and be capable of leading the project through the design/development process. The candidate would take direction from the project manager or engineering manager but needs to be capable of managing the day-to-day work on his/her own.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSHighly skilled at converting customer requirements into electro-mechanical solutions.Self-starter, capable of maintaining project organization throughout production process.Understands the applications and implications of GD&T and its effects on the manufacturability and inspection of the parts.Able to generate tolerance stack-up studies for mechanical components and assemblies.Work with product development project teams as the engineering design lead.Participate in hands on troubleshooting activities, cost-reduction activities, component evaluations, and other manufacturing initiatives.Collaborates with the test organization to define the testing requirements that align with customer specifications.Highly adept at organizing projects from initial directives through fabrication, assembly, QC, and initial production.Occasional regional and international travel is required (up to 20%)Requirements:  CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS & PREFERRED ExperienceS. in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience is required.At least 10 years of experience in design and development with a strong emphasis in the manufacturing processAt least 5 years of electric motor design experience is required.Solenoid, electromechanical machines, gear, or power screw design experience a plus.Strong materials and finish background preferred.Experience in Aerospace or Military Industry is a plus.Minimum of five years of experience doing detailed CAD design. Solidworks strongly preferred. A working knowledge of stress, strain FEA and thermal analysis packages that are available in SolidWorks is beneficial.Hands on troubleshooting and design for manufacturability experienceUnderstanding quality requirements and how inspection will inspect a component based on detailed drawing specifications/tolerances.Please note: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYERMTI Motion is an equal employment opportunity (EEOC) employer such that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age or other legally protected status.We will ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact MTI Motion to request accommodation.DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSIONAt MTI Motion, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you are excited about this role but your experience does not align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or another role. Compensation: TBD

Our Purpose: At Lovesac, were committed to helping people fill their homes with Total Comfort. That means having furniture that can evolve along with them as life unfolds. From Sactionals The Worlds Most Adaptable Couch, to Sacs The Worlds Most Comfortable Seat, Lovesac products provide peace of mind where others cant. Our products can adapt to fit almost any space and style and look like new forever. This enables a new way of living, where people can continue to invest in, add to, and evolve their furniture instead of adding it to the landfill, which is good for families and our environment. What We Believe: Love. It is the name we live up to. It is purposefully and meaningfully woven into every aspect of our business. We champion building meaningful relationships as we foster a culture that embraces and celebrates the experiences, beliefs, backgrounds, expertise, talent, and individuality of everyone. We seek to promote love and happiness with all that we do. #LoveMatters We are committed to working and succeeding by incorporating our Guiding Principles into every aspect of our business: We can all win together Doing less and doing better We are borrowing this earth from our children Home is where life happens Love matters The Role: Currently we are seeking to hire a Sr. Product Engineer to join our St. George, Utah team. As a Sr. Product Engineer, you will be responsible for collaborating on the conception, design and construction of core Lovesac branded product innovations. You will work closely with the company’s founders, cross functional partners, and the product design team to execute on new product initiatives while leveraging your knowledge and experience in engineering, analysis, design process, CAD, materials and manufacturing. You will augment our internal design team’s capabilities while also providing guidance to outside partners and create the future of the brand. This position is considered hybrid and will report into Lovesac Corporate Headquarters based in Saint George, Utah. It will require a hybrid schedule calling for your flexibility to work onsite at the designated HUB or Retail touchpoints as needed in addition to travel required by the Company for occasional meetings and conferences. Summary of Key Job Responsibilities Adopt the Lovesac DFL (Designed for Life) philosophy and use it to guide your design. Design Engineering Follow a specific development process to help design furniture and home accessories including, but not limited to wood, plastic, metal, foam, composites, electronics, lighting, fabric, etc. Create accurate 3D models, drawings using Solidworks on a daily basis to help facilitate injection molding, manufacturing, sourcing and quality control. Own and manage several projects concurrently from end to end (design concept to production) from an engineering perspective. Validate your designs through testing/evaluation methods that you develop. Create detailed production drawings and other data, and communicate those to the factories and the production team, so they can produce high quality product accurately. Collaborate with vendors, contact factories and suppliers both overseas and domestically in sampling, designing, and execution of new product launches. Manage communication with 3rd party factory project managers, technicians and engineers through the sampling and production phases to ensure timelines stay on track for launch. Establish QC test criteria and plans for production. Purchase and expedite test equipment if needed. Troubleshoot production launch issues and approve items through a specific product launch process. Prototype your designs using various methods and materials. Use and maintain 3D printers, metal/wood working tools, test equipment and general shop tools. Work collaboratively with the design and marketing teams to create products that meet or exceed the conditions of research informed product briefs. Manage and maintain the organization of design files. Conduct basic cost estimates and coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure projects meet budgets. Act with integrity and trust at all times, promoting the core values of the company. Meet or exceed all goals and key performance indicators (KPIs). Responsible to meet or exceed all goals and key performance indicators (KPIs). Responsible to meet or exceed all goals and key performance indicators (KPIs). Maintain a calm demeanor and manage issues professionally and respectfully in accordance with our company standards. Act with integrity and trust, modeling behavior that respects our employees, peers and customers in accordance with the core values of our company. Perform any other duties as requested by management. Requirements & Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in mechanical engineering or 10+ years’ experience working in a similar industry, furniture industry preferred (design role or production role). A minimum of 7 years’ experience in designing consumer products or furniture. Direct experience in plastics design, furniture, and mechanism design, consumer electronics/audio equipment, and home automation is preferred. Experience programming and building prototypes utilizing Arduino, or similar electronics prototyping is a plus. Machine shop experience including CNC machining, welding, woodworking is a plus. Experience designing and prototyping looks like and works like mechanisms is a requirement. Experience working with overseas vendors is required. Able to listen, take direction and utilize input to solve problems, anticipate issues and make correct decisions. Must have solid experience with Solidworks and/or Creo: modeling, assemblies, drawings, GD&T, injection molding design, FEA and other simulation tools, Sheet Metal etc. Proficiency utilizing MS Office: Outlook, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, Sharepoint. Experience with Wrike a plus. Design for manufacturing, knowledge of materials, rapid visualization, contextual research. Prototyping skills: including 3D printing, woodworking. Must take accountability and responsibility for your actions. Must have the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines consistently. Must have superior communication skills; verbal, written and interpersonal skills; able to listen effectively to solve problems, anticipate issues and make effective decisions. Demonstrates strong analytical, mathematical and problem-solving skills. Maintains the highest level of customer service, creating solutions and experiences that drive business results and engagement with the brand. Must work collaboratively with fellow employees, treating all clients, both internal and external with dignity and respect at all times. Must comply with the standards, policies and procedures outlined in the Lovesac Employee Handbook. Must be capable of using and operating all equipment as required, including but not limited to: iPad, laptop, etc. Be able to move objects (including medium to large furniture items up to 75 pounds) from a lower to a higher position or horizontally from position-to-position or be able to assemble furniture while working on the selling floor or in our warehouse. Must be able to travel, as required by the Company in its sole discretion, for occasional meetings and conferences using various forms of transportation. Consistent ability to work both remotely and report into Corporate Headquarters or designated retail touchpoint, as required and in accordance with Lovesac policies, CDC and State Guidelines. Must possess a strong work ethic and exemplify The Lovesac Values: Lovesac Core Values Audacious Dreamers Willing to sweep the floors Grit Aspirational Values  Customer Centricity Only A Players Executional Excellence Consciousness Table-Stakes Values  Positivity Flexibility Inclusivity Insatiable Learning Passion Collaboration Empathy Transparency Full Time Benefits* Financial Benefits: Annual Bonus Program, Annual and Inaugural Grant Equity Awards, 401K Matching Contribution, Financial Wellness Tools, Sales Incentive Program. Health and Wellness Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Paid Parental Leave, Life/AD&D, Short Term and Long-Term Disability, Critical Illness and Accident Insurance, Employee Assistance Program. Paid Time Off: Up to 120 hours of paid time off within our fiscal calendar year, prorated from date of hire, 8 paid company recognized holidays, Summer Flex Time. Pet Insurance and generous Associate Discounts. Eligibility and terms for all benefits listed are as outlined in Lovesac’s policy and plan documents. Associate pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level and competencies. Our customers have the opportunity to shop with us seven days a week and select positions may require availability outside of normal working hours. Lovesac is an Equal Opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, marital status, disability, military status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Disclaimer: The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals employed in this position. This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required in this position. The job may change as the business changes or customer need changes or may vary somewhat from location to location. Management retains the right, authority, and discretion to add or change the duties of the position at any time. Associates must learn and observe applicable company policies and safe practices, as well as perform all duties assigned by supervisors. This job description does not constitute an employment contract. To the extent an employee requires a reasonable accommodation in order to perform the duties of this job, please direct such requests to The Lovesac People Department.

About Quartus Quartus Engineering Incorporated (www.quartus.com) is a leading provider of engineering services and integrated hardware solutions for a wide range of clients and industries. We employ advanced computer-aided engineering tools in the areas of optics, structural, thermal, and coupled analyses. We couple our engineering analysis capabilities with design, prototype, integration and test capabilities to create solutions for our clients that are of extraordinary value. What will you do? As a Structural Analyst in our Herndon, VA office, you will create, modify, and maintain structural finite element models (FEMs) of components and systems, with applications ranging from stress analysis to structural dynamics/environments development. Essential Job Functions:Perform structural finite element analysis (FEA) for a range of solutions and load types, including static, nonlinear, thermal distortion, modal, structural dynamics (vibration & shock)Perform structural-thermal-optical-performance (STOP) analysis for optical components and systemsAssist in redesign and optimization of structures and systems not meeting load & environment requirementsPresent findings to the project team, company, or customerCreate reports to document analysis results, conclusions, and recommendations Who is right for the job? Successful candidates must be highly collaborative team player who are committed to Quartus values: People First, Integrity, Curiosity and Bold. We hire resourceful individuals with a passion for learning and an ability to apply engineering principles and techniques to solve a variety of problems. What are we looking for?BS and/or MS in Mechanical, Aerospace, Structural, or similar Engineering field8+ years of work experience with heavy emphasis on FEAExperience or expertise in HyperMesh is required (FEMAP, NASTRAN, ABAQUS, ANSYS experience a plus)Experience in one of the following areas: Spacecraft, Aeronautics, Composite Structures, Optical SystemsMust be a US Person (US Citizen or US Permanent Resident) Preferred Qualifications:Experience with or interest in learning multibody dynamic analysis of mechanismsExperience or expertise with static, modal, and/or vibration test planning, analytical direction, and correlation is highly desirableExperience or expertise in coding with MATLAB, Python, or similar is highly desirable Compensation and Benefits Senior Engineer pay range: $114,609.25 - 187,270.02*This pay range represents base pay. In addition, you may be eligible for additional benefits and compensation. Referral eligibility: Tier 2 Quartus is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to employing a diverse workforce, including, but not limited to, minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans. Quartus provides comprehensive benefits including competitive salary, discretionary performance-based bonus, employee stock ownership plan, medical, dental, vision, and 401k plan with company match.

Job Title : Senior Design EngineerLocation : Red Oak, TX 75154Duration : 12 MonthsJob Description:Senior Design Engineer to be a part of the Sustaining Engineering and Product Support team.Degree level or equivalent in Aeronautical or Mechanical Engineering preferred, with a minimum of 5 to 10 years of experience in Aerospace Design and design & analysis dispositions of Composite and/or metallic components.Experience in stress analysis using classical methods and commercial FEA toolsPerform structural analysis and concessions independently and supervise entry level analystsEssential skills:Excellent knowledge of AerospaceExperience of CATIA V5 is essential with a good ability in 3D modelling and 2D drawing work.Experience with GD&TGood experience of aerospace Composite (honeycomb) /Metallic materials and manufacturing processesGood knowledge of Microsoft officeCustomer focused/Ability to establish credibility with internal and external customersUnderstanding of processes: ECRs, Concessions.Awareness of A/C industry standards, regulations and qualification requirementsGood English verbal and written communication skillsAble to work to tight, demanding deadlines and customer demandsAbility to work effectively within an integrated project teamExperience in scripting using MATLAB, VB,TCL/Tk, Python is an added advantageKnowledge of Hand Calculations, Standards and Design codes is an added advantageJob Type: ContractAbility to commute/relocate:Red Oak, TX 75154: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Work Location: In person

Date Posted: 2023-09-28  Country: United States of America  Location: HFL33: US049-Medley, FL 9100 NW 105 Circle , Medley, FL, 33178 USA  Position Role Type: Onsite  We are hiring for a Senior Certification Engineer onsite, in Miami, FL. Reporting to the Certification Manager, the Sr. Certification Engineer will be responsible for the research, planning, and execution of the FAA certification process for business jet aircraft seats and seating components. This position does offer relocation. Primary Responsibilities: Performs standard engineering assignments usually representing a significant portion of a larger project. Selects engineering techniques to solve problems and make design decisions. Represents the Structural Certification team in internal technical and design reviews. Compiles FAA certification documentation for submission to aircraft OEM's and regulatory agencies. Responsible for the review and approval of design changes for certification substantiation. Supports design optimization tasks (e.g. weight reduction, certification by analysis). Leads component level and certification testing as required. Performs material selection and material specification correlation. Participates as a team member in a specific phase of a broad engineering project. Directs preparation of appropriate documentation for assigned projects. Provides technical leadership to a small group of temporarily assigned engineers and technicians. Ensures successful completion of the assigned project phase within the budgeted time and cost constraints. Participates in defining of engineering approaches and in planning/scheduling work. Basic Qualifications: Typically requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) unless prohibited by local laws/regulations and minimum 5 years prior relevant experience or an Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 3 years of experience or in absence of a degree, 9 years of relevant experience. Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship now or in the future. RTX will not offer sponsorship for this position. Preferred Qualifications: Ability to work with various organizations/product lanes internally and support the team to success. Familiarity with various tasks involved in certification and testing of airplane interior components. 3 or more years of Engineering and/or Certification/Test experience Ability to identify and understand failure modes of systems. Prior experience reviewing and approving drawings. Working knowledge of PMA/TSO/STC/OEM qualification and certification. Demonstrated ability to work effectively and productively with team members and cross functional teams. Prior experience reviewing and approving drawings. Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to prepare and give presentations. Experience and familiarity with FEA modeling applications including the review of analysis results is preferred but not required. Ability to work proficiently in Microsoft Office Suite applications and engineering related software programs. Collins Aerospace, an RTX company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio, and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market. At Collins Aerospace, our Interiors team is focused on innovation, safety and cost efficiency. But we don’t just get people from point A to point B. We’re committed to making air travel more comfortable, connected, and secure. As a leader in aviation interior products and services we’re helping airlines and original equipment manufacturers create a positive experience for their customers. With offices and manufacturing facilities in more than 12 states across the U.S. and more than 10 countries around the globe, we’re changing the game of aircraft interiors. Are you ready to join our team? Collins Aerospace Diversity & Inclusion Statement: Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility. WE ARE REDEFINING AEROSPACE. Please consider the following role type definitions as you apply for this role. Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance employees, as they are essential to the development of our products. Regardless of your role type, collaboration and innovation are critical to our business and all employees will have access to digital tools so they can work with colleagues around the world – and access to Collins sites when their work requires in-person meetings. Some of our competitive benefits package includes: Medical, dental, and vision insurance Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employees Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution, including a Lifetime Income Strategy option. Tuition reimbursement program Student Loan Repayment Program Life insurance and disability coverage Optional coverages you can buy pet insurance, home and auto insurance, additional life and accident insurance, critical illness insurance, group legal, ID theft protection. Birth, adoption, parental leave benefits Ovia Health, fertility, and family planning Adoption Assistance Autism Benefit Employee Assistance Plan, including up to 10 free counseling sessions. Healthy You Incentives, wellness rewards program Doctor on Demand, virtual doctor visits Bright Horizons, child and elder care services Teladoc Medical Experts, second opinion program And more! Nothing matters more to Collins Aerospace than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen. Note: Background check and drug screen required (every external new hire in the U.S.) Drug Screen only performed on re-hires who have been gone for more than 1 year. At Collins, the paths we pave together lead to limitless possibility. And the bonds we form – with our customers and with each other - propel us all higher, again and again. Apply now and be part of the team that’s redefining aerospace, every day. RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. At SimuTech Group, we truly believe that we are driving innovation and changing the world through the power of engineering simulation. Our growing team of energetic, tech savvy professionals work hard every day to inspire our clients to push the boundaries of innovation and deliver transformational products. If you are motivated and driven by a culture where excellent work ethic and passion are rewarded, then a career with SimuTech Group may be for you! Looking for your next career move? Help today’s engineers build tomorrow’s products by providing solutions and guidance with the power of simulation. We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer with 8 to 10 years of experience to join our world-class FEA Support and Consulting team! This position would be based out of either SimuTech office in Rochester, NY, or Everett, WA. For the right candidate, a remote position can be accommodated elsewhere in the US. The right candidate will become a key member of our technical staff, working in an exciting and challenging technical environment. Success of the Mechanical Engineer will be measured by helping grow SimuTech’s FEA business and developing your own technical skills by solving challenging problems in a wide variety of industries. Each member of our staff is a FEA expert who also maintains expertise in one or more specialized fields. Many of our engineers hold advanced degrees with extensive experience in the engineering consulting business. We maintain a high level of professionalism in a friendly, cooperative, flexible environment. Location: Flexible Essential Job Functions/Accountabilities: The Mechanical Engineer will use software such as ANSYS Mechanical and Mechanical APDL to provide: 1. Technical Support - Provide Support to end users of ANSYS by phone, e-mail, or in person. 2. Pre-sales Support - Work with our account managers to determine the customer's software needs, answer customer technical questions during the sales process and provide software demos/presentations on a variety of subjects. 3. Consulting Work with customers to determine their analysis requirements and expectations. Develop quotes/proposals by determining scopes, costs, and schedules Perform all aspects of analysis (Meshing, Load Cases, Solving, Post Processing, Conclusions) Work with customers to propose alternative design ideas Write analysis reports and other technical documents requested by the customer 4. Technical Training - Teach ANSYS classes at client sites, on-line, and in SimuTech offices across the U.S. and Canada Desired Skills/Experience: Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria: Must be permanently authorized to work in the US Professional appearance and presentation required. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Must be able to work well in a group and independently. Excellent English-based communication skills, technical writing and verbal skills required. Documented industry experience with enterprise level finite element analysis tools Ansys (preferred). Abacus, Nastran, Altair, etc. Ability to communicate with customers on a technical pre-sales basis to help drive software and services sales Demonstrates creative problem-solving and strong analytical skills Solid theoretical background in structural mechanics and numerical methods backed up by real-world, production-level experience Documented experience (as evidenced by industry experience and/or publications in reputable journals) in:             Structural linear and non-linear static implicit analysis methods (non-linear materials including plasticity and hyper elasticity as well as contact and large strain/large deformation) Implicit dynamics including linear (modal, harmonic, response spectrum, random vibration) and thermal analysis including both steady-state and time domain transient. ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code Analyses Methods Kinematics and Rigid Body Dynamics Familiarity with grid generation and meshing techniques (Ansys CAE, Femap, Hypermesh) Personable attitude with an ability to work well with clients and other staff Bachelor's degree in engineering required; master's degree considered a plus Helpful Qualifications/Non-requirements: ANSYS programming skills, including GUI customization in J-script and Python Explicit dynamics modeling experience (crash impact, metal forming simulations, etc.) using LS-Dyna, Autodyn, or Abaqus Explicit Ability to use 3-D CAD to modify parts and assemblies (Discovery (preferred), SpaceClaim Direct Modeler (preferred), DM, Solidworks, ProE or Siemens NX ) Practical ANSYS experience manipulating and/or modeling complex 3-D assemblies Academic background or work experience in fluid mechanics and CFD Experience with optimization and DOE methods LF/Maxwell experience Concrete modeling experience a plus. Benefits: Medical insurance 100% paid for by employer (no employee out-of-pocket costs required for the premiums, deductibles, and copays) Dental insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Vision insurance premiums 100% paid for by employer Short Term Disability Long Term Disability 401k Plan with employer match Limited Flexible Spending Account Life Insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Referral program Tuition reimbursement Bonus plan Pay Range: $80,000 - 130,000 Annually ABOUT THE COMPANY: We have a 35+ year relationship with ANSYS and we are their largest Elite Channel Partner in North America. We provide world-class ANSYS engineering simulation software as well as support, training, consulting and physical testing services. We are headquartered in Rochester, NY with additional offices in Cleveland, Seattle, Montreal, and Toronto. We also have remote sales and engineering personnel throughout North America. SimuTech Group employs over 140 people with nearly half being engineers; most holding Master's or PhD degrees. SimuTech Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Description:   Position Summary Senior Project Engineers act as the technical lead for engineering projects, and also help mentor Project Engineers, Mechanical/Electrical Engineers, and Mechanical/Electrical Designers. They direct, coordinate, and oversee the project design team in the execution of the mechanical, systems, and electrical design of equipment for the metallurgical, specialty metals, and aerospace industries by providing in-depth technical guidance and supervision. Job Responsibilities / Act as an engineering project team leader by providing assignments, overseeing work, and providing detailed technical guidance for the design team. / Responsible for approving, in detail, all final designs, design changes, specifications, and drawing releases and ensuring their compliance with engineering principles, company standards, customer contract requirements, and related specifications. / Research, analyze, plan, organize, and coordinate all engineering design efforts for a given project, including the development of engineering project schedule, budget, and staffing needs to support overall program goals. / Conduct internal and external design reviews that address project requirements and incorporate input from customers, vendors, engineering colleagues, designers, and operations personnel. / Develop clear and concise engineering specifications for design and/or procurement of subsystems, components, and engineering services. / Provide technical support for the Sales Department including System sizing analysis, equipment conceptual and detailed layouts, customer visits, and cost analysis. / Review documents such as customer design specifications and requests for quotes to determine feasibility of design and applicability of Retech products to customer needs. / Generate high quality written reports, proposals, instructions, manuals, and other documentation that may be distributed to customers, internal users, or the public at large. / Provides reports on the status of project milestones and adjusts schedules accordingly. / Support fabrication and installation activities to ensure products and systems conform to engineering design and customer specifications. / Develop written methods and procedures for testing equipment and systems. Requirements:   Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills Required / BSME from a four-year college or university. / 10+ years of experience working as a Project Engineer, or similar, preferably designing high temperature furnaces, heavy material handling equipment, or other capital equipment. / Experience with Autodesk Inventor, Solidworks, or another 3D CAD program. / General understanding of OSHA requirements as it applies to capital equipment. / Experience in the design and sizing of vacuum systems is a plus. / Experience in the design of material handling equipment. / Experience with industrial schematics or P&IDs. / Working knowledge of Vacuum Metallurgy and various melting technologies. / Ability to develop project plans, maintain project schedules, adhere to budget. / Working knowledge of recognized industry standards. / Ability to perform heat transfer analysis and energy balance on complex systems. / Strong stress analysis skills. / Working knowledge of FEA analysis. Personal Skills/Attributes required for the Position / Proven track record of generating innovative and practical ideas. / Excellent verbal and written communication skills for both internal and external customers. / Exceptional organization skills with attention to detail. / Ability to be proactive and manage time effectively to meet deadlines. / Detail-orientated with ability to respond quickly to a fast-moving and ever-changing environment. / Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Physical Demands / The employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, hear and talk. / The employee is frequently required to use hands. / The employee occasionally will be required to reach with hands or arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, and crawl. / The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. / Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and depth perception. / The work environment is an office setting with periodic need to visit the plant floor. / This position may be required to work long hours extending into the weekends on some occasions. May also need to travel for short or extended trips as needed. Must be able and willing to travel to international and domestic sites for sales, installation, and customer service support. / Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The Air Combat Command's 67th Cyberspace Wing (67 CW), 346th Test Squadron (346TS) plans, executes, and contributes as both an operational and participating test organization in a full array of operational tests of various cyber weapons in coordination with the 318 Range Squadron (318RANS) who provides instrumented cyber range services, through both physical hardware and virtual systems. In support of this mission, ANALYGENCE is seeking a Senior Test Engineer to plan, prepare, and execute test systems to evaluate results against specifications and requirements as well as analyze and report test results. Specifically, the Senior Test Engineer shall: Determine level of assurance of developed capabilities based on test results Develop test plans to address specifications and requirements Handle test notifications, test concept development, test planning, execution, reporting and close-out phases of all test projects Provide personnel for the following test types: Operational Assessments (OA), Early Operational Assessments (EOA), Operational Utility evaluations (OUE), Initial Operational Test and Evaluations (IOT&E), Tactics Development and Evaluations (TD&E), Force Development Evaluations (FDE), Combined Operational and Developmental Testing (DT/OT), Developmental Operations testing (DEVOPS), TEMPEST (Emission Security testing), Unified Capabilities (UC) testing, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), including Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and Cyber Security Assessments (Vulnerability Assessments, Compliance Assessments and Penetration Testing) Install and maintain network infrastructure device operating system software (e.g., IOS, firmware). Make recommendations based on test results Determine scope, infrastructure, resources, and data sample size to ensure system requirements are adequately demonstrated Create auditable evidence of security measures Validate specifications and requirements for testability Analyze the results of software, hardware, or interoperability testing Perform developmental testing on systems under development Perform interoperability testing on systems exchanging electronic information with other systems. Perform operational testing Test, evaluate, and verify hardware and/or software to determine compliance with defined specifications and requirements Record and manage test data Current Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility. Bachelor's degree in a related field and a minimum of 12 years of experience as a Test Engineer. IAT Level II certification required. Experience with Cyber Mission Systems, Air Force Weapon Systems. Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies. Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk), laws, regulations, policies, and ethics as they relate to cybersecurity and privacy. Experience with cybersecurity and privacy principles, cyber threats and vulnerabilities, specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses. Knowledge of information technology (IT) supply chain security and supply chain risk management policies, requirements, and procedures. Knowledge of critical infrastructure systems with information communication technology that were designed without system security considerations. Knowledge of network security architecture concepts including topology, protocols, components, and principles (e.g., application of defense-in-depth). Knowledge of security architecture concepts and enterprise architecture reference models (e.g., Zachman, Federal Enterprise Architecture [FEA]). Knowledge of security models (e.g., Bell-LaPadula model, Biba integrity model, Clark-Wilson integrity model). Knowledge of cybersecurity-enabled software products. Knowledge of Test & Evaluation processes for learners. Knowledge of network protocols such as TCP/IP, Dynamic Host Configuration, Domain Name System (DNS), and directory services. Experience conducting test events, designing a data analysis structure (i.e., the types of data a test must generate and how to analyze that data), determining an appropriate level of test rigor for a given system, developing operations-based testing scenarios, systems integration testing. Experience writing code in a currently supported programming language (e.g., Java, C++), writing test plans, evaluating test plans for applicability and completeness, conducting Test Readiness Reviews, designing and documenting overall program Test & Evaluation strategies, identifying Test & Evaluation infrastructure (people, ranges, tools, instrumentation) requirements. Skill in managing test assets, test resources, and test personnel to ensure effective completion of test events, preparing Test & Evaluation reports and providing Test & Evaluation resource estimate. Ability to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation). Our people-first culture drives mission success. ANALYGENCE provides leading-edge technology and result-focused solutions that address the infinite variables that affect our clients’ goals in the cyberspace, intelligence, and mission support domains. Born out of diverse backgrounds and forged through government, military and industry experience, our team members are the backbone of our solutions. Our various perspectives advance capabilities and drive successful operations. Through our purpose-driven team culture, the productivity and effectiveness of critical missions are amplified. Our vision is to continue to build an environment that encourages our people to evolve by applying a foundation of core values to everything we do. We focus on adding value to people so that they can bring value to others, and this culture drives our relentless pursuit of exceptional mission critical results. ANALYGENCE is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decision without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

You will be involved in the design, fabrication, and construction of industrial projects as well as project management. STV Incorporated is seeking a Sr. Structural Engineer, Illinois, S.E. candidate to join our Bridge practice in our Chicago, IL operation. More than 100 years old, the firm provides comprehensive architectural, engineering, planning, environmental, and construction management services for public and private sector clients. STV is an award-winning national leader consistently ranking among the country's top companies in the design and planning of transportation and infrastructure projects. Our success is the direct result of our employees' commitment to innovation and quality across all 40 offices and over 2500 people nationwide.   STV has been providing bridge engineering services as one of the premier consultants in the transportation industry. Our Chicago office provides bridge design and inspection services to transit agencies and municipalities throughout the State, as well as for contractors on design build projects. This is a great opportunity to join a growing, highly motivated, and successful team that has played a significant role in numerous major transportation projects throughout the region and the United States.   We have an immediate need for a Senior-level Structural engineer (S.E.) to join our Transportation and Infrastructure Team, ideally located in our Chicago, IL office. This position will assist in leading design and analysis of highway, rail and pedestrian bridges and associated structures. We are looking for a motivated individual who wants to be part of a successful, growing practice within a firm that values integrity, determination and drive and rewards individuals accordingly. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to interact with clients on a regular basis and contribute to business development efforts. This is an excellent opportunity for a creative, self-motivated, and detail-oriented professional looking to take their career to the next level.   Responsibilities Include:    Lead a team of Bridge Engineers in the Bridge Practice in our Chicago office. Provide design and analysis of bridges and related structures Support Complex Prequalification’s Perform FEA Support structural design on selected projects and lead assigned tasks as appropriate Support preparation of technical and cost proposals to win work Assist Senior staff in oversight of project delivery to ensure projects meet or exceed forecasted profit margins Provide leadership and direction by mentoring and motivating junior staff Work with managers, project engineers, and discipline leads to develop budgets, schedules, and project delivery plans Proactively drive safety and ensure that health and safety practices are maintained Assist in maintaining quality of project deliverables produced by the Bridge Group Foster and manage client relationships at appropriate levels to help procure new business.  Some evenings will be spent at professional society meetings where you will work to develop and maintain relationships with clients, teaming partners, and potential technical staff hires.   Qualifications Include:    Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering; Master’s degree preferred, but not required Minimum of 12 years of progressive design experience on structural engineering projects Illinois S.E. license Experience with complex bridge design Solid structural analysis and design skills with an understanding of related engineering disciplines needed to complete transportation and infrastructure projects Project management skills and ability to plan and coordinate work efforts needed to meet deadlines Strong interpersonal and communication skills with ability to form effective relationships with staff and clients    Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.    STV offers the following benefits • Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account • Dental insurance • Vision insurance • Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable) • Disability insurance • Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment • 401(k) Plan • Retirement Counseling • Employee Assistance Program • Paid Time Off (16 days) • Paid Holidays (8 days) • Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year) • Parental Leave (up to 80 hours) • Continuing Education Program • Professional Licensure and Society Memberships

POSITION OVERVIEWThe Principal Mechanical Design Engineer is responsible for the technical oversight of multiple New Product Development (NPD) projects. These NPD projects include the mechanical design, documentation, and specification of electrical machines for both new and existing electric motors/coil/actuator assemblies. This role requires the technical mentoring and guidance of other design engineers in the proper design of electric motors, coils, and actuators. Additionally, this person would be directly responsible for marque NPD design projects. This position has direct contact with the customers to understand their specification/needs and determine the best solution. The ideal candidate will approach the solutions from a systems standpoint and be capable of leading the project through the design/development process. The candidate would take direction from the program manager or engineering manager but needs to highly autonomous and capable of directing projects from a technical perspective.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSDeveloping and executing a standardized method of electrical machine design throughout the department.Highly skilled at converting customer requirements into electro-mechanical solutions.Self-starter, capable of maintaining project organization throughout the New Product Development process.Responsible for CAD component and assembly modeling, drawing package creation and Engineering Specification creation.Understands the applications and implications of GD&T and its effects on the manufacturability and inspection of the parts.Able to generate tolerance stack-up studies for mechanical components and assemblies.Work with cross-functional NPD project teams as the engineering design lead or design oversight.Participate in hands on troubleshooting activities, cost-reduction activities, component evaluations, and other manufacturing initiatives.Collaborates with the test organization to define the testing requirements that align with customer specifications.Highly adept at organizing projects from initial directives through fabrication, assembly, QC, and initial production.Occasional regional and international travel is required (up to 20%)Requirements:  CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS & PREFERRED ExperienceS. in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience is required.At least 10 years of experience in mechanical design and development with a strong emphasis in the manufacturing process. Electric machine (motor/generator), solenoid, electromechanical machines, gear, or power screw design experience a plus.Strong materials and finish background preferred.Experience in Aerospace or Military Industry is a plus.Minimum of 10 years of experience doing detailed CAD design. Solidworks strongly preferred. A working knowledge of stress, strain FEA and thermal analysis packages that are available in SolidWorks is beneficial.Hands on troubleshooting and design for manufacturability experienceUnderstanding quality requirements and how inspection will inspect a component based on detailed drawing specifications/tolerances.Please note: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYERMTI Motion is an equal employment opportunity (EEOC) employer such that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age or other legally protected status.We will ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact MTI Motion to request accommodation.DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSIONAt MTI Motion, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you are excited about this role but your experience does not align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or another role. Compensation: TBD

Stress Analysis Engineer: Senior Structural Design Engineer – Major Cooking Appliances
column7: Midea America Corp., is one of the world’s largest home appliance brands, offering the most comprehensive selection of products in the world to fully serve the needs of day-to-day living at home, at work, or anywhere else you go. In North America we strive to aim high, put the customer first, transform and innovate the marketplace, utilizing our commitment, dedication, inclusion, and partnership with our teams. Midea America is a subsidiary of the Midea Group, a global company with over 150,000 employees and operations in more than 195 countries. As a publicly listed company, we are ranked #245 as a Fortune Global 500 company and offer one of the most comprehensive product portfolios in the industry. Description: The senior structural Engineer will play an essential role in R&D activities to deliver exceptional and market-leading products, with a strong focus on developing innovative features and applying new technologies to gas and electric major cooking appliances. Actively work and provide guidance for product development teams, from ideation to mass production stages. Collaborate, and provide innovative product designs, components, features, and accessories to grow Midea’s patent portfolio. Work with global engineering teams with some national and international travel. Essential Job Responsibilities: Lead and develop innovative mechanical and structural systems for gas and electric home cooking appliances, including but not limited to Ranges, Wall Ovens, and Combination Ovens. Use Lean, Six Sigma, and Reliability methodologies to ensure robust and qualified designs. Improve design using FEA for Structural, Packaging, and Thermal Conditions. Conduct laboratory testing to confirm the design and performance of products. Good experience with complex parts 3D modeling and GPLM- database administration. Validate product compliance to meet certification agency requirements (i.e., CSA, UL). Leading platform cost optimization and standardization projects. Goal-oriented and self-motivated, creative, and resourceful. Strong coaching skills with experience collaborating with remote teams. Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

Job Title: Senior Structural Engineer Location: Beaverton, Oregon Crow Engineering provides engineering design and consultancy services to its clients in the wood products, industrial, and mixed use facilities. The Structural Engineer is responsible for the design of industrial, Cold Storage, Commercial, and High-Density Residential structures for our clients. Typical projects would include: Design of new facilities, foundation and piling design and general arrangements for pre-engineered structures, repair and retrofit designs of damaged or aged facilities, seismic upgrades of facilities to meet code requirements. The individual would be responsible for generating high-quality designs and working with a team of designers and drafters to ensure our client’s requirements are being met. The individual would interact with Crow Engineering Project Managers to obtain timelines, scope, and expectations surrounding work. From time to time this individual will interface with key equipment vendors and clients. Crow Engineering has a highly tenured organization that has a wealth of experience in the wood products and heavy industrial industry, specifically with sawmill systems. We are looking for individuals who while respecting our experience, can help take it to new industries that would benefit from our services. It is expected from each of Crow Engineering’s team members that they can provide significant value to our clients. This value comes through providing high quality, safe and innovative and reliable design work that our clients respect the value of. All team members must provide value in their space as an extension of the overall Crow Engineering team. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Create structural designs, execute calculations, and build specifications for structures utilized in the markets we serve. Work with local jurisdictions to ensure proper permitting support documentation details are available based on client demands. Work closely with Project Managers to ensure client’s needs are being met in a timely, cost effective, and high-quality manner. Provide their own project management administration for small to medium sized projects. Generate construction estimation for projects they are responsible for. Provide a work product that is above average based on industry expectations that demand a value with our clients. Can handle moderately complicated structural tasks with little to no direction. Proactively escalates needs/road blocks to other project team members, project managers, owners, and outside vendors. Executes design work within AutoCAD, Revit, and structural calculation tool sets. Communicates with key vendors and suppliers to ensure incorporated design parameters are being integrated into the project accordingly. Ensures revision control is in place and effective when working on client designs. Can help build standards, best-known methods, and training documentation for future new hires. Can effectively work through difficult situations. Core Competencies: Strong English written/verbal skills. The ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision The ability to work under time constraints and adapt to change Working knowledge and experience with different structure and construction types. The ability to troubleshoot, diagnose and effectively communicate technical solutions to difficult issues Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and group situations to customers, vendors, and other employees of the organization Strong Design/Drafting skills within design software systems. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent attention to detail The ability to clearly document test results, configuration parameters, process and training materials Qualifications: A four-year engineering degree in Civil Engineering. Candidate must be an actively certified Professional Civil Engineer Candidate must have obtained their Structural Engineering certification or have >7 years of experience as a civil engineer specializing in structural designs. 3-5 Years work experience in a similar position. AutoCAD experience, or experience in similar systems to AutoCAD Experience with solid modeling systems is preferred. Client facing presentation skill is highly preferred. Experience with engineering change order and version control systems. Excellent written and verbal communication skills In-depth knowledge of process driven manufacturing facilities. Proven work experience with generating engineering/FEA calculations and appropriate safety margin analysis in prior positions. Mechanical Engineer engaged in changes to the design of complex electro-mechanical systems.General Function: Mechanical Engineer engaged in changes to the design of complex electro-mechanical systems. Construct prototypes of new products and ensure that their designed usage meet the product specifications. Investigates and resolves operational problems in conjunction with other engineering and technical personnel. Compile technical data and information for use for project submittals.
