Experience in reviewing tool designs for injection molding, castings, and stampings. Defines, documents, analyzes, performs, and interprets test for new and/or modified products or product components. Experience with PPAP and other quality review processes. Must be capable of interacting in a team environment and working with others to achieve the best possible product from all functional viewpoints. Answer questions concerning products performance and capabilities. Manage, support and correct product related production issues when problems arise on the production floor. Works with other engineering disciplines to increase production quality, efficiency, or through-put of manufacturing. Provides technical support and advice to various technical and non-technical personnel. Works with outside suppliers in establishing or modifying specifications for purchased items. Devises and applies testing procedures for parts or sub-assemblies received from outside vendors. Perform life cycle testing on proposed cost reducing material to ensure that they meet the product specifications. Supports product certification by outside agency (e.g., UL) to applicable safety and performance codes or standards to obtain product approvals and certifications. Demonstrated analytical skills which should include FEA, statistical analysis, DOE, DFMEA, DFM, and tolerance stack up analysis. Ability to self-manage multi-projects, multi-task, and work alone or in a team setting. Operate as a member of cross-functional teams involved at every stage of design and development in collaboration with colleagues in other engineering functions as well as production, research, marketing, and after-sales service. Solid modeling required; SolidWorks is preferred. Ability to use power tools, hand tools, drill presses, band saw, calipers, and torque wrench. Must have strong interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and in written. Ability to use personal computer, calculator, copy machine, fax, telephone, presentation systems and printers. MS Office experience required. Knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing. Ability to work long hours, if needed. Travel, as required. (Less than 10%)

Climate Robotics is building the next generation of mobile pyrolysis system. Our trailer-mounted systems convert agricultural and forestry waste into biochar, a powerful soil amendment and carbon removal technology. Biochar is one of the most promising and lowest-cost solutions to global climate change, and we are excited to do our part in commercializing this transformational technology. We've partnered with some of the leading buyers of carbon removal credits, including Microsoft, to build a new type of business that helps farmers while fighting climate change. Climate Robotics is well-capitalized by top VC investors in climate tech, including Congruent Ventures, Grantham Foundation, and Microsoft Climate Innovation Fund. We're looking to expand our team of engineers and scientists to help build an entirely new industry in the nation's energy capital, Houston, Texas.We have several openings for highly experienced, dynamic, and innovative mechanical engineers. You will join a team of engineers developing the next generation of mobile pyrolysis systems to sequester gigatons of CO2. Successful candidates will have demonstrated expertise in scaling complex, heavy industrial, or high-temperature chemical processing systems from the early stages (biomass, gasification, pyrolysis, and agriculture).We are looking for candidates with demonstrated expertise in the following areas:Thermal DesignStrong fundamentals in thermal expansion, heat transfer, thermodynamics, and fluid mechanicsPrior experience in solving novel and challenging thermo-mechanical design problems for high-temperature processesExperience modeling, testing, and designing thermo-mechanical components; examples include fans, heat sinks, and heat exchangers.Experience designing pressure vesselsExperience with fatigue and fracture analysis in metals at elevated temperatureFluency in the use of FEA simulation tools for thermo-mechanical analysisHydraulic/Fluid PowerDesigning and installing hydraulic power systems for heavy mobile equipmentTroubleshooting of hydraulics issuesExperience working with power take-off (PTO) and hydraulic power unitsExperience in designing hydraulic drive systems at high and low speedExperience with hydraulic PID control systemsProduct CommercializationPrior experience designing heavy industrial equipment that operates at high temperaturesPrior success scaling pilot projects up to commercial scalePrevious success in developing systems for continuous operationAddress product challenges, including testing and qualifying new materials, processes, techniques, and designsAdditional responsibilities include:Conduct and lead prototype and product testing at the component and subsystem levelAssist with software/control systems testing and validationConduct and lead design reviewsSelect vendors and specify components. Work with vendors on new component requirements or component failuresDesign, packaging, and 3D modelingMentoring or managing junior engineersWork collaboratively with an interdisciplinary teamRequirementsBachelor of Science in Engineering with a minimum of 7+ years relevant engineering experience or Master of Science in Engineering and a minimum of 5 years relevant engineering experienceExpert machine design knowledgeStrong experience with SolidWorks, including PDMHands-on experience in prototyping, troubleshooting, and getting dirt on your faceProven experience developing mechanical systems for mass productionExperience with hydraulics, pneumatics, valving, sensors, and electrical control componentsPrior startup experience or ability to work in a fast-paced environment with challenging deadlinesPreferred Skills and Qualifications:Experience with biomass, gasification, and pyrolysis beyond the lab scaleMaintaining design documents and tracking design changes across a multidisciplinary team of engineersFamiliarity with FEA, ANSYS, and Solidworks SimulationBenefitsCompetitive salary and stock options in the companyHealth benefits (medical, dental, and vision)Flexible vacation & time-off policyRelocation assistance available for qualified candidates401(k) match

Senior Structural Engineer-(174048) Description About Us At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.  Watch Our Story:' https://www.hdrinc.com/our-story'   We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. Primary Responsibilities Consistently ranked among the top firms, including #6 in Top Engineering News-Record 500 Design Firm, by leading industry publications, HDR has 200+ locations around the globe with over 10,000 employees and specializes in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. The position opening for a Senior Structural Engineer offers exciting opportunities in the field of Power Generation and Renewables. As an HDR Senior Structural Engineer your responsibilities may include:Performing detailed structural design, analysis, engineering calculations, and developing construction documents for a variety of reinforced concrete, reinforced masonry, and steel structures as well as a variety of foundation systems like piles, spread footings, and mat foundations.Projects will include new and retrofit power and energy projects (i.e. wind, solar, battery storage, and non-renewable power generation), in addition to industrial, institutional facilities, and a variety of other project types.Acting as an Owner’s Engineer for new or retrofit projects.Writing/Editing structural specifications.Verifying code compliance, quality checks, meeting project schedules and budget.Working independently on projects and overseeing the work of junior engineers.Using stiffness matrix-based analysis software (i.e. RISA, STAAD, and LPile), hand calculations, as well as current codes and standards to perform both static and dynamic analysis.Participating in project site visits in conjunction with the Project Manager and other disciplines.All other duties as assigned. Qualifications Required QualificationsDegree in Civil or Structural Engineering with Structural emphasis, from ABET accredited university, and interest in continuing education.Minimum of 10 years structural engineering experience, preferably in power and energy projects or heavy industrial facilities.Professional Engineering License in home state.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and structural analysis software such as RISA, STAAD, and LPile.Familiarity with CADD software such as AutoCAD or Microstation a plus.Understanding of the finite element method and how to perform FEA.Must be capable of working in a team-oriented environment and possess analytical and organizational skills to work on multiple projects at one time.Having both strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to coordinate your work with other disciplines and CAD designers either in person or remotely from another HDR office.Additional skills such as attention to accuracy, detail orientated, self-directed learning, meeting deadlines, and multi-tasking are required.The willingness to try new things and be a forward thinking, innovative engineer.An attitude and commitment to be an active participant in our employee-owned culture is a must.Preferred QualificationsMaster of Science (MS) Degree in Structural Engineering or Structural emphasisRegistered as a Professional Engineer in multiple statesDemonstrated knowledge of how software packages related to structural engineering workWorking understanding of deep foundations and geotechnical applications for foundation designWhy HDR At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way. Date Posted: 2023-08-15  Country: United States of America  Location: VA141: 8350 Alban Road, Springfield 8350 Alban Road Suite 700, Springfield, VA, 22150 USA  Position Role Type: Onsite  Job Description: Raytheon is seeking a Senior Principal Mechanical Engineer to lead technology development and mission support projects. The Senior Principal Engineer possesses extensive knowledge of mechanical engineering theory and practices, often tackling unique and complex problems. Many of these problems may be undefined or difficult and require extensive investigation, research, experience, and testing to understand root causes and determine engineering solutions to address the underlying issue(s). During this process, you will collaborate and lead cross-functional teams to develop innovative solutions from concept to completion, often including customer deployment and associated readiness activities. You will recommend, develop, and/or implement new products, processes, operating plans, and standards that impact program results, improve upon existing practices, and align with internal and external objectives. In this role, you’ll contribute to functional strategies and operational goals, directing and contributing to activities that affect program execution and results. As a Senior Principal Engineer, you will communicate with internal and external stakeholders, including customers and vendors. You will also work to influence others to adopt your views, practices, and new concepts, and conduct briefings with internal senior leaders. The role requires expert-level knowledge in mechanical engineering principles and practice, acquired through a combination of education and experience. You may also possess knowledge of project management and related disciplines within your work area, identifying links and potential impacts on projects, programs, or systems. Additionally, you will support the Program Manager in meeting technical, cost, and schedule requirements while contributing to future strategies and customer needs. This role offers a unique and rewarding opportunity to drive technology development, lead mission support, and make meaningful impacts to the program, organization, and company. Security Clearance & Other Requirements: U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position requires a U.S. Top Secret Clearance. U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position will require the ability to access US only data systems Ability to travel to temporary assignments outside of the greater Washington DC Metropolitan area. Travel <10%. Required Skills: Candidate must possess an active TS/SCI security clearance A University Degree in Mechanical Engineering and minimum 10 years prior relevant experience, or an Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 7 years’ experience. Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment, handling diverse project tasks. Proficiency in test planning, reports, and procedure documentation. Strong understanding of material mechanics and engineering dynamics. Proficiency in MS Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Project). Experience with Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD, Creo). Experience in leading small technical teams. Ability to lift 50 pounds. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Desired Skills: Familiarity with Finite Element Analysis (FEA) tools. Passed the NCEES Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam or hold an active Professional Engineer’s (PE) license. Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Arlington, VA. To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors and communities to succeed. The following position is to join our Corporate or Research Center Team: Requires expert or mastery level knowledge of work area, typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience. May have deep knowledge of project management. Advanced knowledge of related disciplines within work area and ability to identify links and potential impact on projects, programs or systems. Typically requires: A University Degree or equivalent experience and minimum 10 years prior relevant experience, or An Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 7 years experience Engineering/Other Technical Positions: Typically requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and a minimum of 10 years of prior relevant experience unless prohibited by local laws/regulations. The Air Combat Command's 67th Cyberspace Wing (67 CW), 346th Test Squadron (346TS) plans, executes, and contributes as both an operational and participating test organization in a full array of operational tests of various cyber weapons in coordination with the 318 Range Squadron (318RANS) who provides instrumented cyber range services, through both physical hardware and virtual systems. In support of this mission, ANALYGENCE is seeking a Senior Test Engineer to plan, prepare, and execute test systems to evaluate results against specifications and requirements as well as analyze and report test results. Specifically, the Senior Test Engineer shall: Determine level of assurance of developed capabilities based on test results Develop test plans to address specifications and requirements Handle test notifications, test concept development, test planning, execution, reporting and close-out phases of all test projects Provide personnel for the following test types: Operational Assessments (OA), Early Operational Assessments (EOA), Operational Utility evaluations (OUE), Initial Operational Test and Evaluations (IOT&E), Tactics Development and Evaluations (TD&E), Force Development Evaluations (FDE), Combined Operational and Developmental Testing (DT/OT), Developmental Operations testing (DEVOPS), TEMPEST (Emission Security testing), Unified Capabilities (UC) testing, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), including Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and Cyber Security Assessments (Vulnerability Assessments, Compliance Assessments and Penetration Testing) Install and maintain network infrastructure device operating system software (e.g., IOS, firmware). Make recommendations based on test results Determine scope, infrastructure, resources, and data sample size to ensure system requirements are adequately demonstrated Create auditable evidence of security measures Validate specifications and requirements for testability Analyze the results of software, hardware, or interoperability testing Perform developmental testing on systems under development Perform interoperability testing on systems exchanging electronic information with other systems. Perform operational testing Test, evaluate, and verify hardware and/or software to determine compliance with defined specifications and requirements Record and manage test data Current Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility. Bachelor's degree in a related field and a minimum of 12 years of experience as a Test Engineer. IAT Level II certification required. Experience with Cyber Mission Systems, Air Force Weapon Systems. Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies. Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk), laws, regulations, policies, and ethics as they relate to cybersecurity and privacy. Experience with cybersecurity and privacy principles, cyber threats and vulnerabilities, specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses. Knowledge of information technology (IT) supply chain security and supply chain risk management policies, requirements, and procedures. Knowledge of critical infrastructure systems with information communication technology that were designed without system security considerations. Knowledge of network security architecture concepts including topology, protocols, components, and principles (e.g., application of defense-in-depth). Knowledge of security architecture concepts and enterprise architecture reference models (e.g., Zachman, Federal Enterprise Architecture [FEA]). Knowledge of security models (e.g., Bell-LaPadula model, Biba integrity model, Clark-Wilson integrity model). Knowledge of cybersecurity-enabled software products. Knowledge of Test & Evaluation processes for learners. Knowledge of network protocols such as TCP/IP, Dynamic Host Configuration, Domain Name System (DNS), and directory services. Experience conducting test events, designing a data analysis structure (i.e., the types of data a test must generate and how to analyze that data), determining an appropriate level of test rigor for a given system, developing operations-based testing scenarios, systems integration testing. Experience writing code in a currently supported programming language (e.g., Java, C++), writing test plans, evaluating test plans for applicability and completeness, conducting Test Readiness Reviews, designing and documenting overall program Test & Evaluation strategies, identifying Test & Evaluation infrastructure (people, ranges, tools, instrumentation) requirements. Skill in managing test assets, test resources, and test personnel to ensure effective completion of test events, preparing Test & Evaluation reports and providing Test & Evaluation resource estimate. Ability to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation). Our people-first culture drives mission success. ANALYGENCE provides leading-edge technology and result-focused solutions that address the infinite variables that affect our clients’ goals in the cyberspace, intelligence, and mission support domains. Born out of diverse backgrounds and forged through government, military and industry experience, our team members are the backbone of our solutions. Our various perspectives advance capabilities and drive successful operations. Through our purpose-driven team culture, the productivity and effectiveness of critical missions are amplified. Our vision is to continue to build an environment that encourages our people to evolve by applying a foundation of core values to everything we do. We focus on adding value to people so that they can bring value to others, and this culture drives our relentless pursuit of exceptional mission critical results. Description:   Position Summary Senior Project Engineers act as the technical lead for engineering projects, and also help mentor Project Engineers, Mechanical/Electrical Engineers, and Mechanical/Electrical Designers. They direct, coordinate, and oversee the project design team in the execution of the mechanical, systems, and electrical design of equipment for the metallurgical, specialty metals, and aerospace industries by providing in-depth technical guidance and supervision. Job Responsibilities / Act as an engineering project team leader by providing assignments, overseeing work, and providing detailed technical guidance for the design team. / Responsible for approving, in detail, all final designs, design changes, specifications, and drawing releases and ensuring their compliance with engineering principles, company standards, customer contract requirements, and related specifications. / Research, analyze, plan, organize, and coordinate all engineering design efforts for a given project, including the development of engineering project schedule, budget, and staffing needs to support overall program goals. / Conduct internal and external design reviews that address project requirements and incorporate input from customers, vendors, engineering colleagues, designers, and operations personnel. / Develop clear and concise engineering specifications for design and/or procurement of subsystems, components, and engineering services. / Provide technical support for the Sales Department including System sizing analysis, equipment conceptual and detailed layouts, customer visits, and cost analysis. / Review documents such as customer design specifications and requests for quotes to determine feasibility of design and applicability of Retech products to customer needs. / Generate high quality written reports, proposals, instructions, manuals, and other documentation that may be distributed to customers, internal users, or the public at large. / Provides reports on the status of project milestones and adjusts schedules accordingly. / Support fabrication and installation activities to ensure products and systems conform to engineering design and customer specifications. / Develop written methods and procedures for testing equipment and systems. Requirements:   Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills Required / BSME from a four-year college or university. / 10+ years of experience working as a Project Engineer, or similar, preferably designing high temperature furnaces, heavy material handling equipment, or other capital equipment. / Experience with Autodesk Inventor, Solidworks, or another 3D CAD program. / General understanding of OSHA requirements as it applies to capital equipment. / Experience in the design and sizing of vacuum systems is a plus. / Experience in the design of material handling equipment. / Experience with industrial schematics or P&IDs. / Working knowledge of Vacuum Metallurgy and various melting technologies. / Ability to develop project plans, maintain project schedules, adhere to budget. / Working knowledge of recognized industry standards. / Ability to perform heat transfer analysis and energy balance on complex systems. / Strong stress analysis skills. / Working knowledge of FEA analysis. Personal Skills/Attributes required for the Position / Proven track record of generating innovative and practical ideas. / Excellent verbal and written communication skills for both internal and external customers. / Exceptional organization skills with attention to detail. / Ability to be proactive and manage time effectively to meet deadlines. / Detail-orientated with ability to respond quickly to a fast-moving and ever-changing environment. / Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Physical Demands / The employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, hear and talk. / The employee is frequently required to use hands. / The employee occasionally will be required to reach with hands or arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, and crawl. / The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. / Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and depth perception. / The work environment is an office setting with periodic need to visit the plant floor. / This position may be required to work long hours extending into the weekends on some occasions. May also need to travel for short or extended trips as needed. Must be able and willing to travel to international and domestic sites for sales, installation, and customer service support. / Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

STV Incorporated is seeking a Sr. Structural Engineer, Illinois, S.E. candidate to join our Bridge practice in our Chicago, IL operation. More than 100 years old, the firm provides comprehensive architectural, engineering, planning, environmental, and construction management services for public and private sector clients. STV is an award-winning national leader consistently ranking among the country's top companies in the design and planning of transportation and infrastructure projects. Our success is the direct result of our employees' commitment to innovation and quality across all 40 offices and over 2500 people nationwide.   STV has been providing bridge engineering services as one of the premier consultants in the transportation industry. Our Chicago office provides bridge design and inspection services to transit agencies and municipalities throughout the State, as well as for contractors on design build projects. This is a great opportunity to join a growing, highly motivated, and successful team that has played a significant role in numerous major transportation projects throughout the region and the United States.   We have an immediate need for a Senior-level Structural engineer (S.E.) to join our Transportation and Infrastructure Team, ideally located in our Chicago, IL office. This position will assist in leading design and analysis of highway, rail and pedestrian bridges and associated structures. We are looking for a motivated individual who wants to be part of a successful, growing practice within a firm that values integrity, determination and drive and rewards individuals accordingly. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to interact with clients on a regular basis and contribute to business development efforts. This is an excellent opportunity for a creative, self-motivated, and detail-oriented professional looking to take their career to the next level.   Responsibilities Include:    Lead a team of Bridge Engineers in the Bridge Practice in our Chicago office. Provide design and analysis of bridges and related structures Support Complex Prequalification’s Perform FEA Support structural design on selected projects and lead assigned tasks as appropriate Support preparation of technical and cost proposals to win work Assist Senior staff in oversight of project delivery to ensure projects meet or exceed forecasted profit margins Provide leadership and direction by mentoring and motivating junior staff Work with managers, project engineers, and discipline leads to develop budgets, schedules, and project delivery plans Proactively drive safety and ensure that health and safety practices are maintained Assist in maintaining quality of project deliverables produced by the Bridge Group Foster and manage client relationships at appropriate levels to help procure new business.  Some evenings will be spent at professional society meetings where you will work to develop and maintain relationships with clients, teaming partners, and potential technical staff hires.   Qualifications Include:    Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering; Master’s degree preferred, but not required Minimum of 12 years of progressive design experience on structural engineering projects Illinois S.E. license Experience with complex bridge design Solid structural analysis and design skills with an understanding of related engineering disciplines needed to complete transportation and infrastructure projects Project management skills and ability to plan and coordinate work efforts needed to meet deadlines Strong interpersonal and communication skills with ability to form effective relationships with staff and clients    Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.    STV offers the following benefits • Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account • Dental insurance • Vision insurance • Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable) • Disability insurance • Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment • 401(k) Plan • Retirement Counseling • Employee Assistance Program • Paid Time Off (16 days) • Paid Holidays (8 days) • Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year) • Parental Leave (up to 80 hours) • Continuing Education Program • Professional Licensure and Society Memberships

Additionally, this person would be directly responsible for marque NPD design projects. This position has direct contact with the customers to understand their specification/needs and determine the best solution. Electric machine (motor/generator), solenoid, electromechanical machines, gear, or power screw design experience a plus.Strong materials and finish background preferred.Experience in Aerospace or Military Industry is a plus.Minimum of 10 years of experience doing detailed CAD design. Solidworks strongly preferred. Job Title: Senior Structural Engineer Location: Beaverton, Oregon Crow Engineering provides engineering design and consultancy services to its clients in the wood products, industrial, and mixed use facilities. The Structural Engineer is responsible for the design of industrial, Cold Storage, Commercial, and High-Density Residential structures for our clients. Typical projects would include: Design of new facilities, foundation and piling design and general arrangements for pre-engineered structures, repair and retrofit designs of damaged or aged facilities, seismic upgrades of facilities to meet code requirements. The individual would be responsible for generating high-quality designs and working with a team of designers and drafters to ensure our client’s requirements are being met. The individual would interact with Crow Engineering Project Managers to obtain timelines, scope, and expectations surrounding work. From time to time this individual will interface with key equipment vendors and clients. Crow Engineering has a highly tenured organization that has a wealth of experience in the wood products and heavy industrial industry, specifically with sawmill systems. We are looking for individuals who while respecting our experience, can help take it to new industries that would benefit from our services. It is expected from each of Crow Engineering’s team members that they can provide significant value to our clients. This value comes through providing high quality, safe and innovative and reliable design work that our clients respect the value of. All team members must provide value in their space as an extension of the overall Crow Engineering team. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Create structural designs, execute calculations, and build specifications for structures utilized in the markets we serve. Work with local jurisdictions to ensure proper permitting support documentation details are available based on client demands. Work closely with Project Managers to ensure client’s needs are being met in a timely, cost effective, and high-quality manner. Provide their own project management administration for small to medium sized projects. Generate construction estimation for projects they are responsible for. Provide a work product that is above average based on industry expectations that demand a value with our clients. Can handle moderately complicated structural tasks with little to no direction. Proactively escalates needs/road blocks to other project team members, project managers, owners, and outside vendors. Executes design work within AutoCAD, Revit, and structural calculation tool sets. Communicates with key vendors and suppliers to ensure incorporated design parameters are being integrated into the project accordingly. Ensures revision control is in place and effective when working on client designs. Can help build standards, best-known methods, and training documentation for future new hires. Can effectively work through difficult situations. Core Competencies: Strong English written/verbal skills. The ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision The ability to work under time constraints and adapt to change Working knowledge and experience with different structure and construction types. The ability to troubleshoot, diagnose and effectively communicate technical solutions to difficult issues Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and group situations to customers, vendors, and other employees of the organization Strong Design/Drafting skills within design software systems. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent attention to detail The ability to clearly document test results, configuration parameters, process and training materials Qualifications: A four-year engineering degree in Civil Engineering. Candidate must be an actively certified Professional Civil Engineer Candidate must have obtained their Structural Engineering certification or have >7 years of experience as a civil engineer specializing in structural designs. 3-5 Years work experience in a similar position. AutoCAD experience, or experience in similar systems to AutoCAD Experience with solid modeling systems is preferred. Client facing presentation skill is highly preferred. Experience with engineering change order and version control systems. Excellent written and verbal communication skills In-depth knowledge of process driven manufacturing facilities. Proven work experience with generating engineering/FEA calculations and appropriate safety margin analysis in prior positions. This opportunity is located within our Ensign-Bickford Aerospace & Defense Company business, a global leader of mission-critical hardware and systems solutions including precision energetics systems and innovative explosive solutions.    Job Description    EBAD is seeking a Senior Capture Engineer reporting to the Manager, Engineering Technology. This role is based in either Moorpark, CA or Simsbury, CT.    Responsibilities:    The Senior Capture Engineer is the development and applications engineer on new business for an assigned market segment of our business. EBAD market segments include Launch Vehicles, Missile Systems, Satellite Systems, and Warfighter. Working together with the Capture Manager and Business Development Manager, the Senior Capture Engineer identifies and proposes winning technical solutions and prepares future programs of record for success. The Senior Capture Engineer understands both customer needs and EBAD capability and continuously seeks to fill any gaps between the two by proposing and executing both rapid development efforts on capture funding and larger Internally funded Research And Development (IRAD) programs.    Detailed Responsibilities:  Lead business capture efforts as the technical point of contact with both the customer and internal stakeholders Understand assigned market segment business strategy and act in support of that strategy Develop creative design solutions that solve customer problems Plan and execute rapid prototype builds and risk reduction tests Perform and present structured design trade studies Manage and mitigate capture and IR&D program technical, schedule, and cost risks Estimate and manage costs for IRAD, business capture, and proposal activities Identify, propose, and execute internally funded R&D projects to meet market needs in partnership with the business development team Create and maintain product specifications and compliance verification for capture and IRAD projects Assess design feasibility using FEA or classical mechanics Create conceptual CAD models and renderings   Requirements:    The successful candidate must have a BS or MS in an engineering discipline and a minimum of 8 years of experience in product design of aerospace, missile, and/or defense products.    Required skills and experience include:  Experience leading technical teams thru product development, from prototype to production. Experience with low volume, high mix manufacturing and generation of manufacturing instructions. Experience communicating effectively verbally and in writing with customers and internal management Commitment to safety Ability to make sound judgement calls in order to proceed with minimal requirements and guidance from customers and stakeholders Proficiency with solid modelling (SolidWorks preferred) Ability to interpret and analyze technical specifications Ability to obtain a US Department of Defense (DoD) security clearance Status as a U.S. Citizen capable of working on U.S. DoD and ITAR restricted products   Preferred Skills:  Electro-mechanical device integration Finite element analysis Knowledge of explosive materials and energetic devices   Compensation:    Salary Range: $90,000 - $155,000 per year. Salary is determined by the applicant's education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities, internal equity, and alignment with market data.  Ensign-Bickford Aerospace & Defense Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, national origin, or veteran status.About this Subsidiary       Ensign-Bickford Aerospace & Defense Company (EBAD), headquartered in Simsbury, CT with facilities in Moorpark, CA, San Rafael, CA and Graham, KY is a global leader of mission-critical hardware and systems solutions including precision energetics systems and innovative explosive solutions.            Our capabilities include customized man-portable breaching systems; fully integrated payload system, subsystem or energetic component production; shock tube-based, signal transmission technology integrated with our highly reliable family of detonators; and armored vehicle solutions. EBAD also has extensive satellite/spacecraft and missile/aircraft/launch vehicle manufacturing capabilities for system initiation, signal transfer, separation release, actuation and deployment and flight termination. No matter what the mission, EBAD can provide tailored, customized solutions to address our customers' challenges.      Ensign-Bickford Aerospace & Defense Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, national origin, or veteran status.

Mechanical Engineer engaged in changes to the design of complex electro-mechanical systems.General Function: Mechanical Engineer engaged in changes to the design of complex electro-mechanical systems. Essential Functions: Perform a variety of engineering work, including designing new parts or changing existing parts to improve and cost reduce products. Conceive and develop 3D part designs, manage 3D assemblies, and create detailed 2D drawings using SolidWorks. Participate in updating and maintaining mechanical development processes and procedures. Construct prototypes of new products and ensure that their designed usage meet the product specifications. Investigates and resolves operational problems in conjunction with other engineering and technical personnel. Compile technical data and information for use for project submittals. Knowledge of various materials (plastics, metal, sheet metal) and ways to process them (injection molding, casting, powdered metal, stamping). Experience in reviewing tool designs for injection molding, castings, and stampings. Defines, documents, analyzes, performs, and interprets test for new and/or modified products or product components. Experience with PPAP and other quality review processes. Must be capable of interacting in a team environment and working with others to achieve the best possible product from all functional viewpoints. Answer questions concerning products performance and capabilities. Manage, support and correct product related production issues when problems arise on the production floor. Works with other engineering disciplines to increase production quality, efficiency, or through-put of manufacturing. Provides technical support and advice to various technical and non-technical personnel. Works with outside suppliers in establishing or modifying specifications for purchased items. Devises and applies testing procedures for parts or sub-assemblies received from outside vendors. Perform life cycle testing on proposed cost reducing material to ensure that they meet the product specifications. Supports product certification by outside agency (e.g., UL) to applicable safety and performance codes or standards to obtain product approvals and certifications. Demonstrated analytical skills which should include FEA, statistical analysis, DOE, DFMEA, DFM, and tolerance stack up analysis. Other duties as assigned by supervisor.Education: BS/MS in Mechanical Engineering Experience/Skills Required: 7+ years mechanical design and integration experience for electro-mechanical products, preferably in a high-volume manufacturing industry. Strong knowledge of mechanical engineering methodology. Strong decision-making requiring detail analysis and investigation with solutions requiring original thinking. Excellent problem solving and analytical skills. Experience with Engineering Change Notice Processes (ECN/ECR’s). Ability to self-manage multi-projects, multi-task, and work alone or in a team setting. Operate as a member of cross-functional teams involved at every stage of design and development in collaboration with colleagues in other engineering functions as well as production, research, marketing, and after-sales service. Solid modeling required; SolidWorks is preferred. Ability to use power tools, hand tools, drill presses, band saw, calipers, and torque wrench. Must have strong interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and in written. Ability to use personal computer, calculator, copy machine, fax, telephone, presentation systems and printers. MS Office experience required. Knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing. Ability to work long hours, if needed. Travel, as required. (Less than 10%)

Climate Robotics is building the next generation of mobile pyrolysis system. Our trailer-mounted systems convert agricultural and forestry waste into biochar, a powerful soil amendment and carbon removal technology. Biochar is one of the most promising and lowest-cost solutions to global climate change, and we are excited to do our part in commercializing this transformational technology. We've partnered with some of the leading buyers of carbon removal credits, including Microsoft, to build a new type of business that helps farmers while fighting climate change. Climate Robotics is well-capitalized by top VC investors in climate tech, including Congruent Ventures, Grantham Foundation, and Microsoft Climate Innovation Fund. We're looking to expand our team of engineers and scientists to help build an entirely new industry in the nation's energy capital, Houston, Texas.We have several openings for highly experienced, dynamic, and innovative mechanical engineers. You will join a team of engineers developing the next generation of mobile pyrolysis systems to sequester gigatons of CO2. Successful candidates will have demonstrated expertise in scaling complex, heavy industrial, or high-temperature chemical processing systems from the early stages (biomass, gasification, pyrolysis, and agriculture).We are looking for candidates with demonstrated expertise in the following areas:Thermal DesignStrong fundamentals in thermal expansion, heat transfer, thermodynamics, and fluid mechanicsPrior experience in solving novel and challenging thermo-mechanical design problems for high-temperature processesExperience modeling, testing, and designing thermo-mechanical components; examples include fans, heat sinks, and heat exchangers.Experience designing pressure vesselsExperience with fatigue and fracture analysis in metals at elevated temperatureFluency in the use of FEA simulation tools for thermo-mechanical analysisHydraulic/Fluid PowerDesigning and installing hydraulic power systems for heavy mobile equipmentTroubleshooting of hydraulics issuesExperience working with power take-off (PTO) and hydraulic power unitsExperience in designing hydraulic drive systems at high and low speedExperience with hydraulic PID control systemsProduct CommercializationPrior experience designing heavy industrial equipment that operates at high temperaturesPrior success scaling pilot projects up to commercial scalePrevious success in developing systems for continuous operationAddress product challenges, including testing and qualifying new materials, processes, techniques, and designsAdditional responsibilities include:Conduct and lead prototype and product testing at the component and subsystem levelAssist with software/control systems testing and validationConduct and lead design reviewsSelect vendors and specify components. Work with vendors on new component requirements or component failuresDesign, packaging, and 3D modelingMentoring or managing junior engineersWork collaboratively with an interdisciplinary teamRequirementsBachelor of Science in Engineering with a minimum of 7+ years relevant engineering experience or Master of Science in Engineering and a minimum of 5 years relevant engineering experienceExpert machine design knowledgeStrong experience with SolidWorks, including PDMHands-on experience in prototyping, troubleshooting, and getting dirt on your faceProven experience developing mechanical systems for mass productionExperience with hydraulics, pneumatics, valving, sensors, and electrical control componentsPrior startup experience or ability to work in a fast-paced environment with challenging deadlinesPreferred Skills and Qualifications:Experience with biomass, gasification, and pyrolysis beyond the lab scaleMaintaining design documents and tracking design changes across a multidisciplinary team of engineersFamiliarity with FEA, ANSYS, and Solidworks SimulationBenefitsCompetitive salary and stock options in the companyHealth benefits (medical, dental, and vision)Flexible vacation & time-off policyRelocation assistance available for qualified candidates401(k) match

Senior Structural Engineer-(174048) Description About Us At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.  Watch Our Story:' https://www.hdrinc.com/our-story'   We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. Primary Responsibilities Consistently ranked among the top firms, including #6 in Top Engineering News-Record 500 Design Firm, by leading industry publications, HDR has 200+ locations around the globe with over 10,000 employees and specializes in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. The position opening for a Senior Structural Engineer offers exciting opportunities in the field of Power Generation and Renewables. As an HDR Senior Structural Engineer your responsibilities may include:Performing detailed structural design, analysis, engineering calculations, and developing construction documents for a variety of reinforced concrete, reinforced masonry, and steel structures as well as a variety of foundation systems like piles, spread footings, and mat foundations.Projects will include new and retrofit power and energy projects (i.e. wind, solar, battery storage, and non-renewable power generation), in addition to industrial, institutional facilities, and a variety of other project types.Acting as an Owner’s Engineer for new or retrofit projects.Writing/Editing structural specifications.Verifying code compliance, quality checks, meeting project schedules and budget.Working independently on projects and overseeing the work of junior engineers.Using stiffness matrix-based analysis software (i.e. RISA, STAAD, and LPile), hand calculations, as well as current codes and standards to perform both static and dynamic analysis.Participating in project site visits in conjunction with the Project Manager and other disciplines.All other duties as assigned. Qualifications Required QualificationsDegree in Civil or Structural Engineering with Structural emphasis, from ABET accredited university, and interest in continuing education.Minimum of 10 years structural engineering experience, preferably in power and energy projects or heavy industrial facilities.Professional Engineering License in home state.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and structural analysis software such as RISA, STAAD, and LPile.Familiarity with CADD software such as AutoCAD or Microstation a plus.Understanding of the finite element method and how to perform FEA.Must be capable of working in a team-oriented environment and possess analytical and organizational skills to work on multiple projects at one time.Having both strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to coordinate your work with other disciplines and CAD designers either in person or remotely from another HDR office.Additional skills such as attention to accuracy, detail orientated, self-directed learning, meeting deadlines, and multi-tasking are required.The willingness to try new things and be a forward thinking, innovative engineer.An attitude and commitment to be an active participant in our employee-owned culture is a must.Preferred QualificationsMaster of Science (MS) Degree in Structural Engineering or Structural emphasisRegistered as a Professional Engineer in multiple statesDemonstrated knowledge of how software packages related to structural engineering workWorking understanding of deep foundations and geotechnical applications for foundation designWhy HDR At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way. Date Posted: 2023-08-15  Country: United States of America  Location: VA141: 8350 Alban Road, Springfield 8350 Alban Road Suite 700, Springfield, VA, 22150 USA  Position Role Type: Onsite  Job Description: Raytheon is seeking a Senior Principal Mechanical Engineer to lead technology development and mission support projects. The Senior Principal Engineer possesses extensive knowledge of mechanical engineering theory and practices, often tackling unique and complex problems. Many of these problems may be undefined or difficult and require extensive investigation, research, experience, and testing to understand root causes and determine engineering solutions to address the underlying issue(s). During this process, you will collaborate and lead cross-functional teams to develop innovative solutions from concept to completion, often including customer deployment and associated readiness activities. You will recommend, develop, and/or implement new products, processes, operating plans, and standards that impact program results, improve upon existing practices, and align with internal and external objectives. In this role, you’ll contribute to functional strategies and operational goals, directing and contributing to activities that affect program execution and results. As a Senior Principal Engineer, you will communicate with internal and external stakeholders, including customers and vendors. You will also work to influence others to adopt your views, practices, and new concepts, and conduct briefings with internal senior leaders. The role requires expert-level knowledge in mechanical engineering principles and practice, acquired through a combination of education and experience. You may also possess knowledge of project management and related disciplines within your work area, identifying links and potential impacts on projects, programs, or systems. Additionally, you will support the Program Manager in meeting technical, cost, and schedule requirements while contributing to future strategies and customer needs. This role offers a unique and rewarding opportunity to drive technology development, lead mission support, and make meaningful impacts to the program, organization, and company. Security Clearance & Other Requirements: U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position requires a U.S. Top Secret Clearance. U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position will require the ability to access US only data systems Ability to travel to temporary assignments outside of the greater Washington DC Metropolitan area. Travel <10%. Required Skills: Candidate must possess an active TS/SCI security clearance A University Degree in Mechanical Engineering and minimum 10 years prior relevant experience, or an Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 7 years’ experience. Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment, handling diverse project tasks. Proficiency in test planning, reports, and procedure documentation. Strong understanding of material mechanics and engineering dynamics. Proficiency in MS Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Project). Experience with Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software (e.g., SolidWorks, AutoCAD, Creo). Experience in leading small technical teams. Ability to lift 50 pounds. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Desired Skills: Familiarity with Finite Element Analysis (FEA) tools. Passed the NCEES Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam or hold an active Professional Engineer’s (PE) license. Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Arlington, VA. To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors and communities to succeed. The following position is to join our Corporate or Research Center Team: Requires expert or mastery level knowledge of work area, typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience. May have deep knowledge of project management. Advanced knowledge of related disciplines within work area and ability to identify links and potential impact on projects, programs or systems. Typically requires: A University Degree or equivalent experience and minimum 10 years prior relevant experience, or An Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 7 years experience Engineering/Other Technical Positions: Typically requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and a minimum of 10 years of prior relevant experience unless prohibited by local laws/regulations. RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. The Air Combat Command's 67th Cyberspace Wing (67 CW), 346th Test Squadron (346TS) plans, executes, and contributes as both an operational and participating test organization in a full array of operational tests of various cyber weapons in coordination with the 318 Range Squadron (318RANS) who provides instrumented cyber range services, through both physical hardware and virtual systems. In support of this mission, ANALYGENCE is seeking a Senior Test Engineer to plan, prepare, and execute test systems to evaluate results against specifications and requirements as well as analyze and report test results. Specifically, the Senior Test Engineer shall: Determine level of assurance of developed capabilities based on test results Develop test plans to address specifications and requirements Handle test notifications, test concept development, test planning, execution, reporting and close-out phases of all test projects Provide personnel for the following test types: Operational Assessments (OA), Early Operational Assessments (EOA), Operational Utility evaluations (OUE), Initial Operational Test and Evaluations (IOT&E), Tactics Development and Evaluations (TD&E), Force Development Evaluations (FDE), Combined Operational and Developmental Testing (DT/OT), Developmental Operations testing (DEVOPS), TEMPEST (Emission Security testing), Unified Capabilities (UC) testing, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), including Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and Cyber Security Assessments (Vulnerability Assessments, Compliance Assessments and Penetration Testing) Install and maintain network infrastructure device operating system software (e.g., IOS, firmware). Make recommendations based on test results Determine scope, infrastructure, resources, and data sample size to ensure system requirements are adequately demonstrated Create auditable evidence of security measures Validate specifications and requirements for testability Analyze the results of software, hardware, or interoperability testing Perform developmental testing on systems under development Perform interoperability testing on systems exchanging electronic information with other systems. Perform operational testing Test, evaluate, and verify hardware and/or software to determine compliance with defined specifications and requirements Record and manage test data Current Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility. Bachelor's degree in a related field and a minimum of 12 years of experience as a Test Engineer. IAT Level II certification required. Experience with Cyber Mission Systems, Air Force Weapon Systems. Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies. Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk), laws, regulations, policies, and ethics as they relate to cybersecurity and privacy. Experience with cybersecurity and privacy principles, cyber threats and vulnerabilities, specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses. Knowledge of information technology (IT) supply chain security and supply chain risk management policies, requirements, and procedures. Knowledge of critical infrastructure systems with information communication technology that were designed without system security considerations. Knowledge of network security architecture concepts including topology, protocols, components, and principles (e.g., application of defense-in-depth). Knowledge of security architecture concepts and enterprise architecture reference models (e.g., Zachman, Federal Enterprise Architecture [FEA]). Knowledge of security models (e.g., Bell-LaPadula model, Biba integrity model, Clark-Wilson integrity model). Knowledge of cybersecurity-enabled software products. Knowledge of Test & Evaluation processes for learners. Knowledge of network protocols such as TCP/IP, Dynamic Host Configuration, Domain Name System (DNS), and directory services. Experience conducting test events, designing a data analysis structure (i.e., the types of data a test must generate and how to analyze that data), determining an appropriate level of test rigor for a given system, developing operations-based testing scenarios, systems integration testing. Experience writing code in a currently supported programming language (e.g., Java, C++), writing test plans, evaluating test plans for applicability and completeness, conducting Test Readiness Reviews, designing and documenting overall program Test & Evaluation strategies, identifying Test & Evaluation infrastructure (people, ranges, tools, instrumentation) requirements. Skill in managing test assets, test resources, and test personnel to ensure effective completion of test events, preparing Test & Evaluation reports and providing Test & Evaluation resource estimate. Ability to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation). ANALYGENCE provides leading-edge technology and result-focused solutions that address the infinite variables that affect our clients’ goals in the cyberspace, intelligence, and mission support domains. Born out of diverse backgrounds and forged through government, military and industry experience, our team members are the backbone of our solutions. Our various perspectives advance capabilities and drive successful operations. Through our purpose-driven team culture, the productivity and effectiveness of critical missions are amplified. Description:   Position Summary Senior Project Engineers act as the technical lead for engineering projects, and also help mentor Project Engineers, Mechanical/Electrical Engineers, and Mechanical/Electrical Designers. They direct, coordinate, and oversee the project design team in the execution of the mechanical, systems, and electrical design of equipment for the metallurgical, specialty metals, and aerospace industries by providing in-depth technical guidance and supervision. Job Responsibilities / Act as an engineering project team leader by providing assignments, overseeing work, and providing detailed technical guidance for the design team. / Responsible for approving, in detail, all final designs, design changes, specifications, and drawing releases and ensuring their compliance with engineering principles, company standards, customer contract requirements, and related specifications. / Research, analyze, plan, organize, and coordinate all engineering design efforts for a given project, including the development of engineering project schedule, budget, and staffing needs to support overall program goals. / Conduct internal and external design reviews that address project requirements and incorporate input from customers, vendors, engineering colleagues, designers, and operations personnel. / Develop clear and concise engineering specifications for design and/or procurement of subsystems, components, and engineering services. / Provide technical support for the Sales Department including System sizing analysis, equipment conceptual and detailed layouts, customer visits, and cost analysis. / Review documents such as customer design specifications and requests for quotes to determine feasibility of design and applicability of Retech products to customer needs. / Generate high quality written reports, proposals, instructions, manuals, and other documentation that may be distributed to customers, internal users, or the public at large. / Provides reports on the status of project milestones and adjusts schedules accordingly. / Support fabrication and installation activities to ensure products and systems conform to engineering design and customer specifications. / Develop written methods and procedures for testing equipment and systems. Requirements:   Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills Required / BSME from a four-year college or university. / 10+ years of experience working as a Project Engineer, or similar, preferably designing high temperature furnaces, heavy material handling equipment, or other capital equipment. / Experience with Autodesk Inventor, Solidworks, or another 3D CAD program. / General understanding of OSHA requirements as it applies to capital equipment. / Experience in the design and sizing of vacuum systems is a plus. / Experience in the design of material handling equipment. / Experience with industrial schematics or P&IDs. / Working knowledge of Vacuum Metallurgy and various melting technologies. / Ability to develop project plans, maintain project schedules, adhere to budget. / Working knowledge of recognized industry standards. / Ability to perform heat transfer analysis and energy balance on complex systems. / Strong stress analysis skills. / Working knowledge of FEA analysis. Personal Skills/Attributes required for the Position / Proven track record of generating innovative and practical ideas. / Excellent verbal and written communication skills for both internal and external customers. / Exceptional organization skills with attention to detail. / Ability to be proactive and manage time effectively to meet deadlines. / Detail-orientated with ability to respond quickly to a fast-moving and ever-changing environment. / Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Physical Demands / The employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, hear and talk. / The employee is frequently required to use hands. / The employee occasionally will be required to reach with hands or arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, and crawl. / The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. / Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and depth perception. / The work environment is an office setting with periodic need to visit the plant floor. / This position may be required to work long hours extending into the weekends on some occasions. May also need to travel for short or extended trips as needed. Must be able and willing to travel to international and domestic sites for sales, installation, and customer service support. / Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

STV Incorporated is seeking a Sr. Structural Engineer, Illinois, S.E. candidate to join our Bridge practice in our Chicago, IL operation. More than 100 years old, the firm provides comprehensive architectural, engineering, planning, environmental, and construction management services for public and private sector clients. STV is an award-winning national leader consistently ranking among the country's top companies in the design and planning of transportation and infrastructure projects. Our success is the direct result of our employees' commitment to innovation and quality across all 40 offices and over 2500 people nationwide.   STV has been providing bridge engineering services as one of the premier consultants in the transportation industry. Our Chicago office provides bridge design and inspection services to transit agencies and municipalities throughout the State, as well as for contractors on design build projects. This is a great opportunity to join a growing, highly motivated, and successful team that has played a significant role in numerous major transportation projects throughout the region and the United States.   We have an immediate need for a Senior-level Structural engineer (S.E.) to join our Transportation and Infrastructure Team, ideally located in our Chicago, IL office. This position will assist in leading design and analysis of highway, rail and pedestrian bridges and associated structures. We are looking for a motivated individual who wants to be part of a successful, growing practice within a firm that values integrity, determination and drive and rewards individuals accordingly. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to interact with clients on a regular basis and contribute to business development efforts. This is an excellent opportunity for a creative, self-motivated, and detail-oriented professional looking to take their career to the next level.   Responsibilities Include:    Lead a team of Bridge Engineers in the Bridge Practice in our Chicago office. Provide design and analysis of bridges and related structures Support Complex Prequalification’s Perform FEA Support structural design on selected projects and lead assigned tasks as appropriate Support preparation of technical and cost proposals to win work Assist Senior staff in oversight of project delivery to ensure projects meet or exceed forecasted profit margins Provide leadership and direction by mentoring and motivating junior staff Work with managers, project engineers, and discipline leads to develop budgets, schedules, and project delivery plans Proactively drive safety and ensure that health and safety practices are maintained Assist in maintaining quality of project deliverables produced by the Bridge Group Foster and manage client relationships at appropriate levels to help procure new business.  Some evenings will be spent at professional society meetings where you will work to develop and maintain relationships with clients, teaming partners, and potential technical staff hires.   Qualifications Include:    Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering; Master’s degree preferred, but not required Minimum of 12 years of progressive design experience on structural engineering projects Illinois S.E. license Experience with complex bridge design Solid structural analysis and design skills with an understanding of related engineering disciplines needed to complete transportation and infrastructure projects Project management skills and ability to plan and coordinate work efforts needed to meet deadlines Strong interpersonal and communication skills with ability to form effective relationships with staff and clients    Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.    STV offers the following benefits • Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account • Dental insurance • Vision insurance • Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable) • Disability insurance • Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment • 401(k) Plan • Retirement Counseling • Employee Assistance Program • Paid Time Off (16 days) • Paid Holidays (8 days) • Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year) • Parental Leave (up to 80 hours) • Continuing Education Program • Professional Licensure and Society Memberships

Company Description  At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.  We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.  Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.  Job Description  The West Region Dams and Reservoirs team of AECOM is actively seeking a motivated, creative, highly talented Structural Engineer with risk analysis experience for employment in the Denver, CO office. The dams and reservoirs team within the Water Business Line is responsible for providing engineering and design services in support of multidisciplinary projects, with a focus on water storage and hydropower dam projects.  The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  + Managing and providing technical support for structural analyses such as 2D and 3D FEA of concrete gravity dams, curved gravity dams, arch dams, and other hydraulic structures such as intake towers, spillways and spillway gates.  + Preparing structural reports, drawings, and specifications for water storage and hydropower dams.  + Preparing and presenting technical presentations to project team, clients, and technical review boards.  + Performing dam safety inspections.  + Conducting potential failure mode analyses and risk analyses for water storage and hydropower dams, including identifying and developing potential failure modes, serving as recorder, subject matter expert, and/or facilitator in risk analysis workshops, estimating risk, and report documentation.  + Managing budgets, providing client updates, and performing general project management tasks.  + Preparing structural engineering proposals.  Qualifications Minimum Requirements: + BA/BS + 6 years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education.  + Valid Drivers License required. Preferred Skills/Experience: + Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering from ABET-accredited institution  + 10+ years of experience in the structural engineering discipline.  + Valid PE License or equivalent license in home country.  + Experience working on 6+ risk analysis projects as recorder, subject matter expert, and/or facilitator  + Experience in project management and/or task leadership  + Technical experience in dam design and evaluation  + Experience in preparing design reports, drawings, and specifications  + Excellent verbal and written communication skills  + Demonstrate proactive problem-solving skills  + Ability to delegate tasks effectively  + Ability to maintain organization in a changing environment  + Exhibits initiative, responsibility, and flexibility  + Must be a resourceful, highly organized professional with attention to detail  + Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines  + Effective time-management and interpersonal skills  + Ability to work independently and in a team environment  + Must possess a valid driver’s license  + Occasional travel to project sites, both local and remote  + Master’s degree in Civil/Geotechnical Engineering from ABET-accredited institution  + Experience working on 3+ risk analysis projects as a subject matter expert and/or facilitator is preferred  + Experience with ANSYS, SAP2000, MathCAD, Grapher, and AutoCAD Civil3D  Additional Information  + Relocation is available for this role.  + Sponsorship is available for this position.  + Up to 30% travel required for this role.  + Offered rate of compensation will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The target salary range for this position is $100,000 - $135,000.  + AECOM is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits program to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D and disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absence, voluntary benefits, perks, wellness and global well-being, and global EAP, Business Travel and Service Awards programs.  Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.  We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options.
