Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow. We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships. At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world. Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow Your Impact: Jacobs Technology Group is a performance unit of our Critical Mission Solutions (CMS) Line of Business. The Jacobs CMS Technology Group specializes in the design, construction, and operation of unique and complex research and development facilities, including, as examples, wind tunnels (aerospace, automotive, and motorsports), rocket test stands, climatic chambers, jet engine test cells, acoustic chambers, altitude test facilities, captive trajectory systems, and nuclear facilities. Our projects span the automotive, motorsports, defense, nuclear, and aerospace markets. Recent clients include Audi, Boeing, BMW, Fiat Chrysler, Ford, Honda, General Motors, NASA, U.S. Air Force, U.S. Navy, U.S. Department of Energy, Volkswagen, and many others in North America, Europe, and Asia.Our capabilities and some recent project photos and videos can be found in downloadable files at https://jtftp.jacobstechnology.com/. Use “anontg” as both the user name and password.Most of your designs will be unique, and you will usually be working on several projects at one time in a dynamic, challenging, and even fun environment. Many designs are “blank sheet of paper,” with few analogs or comparisons. This position will provide you with an exciting opportunity to lead and manage Machine Design projects as part of a multi-discipline team of professionals. We are looking for a Machine Design engineer who will work to ensure client satisfaction and deliver key Machine Design projects within scope, budget, and schedule. You should be a self-motivated professional with at least 20+ years of progressive Machine Design experience.Duties and Responsibilities:Projects are often complex and multi-discipline, and Senior Engineers in E&P have ownership of the technical, schedule, and budget performance of the work assigned to them, and are expected to operate with general instructions in an independent mode. The Senior Engineer:Independently plans, schedules, conducts or coordinates detailed phases of engineering work through the selection and adaptation or modification of techniques, procedures, and criteria.Analyzes complex features of the work and applies machine design principles and practices, or devises new approaches in problem solutions.Thoroughly reviews all results from assigned tasks and determine if outputs are complete, correct, integrated with project objectives, and adequately documented.Develops and presents technical reports, 3D concepts, presentations, and calculations to project management and Clients.Coordinates and formally reviews the work of others for techniques and technical approach.Evaluates and defines interfaces with other disciplines, working closely with structural, mechanical process, controls and instrumentation, and aerodynamics/fluid dynamics engineers.Leads design team to produce complete design packages, including detailed drawings, calculations, and specifications, as required.Here’s What You’ll Need: Minimum Experience/Education:B.S.M.E. from an accredited engineering schoolMinimum of twenty (20) years’ relevant and progressive Machine Design experience (see “Adjacent Industries” below)Demonstrated experience leading other engineers and designer/draftersKey Skills:Design for small-scale fabrication & manufacturing (milling, turning, welding, laser-cutting, forming, etc.)Design for assembly & installationDemonstrated knowledge and experience of common machine design elements: gears, bearings, belts, machine screws, chains, cams, linkages, gearmotors, servomotors, etc.Strong mechanical engineering analytical skills – kinematics, dynamics, stress/strain, power transmission, etc.FEA – static stress-strain, natural frequencyDemonstrated experience and expertise in employing GD&T/ASTM Y14.5 in detailed design drawings; understanding of tolerance, fits, and stack-up analysisScope/Schedule/Budget managementPreferred Qualifications:3D CAD experience, Inventor or Solidworks preferredFEA – thermal, non-linear, forced mode dynamics and multi-physics analysis, Ansys preferredDesign experience with ASME B&PV Section VII, Div I & Div IIFluid Power – employing pneumatic/hydraulic cylinders, valve stand design, P&IDs, etc.Basic experience with machine instrumentation (proximity sensors, vision sensors, strain gauges, scales, etc.)Installation Support and Supervision – guiding and answering suppliers, sub-contractors and other trades questions from the office and on-site Design for fiber-composites manufacturing (fiberglass, carbon fiber)Adjacent IndustriesAerospace & Defense Mechanical DesignFactory Automation (material handling, web handling, process automation, etc.)Fluid Power (Hydraulics/Pnumatics)ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSUnusual or Special Physical Requirements of PositionLifting: 0%Climbing: 0%Crawling: 0%Special clothing/equipment (wearing): 1%Unusual physical requirements: 0%High noise level: 1%Description of Work EnvironmentInside? Location: Newport News, Virginia, United States     Date: Nov 4, 2023           Req ID: 34678       Team: E46 SHIP SURVABLTY       Entity: Newport News Shipbuilding           US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes           Full-Time       Shift: 1st       Relocation: Relocation assistance will be available       Virtual/Telework Opportunity: Yes - Occasional or hybrid telework available           Travel Requirement: Yes, 10%-25% of the time           Clearance Required: No - Clearance Not Required to Start     Meet HII’s Newport News Shipbuilding With more than 25,000 employees – including third-, fourth- and even fifth-generation shipbuilders – HII’s Newport News Shipbuilding (NNS) division is the largest industrial employer in Virginia. We’re the sole designer, builder and refueler of U.S. Navy nuclear aircraft carriers and one of two providers of U.S. Navy nuclear submarines. Our diverse and innovative team of professionals ranges from skilled trades to project managers, engineers and software developers to solution architects, technical subject matter experts, and system users. Anchored in our rich, 135-year history, we collaborate together at the forefront of technology, manufacturing, and integration of the most powerful and survivable naval ships in the world. Want to be part of the team? Apply today! We look forward to meeting you.      The Role          The Shock Engineering and Advanced Analysis team is looking for an Engineer Structural 4 for support of all platforms (CVN, Special Projects, VCS, SSNX). This is an opportunity to join our growing team to contribute and influence the Navy's future and work on a broad spectrum of exciting projects and problems. The candidate will perform dynamic structural (shock) analyses utilizing finite element analysis (FEA) methods with the pre-/post-processor (FEMAP and NASTRAN, Abaqus, Hypermesh, Government codes) computer applications, perform hand calculations using textbook methods, and develop engineering calculation reports, check structural analyses reports. The candidate will be working in an environment where technical growth opportunities abound, and will be responsible for leading dynamic and transient analysis methods, underwater explosion analysis and related projects, and will be responsible for training and mentoring junior engineers in these areas. The candidate will be relied on as a project lead to plan, execute, and ensure objectives are met for projects of various scope.         Eventual SECRET clearance                 Analyzes, researches and develops structural engineering specifications involving metals, non-metallic or composite structural materials for product design, or operation of product to include structures, mechanical, hydraulic, electrical and electronics, power plant, armament, heating and ventilating, equipment and maintenance designs. Analyzes damage tolerance, durability, design allowables and structural modeling. Specific structural engineering specialties may include dynamics and loads, stability and stress fatigue and thermal analysis. Tools utilized may include CATIA, IDEAS, ProEngineer and a variety of software applications.         Must Have          Bachelor's Degree and 9 years of relevant exempt experience;          Master’s Degree and 7 years of relevant professional experience;          Ph.D. and 4 years of experience.                 Newport News Shipbuilding requires a Bachelor's Degree in engineering from an ABET accredited program.         Nice to HaveExtensive knowledge of structural response and design requirements for surface ship or submarinesExtensive knowledge and experience with Finite Element Analysis software (Femap, Hypermesh, and/or Abaqus) and related first-principles methodsExperience in nonlinear material response, structural dynamics, and vibrationsDetailed experience and knowledge in shock qualification methods and requirements, including testing and extensionsAbility to execute new programs and old, i.e. FORTRAN, Matlab, python, etc.Ability to lead a team of junior engineers toward group and project goalsLeadership, mentoring and training experienceSkilled at project management with an ability to plan and execute tasks to meet program objectivesExperience working with NAVSEA and naval warfare centers (NUWC, NSWC-CD, NSWC-PD, NSWC-IHDAbility to communicate with internal and external customers in a professional mannerSkilled at technical writing and reporting and oral communicationExperience with high performance computing systems and nonlinear advanced analysis methodsWhy HII We build the world’s most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. HII’s diverse workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals.           Recognized as one of America’s top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people’s safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you’ll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career.           Working at HII is more than a job - it’s an opportunity to build a future. We offer comprehensive benefits including: medical, prescription drug, dental and vision plan choices, on-site health centers, tele-medicine, wellness resources, employee assistance programs, savings plan options (401K), financial education and planning tools, life insurance, tuition reimbursement, employee discounts, early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships, and more. Some benefits may vary depending on your specific division or work location.     Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive.      Today’s challenges are bigger than ever, and the nation needs the best of us. It’s why we’re focused on hiring, developing and nurturing our diversity. We believe that diversity among our workforce strengthens the organization, stimulates creativity, promotes the exchange of ideas and enriches the work lives of all our employees.           All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.     Do You Need Assistance? Our Company Miso Robotics is transforming the food industry, and making lives better. We've developed an AI-powered kitchen robot named Flippy which automates the most repetitive of kitchen tasks, such as operating a deep fryer. Flippy is fun to watch, but under the hood, it’s powered by a sophisticated AI platform – all driven by our proprietary deep learning experience and patented technologies. Miso is a well known first-mover in food AI, and it continues to enjoy that first-mover advantage today. The company has raised over $100 million from crowdfunding, which we believe makes it THE most successful crowdfunding story in history. It has successfully piloted its products with the most prominent global brands in food, and now it’s time for the company to partner with institutional capital and super-charge the commercialization of what we do. The challenge of bringing AI and robotics into commercial kitchens requires many disciplines to work together, and the composition of our teams at Miso reflects this multidisciplinary approach. We’re proud to have built a world-class team, and we’re looking for more exceptional people to join us. If you believe, like we do, that the future of the kitchen involves artificial intelligence and robots (HINT: It definitely does!), and if you want to count yourself among the handful of amazing people on the leading edge of creating them, then Miso Robotics may be the right place for you! Our Values We live with a TEAM mindset - we win together. We work relentlessly together to solve issues. We use polite and direct candor - ego has no place here. We operate with rigor - superb execution is a core skill. We are bought in, each of us is dedicated to the mission. Innovation is in our blood - we are intrepid. We think big and we’re here to make an impact. Benefits We Offer Company equity Flexible vacation Comprehensive benefits 401K plan Accelerated growth opportunities Free snacks from our robot chefs The Role As a Sr. Mechanical Engineer on the Miso team, you will use your expertise in mechanical engineering to own the design, prototype, and commercialization of mechanical components of our robotic kitchen assistants focused primarily on improving the experience for the users of our systems. You will work with users of our product to make our products easier to work with. You will own the full development lifecycle. The pay range for this position is $100,000 - $150,000 + equity + benefits. As a pre-revenue company, equity is a key component of compensation. Our salary ranges are determined by data from our industry peers, the level of responsibility, job-related skills required, training, education, experience, and the current stage of Miso’s growth. The range posted for this role represents a range that Miso Robotics,in good faith, believes it is willing to pay at the time of this posting. What You’ll Do Define hardware requirements and perform system level design trades with the product team. Collaborate closely with product managers, software, and other mechanical engineers to evaluate and optimize designs for customer needs, reliability, and ease of deployment into a live restaurant environment. Lead the full development cycle of various robot subsystems (mechanical, electronic, software, etc.) to meet defined performance requirements. This includes architecture definition, component selection, system design, analysis, testing, qualification, etc. Take ownership of the hardware delivery timeline and overall success from concept to deployment. Design, prototype, and build mechanical modules for robotic systems. Implement rigorous testing protocols, creating testing documentation and test designs. Iterate on designs to drive long term reliability. Build and maintain detailed component CAD models. Apply DFM on early-stage part designs to drive down manufacturing costs. Work within a team to ideate, review and improve product designs. Identify and evaluate component suppliers and vendors. Maintain inventory and BOM for parts within the system. Integrate mechanical modules with other systems (electrical, electronic, software etc.) Work with third-party vendors to procure and build parts. Establish supply chain and assembly paths for large-scale manufacturing. Design and simulate component parts to reduce cost and increase reliability. Deploy complex electro-mechanical systems at scale. Participate in design sessions with your team to build a shared understanding of the product. Attend daily stand ups with your team where you strategize on the work for the day. Maintain documentation on the systems you create. Requirements BS/MS degree in Mechanical Engineering required. Masters degree preferred. 7+ years of mechanical engineering experience designing, building and testing mechanical systems or robots. Experience working in a team that designed, manufactured, shipped and supported products. Proficiency in CAD (Modeling, Assemblies, Drawings, Motion); SolidWorks or OnShape experience preferred. Experience using PLM systems, assigning part and assembly numbers. Proficiency in Finite Element Analysis (FEA) for design validation. Proficiency in using GD&T for creating detailed part/assembly drawings. Knowledge of various manufacturing processes, specifically machining, sheet metal bending, laser cutting and welding. Experience using 3D printing for rapid prototyping (Formlabs, Flashforge, Ender, Ultimaker, Makerbot). Experience in integrating and validating automated systems. Experience using Confluence and Jira. Ability to work well in small teams, able to leave a positive impact on working culture. Ability to communicate well with people from different areas of expertise, from customers to designers to software developers. Strong attention to detail, analytical skills and ability to learn at hyperspeed. Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Able to work daily in our Headquarters in Pasadena, CA. Able to lift around 30 lbs. gR08vknR96

Job Title: Senior Structural Engineer Location: Beaverton, Oregon Crow Engineering provides engineering design and consultancy services to its clients in the wood products, industrial, and mixed use facilities. The Structural Engineer is responsible for the design of industrial, Cold Storage, Commercial, and High-Density Residential structures for our clients. Typical projects would include: Design of new facilities, foundation and piling design and general arrangements for pre-engineered structures, repair and retrofit designs of damaged or aged facilities, seismic upgrades of facilities to meet code requirements. The individual would be responsible for generating high-quality designs and working with a team of designers and drafters to ensure our client’s requirements are being met. The individual would interact with Crow Engineering Project Managers to obtain timelines, scope, and expectations surrounding work. From time to time this individual will interface with key equipment vendors and clients. Crow Engineering has a highly tenured organization that has a wealth of experience in the wood products and heavy industrial industry, specifically with sawmill systems. We are looking for individuals who while respecting our experience, can help take it to new industries that would benefit from our services. It is expected from each of Crow Engineering’s team members that they can provide significant value to our clients. This value comes through providing high quality, safe and innovative and reliable design work that our clients respect the value of. All team members must provide value in their space as an extension of the overall Crow Engineering team. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Create structural designs, execute calculations, and build specifications for structures utilized in the markets we serve. Work with local jurisdictions to ensure proper permitting support documentation details are available based on client demands. Work closely with Project Managers to ensure client’s needs are being met in a timely, cost effective, and high-quality manner. Provide their own project management administration for small to medium sized projects. Generate construction estimation for projects they are responsible for. Provide a work product that is above average based on industry expectations that demand a value with our clients. Can handle moderately complicated structural tasks with little to no direction. Proactively escalates needs/road blocks to other project team members, project managers, owners, and outside vendors. Executes design work within AutoCAD, Revit, and structural calculation tool sets. Communicates with key vendors and suppliers to ensure incorporated design parameters are being integrated into the project accordingly. Ensures revision control is in place and effective when working on client designs. Can help build standards, best-known methods, and training documentation for future new hires. Can effectively work through difficult situations. Core Competencies: Strong English written/verbal skills. The ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision The ability to work under time constraints and adapt to change Working knowledge and experience with different structure and construction types. The ability to troubleshoot, diagnose and effectively communicate technical solutions to difficult issues Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and group situations to customers, vendors, and other employees of the organization Strong Design/Drafting skills within design software systems. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent attention to detail The ability to clearly document test results, configuration parameters, process and training materials Qualifications: A four-year engineering degree in Civil Engineering. Candidate must be an actively certified Professional Civil Engineer Candidate must have obtained their Structural Engineering certification or have >7 years of experience as a civil engineer specializing in structural designs. 3-5 Years work experience in a similar position. AutoCAD experience, or experience in similar systems to AutoCAD Experience with solid modeling systems is preferred. Client facing presentation skill is highly preferred. Experience with engineering change order and version control systems. Excellent written and verbal communication skills In-depth knowledge of process driven manufacturing facilities. Proven work experience with generating engineering/FEA calculations and appropriate safety margin analysis in prior positions. Experience with risk analysis and process validation methods Experience taking onsite measurements and building “as built” documentation prior to generating Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Physical demands are characteristic of a typical office environment. Climate Robotics is building the next generation of mobile pyrolysis system. Our trailer-mounted systems convert agricultural and forestry waste into biochar, a powerful soil amendment and carbon removal technology. Biochar is one of the most promising and lowest-cost solutions to global climate change, and we are excited to do our part in commercializing this transformational technology. We've partnered with some of the leading buyers of carbon removal credits, including Microsoft, to build a new type of business that helps farmers while fighting climate change. Climate Robotics is well-capitalized by top VC investors in climate tech, including Congruent Ventures, Grantham Foundation, and Microsoft Climate Innovation Fund. We're looking to expand our team of engineers and scientists to help build an entirely new industry in the nation's energy capital, Houston, Texas.We have several openings for highly experienced, dynamic, and innovative mechanical engineers. You will join a team of engineers developing the next generation of mobile pyrolysis systems to sequester gigatons of CO2. Successful candidates will have demonstrated expertise in scaling complex, heavy industrial, or high-temperature chemical processing systems from the early stages (biomass, gasification, pyrolysis, and agriculture).We are looking for candidates with demonstrated expertise in the following areas:Thermal DesignStrong fundamentals in thermal expansion, heat transfer, thermodynamics, and fluid mechanicsPrior experience in solving novel and challenging thermo-mechanical design problems for high-temperature processesExperience modeling, testing, and designing thermo-mechanical components; examples include fans, heat sinks, and heat exchangers.Experience designing pressure vesselsExperience with fatigue and fracture analysis in metals at elevated temperatureFluency in the use of FEA simulation tools for thermo-mechanical analysisHydraulic/Fluid PowerDesigning and installing hydraulic power systems for heavy mobile equipmentTroubleshooting of hydraulics issuesExperience working with power take-off (PTO) and hydraulic power unitsExperience in designing hydraulic drive systems at high and low speedExperience with hydraulic PID control systemsProduct CommercializationPrior experience designing heavy industrial equipment that operates at high temperaturesPrior success scaling pilot projects up to commercial scalePrevious success in developing systems for continuous operationAddress product challenges, including testing and qualifying new materials, processes, techniques, and designsAdditional responsibilities include:Conduct and lead prototype and product testing at the component and subsystem levelAssist with software/control systems testing and validationConduct and lead design reviewsSelect vendors and specify components. Work with vendors on new component requirements or component failuresDesign, packaging, and 3D modelingMentoring or managing junior engineersWork collaboratively with an interdisciplinary teamRequirementsBachelor of Science in Engineering with a minimum of 7+ years relevant engineering experience or Master of Science in Engineering and a minimum of 5 years relevant engineering experienceExpert machine design knowledgeStrong experience with SolidWorks, including PDMHands-on experience in prototyping, troubleshooting, and getting dirt on your faceProven experience developing mechanical systems for mass productionExperience with hydraulics, pneumatics, valving, sensors, and electrical control componentsPrior startup experience or ability to work in a fast-paced environment with challenging deadlinesPreferred Skills and Qualifications:Experience with biomass, gasification, and pyrolysis beyond the lab scaleMaintaining design documents and tracking design changes across a multidisciplinary team of engineersFamiliarity with FEA, ANSYS, and Solidworks SimulationBenefitsCompetitive salary and stock options in the companyHealth benefits (medical, dental, and vision)Flexible vacation & time-off policyRelocation assistance available for qualified candidates401(k) match

Senior Structural Engineer-(174048) Description About Us At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.  Watch Our Story:' https://www.hdrinc.com/our-story'   We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. Primary Responsibilities Consistently ranked among the top firms, including #6 in Top Engineering News-Record 500 Design Firm, by leading industry publications, HDR has 200+ locations around the globe with over 10,000 employees and specializes in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. The position opening for a Senior Structural Engineer offers exciting opportunities in the field of Power Generation and Renewables. As an HDR Senior Structural Engineer your responsibilities may include:Performing detailed structural design, analysis, engineering calculations, and developing construction documents for a variety of reinforced concrete, reinforced masonry, and steel structures as well as a variety of foundation systems like piles, spread footings, and mat foundations.Projects will include new and retrofit power and energy projects (i.e. wind, solar, battery storage, and non-renewable power generation), in addition to industrial, institutional facilities, and a variety of other project types.Acting as an Owner’s Engineer for new or retrofit projects.Writing/Editing structural specifications.Verifying code compliance, quality checks, meeting project schedules and budget.Working independently on projects and overseeing the work of junior engineers.Using stiffness matrix-based analysis software (i.e. RISA, STAAD, and LPile), hand calculations, as well as current codes and standards to perform both static and dynamic analysis.Participating in project site visits in conjunction with the Project Manager and other disciplines.All other duties as assigned. Qualifications Required QualificationsDegree in Civil or Structural Engineering with Structural emphasis, from ABET accredited university, and interest in continuing education.Minimum of 10 years structural engineering experience, preferably in power and energy projects or heavy industrial facilities.Professional Engineering License in home state.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and structural analysis software such as RISA, STAAD, and LPile.Familiarity with CADD software such as AutoCAD or Microstation a plus.Understanding of the finite element method and how to perform FEA.Must be capable of working in a team-oriented environment and possess analytical and organizational skills to work on multiple projects at one time.Having both strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to coordinate your work with other disciplines and CAD designers either in person or remotely from another HDR office.Additional skills such as attention to accuracy, detail orientated, self-directed learning, meeting deadlines, and multi-tasking are required.The willingness to try new things and be a forward thinking, innovative engineer.An attitude and commitment to be an active participant in our employee-owned culture is a must.Preferred QualificationsMaster of Science (MS) Degree in Structural Engineering or Structural emphasisRegistered as a Professional Engineer in multiple statesDemonstrated knowledge of how software packages related to structural engineering workWorking understanding of deep foundations and geotechnical applications for foundation designWhy HDR At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way. Description:   Position Summary Senior Project Engineers act as the technical lead for engineering projects, and also help mentor Project Engineers, Mechanical/Electrical Engineers, and Mechanical/Electrical Designers. They direct, coordinate, and oversee the project design team in the execution of the mechanical, systems, and electrical design of equipment for the metallurgical, specialty metals, and aerospace industries by providing in-depth technical guidance and supervision. Job Responsibilities / Act as an engineering project team leader by providing assignments, overseeing work, and providing detailed technical guidance for the design team. / Responsible for approving, in detail, all final designs, design changes, specifications, and drawing releases and ensuring their compliance with engineering principles, company standards, customer contract requirements, and related specifications. / Research, analyze, plan, organize, and coordinate all engineering design efforts for a given project, including the development of engineering project schedule, budget, and staffing needs to support overall program goals. / Conduct internal and external design reviews that address project requirements and incorporate input from customers, vendors, engineering colleagues, designers, and operations personnel. / Develop clear and concise engineering specifications for design and/or procurement of subsystems, components, and engineering services. / Provide technical support for the Sales Department including System sizing analysis, equipment conceptual and detailed layouts, customer visits, and cost analysis. / Review documents such as customer design specifications and requests for quotes to determine feasibility of design and applicability of Retech products to customer needs. / Generate high quality written reports, proposals, instructions, manuals, and other documentation that may be distributed to customers, internal users, or the public at large. / Provides reports on the status of project milestones and adjusts schedules accordingly. / Support fabrication and installation activities to ensure products and systems conform to engineering design and customer specifications. / Develop written methods and procedures for testing equipment and systems. Requirements:   Education, Experience, Knowledge and Skills Required / BSME from a four-year college or university. / 10+ years of experience working as a Project Engineer, or similar, preferably designing high temperature furnaces, heavy material handling equipment, or other capital equipment. / Experience with Autodesk Inventor, Solidworks, or another 3D CAD program. / General understanding of OSHA requirements as it applies to capital equipment. / Experience in the design and sizing of vacuum systems is a plus. / Experience in the design of material handling equipment. / Experience with industrial schematics or P&IDs. / Working knowledge of Vacuum Metallurgy and various melting technologies. / Ability to develop project plans, maintain project schedules, adhere to budget. / Working knowledge of recognized industry standards. / Ability to perform heat transfer analysis and energy balance on complex systems. / Strong stress analysis skills. / Working knowledge of FEA analysis. Personal Skills/Attributes required for the Position / Proven track record of generating innovative and practical ideas. / Excellent verbal and written communication skills for both internal and external customers. / Exceptional organization skills with attention to detail. / Ability to be proactive and manage time effectively to meet deadlines. / Detail-orientated with ability to respond quickly to a fast-moving and ever-changing environment. / Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Physical Demands / The employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, hear and talk. / The employee is frequently required to use hands. / The employee occasionally will be required to reach with hands or arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, and crawl. / The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. / Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and depth perception. / The work environment is an office setting with periodic need to visit the plant floor. / This position may be required to work long hours extending into the weekends on some occasions. May also need to travel for short or extended trips as needed. Must be able and willing to travel to international and domestic sites for sales, installation, and customer service support. / Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The Air Combat Command's 67th Cyberspace Wing (67 CW), 346th Test Squadron (346TS) plans, executes, and contributes as both an operational and participating test organization in a full array of operational tests of various cyber weapons in coordination with the 318 Range Squadron (318RANS) who provides instrumented cyber range services, through both physical hardware and virtual systems. In support of this mission, ANALYGENCE is seeking a Senior Test Engineer to plan, prepare, and execute test systems to evaluate results against specifications and requirements as well as analyze and report test results. Specifically, the Senior Test Engineer shall: Determine level of assurance of developed capabilities based on test results Develop test plans to address specifications and requirements Handle test notifications, test concept development, test planning, execution, reporting and close-out phases of all test projects Provide personnel for the following test types: Operational Assessments (OA), Early Operational Assessments (EOA), Operational Utility evaluations (OUE), Initial Operational Test and Evaluations (IOT&E), Tactics Development and Evaluations (TD&E), Force Development Evaluations (FDE), Combined Operational and Developmental Testing (DT/OT), Developmental Operations testing (DEVOPS), TEMPEST (Emission Security testing), Unified Capabilities (UC) testing, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), including Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and Cyber Security Assessments (Vulnerability Assessments, Compliance Assessments and Penetration Testing) Install and maintain network infrastructure device operating system software (e.g., IOS, firmware). Make recommendations based on test results Determine scope, infrastructure, resources, and data sample size to ensure system requirements are adequately demonstrated Create auditable evidence of security measures Validate specifications and requirements for testability Analyze the results of software, hardware, or interoperability testing Perform developmental testing on systems under development Perform interoperability testing on systems exchanging electronic information with other systems. Perform operational testing Test, evaluate, and verify hardware and/or software to determine compliance with defined specifications and requirements Record and manage test data Current Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility. Bachelor's degree in a related field and a minimum of 12 years of experience as a Test Engineer. IAT Level II certification required. Experience with Cyber Mission Systems, Air Force Weapon Systems. Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies. Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk), laws, regulations, policies, and ethics as they relate to cybersecurity and privacy. Experience with cybersecurity and privacy principles, cyber threats and vulnerabilities, specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses. Knowledge of information technology (IT) supply chain security and supply chain risk management policies, requirements, and procedures. Knowledge of critical infrastructure systems with information communication technology that were designed without system security considerations. Knowledge of network security architecture concepts including topology, protocols, components, and principles (e.g., application of defense-in-depth). Knowledge of security architecture concepts and enterprise architecture reference models (e.g., Zachman, Federal Enterprise Architecture [FEA]). Knowledge of security models (e.g., Bell-LaPadula model, Biba integrity model, Clark-Wilson integrity model). Knowledge of cybersecurity-enabled software products. Knowledge of Test & Evaluation processes for learners. Knowledge of network protocols such as TCP/IP, Dynamic Host Configuration, Domain Name System (DNS), and directory services. Experience conducting test events, designing a data analysis structure (i.e., the types of data a test must generate and how to analyze that data), determining an appropriate level of test rigor for a given system, developing operations-based testing scenarios, systems integration testing. Experience writing code in a currently supported programming language (e.g., Java, C++), writing test plans, evaluating test plans for applicability and completeness, conducting Test Readiness Reviews, designing and documenting overall program Test & Evaluation strategies, identifying Test & Evaluation infrastructure (people, ranges, tools, instrumentation) requirements. Skill in managing test assets, test resources, and test personnel to ensure effective completion of test events, preparing Test & Evaluation reports and providing Test & Evaluation resource estimate. Ability to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation). STV Incorporated is seeking a Sr. Structural Engineer, Illinois, S.E. candidate to join our Bridge practice in our Chicago, IL operation. More than 100 years old, the firm provides comprehensive architectural, engineering, planning, environmental, and construction management services for public and private sector clients. STV is an award-winning national leader consistently ranking among the country's top companies in the design and planning of transportation and infrastructure projects. Our success is the direct result of our employees' commitment to innovation and quality across all 40 offices and over 2500 people nationwide.   STV has been providing bridge engineering services as one of the premier consultants in the transportation industry. Our Chicago office provides bridge design and inspection services to transit agencies and municipalities throughout the State, as well as for contractors on design build projects. This is a great opportunity to join a growing, highly motivated, and successful team that has played a significant role in numerous major transportation projects throughout the region and the United States.   We have an immediate need for a Senior-level Structural engineer (S.E.) to join our Transportation and Infrastructure Team, ideally located in our Chicago, IL office. This position will assist in leading design and analysis of highway, rail and pedestrian bridges and associated structures. We are looking for a motivated individual who wants to be part of a successful, growing practice within a firm that values integrity, determination and drive and rewards individuals accordingly. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to interact with clients on a regular basis and contribute to business development efforts. This is an excellent opportunity for a creative, self-motivated, and detail-oriented professional looking to take their career to the next level.   Responsibilities Include:    Lead a team of Bridge Engineers in the Bridge Practice in our Chicago office. Provide design and analysis of bridges and related structures Support Complex Prequalification’s Perform FEA Support structural design on selected projects and lead assigned tasks as appropriate Support preparation of technical and cost proposals to win work Assist Senior staff in oversight of project delivery to ensure projects meet or exceed forecasted profit margins Provide leadership and direction by mentoring and motivating junior staff Work with managers, project engineers, and discipline leads to develop budgets, schedules, and project delivery plans Proactively drive safety and ensure that health and safety practices are maintained Assist in maintaining quality of project deliverables produced by the Bridge Group Foster and manage client relationships at appropriate levels to help procure new business.  Some evenings will be spent at professional society meetings where you will work to develop and maintain relationships with clients, teaming partners, and potential technical staff hires.   Qualifications Include:    Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering; Master’s degree preferred, but not required Minimum of 12 years of progressive design experience on structural engineering projects Illinois S.E. license Experience with complex bridge design Solid structural analysis and design skills with an understanding of related engineering disciplines needed to complete transportation and infrastructure projects Project management skills and ability to plan and coordinate work efforts needed to meet deadlines Strong interpersonal and communication skills with ability to form effective relationships with staff and clients    Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.    STV offers the following benefits • Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account • Dental insurance • Vision insurance • Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable) • Disability insurance • Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment • 401(k) Plan • Retirement Counseling • Employee Assistance Program • Paid Time Off (16 days) • Paid Holidays (8 days) • Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year) • Parental Leave (up to 80 hours) • Continuing Education Program • Professional Licensure and Society Memberships

About Charm  Our mission is to reverse climate change and return the atmosphere to 280 ppm CO₂, profitably. We convert waste biomass into carbon-rich bio-oil and inject it into permanent, underground storage as carbon removal, or reform the bio-oil to produce syngas for fossil-free steel.  Our carbon removal pathway took off in 2020 with initial purchases from customers like Stripe, Shopify & Microsoft. In 2021 and 2022 we delivered thousands of tons of carbon removal via off-the-shelf pathways, and also deployed our first R&D prototype pyrolyzer of our own. In the next 18 months, we'll build and deploy the next pyrolyzer revision, demonstrate our fossil-free ironmaking pilot, substantially expand our operations in Colorado and put thousands of tonnes of CO₂e underground.  We're looking to expand our team of ambitious creative and hands-on engineers, fabricators, operators, and forward-thinking humans. We value psychological safety and collaboration. We take calculated risks and don't sweep mistakes under the rug; instead, we pin them to the wall and learn from them. We value that everyone’s unique backgrounds and perspectives shape their work. We encourage you to read our company values.  Come help us reverse climate change. Gigatons or bust!  About the Role We’re looking for an experienced mechanical engineer who can support our efforts toward research and evaluation of pyrolysis reactor technologies through calculations, modeling, and experiments. This role will interface with cross-functional teams including fabrication, electronics, test, and development. This role includes the design, fabrication, and testing of part or whole pyrolysis systems including reactor, condenser, and burners. This role will also serve as a resource to other mechanical engineers. It will be common for other engineers to ask for a design review, or brainstorm actively with you.  Responsibilities You will serve as a senior engineering resource on the SF Research team, which is currently responsible for evaluating alternative pyrolysis technologies. You will be responsible for designing parts of a test system, overseeing fabrication and installation, creating test matrices, and using data from testing to evaluate performance. In building those test systems, you’ll interface cross-functionally with fabrication and electronics resources to see these designs through to fruition. You will play an active role in shaping and scaling our roadmap for pyrolysis technology. Requirements Experienced mechanical engineering experience CAD knowledge is a must, we use Solidworks Familiar with GD&T, familiar with basic fabrication techniques Familiarity with electromechanical systems Experience with fluids and thermodynamics Experience with modeling Ability to communicate priorities and work cross-functionally An excitement for hardware that has the potential to positively impact climate change! Bonus (but not required) Chemical process equipment design experience Experience with fluid and/or thermal systems Managed/mentored junior engineers previously Experience with solids handling is a plus CFD or FEA experience   The anticipated salary range is $130-$160K, dependent on factors such as experience within the job, within the industry, education, etc.    What We Offer  Stock optionsHealth benefits (medical, dental, vision)Traditional and Roth 401(k)Paid time off, including parental leaveA yearly professional development stipendHealthy snacks and lunches at a sweet workplace with lots of space inside and outA chance to pivot into a role in climate! Visa Sponsorship Policy  Since we are a small startup, certain accommodations for visa sponsorship may not be within our capability. At this time, Charm Industrial is only sponsoring E3 and TN visas.    Our Commitment  Charm Industrial is an equal opportunity employer with a firm commitment to growing our team in an inclusive way, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, medical condition, age, or veteran status. The consequences of climate change inherently affect some more than others, and we need a diverse team to help us save our little planet most effectively & justly. We are excited about all of those who choose to apply, and for those who end up joining us, to see how you better us as a team and company. We are more than the sum of our parts.

Location: Newport News, Virginia, United States     Date: Nov 4, 2023           Req ID: 34678       Team: E46 SHIP SURVABLTY       Entity: Newport News Shipbuilding           US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes           Full-Time       Shift: 1st       Relocation: Relocation assistance will be available       Virtual/Telework Opportunity: Yes - Occasional or hybrid telework available           Travel Requirement: Yes, 10%-25% of the time           Clearance Required: No - Clearance Not Required to Start     Meet HII’s Newport News Shipbuilding With more than 25,000 employees – including third-, fourth- and even fifth-generation shipbuilders – HII’s Newport News Shipbuilding (NNS) division is the largest industrial employer in Virginia. We’re the sole designer, builder and refueler of U.S. Navy nuclear aircraft carriers and one of two providers of U.S. Navy nuclear submarines. Our diverse and innovative team of professionals ranges from skilled trades to project managers, engineers and software developers to solution architects, technical subject matter experts, and system users. Anchored in our rich, 135-year history, we collaborate together at the forefront of technology, manufacturing, and integration of the most powerful and survivable naval ships in the world. Want to be part of the team? Apply today! We look forward to meeting you.      The Role          The Shock Engineering and Advanced Analysis team is looking for an Engineer Structural 4 for support of all platforms (CVN, Special Projects, VCS, SSNX). This is an opportunity to join our growing team to contribute and influence the Navy's future and work on a broad spectrum of exciting projects and problems. The candidate will perform dynamic structural (shock) analyses utilizing finite element analysis (FEA) methods with the pre-/post-processor (FEMAP and NASTRAN, Abaqus, Hypermesh, Government codes) computer applications, perform hand calculations using textbook methods, and develop engineering calculation reports, check structural analyses reports. The candidate will be working in an environment where technical growth opportunities abound, and will be responsible for leading dynamic and transient analysis methods, underwater explosion analysis and related projects, and will be responsible for training and mentoring junior engineers in these areas. The candidate will be relied on as a project lead to plan, execute, and ensure objectives are met for projects of various scope.         Eventual SECRET clearance                 Analyzes, researches and develops structural engineering specifications involving metals, non-metallic or composite structural materials for product design, or operation of product to include structures, mechanical, hydraulic, electrical and electronics, power plant, armament, heating and ventilating, equipment and maintenance designs. Analyzes damage tolerance, durability, design allowables and structural modeling. Specific structural engineering specialties may include dynamics and loads, stability and stress fatigue and thermal analysis. Tools utilized may include CATIA, IDEAS, ProEngineer and a variety of software applications.         Must Have          Bachelor's Degree and 9 years of relevant exempt experience;          Master’s Degree and 7 years of relevant professional experience;          Ph.D. and 4 years of experience.                 Newport News Shipbuilding requires a Bachelor's Degree in engineering from an ABET accredited program.         Nice to HaveExtensive knowledge of structural response and design requirements for surface ship or submarinesExtensive knowledge and experience with Finite Element Analysis software (Femap, Hypermesh, and/or Abaqus) and related first-principles methodsExperience in nonlinear material response, structural dynamics, and vibrationsDetailed experience and knowledge in shock qualification methods and requirements, including testing and extensionsAbility to execute new programs and old, i.e. FORTRAN, Matlab, python, etc.Ability to lead a team of junior engineers toward group and project goalsLeadership, mentoring and training experienceSkilled at project management with an ability to plan and execute tasks to meet program objectivesExperience working with NAVSEA and naval warfare centers (NUWC, NSWC-CD, NSWC-PD, NSWC-IHDAbility to communicate with internal and external customers in a professional mannerSkilled at technical writing and reporting and oral communicationExperience with high performance computing systems and nonlinear advanced analysis methodsWhy HII We build the world’s most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. HII’s diverse workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals.           Recognized as one of America’s top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people’s safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you’ll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career.           Working at HII is more than a job - it’s an opportunity to build a future. Job Title: Senior Structural Engineer Location: Beaverton, Oregon Crow Engineering provides engineering design and consultancy services to its clients in the wood products, industrial, and mixed use facilities. The Structural Engineer is responsible for the design of industrial, Cold Storage, Commercial, and High-Density Residential structures for our clients. Typical projects would include: Design of new facilities, foundation and piling design and general arrangements for pre-engineered structures, repair and retrofit designs of damaged or aged facilities, seismic upgrades of facilities to meet code requirements. The individual would be responsible for generating high-quality designs and working with a team of designers and drafters to ensure our client’s requirements are being met. The individual would interact with Crow Engineering Project Managers to obtain timelines, scope, and expectations surrounding work. From time to time this individual will interface with key equipment vendors and clients. Crow Engineering has a highly tenured organization that has a wealth of experience in the wood products and heavy industrial industry, specifically with sawmill systems. We are looking for individuals who while respecting our experience, can help take it to new industries that would benefit from our services. It is expected from each of Crow Engineering’s team members that they can provide significant value to our clients. This value comes through providing high quality, safe and innovative and reliable design work that our clients respect the value of. All team members must provide value in their space as an extension of the overall Crow Engineering team. Work with local jurisdictions to ensure proper permitting support documentation details are available based on client demands. Work closely with Project Managers to ensure client’s needs are being met in a timely, cost effective, and high-quality manner. Provide their own project management administration for small to medium sized projects. Generate construction estimation for projects they are responsible for. Provide a work product that is above average based on industry expectations that demand a value with our clients. Can handle moderately complicated structural tasks with little to no direction. Proactively escalates needs/road blocks to other project team members, project managers, owners, and outside vendors. Executes design work within AutoCAD, Revit, and structural calculation tool sets. Communicates with key vendors and suppliers to ensure incorporated design parameters are being integrated into the project accordingly. Ensures revision control is in place and effective when working on client designs. Can help build standards, best-known methods, and training documentation for future new hires. Can effectively work through difficult situations. Core Competencies: Strong English written/verbal skills. The ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision The ability to work under time constraints and adapt to change Working knowledge and experience with different structure and construction types. The ability to troubleshoot, diagnose and effectively communicate technical solutions to difficult issues Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and group situations to customers, vendors, and other employees of the organization Strong Design/Drafting skills within design software systems. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent attention to detail The ability to clearly document test results, configuration parameters, process and training materials Qualifications: A four-year engineering degree in Civil Engineering. Candidate must be an actively certified Professional Civil Engineer Candidate must have obtained their Structural Engineering certification or have >7 years of experience as a civil engineer specializing in structural designs. 3-5 Years work experience in a similar position. AutoCAD experience, or experience in similar systems to AutoCAD Experience with solid modeling systems is preferred. Client facing presentation skill is highly preferred. Experience with engineering change order and version control systems. Excellent written and verbal communication skills In-depth knowledge of process driven manufacturing facilities. Proven work experience with generating engineering/FEA calculations and appropriate safety margin analysis in prior positions. Climate Robotics is building the next generation of mobile pyrolysis system. Our trailer-mounted systems convert agricultural and forestry waste into biochar, a powerful soil amendment and carbon removal technology. Biochar is one of the most promising and lowest-cost solutions to global climate change, and we are excited to do our part in commercializing this transformational technology. We've partnered with some of the leading buyers of carbon removal credits, including Microsoft, to build a new type of business that helps farmers while fighting climate change. Climate Robotics is well-capitalized by top VC investors in climate tech, including Congruent Ventures, Grantham Foundation, and Microsoft Climate Innovation Fund. We're looking to expand our team of engineers and scientists to help build an entirely new industry in the nation's energy capital, Houston, Texas.We have several openings for highly experienced, dynamic, and innovative mechanical engineers. You will join a team of engineers developing the next generation of mobile pyrolysis systems to sequester gigatons of CO2. Successful candidates will have demonstrated expertise in scaling complex, heavy industrial, or high-temperature chemical processing systems from the early stages (biomass, gasification, pyrolysis, and agriculture).We are looking for candidates with demonstrated expertise in the following areas:Thermal DesignStrong fundamentals in thermal expansion, heat transfer, thermodynamics, and fluid mechanicsPrior experience in solving novel and challenging thermo-mechanical design problems for high-temperature processesExperience modeling, testing, and designing thermo-mechanical components; examples include fans, heat sinks, and heat exchangers.Experience designing pressure vesselsExperience with fatigue and fracture analysis in metals at elevated temperatureFluency in the use of FEA simulation tools for thermo-mechanical analysisHydraulic/Fluid PowerDesigning and installing hydraulic power systems for heavy mobile equipmentTroubleshooting of hydraulics issuesExperience working with power take-off (PTO) and hydraulic power unitsExperience in designing hydraulic drive systems at high and low speedExperience with hydraulic PID control systemsProduct CommercializationPrior experience designing heavy industrial equipment that operates at high temperaturesPrior success scaling pilot projects up to commercial scalePrevious success in developing systems for continuous operationAddress product challenges, including testing and qualifying new materials, processes, techniques, and designsAdditional responsibilities include:Conduct and lead prototype and product testing at the component and subsystem levelAssist with software/control systems testing and validationConduct and lead design reviewsSelect vendors and specify components. Work with vendors on new component requirements or component failuresDesign, packaging, and 3D modelingMentoring or managing junior engineersWork collaboratively with an interdisciplinary teamRequirementsBachelor of Science in Engineering with a minimum of 7+ years relevant engineering experience or Master of Science in Engineering and a minimum of 5 years relevant engineering experienceExpert machine design knowledgeStrong experience with SolidWorks, including PDMHands-on experience in prototyping, troubleshooting, and getting dirt on your faceProven experience developing mechanical systems for mass productionExperience with hydraulics, pneumatics, valving, sensors, and electrical control componentsPrior startup experience or ability to work in a fast-paced environment with challenging deadlinesPreferred Skills and Qualifications:Experience with biomass, gasification, and pyrolysis beyond the lab scaleMaintaining design documents and tracking design changes across a multidisciplinary team of engineersFamiliarity with FEA, ANSYS, and Solidworks SimulationBenefitsCompetitive salary and stock options in the companyHealth benefits (medical, dental, and vision)Flexible vacation & time-off policyRelocation assistance available for qualified candidates401(k) match

Senior Structural Engineer-(174048) Description About Us At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.  Watch Our Story:' https://www.hdrinc.com/our-story'   We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. Primary Responsibilities Consistently ranked among the top firms, including #6 in Top Engineering News-Record 500 Design Firm, by leading industry publications, HDR has 200+ locations around the globe with over 10,000 employees and specializes in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. The position opening for a Senior Structural Engineer offers exciting opportunities in the field of Power Generation and Renewables. As an HDR Senior Structural Engineer your responsibilities may include:Performing detailed structural design, analysis, engineering calculations, and developing construction documents for a variety of reinforced concrete, reinforced masonry, and steel structures as well as a variety of foundation systems like piles, spread footings, and mat foundations.Projects will include new and retrofit power and energy projects (i.e. wind, solar, battery storage, and non-renewable power generation), in addition to industrial, institutional facilities, and a variety of other project types.Acting as an Owner’s Engineer for new or retrofit projects.Writing/Editing structural specifications.Verifying code compliance, quality checks, meeting project schedules and budget.Working independently on projects and overseeing the work of junior engineers.Using stiffness matrix-based analysis software (i.e. RISA, STAAD, and LPile), hand calculations, as well as current codes and standards to perform both static and dynamic analysis.Participating in project site visits in conjunction with the Project Manager and other disciplines.All other duties as assigned. Qualifications Required QualificationsDegree in Civil or Structural Engineering with Structural emphasis, from ABET accredited university, and interest in continuing education.Minimum of 10 years structural engineering experience, preferably in power and energy projects or heavy industrial facilities.Professional Engineering License in home state.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and structural analysis software such as RISA, STAAD, and LPile.Familiarity with CADD software such as AutoCAD or Microstation a plus.Understanding of the finite element method and how to perform FEA.Must be capable of working in a team-oriented environment and possess analytical and organizational skills to work on multiple projects at one time.Having both strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to coordinate your work with other disciplines and CAD designers either in person or remotely from another HDR office.Additional skills such as attention to accuracy, detail orientated, self-directed learning, meeting deadlines, and multi-tasking are required.The willingness to try new things and be a forward thinking, innovative engineer.An attitude and commitment to be an active participant in our employee-owned culture is a must.Preferred QualificationsMaster of Science (MS) Degree in Structural Engineering or Structural emphasisRegistered as a Professional Engineer in multiple statesDemonstrated knowledge of how software packages related to structural engineering workWorking understanding of deep foundations and geotechnical applications for foundation designWhy HDR At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.
